review_body: This hotel's location is super close to USJ on foot it takes less than 5 min. It is in Universial city as well. Hotel's decoration shows Fantasy as theme park hotel. Very clean and kind. Also, breakfast is quite good. As soon as Park open we could head to, Also at night after theme park closing hour we could arrive hotel and took a rest easily. No need to have transportation is super good while we stayed here.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed at The Park Front Universal Studios for 2 nights and it delivered what was needed. I was definitely worried about the potential noise factor, being in a hotel with so many children; but really didn’t hear much of anything once inside the room.For all of the lobby glitz, the room was spacious, but basic. I was in a park view room with 2 single beds. The bed were firm, which I love. Though it was a twin bed, it’s not what we consider a twin in the US, it’s definitely bigger. Two kinds of pillows offered: thicker and thinner- which was nice.There is a separate toilet room and bathroom. They were fine but nothing special. The bathroom consisted of a shower and tub room, so to speak. The towels were very thin.The safe was big enough to fit an iPad and something the size of a folder, which was helpful.The blackout shades, though helpful, did not truly blackout the light come morning.The room overall was tired and a bit dated. That being said, for the location and price, I was pretty happy. We were literally steps from the park and from the train...so convenient. For those reasons, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel if you want to be close to the park.

review_body: This hotel is just right in front of the Universal Studios theme park and hence it’s the closest one can get to the Park! Our room besides being very comfortable and nice, also had a view of the Park from the windows! It was exciting indeed ! The hotel is also in the midst of many restaurants and eating places , also has several places to shop nearby , so in that sense it’s absolutely centrally located. The staff was very, very nice ! A very comfortable and memorable stay for us! We loved it! Thank you hotel team for making our stay amazing !! Loved it !

review_body: Stayed here for one night after a long, tiring day at the theme park.We dropped off our luggage on arrival then headed for the park.Returned at night to check in. Our cases were already in our room.The room was very large with 4 comfortable beds.Lots of toiletries supplied as well as a hairdryer and a sleep shirt and slippers.Breakfast was amazing. Lots of choice, including a chocolate fountain and sweets.A late checkout meant no rushing so sat in the window enjoying the views of the park.Wonderful!

Going the opposite way as the park traffic every day was funny. I didn’t get the room I thought I was going to, but it was fine.

review_body: This hotel is located literally 100 meters from USH gates.Some tips:- if you traveling with family from Kansai Airport, it is more convenient to go by bus to universal studio. It took less that an hour. From the universal studio bus stop it is like 300 meters walk to the hotel. If you travel by train, the universal city station is also very close to the hotel.- if you arrive early, the hotel will keep your luggage and they will have it ready in your room by the time you come back- you can purchase USJ tickets and express pass from the tickets counter at the 3rd floor (next to the check in counter)- breakfast buffet spread is awesome. There are an extended japanese and international selection. It is good value for money and best option before going to the park- for lunch and dinner there are numerous restaurants option in the universal city shopping & dining area. They are open until late.- there are luggage forwarding service (Ta-Q-Bin) at the 2nd floor. It opens from 7 am to 12 pm. I use it to send big luggages to my next hotel in Tokyo- They have a room with park view. It depends on your personal judgement, but after spending a whole day or two at the park I wouldn’t pay extra for that view. The room and bathroom is very spacious though- they dont provide iron & ironing board in the room but you can ask to borrow one.- there is lawson store at ground floor. It’s very convenient to buy some snacks, drinks and other stuff. They also sell electrical adaptor and other crucial traveling stuffs.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having a hotel nearby to go back to after a tiring day at USJ is awesome. The hotel room and the bath is big and I really enjoyed my stay there. I love spacious rooms (something that is rare in Japan).I didn’t go for the breakfast option as it’s quite expensive and there are a couple of good cafes nearby. I’m glad I didn’t as I see huge lines outside the cafe in the morning. I wouldn’t want to queue for my breakfast especially if I’m rushing to USJ. It’s a beautiful hotel and yes, I will recommend it if u are intending to visit USJ. Try the sushi place (revolving sushi) nearby as it’s pretty good! There’s loads of eateries where the hotel is. Try asking for the room facing universal studios. I think it’s more expensive though. However, from where I am (facing the other way), I could see fireworks display at night! :)

review_body: Stayed at this hotel from 2nd till 3rd Dec 2018, Room 2202 and 2203. The booking was made via online through their website. Check in process is normal and can be considered average. There is nothing special of the services rendered by the reception staff. My main concern is that no one assisting us (I come with my family of 5) with our luggages upon our arrival. We arrived via taxi at the ground floor roughly around 7pm. There is only 1 lady staff at the small concierge unit. Not so fluent in English and just told my family “check in upstairs “. We have to carry out out luggage on our own to the lobby by the escalator. She is not telling us whether there is an elevator or otherwise and till today I really not sure about it.Nothing to shout about the room as I believe on par with other resort boutique theme park hotel. Main advantage is just the hotel is near to USJ and located along the universal walk. The rest I think is average and could be a bit expensive and not worth of money.Breakfast is ok. Maybe it’s time for the hotel management to consider halal @ Muslim friendly food as the number of Muslim customers are growing fast. Another thing probably the tv channel inside the hotel could provide ‘live’ coverage of the theme park for information of its patrons. There is a counter selling tickets for the park inside the hotel which may benefit the customers.

review_body: The hotel's proximity to USJ and the bus station (bus to airport) is simply amazing. After 2 tired but fun days at USJ, having the hotel at a stone's throw away was great.It was also very fun to see USJ from our room window. We could see the queues, the crowds and the day/night scenes.The hotel had coin laundry facilities which was very convenient for us. The shops outside the hotel at Citywalk had a good variety of restaurants, supper snacks and souvenirs/gifts.

review_body: We visited Osaka mostly for USJ and this is THE hotel to stay for such activity. It is located right on the heart of Citywalk just a couple of minutes walk to the park entrance. You can easily purchase the tickets and fast lane passes right in the hotel, so there is no need to queue at the park ticket counters. The room was huge and the view as even better. It was especially interesting to see what is going on after the park closes with all the preparations during the night. A must see for Universal Park fans. There is also a train station with quick access to other parts of Osaka. There was no desk or workplace for a laptop and given the room size, they could easily add that. There was a little disorientation by staff during check-out on where to go to catch a cab to the airport.

review_body: So much to love about this hotel, the decoration and the overall fun vibe really made it a unique holiday for us. We got very lucky as our room had a direct view of the park and was quite massive for two people, with a massive bathroom as well. You are able to buy tickets for everything through the hotel counter which makes entire experience very convenient, this is the most hassle free way to visit this park. The food was okay, could be improved, but not entirely bad.

review_body: We've stayed at the Park Front Hotel @ USJ on last Sunday night. We chose this property as we thought we might stayed until the park closed. We did arrive in the morning to leave all baggage then spent time at USJ. The check-in process is not complicated and take just 2 minutes. When we came back to the hotel, our room was ready and luggage was delivered to the room already. The room is big compared to Japanese standard room. The hotel provided all amenities we needed and specially the foot spa pads, it's very nice after you walked all the days at USJ. The decoration may not be super-fancy like you stayed at Disney official's Hotel but it's fine for me as we didn't travel with children. There is vending machine, ice machine and microwave on the floor we stayed (28th floor). Breakfast, we didn't expect much on this so it's beyond our expectation. The line buffet is great, there are variety of foods and we're really enjoy. We did book the room directly at Hotel's website as it's cheaper than the other website. Even hotel is not located in the city center but, personally, I still recommended this hotel for the others, especially, if you have a train pass and mainly use JR, not subway. The station is just <1 minute walk from the hotel.

review_body: It is the closest hotel to the park. The best location we could ever ask for. Lots of restaurants and shops around the hotel. We had a corner triple room and it was really roomy, not only had enough space for two adults and two kids but also 3 large fully opened suitcases. Huge bathroom with double sinks, big and comfortable beds, large windows provided bright light and a great view of the park. Check-in was easy and quick. Mr Mochido at the front desk was so helpful and polite, he made our stay a better one. Great value for money hotel, I will stay again at The Park front hotel when I visit USJ again.

review_body: Pros. 2nd summer visits and celebrations for my husband. Close to USJ. Clean. Spacious room. Buffet breakfast ok.Cons. My husband brought some candies out for my daughter who did not goto conplmentary breakfast. A staff blocked his way and asked him to put back. I was outside & asked what happened. He showed me a sign & said loudly & rudely to me that this is rule not to bring any food outside.. My husband said a 3-year old child in front of him also got candies on hand was also asked to put back candies which made her cry. Why so rude? My husband then stayed for some more time. This staff talked & looked at my husband many times & laugh. This was the birthday of my husband & he had bad feeling. He said he would never visit this hotel again.

review_body: Can't go wrong staying here if you want to go to Universal Studios. It is literally 100 meters to the entry gate. It is the closest one to it. The buffet restaurant is probably the biggest I have ever seen its massive and does all the way around to the left hand side of the entrance. More food choices for breakfast than I have ever seen. Staff were great especially Koyama who went out of her way to print off some documents for me. Hotel is surprisingly quiet considering its location. Rooms area good size and very clean. Highly recommend staying here is you visit Universal Studios Osaka.

review_body: This hotel is located within Universal City, a stone's throw from the JR and subway stations. It's also within walking distance from the ferry to the Osaka Aquarium Kaiyukan and from the entrance to Universal studios. Couldn't have picked a better place. We were given room 2010 which had a great view of the harbor, ferris wheel, and neighboring hotels. The rooms are really large by local standards (ours had three comfortable single beds) and a nice bathroom with separate toilet (by that I don't mean shared, just its own separate cubby with door- really nice feature.) A good choice of restaurants and shops nearby.

review_body: Loved the convenience of staying at the park front hotel. It is a especially wonderful for families with kids. Pluses:1. The location was superb for anyone visiting the Universal studios.2. USJ train station was right next to it.3. The Osaka bay ferry terminal about 5 minutes walk away. 4. Via a short ferry ride, one can visit the Osaka aquarium near by.5. The train station makes it convenient to go almost anywhere in Osaka, to Kyoto, to Nara. 6. It has more that 10-15 restaurants right around it so, food is not a problem at all.7. The most amazingly vast and varied breakfast Buffet with western, and Japanese cuisine. Especially fun for kids with multiple cereal, candy, fondue as well as ice cream options.8. The hotel has a time travel theme, and is a lot of fun for the kids.9. Festive atmosphere due to the location being right on Universal city walk.10. Very helpful reception and concierge.11. Huge spacious rooms with great views of the USJ Park and Osaka Bay area.12. Large spacious, and modern bathrooms with luxurious amenities.I could really so no negative, and had a great time. We loved this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

review_body: This hotel is ideal for Universal Studios as it is less than a minute walk to the park entrance and the train station plus right in the middle of City Walk restaurants so was perfect at the end of a long day in the park. We chose a city view room but could still see 50% of the park. Rooms were clean, shower was extremely powerful, reception staff very helpful and you can purchase park tickets plus fast passes. Breakfast buffet provided good choice of foods including smarties, flumps, and a chocolate fountain! When we booked we were surprised at the low cost (compared to Orlando Universal hotels) however were amazed at the high quality standard provided. Would highly recommend this hotel.

review_body: The location is fantastic! Right next to Universal Studios!! We bought our park tickets here before heading to the park, and that saved us from having to wait in the line to buy tickets at the park. Our room was very spacious and our view was nice. There were two pillows on the bed, one was soft and the other one was firm. It was nice to have a choice. The staff was really nice and helpful! Breakfast was included for us and there was a good selection of both Japanese food and western food. I would stay here again for sure! Really great experience all around!

review_body: I stayed at this hotel on a visit to Osaka with my family. The rest of my family are theme park fans and this hotel proved to be a very convenient choice because it is located right by the Universal Studios theme park. The hotel was very clean and comfortable and room sizes were good. When you exit the back of the hotel the universal city is right there , boasting of lots of different restaurants, shops, a huge candy store , a convenience store and many more. The train station is also located right by the hotel . If you mainly want to be right by the park, this is a great hotel since the park is a short walk to the universal studios park otherwise there is nothing else around the hotel, one has to either take the train or a taxi to go to other parts of the city. I was frustrated also because this is one of the few international hotels where very little orAlmost no staff spoke decent english. I think for being such a family oriented hotel with a western theme park, i think the hotel should be better equipped with a more multilingual staff. It was difficult to go to anyone , even to the concierge to ask for help with reservations or just simply to ask questions or make suggestions as to where to go other than the park.

Staff were friendly and even we did not book a park view room we were given a partial park view room and it was great! Room was big and clean!The only down side is the tv as the channel are all Japanese and none of it was English or Chinese, no movie channel, if you want movie you have to pay additional which is not good as it’s the official USJ hotel but they did not provide any universal movie channel.

review_body: Came to Osaka for my birthday and we stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It is just next to the train station so no need to drag our luggage for long and the other entrance is just in front of USJ! Very convenient esp when you want to be early for USJ. There are also cafes, dining places (both local e.g. ramen, revolving sushi, tonkatsu, omu-rice, etc. and international - steak, western, etc.), souvenir shops, clothing store, etc. surrounding the area. Our room is very clean and comfortable, and the staff are also very friendly and accommodating. I had a perfect birthday! We are very happy with our stay here and will definitely book this hotel again.
hotelName:

Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My adult son and I stayed 2 nights this week for 37000 yen booked through the booking.com.iWe caught the airport bus from KIX to the bus stop at USJ.Catching the bus was easy.Easy to find and a person to help you buy tickets from a machine.About 1500 yen each.We arrived early and they offered us check in at 1pm for no extra.Reasonable English at reception.We had a twin room on the 9th floor (905).Although I paid for a city view room (park views cost more), we were given a park view.The Hollywood Dream coaster looked really close and we could see the crowds gathering at the entry gate.There was no noise in the room .The room was in new condition and very large with 2 extra wide singles and a sofa bed.It didn't have a desk/chair.The beds were not too hard, with nice bedding and 2 pillows , one of which was soft for Westerners and one Japanese style.There was a separate toilet and a large bathroom partitioned into an area with 2 sinks and a wet area with a large bath and shower.We went to USJ for one and a half days.I was disappointed because not much appealed to me.I like Tokyo Disney SO much better.It was a 5 minute walk to the front gate which was wonderful for an early start and for returning late.Both nights we had food from Lawson's for dinner.We had a nice Japanese lunch in the park one day and a so so lunch at the Three Broomsticks the other day.We ate cereal for breakfast brought from home in our room.I used luggage forwarding on the second floor.They had enough English to help me.I can't recommend luggage forwarding enough.There is a self service laundry but I didn't see it.We took the bus to Itami airport on departure.It was raining so we took a taxi, lined up on the street outside the 2nd floor entrance, although it was only a short distance.We arrived at the bus stop 15 minutes early and there was already a queue.I highly recommend this hotel if the purpose of your visit is USJ.No negatives about the hotel at all.
hotelName:

review_body: A very good choice for fun family enjoying the adventure in Universal Studio because this hotel is just located in front of the park with 2 mins walking distance. Also, the train station is very close to, with also around 3 mins by walking.The hotel room is spacious and having great horizon views on higher floors.Only thing that tourists need to consider is that if we need to travel to city center of Osaka, this hotel is quite far from city center and needs several transfers by train.We will definitely go back to this hotel if we plan for a family trip to Universal studio Osaka.

review_body: Hotel was booked because it was so close to universal. It is close by taxi to the Osaka aquarium and LEGO land, however public transport is not so quick if your goi g from the hotel to either LEGO land or the aquarium as you need to change lines and they line to the aquarium and LEGO land is not on a JR line which means your JR pass won’t work (but only a small fee). Taxi from Shin Osaka to the hotel is approx ¥6000 depending on time of day. Getting into Osaka city is quick by JR Tain from Universal City. The hotel isn’t central to everything, but if your willing to travel a bit and have the money (not for budget trips) it’s worth the stay. Area surrounding the hotel is known as Universal City (Same Name as the train station). It has some cool shops as well as heaps of restaurants. Good pricing varies depending on where you go, however value is good in General. Hotel breakfast is great and can’t complain. Hotel is super convenient to go to Universal studios. We went on our last day just as the park opened at 10am. We checked out and left our bags at reception and went straight to the park. Lines where moderate and I’m glad we didn’t have to wake up earlier to get there from Osaka or further away. Once we finished at the park (around 6:30pm) we walked back to the hotel and got a taxi back to Shin-Osaka Would definitely stay again if I’m back.

review_body: The location was awesome. The nearest hotel to Universal Studio Japan. Located in front of Universal Studio Japan and Hard Rock Cafe Osaka. The room was spacious,new and comfortable. The view of USJ was stunning..Highly recommended.

review_body: The hotel room is nice and very clean. The room is spacious and suitable for family. The breakfast was excellent. The hotel location is just in front of Universal, make it convenient after a tiring day playing. Definetely value for money.

Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being right in front of the USJ entrance brings out a massive sigh of relief from tired parents coming out of USJ - and it was great to come back to a good hotel after a full day at USJ.Location - its approx 1 hour 15 minutes using the airport express bus from Kansai airport and it stops at the bus stop, about 5 minutes walk away. Its flat all the way so no problems with pushing those roller bags - you will be walking past the entrance of Universal Studios and then voila, you will see the hotel. We actually stayed a full week in this hotel even though we did not go to USJ each day. While its not in the main part of Osaka, you have the Universal City train station right next to the hotel. Getting to Namba is about a 20 minute train ride away, which for us was not a problem as the trains are frequent enough. We in fact did day trips out to Kyota and Nara without much hassle. The hotel is part of the Universal City Walk so there are plenty of restaurants to choose from. The hotel has a Lawsons convenience store in its premises, and there is another one just outside - if you get hungry, the Lawsons sells plenty of food - both hot and cold, as well as some of the most fabulous, value for money desserts. Try the cream puffs!The rooms are large and long - so for us, we had 4 beds next to one another, in a very long, slightly narrow room. No issue with the room size, it was comfy enough and pretty large for Japanese standards. Fantastic bathroom amenities, spanking clean, wifi was good. If you can, do get a room that faces the park. It is lovely to see the park during sun rise, and we could also see the fireworks every night from the Christmas show. At the same time you can see the Tempozan Ferris wheel, which is very pretty in the night. The hotel was great with providing accessories for our toddler - like bed rail, and stool which was fantastic. Tickets for USJ can be bought in the hotel and charged to the room. This was useful as you do not need to queue at USJ to purchase the tickets. We had the buffet breakfast each day - pretty good variety, with a Japanese/Asian slant, but quality is very decent, and plenty to eat. We love how they deal with the crowds very efficiently - so even during the peak hours, food is topped up, and queues are manageable. A slight issue would be the difficulty in communication in English, an issue that is not just in this hotel so its not entirely a criticism. We had problems trying to understand the USJ express pass system, and had problems finding a money changer (Which by the way is in the Keihan hotel next door) and problems finding a route to the airport without using the taxi.Our communication with the hotel staff was difficult due to the language barrier. While they were always polite, they were not necessarily helpful in providing proper instructions - again, likely due to language. So if you need help with directions, train schedules, train routes- use Google Maps. It was particularly helpful when figuring out the train system.
hotelName:

review_body: The room has excellent view of the park as well as Tempozan ferris wheel. The 2 wash basins and 2 toilets definitely is useful for sharing. The bathroom is spacious and clean. Conveniently bought the Universal Studio Pass Tickets from the hotel counter.

review_body: I’ll keep it short.Pros: - a extremely short walking distance to USJ. Staying late to watch the Christmas show knowing that the hotel is near after a long day was great.- check-in was a breeze.- I took domestic flight to osaka, round trip for limo bus was a breeze.- I like how their bathroom and toilet are separated. Cons:- universal city was fun to walk but limited choices of food. Need to travel out with at least 40 mins train ride. I recommend this hotel just for USJ stay for a night or two. Do travel light to get here (I.e a luggage will be sufficient for 2 to 3 people), it will be easier for you.

Got a standard quadruple room but was upgraded to a superior with park view!The room is big though with 4 beds a bit cramped but we don't mind. Bath room is separate from toilet and everything is so clean. There's also a lawson store with atm inside the hotel and a coin operated laundry.A bit far from Osaka proper but for us it served its purpose because we were already dragging our 7 year old after spending an entire day in the park. So overall it was a great stay and my kids loved it.

Not the cheapest hotel option but amazing value. Stay Here.

I’m not sure if this is the case with Swissotel Nankai, so you should make sure first. But the rooms were very clean and pretty. I liked the interior design and the beds were quite comfortable. I enjoyed the city view and it was fun to stay on a higher level. I’d recommend this place if you can afford it. It’s a bit pricey but I splurged because it was my birthday.

review_body: Great room & bathroom - spotless good size and view. Great location. great service For reference, We are mature family with elderly, didn’t drive- thus location and size of room are the main concern for selecting hotels. Swissotel achieves everything. Breakfast were perfect as well, tidy, food kept refilling , loved the juice selection, chefs were eager to help. No complaint at allLocation? I can’t find better than that! My parent can’t walk too much, thus most of the time we sent them back to hotel and sneaked out for shopping or supper, the location allowed us to do so without any hassle. There are multi- entrance available for the hotel eg airport express station (Rapi:t), Namba city which connecting to different malls as well eg Namba park. Sound proof is great too, we could hear family with kids in the corridor but never disturbed us in room . Great view in both room and breakfast place. We have no regret at all to take the hotel and will definitely recommend to others We made use of the luggage delivery service (by another operator with counter in hotel) to the Airport too at a very good price. What a wonderful bonus ! We thus spent our last few hours at Rinku Town outlet without our luggage.Thank you for the responsive reservation and concierge team!! They helped us a lot through the booking and reserving restaurants. Always positive and helpful . everything well communicated. Thank you for the front office team for arranging nice rooms on the same floor for my family. My parent is happy with the rooms and Almost didn’t want to get out of it =] size is one of the largest I stayed in osaka. We are not at a very high floor but still promising view indeed. Housekeeping did spotless cleaning ! Although they could be busy with their work, whenever they met us at the corridor, they always greeted us with smile. In- room dining team has sent us beautiful cake and Macarons. Love them !

1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka

review_body: They claim this is a 5 star hotel but this hotel needs to seriously look at what it's offering. Rooms desperately in need of a refurb, old and tired is what you get. Breakfast is expensive, 2950 yen and that is supposedly a discounted rate. The location is good however. Would I stay here again? No.

review_body: It was my first time to visit Osaka after having visited Tokyo a couple of times and was looking for a central and accessible location to explore the place as well as partake of the food that Osaka has become synonymous with — boy did this hotel not disappoint. The location and the accessibility of this hotel is its main draw but don’t be fooled because the rooms are very comfortable and some have been newly renovated too. The Hotel is very near, in fact has access directly, to one of the most well known Japanese Malls - Takashimaya which is not only a good place to shop but is also a great place to eat whether it’s in one of the restaurants or grabbing something at the Basement Food hall! Accessibility from the airport and other nearby attractions like Narra and Kyoto is another draw of this hotel as it sits on top of the train station. If shopping is your thing but you’re not really into malls, this is still the location for you as you there are numerous 100 Yen stores around and it’s located in one of the two shopping districts of Osaka - Namba. It’s close to Shinsaibashi-suji which basically is the 600 meter connection to Umeda (the other major shopping district of Osaka)
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best locaton - on the train station to the airport (ask for the direct train), near the best arrea of the city of Osaka. very clean. very good service. ask for a room with a bed that not in the corner of the room.
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located at the busy transportation Hub of Osaka is an advantage for travelers using train etc. Well connected throughout entire network of train transportation and located above the famous Takishmaya department store. Suitable for business and family.
hotelName:

Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The pool and sauna were wonderful. Hotel staff at very helpful. Bike use and use of phone with internet is really a great freebie. The room was a bit small. But overall, great value for money especially if you plan on traveling the Kansai region via trains. :)
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed at the Swissotel Nankai in Osaka and the following was my overall experiences. +- Centrally located location- it was easy to get around because the Namba station is right below the Hotel. We were traveling from city to city to wanted to be as close as possible to our train stations and this helped out. + Easy to get to from the train station- there are signs underground that lead you to the right direction. - Rooms are tiny, the bathroom is small- this was by far the smallest hotel we stayed throughout our Japan trip. - The main entrance to the hotel comes from the street/train level and that's the only entrance I found aside from the taxi stand. It's inconvenient when you are upstairs looking around at the shops and having to go back down to that level to take the elevator back to main lobby. Overall, I would recommend this hotel based on the location only. That's about it if you have a lot of luggage or bags it's going to be cramped quickly. I would recommend going elsewhere if you don't mind being further from the Namba station.
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel is so convenient that we can find it easily when we drop off the train at Nanbai station. The service and room is good as well. We had a rest in this hotel and hope this can help the others who maybe choose this hotel.
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I hadn't heard of Swissôtel when I booked the room for my family and I for our short 3-day, 2-night Osaka trip. The hotel is new, clean and modern with all the right amenities and excellent service. A 2-bed room fit my family of 4, although we'd probably opt for a larger room with an extra bed or pull-out next visit. The location is fantastic: connected to the multi-line Namba train station, Takashimaya department store, and directly across Dotonburi. Swissôtel Nankai is our hotel of choice in Osaka!
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, Subway & trains are below the hotel . Lots of food options to choose from , lots of shops and nearby Dotombori lights. Rooms are spacious and it is nice looking out the windows at the Views. The beds are very comfortable and have a pillow menu too. Breakfast was included in our package. The week day attendant from Belgium was very welcoming and was a great way to start out day , Hefeweizen very welcoming and bubbly. The buffet breakfast had the biggest choices for breakfast , there is every thing you could imagine and more from the buffet , they have Asian choices and western choices. The buffet was very tasty and I would recommend this hotel and if I am ever in Osaka it would be my 1st choice of Hotel in Osaka.
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Price on the very high bracket especially for Friday & Saturday. Excellent location. Easy access to sight seeing places, shopping, restaurant & connection to airport. Food varieties for breakfast were very good.

Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Junior Suite room is perfect for family with kids. However, the Executive Twin room where it said can occupied by 3 adults & 1 kid is way too small and they stay uncomfortably. Inaccurate information.
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful stay at the hotel for 3 nights, high floor, nice room with great view of Osaka city. Friendly and helpful staff at the concierge who to direct us how to walk. Good location, direct train from airport to hotel, and the famous walking streets of Osaka are just downstair of the hotel. Will definitely stay at this hotel again.
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: always a great time at this nice, clean, convenient, posh hotel. reception and all staffs are all warm, helpful and accomodating. breakfast with a great aerial view of osaka on the 36/F. parking is convenient.
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ll come back because of its location (on top of train station, subway nearby, at the heart of Namba area, and walkable to shops and restaurants). But it also offers quiet and clean rooms as well as friendly service.Typical of Japanese urban hotels: room size is on the small side and facilities are basic. But they do take good care of you.Didn’t try breakfast because there were simply too many to choose from in the surrounding neighbourhood.We drove because of our travelling plan for the central region. It’s quite a challenge to find this hotel’s parking. Do ask in advance. And you’ll need to pay (at a discounted rate).We slept well and were happy.
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The check-in was smooth and the room we stayed in is comfortable and overlook the train station (to my son's greatest surprise). On the second night, to our dismay we realise we left the "DND" sign on and the room was not cleaned. However, housekeeping came by at 10pm and changed our towels, and replenish all amenities, even though its way after working hours. We are very touched by the hotel effort to ensure our stay is comfortable throughout. Thumbs up.
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed here nearly every year since we started visiting in 2013. This year is a shocking disappointment. Cleaners are not competent. Can't even get hold of front desk right now because all phones are not working! It's 9.30PM. Imagine if we had an emergency!Was already unimpressed when we arrived and no staff present to take our luggages. When did service level for a luxury hotel become so low?
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is great and so covenient to go anywhere in Osaka and nearby. From Kansai airport, you can take the MRT to Namba station and hotel is on the north side with the access elevator to the hotel. Takashima is on the same building and Namba is great for shopping as always.
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great time! Staff were very helpful and the service was perfect and professional! Overall I wish it was the last hotel we stayed at because it was the best one out of the three we went to. We stayed for a few nights while exploring Osaka and it has been memorable!
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in one of the club rooms which are newly renovated and are super comfy. Breakfast and happy hour in the lounge is superb and service is super friendly. They have staff from all around the world so every guest will find someone speaking their mother tongue. Location is superb with minutes to the famous night markets only. Absolutely would return and can only recommend!
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed this property on 3/27/2019.Property is nice , central ,clean.I was staying Room 3209.I requested early check in at the time of reservation . I know it depends on availability .I pre paid the room and my breakfast at the time of my reservationI was there at 12 Noon , was told room is empty but not clean , so come back at 3 PM. It does not take 3 hours to clean a roomI was told only option is to pay 15000 yens and go to executive level. .The front desk check in was VERY unwelcoming , unpleasant and not helpful at all. This is very unusual for Japanese culture, they are always helpful and polite people.I was tired I paid 15000 yens to go to the executive floor I go to room and find it is 2 twin beds. I went with my wife. I had to come down and ask her to give me one queen size bed room as per my reservationI did not get to room till ! PM. The executive floor is nothing but cheap wine and finger food. We do not drink alcohol so it was waste of my money. It is not like Ritz Carlton Club level.I enjoyed my stay in Tokyo, Kyoto . But I found this hotel check in staff did not care for me. I was there for fun not business . May be they deal with more business customers.
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice large room but after the superb Peninsula in Tokyo quite disappointing service and ambiance. The concierge was literally never there over three days and two nights. When the heat did not work, instead of sending an engineer they sent a bellman who could only (uselessly) turn up the dial on the thermostat. It also turns out they charge 9,000 yen/night to open the advertised fold-out couch in the junior suite for your child to sleep on - it felt like a bait and switch. With no concierge the bellman was nice enough to make a dinner reservation, then spoiled it a bit by telling me firmly twice not to be late. The food in the executive lounge was skimpy - it turns out they will make you eggs, but the waitress did not come over to tell us and take an order until we were nearly finished eating. So in nearly every interaction, the staff betrays poor or non-existent training. The result is that the Peninsula makes you feel like royalty, Swissôtel like they really don’t want you there.
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved everything about our stay here. The location was excellent, the rooms were clean and modern, the staff were helpful and prompt and best was the buffet breakfast. There was so much variety of food including Western, Japanese and Chinese dishes that even my husband and daughter, who are picky eaters, enjoyed it. The food was fresh, high quality and delicious and the dining room had a great view of the city,
hotelName:
1    Swissotel Nankai Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great property. Service is exceptional and the rooms were great. All of the rooms we have stayed in on our trip were very small. These rooms weren’t as small as the other places but smaller that what you would see in the US. Very nice rooms, clean, well taken care of. Can’t say enough about the quality of the room. AC worked magnificently, kept the room cold, actually had to turn it up. Turn down service at night. We had pizza delivered on Monday June 8th and we waited at the entry to the hotel. The young men there in top hats were very helpful. I wish I knew their names. They were on duty on the 8th around 3pm. The delivery driver forgot to leave the drinks. One of the young men didn’t pause, he took off running to find the driver (I had already walked in the hotelBefore realizing I didn’t have drinks). He came back several minutes later, drinks in hand. Not sure how far he had to go but that was a wow moment. Great job and I hope these guys get recognized for the extra service.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time for choosing Ritz Osaka with family. Booking the Japanese suite to try the different experience in Japan. The room was not big as normal and ok for funny experience. But not strong recommendation. The service is very good and breakfast is ok but no more choice. The location is good and can walk to Osaka Station within 10 minutes.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had been in the ritz carton twice and I think it is good with a enjoy full of dinner. The lounge is big and the food is epically tasty. For example, the desserts, and the fruits are so sweet. The room size is big and the decorations are high, there was a teddy bear grossed in blue and red just like the London soldiers.The hallway is close to the MTR station and easy to travel around the area. In addition, I had been to Takashi maya in almost 6 minutes! You can also go shopping in there while you walk there.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my fourth time at The Ritz-Carlton Osaka . At this time I had a very special occasion to celebrate my son graduation . The Ritz-Carlton Osaka is the place that I realized and they 've never let me disappointed to choose . Everybody recognized me , from the lobby , the bellman , Mr.Kim from Korean addressed with me and told that he remember my last time here . And when I went up to the club lounge , I feeled like back to home again . All of the Ritz-Carlton Osaka ladies and gentlemen treated me as I and my family are a part of their family . I 've got a warm welcome from Miss Haruka and Miss Abe . The foods and drinks at the club lounge are more delicious than my last time . I would like to thank you to Monsieur Jeremy Goffard who prepared everythings that very amazing and surprise me and my family to have a big happiness , the room was upgraded to the best room with the sweet congratuation cake in there , we are so appreciated . We 've just arrived home in Thailand but can't wait to go to The Ritz-Carlton Osaka again soon !
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has a very grand feel to it, this was our last stop in Japan. The hotel is located close to the shopping malls, the rooms are beautiful and the views are breathtaking especially on the higher floors the staff is very pleasant and helpful, the concierge was alright not the best especially compared to the hotels we visited previously in Japan.A classic Ritz Carlton hotel.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Disappointing experience for a Ritz Carlton.Although recently renovated (2-3 years), the property is dated.The suite assigned to me smelled of cigarette smoke. Mainland Chinese Customers smoke in rooms.Changed suite and although better, the thick carpet was still permeated in the persistent smell of smoke. The automatic blinds did not working smoothly and the room had a dated feeling.Service as far as the attention to the small details is concerned is missing.No WOW factor.Concierge service is inexistent..Check in process is convoluted.Breakfast is ok, but not impressive.The hotel seems to lack command and control from Management.Good location.Conrad Hotel is a better overall Property!
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This spring, I was fortunate to get the opportunity to spend another two weeks at this top-notch hotel. The staff in Osaka goes above and beyond to make every guest feel welcome and at home. The service is simply superb. Views from the hotel are breathtaking as you are able to see (from the higher levels) much of the Osaka skyline, and the city is even more beautiful after sunset when all of the lights come on. The property of the hotel is immaculately kept, and the hotel is within easy walking distance of a large number of hotels and entertainment options. In addition, there is an underground station below the hotel that connects to Osaka Station, so you can get to the train station without having to go outside if the weather is bad or hot. The dining options in the hotel are excellent as well as the hotel spa and fitness center. I've included more information about getting to and around Osaka in my blog post on our second trip. Many thanks to the Ritz Carlton Osaka staff for their kindness and professionalism. I can't wait to go back!
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Ritz Carlton Osaka was the best hotel in Osaka, it has 22 years old, but you can't see any mark of aged, the room was big due to old design, and all staff of this hotel was so nice and helpful, no other to say, just fantastic!
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful and luxurious hotel with even better, 7 star service. Finished a 10 day trip to Japan with 2 nights at the wonderful Ritz Osaka and couldn’t be happier with the attentive, welcoming staff that made us feel at ease from the moment we stepped in. Absolutely delightful experience!
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I were part of the Tauck Tours to Japan to see the Cherry Blosooms and we decided to arrive a few days early for our own private pre-tour of Osaka. The Ritz Carlton Osaka (RCO) is a luxurious 5 star hotel with all the amenities you could ask for.There are several restaurants housed within RCO making it very convenient to choose dining at these high end restaurants. Splendido is Italian, however, since we were in Japan, we wanted to try Japanese cuisine on our first night in Osaka. But, at Splendido, breakfast is a good option providing a buffet and ala carte menu. If you are not big breakfast eaters, Ala Carte is the way to go as the cost is quite high for buffet. If you are not comfortable with left hand driving, as Japan is like the British system using shuttle and taxis is the way to go. Taxi's are queued up at the front of SCO for really easy and secure selection of taxi cabs and reliable drivers to and from your hotel. Check to be sure, that they accept credit cards, best way to conserve you Yen for other travel purposes. Toilet are TOTO, our first introduction to the high tech world of a toilet seat greeter upon entrance to the compartmentalized toilet area. If you choose, you can get an automatic sprinkle wash of your bottom with a warm soothing water spray with a variety of water pressures. What we didn't know is that most of Japan has move to a total "TOTO" approach, including public areas of transportation and most high end establishments. Looks like this is going to put a dent in the toilet paper industry!Our room had a great view of the harbor being on the 30th floor with spectacular morning and evening views. We came for the Cherry Blossoms and sad to say, Osaka experienced an extreme cold snap a few weeks before loosing most of it's blossoms. However, if you look far and near you will find some trees with a variety of floral colors. On our first day, we went up to the garden area and found one tree with a few blossoms! We realized that this might just be a indication of what's was to come...Little or No Cherry Blossoms!
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there for 2 nights. The hotel is location is great. We can take the under pass from Osaka train station and go to the hotel directly.Room and the staff service is really world class. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The views from the high floors are to die for, they made us feel so special in our 10 year anniversary, with a fantastic room upgrade and a fruit plate with a personal greeting! But the best part was the sersonal and flawless service. Yuko Nakakura is one of the best Concierges we ever met in any hotel, going out of her way to get us dinner reservations at very hard to book restaurants and personally going to the train station to change a Shinkansen ticket and find us a place at an earlier train in an extremely busy holiday start.Five stars with high honors!
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Osaka for 5 nights. We enjoyed very good service from the moment we arrived late at night. We were picked up promptly from the airport limousine bus stop at Herbis Osaka. We ordered room service and the room service staff took a lot of effort to ensure the food and champagne was well presented and our in room dining experience was an enjoyable one. We had wonderful help from Ms Miwa Hayashi (Concierge) every day who made excellent restaurant recommendations, made reservations, printed confirmations and directions, enquired about gluten free options (for me), and even escorted us to a restaurant just below the Ritz Carlton. (Thank you Hayashi san!). Finally the room was great. We had a most enjoyable stay.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was perfect from the beginning to end! The attention to detail in this hotel is above all standards. We felt at home immediately. All staff was welcoming and spoke English. The food was exquisite, in all outlets. We highly recommend a stay here! It is a 5 star jewel. Thank you to all of the staff at the Ritz Cartlon Osaka for your hospitality!
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very very grand and the reception service was very good. We are luckily that to have an upgrade to a corner room. It is much bigger. The view was amazing. We went down to the bar at 5/F for a drink before dinner. The waiter seemed a bit odd and ignored us. I guessed that we did not dress up. we left and had a drink in the lounge instead. Generally the staff are friendly and welcoming except the waiter in the bar on 5/F.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Osaka was our last city visited in Japan and we are quite pleased that we left the Ritz Carlton for last as it concluded our trip at a top noteThe city is beatifull with many sight seeings worth to visit, yet one must not miss the Osaka Castle originaly built by Toyotomi in 1585Great building, beatiful suroundings and with a superb view from top florWe’ll love to come back to Japan
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton, Osaka for about 4 days in March 2019. It surpassed all our expectations in terms of comfort and service. The service staff at the Ritz, especially the concierge team, went over and beyond to make us feel welcomes and attended to our needs with genuine sincerity. I would highly recommend staying at the Ritz-Carlton, Osaka. Although the cost is higher, the amount of help and assistance that they give to guests to make their time in Osaka memorable is immeasurable. Apart from the great service, the hotel is also conveniently located near different subway lines such as the Osaka Station and Shin-osaka Stations.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good service and convenient location.Will come back again!This is a high rise so the views are amazing!Rooms are kept well cleaned and bath room are spacious. I dont speak Japanese and I can communicate fine with the hotel staff.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Ritz-Carlton in Osaka is a wonderful hotel with an amazing staff. I've already planned my next stay there since it's conveniently located outside of Osaka Station, which is very close to Shin Osaka Station for easy access to the Shinkansen.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a business/event partner/venue, Ritz Carlton has never disappointed given the top notch event organization capacity, service standard, professionalism, amd of course location itself is a big plus as well. But as for individual guests, I have to say this time the experience is a bit underwhelming as my third time here. First of all, the hotel needs a renovation. The rooms and facilities are old. Not the old-charm heritage type of old, but worn out. Service has also become average. It doesn't feel like Ritz Carlton, although the brand has done all it can to undermine that Marriott ownership, which I don't blame them. But it hasn't really delivered the traditional Ritz standard either. More English training is needed for front desk and concierge staff, otherwise this feels like a local chain. The housekeepers need to be more detail-oriented (i thought we are in Japan, excuse me?) to avoid constantly putting back empty toilet amenities without replacing them, or to do better in the night service. Again, if this was for a normal hotel, I wouldn't have ranked four star. But it still carries the Ritz Carlton name, I would assume and expect higher standard. The only standard it never seems to miss is pricing.To be honest, I wonder how this type of old-school so called luxurious hotels stay competitive in an environment that people's travel behavior has fundamentally changed. Anyway, not my problem.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family stayed here for a few nights this month. We had an amazing time and could not think of a single point of improvement. The staff are so well-trained and they take such good care of their guests. We had three children in our single hotel room and all of us fit perfectly (we brought two inflatable mattresses)We booked a superior room- probably their lowest category of room, yet it was so spacious and had a wonderfully spacious bathroom with a shower and a tub. Beds were amazing and there was no sound from other rooms or other floors. Location is fantastic with easy access to the underground walkway. View of Osaka was wonderful! Pool was absolutely perfect and delightful. Lastly, restaurants were wonderful! Staying here made our time in Osaka so easy and wonderful. Thank you to the incredible staff and management. We can't wait to return.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were transiting through Osaka and only stayed 2 days, but loved our time there and The Ritz-Carlton made it so very special. The building lobby & rooms take you back in time with proper afternoon tea in at the Lobby Lounge. Our room was in spacious and very nicely appointed. They recently made breakfast free for guests, which was an added treat as they selection & quality was fantastic. Above all, the staff were warm and welcoming, making our stay all-the-more enjoyable. In particular, the bell hop that assisted us when checking in (Asaki Yoshiuchi) was very polite and entertained our 4 & 5 year old children while we checked in. On top of that, when we mentioned we were heading to Kyoto after our stay there, he had waiting for us the following day a map & other materials with a number of suggestions on places we might enjoy while we were there. Our kids looked for him each time we went through the lobby, making it a great experience for them as well. We will definitely be back and thank The Ritz-Carlton for a great & memorable stay in Osaka.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Is what we expect from the Ritz. The service at Osaka is outstanding good at the Lounge. Everybody knows us now after 6 nights . I’m writing still at the Hotel. We had no upgrade this time at the Ritz and for the lounge we had to pay. I must mention the housekeeping which is so perfect in cleaning and tidying up.The chocolate buffet is similar good like in Singapore. Location of the Ritz is near Osaka Station.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The ladies and gentlemen in The Ritz-Carlton Osaka, from reception to the door staff, made us feel at home away from home during our staying for four days. When we heard “Welcome back”, we knew that we were home.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the junior suite and it was fantastic. Plenty of space and with a nice view over the city. The only surprising thing was that they did not have bathrobes in larger size. One would expect that in such a exclusive hotel.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay at Ritz Carlton Osaka at Feb for fours nights.This at our first time stay here and we make a right choiceReally Home away home Start from the arrival till the departure.RC Osaka Extend the Warm Welcome, genuine Care and provide the comfort place for us.Room and hotel location are prefect We receive the Full and daily amenities in our room,Housekeeping professional.The GR team is our standing.Junko -She is the star in the hotel, superb Professional and amazing.She Take care of us upon arrival till we leftTruly appreciateWe got the late check out offer from the hotel,Professional Bell attendant to help us pack our luggage and even the driver drop us off at the bus station.Specially Thank you and congratulations the General Manger Mr Chris Clark running such as beautiful hotel and best team.The Ritz Carlton Osaka ,we will be back)))
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent three nights at the Ritz Carlton Osaka, a marvellous and beautiful hotel in the Kita-area of Osaka. The professionalism of the staff was evident from our first arrival, and lasted throughout our stay. The building is classic, with beautiful details throughout. The rooms are big and quite modern, with spacious bathrooms and views of the city.The breakfast was a mix between Western and Japanese, and it had some interesting elements, such as the truffle omelette. However, the range was quite narrow in comparison to other Ritz Carlton’s, and expensive. I recommend the hotel for everyone who would like a luxurious stay in close vicinity to the major attractions of the city, and for a hotel with a great concierge service.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights mainly due to it is closed to Shopping mall and streets.Overall experience is excellent, good services and nice food.Rooms are possible renovated as it don't look like 20 years old.Contemporary design for bathroom, size is big with 2 basin, heated mirror. Fully automatic Japan bidet type water closet.the lobby is designed to Old English style.the Teppanyaki was good but pricey. Not worth in my opinion, there are much more choice out there.Will definitely re visit again
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Looked like many locals come to enjoy the hotel. The hotel rooms were bit dated but the workers were superb at accommodating their guests. The helium balloons and the camping tent bedding they prepared for kids were loved my my little ones. Their lounge is beautiful and foods are delicious. This lounge had one of the best lounge cocktails I’ve experienced. Their signature cocktails were all amazing. The GM came around greeting at the lounge and he was very welcoming and friendly. Swimming pool felt a bit dated as well but it was enough for my kids.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy to get here from Kansai via the airport limo bus. Once you arrive at the bus terminal a quick call to the hotel will send a shuttle which is literally around the corner. The front desk staff were perfect in explaining everything about the hotel to include our porter Mr. Kim. Who explained all the buttons in the room. The fitness center was closed along with a restaurant for renovations. A bit pricey for cocktails in the lounge and a temporarily relocated bar on the 37th floor which charged a cover fee. Don't know why a hotel guest would be charged but other than that 1st class. Buffet breakfast was a feast with a mix of asian and american food.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at a king superior room.As soon as I entered the hotel entrance I feel lost in a different country.Though the view from the room was not good, the room was comfortable including bed.The breakfast was good! We choice various cuisines. The staff members cooked omelet in front of guest. We can choose some omelet. I recommend Truffe omelet! In addition, we can drink sparkling wine.It’s good that we can have dinner after 10pm in the bar. You can have dinner after concert.All the staff member was friendly and they introduce themselves when I meet them for the first time. After that, they remember guest name , they talk to us when I see in the hotel.キングスーペリアルームに宿泊しました。ホテルに入った途端に違う国に迷いこんだような感覚になります。部屋からの景色はあまり良くなかったですが、ベッドを含めて部屋は快適でした。朝食はいろんな種類から選べるのがGoodだと思います。オムレツはいくつかの種類から選べて、ゲストの前で作ってくれます。トリュフオムレツがオススメです。また、朝からスパークリングワインが飲めます。コンサート帰り等夜10時を過ぎても、バーで食事ができるのも良いです。ホテルのスタッフはフレンドリーで、最初に会った時には自己紹介をして、ゲストの名前を覚えてくれます。ホテルで見かけた時には話しかけてくれます。
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my fourth trip to this Ritz and I now look to see anything less than perfection. I found everything to be perfect. The staff is exceptionally well trained, friendly and helpful in every regard. I hope to return.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked 5 nights for my family vocation. This location is closed to train so that it is convenient for you to go to Kyoto or other cities. You can walk to several shopping malls in 10 minutes underground.Moreover, the view is nice at night!
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel from the minute you walk in is fantastic, it is very luxurious (a little bit pricy unless you have corporate rates when your an get a great deal!). The spa facility has a really nice gym, pool, sauna/jacuzzi and massage services.Staff are extremely helpful and knowledgeable on local restaurants, quick places to visit of an evening for a quick trip around the Osaka sites. Food is a little expensive but the quality is exceptional, you get what you pay for I guess. For something a little special, I would strongly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff and service is professional as expected, and they spend time attending to every inquiry and need of guests. The room was luxurious and elegant with a fantastic view of Osaka's densely populated and beautiful metropolitan high rise of 2.5 million people. The food delicious fusion of western and Japanese options. On site 24 hour gym came in handy when the jet lag kept me awake, but they also had a spa and an in room massage services till 2am. Better yet, when we had to extend our check out by 1 hour, they pleasantly agreed and asked how they could be of assistance. Overall, an agreeable experience.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spend 6 nights at the hotel. Everything is perfect. We are upgraded to the Club Floor. The view is gorgeous. The staffs are very attentive, paying to our little details and requests.One minor complaint is that the breakfast buffet is too crowded when the hotel is fully booked during Christmas period. We have to wait for the table and some food is running out. This is the common nature during the holiday season. We are understand.Apart from this, we love the hotel and staffs (Room Service, Guest Service and others) . Definitely worth the money and absolutely recommended.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was big and cozy. The service at sushi restaurant was excellent. Highly recommend to try their lunch set menu for sushi. Only thing is hotel location is little bit far from main area and no shopping center closed.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A wonderful place with lots of space in the room. Great wifi and an amazing location, just a stone’s throw from Osaka Station, shops and eateries. The staff are ever so helpful too. Had the most wonderful time here and will definitely return again!
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Most services are good however not as good as Ritz Carlton Kyoto. Room services could be improved. Also as was settled in a room to the railway side, there was a little bit of noise at night when trains passed through.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel. It is just old ! It has a very classic style, like a Ritz you imagine your grandparents went to. Every thing is pretty well kept, but it just feels old and out dated . The location is great and the staff is really friendly and attentive. The food could use some improvement. I am specifically talking about the breakfast buffet and the chocolate buffet (yes a mid afternoon buffet that serves everything with chocolate) the quality in my opinion is not at a Ritz standard. Now the sushi restaurant was AMAZING ! the place , service and quality is second to none ! So is the price !!! VERY EXPENSIVE to order a la carte .This hotel If remodeled could be spectacular
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Osaka for the last few years for our company's Japan seminar. It is always a great experience to come to the Ritz during November, when all of the Christmas decorations are up. You really get a sense of the holidays during this time.The breakfast buffet is good and they also provide champagne, with a wide range of egg options. The rooms are nicely furnished and decently sized. Service at the Ritz Carlton is great, with well-trained staff.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights at the Ritz Carlton Osaka during the thanksgiving weekend. It’s our first time to Osaka, and I was glad that I picked the hotel, not just because of the easy location but also the friendly staff and the high quality service. I have never vacation with my kids without my husband, so I was a bit nervous before the trip, thank goodness the hotel concierge was very helpful, they explained the direction patiently and gave us nice advices regards restaurants. The room wasn’t new but they maintain it well and the bed was comfortable. I have nothing to complain except the strong smell from the toilet. Overall it’s a pleasure stay and we will definitely come back if we ever visit Osaka again!P.S their bakery is a hidden gem, make sure to stop by if you are there!
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my first time staying in this hotel in Osaka. Hotel is excellent and Location is very nice. Room is big, classic, tidy and clean. Hotel staffs are very friendly, supportive and professional. Hotel services are excellent like they provide transportation between airport limousine stop and hotel which other hotels don't. Overall experience is excellent and recommended. Wish I can come back soon as I'll stay away from Marriott group hotel now because of Marriott/SPG merge membership issue. Sad. Good luck to Marriott.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ritz Carlton Osaka is truly a model for what a Ritz Carlton is supposed to be. The quality of the room is fantastic. Every detail is thoughtful in luxury and design. The showers are amazing. The bed is super comfortable. The TV is large and easy to use. The amenities are generous in size and quality.The best part is the people. Rarely have I seen such excellent staff perform their roles with such genuine care and professionalism. This an experience worth having. Bravo!!
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service here was by far the best I've ever come across. Very attentive staff! We were there during typhoon Jebi and our window blew open (scariest moment of my life, but nevertheless memorable), and the staff were so helpful. Breakfast was amazing (hubby is still going on about the truffle omelette), and room service was great. I don't have a single negative thing to say about our experience. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Even if I were very picky, I couldn’t come up with something wrong during our stay at this hotel. Rooms are ample and comfortable, service is outstanding, and the breakfast buffet is great.For kids, the staff will bring them a unique experience starting with a personalized check-in, where thy will make them feel like they are the actual guests instead of their parents.We learned a few hours before our arrival of something called the “Exploration experience” for kids; we were sad to learn that you had to make arrangements for it one week before arrival, however, we still asked upon our check-in; the staff managed to arrange it for our second night!This experience consists on setting un a camping tent inside the room so that kids can sleep as if they went camping; our kid loved it!Can’t recommend this hotel enough.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Checkin was the worse. We arrived at 1:30/1:45, we did not get into our room until 4:30. When we arrived we were advised the room wasn't ready. Others checking in at the same time were able to get into their room without an issue. We are platinum elite status so are entitled to a room upgrade, but were told they didn't have any. That was fine. After waiting 15 minutes, they took us to the room. We asked for a nonsmoking room, when we got to the room, the room smelled of smoke, or perhaps just musty and dusty. Went back to front desk for a room change. Again, no room ready. Front desk manager gets involved. He said he could upgrade us but room would not be ready until 4:30, by this time it is 3. We are too late to get lunch, most places stop lunch at 2:30-3. I asked manager for access to the lounge to make up for the terrible check in experience. At first he said yes, but when we came back he said the he would only charge us 12,000 yen ($107) per day for access to the lounge, discounted from 80,000 yen ($700)!!! This is a ridiculous price. I went on line and the difference in price between the room I booked and the lounge room was only 8,000-10,000 yen, but he was giving us a break at 12,000 yen!! So they did nothing to make up for wasting 3 hours of our time.The hotel is very stuffy, both the furniture & décor and the air. There was no good air circulation in the lobby or bar. Bar on the 5 floor is a cigar bar, very smelly. They charge 1,900 yen per person cover charge. 2 drinks with cover, tip & tax was almost $100 to sit in a hot smelly smoky bar. They even charged a 15% service charge for the mini bar in the room!The room was nice, if you like that style. Again, all felt stuffy. Breakfast was very good, many options. WiFi worked well. Concierge was not particularly helpful with picking restaurants. I’ve stayed at Four Seasons previously, I’ll stick with them.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It has been some time since I have last visited Osaka. I have always loved going to Japan for the food but this is the first time I have gone with our kid. The hotel is really nice, with nice big room and great attention to details. They have the sleeping wear for the adults and the kids. They have also prepared the kids tooth brush and slippers for our kid. Also, they have a nice swimming pool that separated the lap area and kids swimming area. If you plan to swim, please remember to bring your swimming cap. Also, if you have a tattoo, you would have to cover them up by wearing a rashie. They also have rashies to loan you if you do not have one. Around the hotel, the shopping areas are close by with lots of good food. The hotel itself has a wonderful Japanese restaurant. I think I have found my go to hotel in Osaka. I will definitely stay there again in the future.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A few days in Osaka with my family at the RITZ could not have been better. Excellent location close to the train station and downtown core - easy access to subway and so much to see and do. Very well appointed rooms and attentive staff and excellent service.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotels are about comfort, features, location and food. Great hotels are about people. The Osaka Ritz-Carleton is a great hotel. The staff, from manager Rory Slater to the folks who empty your dustbin know who you are and are genuine in their desire to help.The Ryuichi Sakamoto tunes performed in the tea room and wafting through the lobby didn’t hurt, either.It is a wonderful place to stay.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka while traveling around Japan with my husband for our honeymoon. This was our first time in Japan, and we decided to stay in all of The Ritz-Carlton locations in the country.The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka blew our expectations out of the water. Out of all of our Ritz-Carlton stays in both the U.S. and around the world, The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka has been our favorite by far.Our check-in experience was the smoothest we have ever experienced in all of our travels. Upon driving up to the hotel in a taxi, our luggage was already taken care of by the staff. We arrived at the Front Desk and were greeted by a very friendly agent and immediately served water. We booked their standard Superior Room with a King bed, but because of our honeymoon celebrations combined with our rewards membership, we were given a beautiful Suite on their Club Level.We were escorted up to the Club Lounge to proceed with the check-in process while enjoying drinks and treats. The Club Lounge itself is breathtaking and the food served is full of flavor.Once we were taken up to our room, we saw beautiful amenities set up in celebration of our honeymoon both in the living room and in the bedroom. The staff went above and beyond to wow us, and it worked! I almost cried seeing the beautiful set up in the room. They placed photos from our wedding throughout the room, with balloons, sweets, fruits, sake, and personalized origami. The room was comfortable, impeccably clean, and provided stunning views of the city.We also really enjoyed that the hotel was within walking distance to a lot of shops and restaurants, and most importantly, Osaka Station. It is a great location and allowed us to adventure throughout the city without ever having to take a taxi.However, what really stands out in this location is the staff. Every single staff member we walked past greeted us and offered to provide assistance with anything we needed.It is unfortunate that we only stayed here for one night and couldn't fully take advantage of all of the hotel amenities. Overall, we enjoyed this hotel so much that it will be our go-to accommodation when we return to Japan. We cannot wait to come back and stay here for a longer period of time!
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Complaints- no recognition of loyalty as a Gold member. I felt like just another guest. Maybe this level of membership isn't really worth maintaining....though it still requires 25+ nights a year. No upgrade or any amenities- though it was our anniversary. Location- a bit further away from the train stations about 15 mins walk. Suggest to take the underground passages linking otherwise you have to take overpasses etc....we didn't know and we had luggage.Check-inThe greeters was great and very courteous. The gentlemen at the desk was helpful.RoomOlder style, clean, spacious, decor would bring you back 20 years with modern touches such as USB charging (reminds me of Island Shangri La in HK)
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here last year in February. The pools and the resort desk are excellent. Must visit and good value for money as it is included in the room. View from the room is nice with the pool view. Concierge people are very helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel. I love it so much.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is conveniently located walking distance to the train station and shopping area. Have a variety of rooms, I recommend a corner room. Food and service is outstanding.Have a few restaurants on property, Japanese, French, great bar.
hotelName:
2    The Ritz-Carlton, Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What can I say, this hotel has grown to my heart. The atmosphere, the rooms and the great and friendly staff are just adorable.
