Osaka Castle within walking distance, subway and train station nearby and great nightlife just around the corner. The Ofuro (Japanese bath) is very pleasant with a great old style rest room. But be careful, the rest room (not separated according to gender) may only be entered modestly dressed or in a bathrobe. If it happens to you like that, that you will enter the rest room only with entwined towels, then you will be asked very politely and discreetly to dress and to return accordingly. (I did and it´s one more typical Gaijin mistake in Japan on my long list ;)) Gomen nasai Monterey.All in all a lovely hotel that I can recommend to everyone.Hotel Monterey and staff, domo arigatoo gozaimashita.We'll meet again
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed with family from 27th April to 30th April 2019. Very conveniently located to the Kyobashi (Osaka) Loop line about 10 minutes walk from the station. There is a convenience store within the hotel premises. Mc Donald's outlet is close by about 2 minute walk from the hotel. Access to Business Park and Osaka Castle is very easy, and within walking distance. Hotel provides a WiFi enabled phone for the resident guests, with free local calls; this was very handy for us especially when looking for directions to various places of interest. The triple room we booked was cozy and comfortable.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked as room for vacation November 2018. It takes around 1 hour from Kansai Airport to hotel. You better take JR line Kansai airport station > JR Tennoji > JR Kyobashi and walk 5-10 minutes to hotelThe room is larger than Hotel APA that I was visit. The bed is nice and sleep well, and the bathtub full body is the great point to come back.Compliment for maid who make the room everyday. Fill-up amenities with new things. You can get drink supply from vending machine at the foyer.The convenience shop 24/7 at the ground floor.There is Handy phone with Free Internet and calling for some country. this will safe your data roaming and netbank while you travel.Hotel location is closed to JR Kyobashi / Metro Osaka Business Park / Keihan Kyobashi .Osaka Business Park is really quiet after 9-10 PM There one thing that I would comment is the lighting in the guest room. there is warm color light, I think it is difficult to see things and make the room looks old.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We're a family of 4 - Mum, Dad and two kids. We booked 2 rooms as we like a bit of space and quite frankly didn't want to share with the kids! We were in rooms on the 22nd floor. We've stayed at other hotels in Japan and were really happy that the non-smoking floor didn't smell of cigarettes. Sounds weird but if you've travelled in Japan you'll know what I mean! The rooms were spacious enough and the bathroom, while not opulent, was perfectly fine. The hotel is close to Kyobashi station, which was great. We had a number of suitcases and it really is a 5 minute walk from the station - just follow the instructions on the hotel website. We went to Universal Studios and it was very convenient to jump on the train. There's a Family Mart under the hotel which is great. Note that there is a fridge in the rooms but they're empty, so you'll need to stick up. There's also McDonalds and Subway restaurants over the road if you're feeling the need for something "western". All in all, we enjoyed our stay - the rooms were clean, air conditioned (it was really hot when we stayed so a/c was essential), the staff were helpful and friendly and the location was good. Only gotchas - there were no English channels on the TV and the internet slowed a bit at night but the WiFi signal was fine.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice . Very clean. Very helpful and courteous staff. A 24 hour Family Store at the hotel was very convenient!Only drawback is location. It is located a bit far from train stations. Not bad, but about a 10-15 minute walk to train stations. Also note that the airport limo busses do not go to this hotel so you have to go by trains or a $110 taxi.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was easy to find from the JR Kyobashi station (just follow the directions on the hotel’s website) and it is all through covered walkways and no roads to cross. The room was small but not as small as the Ibis Styles Kyoto Station. The room itself could have been more soundproof as I could hear people talking quite distinctly in the corridor. The hotel itself is quite grand and even has an onsite onsen, which I didn’t use. The setting of the hotel is good as it’s just beside a river and the area around the Business Park where the hotel is located is quiet, although lacking in atmosphere. The hotel offers a 11,000 yen taxi service to Kansai airport which was very convenient and I recommend. The staff could have been more polite, but perhaps it’s the Osaka way, which is supposed to be more robust. They provide a free smart phone which was very handy for directions.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: was absolutely fantastic.location was great. So close to Kyobashi Station.Very easy to get around.Would highly recommend to all my Australian friends.Room good size and very functional.Wife and I just loved it. can't wait to rebook at another of the Hotel Monterey group Hotels when we come back to my mother's country of birth.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at a sister facility (Hotel Monterey Grasmere) last time we were in Osaka and were very impressed, so when Grasmere didn't have availability for us this trip, we found this location. Great location close to JR Kyoubashi and Keihan shopping mall. Just north of the mall is a large cluster of little restaurants all collected together over a couple blocks of alleyways, with many dining choices. Looks like lots of locals go there, so not all places have English menus, and prices are very reasonable. Definitely not a touristy place! Hotel Montery Lasoeur itself is beautiful -- lots of wood and polished stone, and an old English chapel on one floor which is popular for weddings and such. Rooms are well-appointed, good amenities, very clean and relatively spacious for a Japanese hotel. Breakfast buffet (not included, but worth the cost) is quite extensive with many Japanese and Western food options, and very good coffee. Staff is gracious and helpful. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient location with direct access from Kansas airport and three subway lines. It has a quiet surrounding with some cafes and shopping places. The room was fine and my kid was happy that he has his own bed. The room temperature, the bed and the quilt were remarkably comfortable and we did have our good sleep. Staff were helpful in advising directions and reserving dining tables. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 喫煙室を予約してしまった。キツイ匂い。自分のミスにて仕方ない。ふと部屋の床を見ると月日の流れを感じる。１６階に天然温泉。ベットの上にご親切にパジャマが置いてあるのでそれを着て温泉に行ったらお断りされる。ならばパジャマの自慢（綿１００％）などどうでもよいから「SPAはパジャマ禁止」と書いておいてほしい。こちらが常識ないということか。ちなみにそのパジャマは５０００円で販売しているらしい。どうでもよいが。I booked smorking room by mistake. The room smells so bad. There is no other room available. Ok, it is my mistake anyway. I found floor is also dirty. Guess the hotel is getting old and not renovated at all. Don't mind, price is cheap.There are many foreign guests staying. In front of the vending machine,it looks an old lady having trouble. I said what's up? She said, I just wanna beer but don'w know which is... Sorry mam, there are no english instructions. I simply pointed out SUPER DRY for her.There is a natural spring spa at 16th floor, where I was rejected to enter. She said, sorry mister, pajama is not allowed. I said, are there such instruction?It's my mistake, let's go bed..... and asking myself.....am I out of Japanese common sense? Probably their answer is , yes you are....
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were on the top floor and had a beautiful view of the canal. Our room was very nice. Only downside was that the beds and pillows were quite hard. Just a couple minutes walk from Kyobashi Station, and short walk to Osaka Castle. The hotel also offers very discounted car service to a number of locations in the city. The breakfast buffet was excellent and offers both traditional Japanese and western options. Staff is very friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1)Easy access from Kyobashi Station (JR and Keihan Line). Also near to Osaka Business Park subway station.2)Near to AEON and Keihan Mall. We bought dinner at Keihan mall. There is also a Family Mart on the first level where we can buy food and drinks. Family Mart has an ATM machine you can withdraw cash with your credit card.3)Kyobashi Shotengai shopping district where you can find restaurants.4)Rooms are cleaned daily. Well informed staff at counter.Well stay again.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good 7 to 10 minute walk from Kyobashi station. In a quiet business area near Osaka Castle. Friendly staff, room was adequate and the price was reasonable. I've shown the taxi driver the Japanese address but he still got confused due to it being a bit isolated but there are convenience stores and fast food outlets in the area.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a week, basing ourselves in Osaka while we explored the area and did day-trips on the bullet trains.It's quite close to Kyobashi station, which is part of the Osaka loop line (which goes direct to Universal). When you arrive at Shin-Osaka station, you have to catch another train to Osaka station, THEN catch the loop to Kyobashi. It's a bit complicated, but once you've done it the first time it's easy.Fairly easy walk to Osaka Castle 20 min-ish.Staff were very helpful, and spoke good English. The room was pretty tiny - but no more than is usual for Japanese hotel rooms! A laundry for guests to use would have made the stay even better.Breakfast was included with our rate... it wasn't fantastic. If you got there after 9, most of the hot food had gone cold. There's a convenience store and cafe on the ground floor of the building that are ideal for breakfast. The cafe did exceptionally good coffee, and had pancakes too.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days and absolutely loved it. Nice comfortable beds and walking distance to everything. Friendly staff too. Just washrooms were a bit cramped but still workable. Would recommend!
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is conveniently located from the Osaka Business Park MRT. For holidaymakers the Osaka Castle is nearby too. Hotel is located near to Kyobashi which gives an easy access to travel to Kyoto via JR or other lines.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hotel is all we wanted.Very clean, close to one of the JR lines, restaurants, very friendly staff and good internet connection.We got lost the first day..so if you catch one of the JR lines to Kyobashi station make sure you exit through the west exit, cross the tunel (bridge) and then turn to you left. You will see the hotel at your left. The entrance is just there on the second floor.Thank you
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of four, including my parents stayed here for our second night in Osaka. When we first arrived, there was a long line with two serviceman tried to fix the chandelier. I have to stood next to the ladder, and felt unsafe. When I tried to ask the receptionist whether she speak English (mind you, I asked her in Japanese), she answered in English that yes she can speak english. The problem is she did not has a good command of English, so after wasting our time, she finally gave up and pointed me to someone else. I later found out that she is a trainer. If this was a small traditional inn then I can understand, but it is a big hotel, so there is really no excuse. This hotel is close to JR Kyobashi station. The room is comfortable enough. I would stay here again if I travel by myself next time.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was here with my wife for a lovely ten-day getaway, leaving our children safely at home ;) To start with, the hotel was really easy to reach by train with luggage from KIX (only one exchange on the way, and the cost, a few bucks vs. pre-order taxi of 230...).We found the location excellent. You have quite a few things (malls, restaurants, riverside) within walking distance and both the train station and subway are around the corner. Yet, you are not in the middle of all the hassle. The breakfast is something you don't see too often... Both Eastern and Western, and of course pastry :)The staff are VERY polite, as Japanese always are. I want to give them ten points for handling a minor incident. I don't want to go into details, but they accepted responsibility immediately and showed us good will afterwards. Also, when my wife had a birthday, they remembered her (I think I mentioned them she has a birthday during our stay). Made us feel appreciated.I would, and I think I will come here again. Next time I will bring the kids too. We went here and there and we think this was a great place to start your journey wherever you want to go, including Nara, Kioto, and Kobe. If you want to see the Osaka castle and its moats, it's right in front of you.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 3 nights on a business trip. From Osaka airport (KIX) to the hotel is almost door to door if you take the train that connects to the Osaka loop, and you don't even have to get off to switch to another train. The ride takes about 80 minutes and there's a 10 minute walk from Kyobashi station to the hotel.The hotel is next to the Osaka Business Park, and there are numerous restaurants all around as well as shopping malls. And because the subway is just 10 minutes away, you can connect to just about anywhere in Japan.I stayed at probably the smallest size room at this hotel, but it is actually very good size by Japan standard especially in big cities like Tokyo and Osaka. And because the hotel is located on the upper half of the building, you can have a pretty good view of the city. The breakfast doesn't have a huge variety but plenty enough and good quality. I found the hotel staff from front desk, housekeeper, breakfast servers and at the SPA, are all very courteous and friendly. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Osaka.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is located not far from the kyobashi train station which is pretty convenient. Exiting from the other exit, there are many restaurants nearby, so there's no need to worry if you cannot find any food. In the hotel, it was pretty spacious and the beds were comfortable. As the rooms were located on the 17th floor and above, the views were pretty good. Comfortable stay after all!
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very easy Hotel to find but does require a small walk from the train. It is a very classy establishment with accomodation very polished. If you are continuing on to Southern Japan it may not prepare you for the future accomodation but that is to be expected with a Business Hotel compared to a traditional Japanese establishment.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Luxury hotel with budget price. I booked 3 nights on hotel website directly and received daily free breakfast/spa vouchers. It is best deal of all. Everything is great! Location is excellent. We walked to Osaka Castle and to hotel from Kyobashi station is easy if you take the West exit, follow the sign to Osaka business park. You can see the hotel when walking across the covered air bridges. Also I enjoyed the massage in the spa so much (Did not use the shower/tub in the room during all 3 nights). Breakfast buffet is so delicious. I love the variety of fruit and it is all cut into bite size. I will book this hotel again next time in Osaka for sure.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 3 years earlier I'm not familiar with this island country just close to my country at all. I accidentally chose this hotel and it is a great choice evidently. The scene through the window is nice, a little bit far but not very far to the center of Osaka city. All the things inside the room comforts me when traveling in a whole strange place. Monterey is my virgin hotel in Japan, I still choose it sometimes in Japan recently.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a clean and comfortable hotel. It had a few dings and scrapes in the walls, but overall was in tidy condition. The location was great. We walked to Osaka Castle (around 20 mins, 10 mins to the grounds), caught the train from Kyobashi station to Universal Studios, and caught the subway to Shinsaibashi from Osaka Business Park. Navigation to the hotel from Kyobashi station is easy if you take the West exit, then turn left twice across the air bridges. The air conditioning was great, and stayed on during the day while you were out sightseeing, do you could return to a cool room. Overall we were very happy with our stay.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice location in the business district of Osaka. The room was very clean and well furnished. Especially the huge spa was a nice option for relaxing. All in all I would choose this hotels for my next Osaka trip again.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very close to Kyobashi Station, which means easy and non-stop train service is available when going to Kyoto, Nara, Kansai Airport, etc. In addition, Osaka Loop Line provides fast access to famous tourist attractions in Osaka. About 15 minutes walk to Osaka Castle. There is a 24-hour FamilyMart store on the first floor. View in the room is somewhat limited by the outside balcony which is not accessibel.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location (be sure to take the correct exit from the train station in order not to walk too much) and great service. Price could be better, for sure, but in general I was very pleased. I recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We checked in at 11Pm after a long day of traveling. We were exhausted and requested one hour late check out (12pm). The hotel refused, not because they were busy, but they wanted to charge us. Arrived to the room to find blood on the sheets. What surprised me the most is when we told them the Hotel staff and manager did NOTHING. They said "sorry", and did nothing, didn't even make a note of the issue nor rectify the situation. This means the Hotel does not always change their sheets. gross!
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here on our first night after a long flight. Right next to Osaka castle and two underground stations. There was a coffee shop and 24hr minimart attached. Staff very friendly. Room as large as they get in japan with a night view of the cityscape and the bed was comfortable. Would recommend.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The purpose of our trip was to join a wedding lunch so we chose a hotel which could be in a walkable distance to the venue. The hotel is close to Kyobashi JR station and Kyobashi Keihan line which is around 10-15 minutes by walk. It is convenient traveling to Kyoto by Keihan line and to Umeda and Shinsaibashi by JR Osaka Loop line. Also, Osaka Castle is nearby, just around 15 minutes walk. It is definitely worthwhile to go! Such a beautiful and comfortable place to take a walk! Since we were there for a special occasion, the hotel upgraded our room and prepared some gifts for us. It was very appreciated for their kindness! However, there are some points which I want to raise up and hope the hotel to review on that. First of all, the hotel did not offer any help if you want to post any post card. This is so surprising that a hotel does not have this service. This should be a basic service but unfortunately they do not. This is so disappointing and shocking to hear that. We need to find a post office and buy stamps ourselves! Secondly, if you ask for an extra key card, you have to pay for it. I think usually this only happens to 2 or 3 star hotels but yes it happened here. We were travelling as a family group, and needed to look after each other so it would have been more convenient to have an extra key card. However even we took our family's passport to the reception and requested, the answer we got was to pay for extra. Although it was not expensive, it was annoying to us. Overall, the stay was okay.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a large business/reception hotel, quite lovely. I chose it for easy access to the JR station and Osaka Castle - we walked to these places with ease. To get to the hotel, get yourself to the Kyobashi JR train station and take the West Exit. Follow the signs along the covered passage to Osaka Business Park. You can see the hotel across the river as you walk; the passage is connected to the entrance.Our room was quite large and we had a great view of the city at night. We were just passing through on our way to Koya-san, so we didn't do much exploring except of the castle. We didn't reserve the breakfast, so no idea on its quality.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked two rooms, one triple one twin. Rooms are average size not really big. Stayed there two nights. Easy to locate ,near to the Kyobashi/ keihan station. Near to the OBP( Osaka business park)Walking distance to osaka castle and Sakuranomiya.Beautiful and big breakfast room with nice view . Great breakfast and good service.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The good things first - the location of the hotel is good with a JR station just across the bridge with a covered walkway. It helped us immensely on a rainy day. There is a 24 hours’ convenience store below the hotel, which was pretty big and keeps pretty much everything you would need during a vacation. I could find diapers there. There is a McDonald’s and Subway just across the road as well. Osaka castle is also close. The hotel has free and good wifi connection.Things I didn't like include rooms the size of pigeon holes, no room service of any kind, restaurants that close very early, inflexibility with any kind of late checkout request with even an extra hour being charged. Frankly, for me the no room service is the deal breaker and had I known earlier, I would not have gone there in the first place. You need the comfort of in room late night dinners, especially if you are out walking and sightseeing all day!Now, the reason why I would rate this a 4 out of 5. We had sent our luggage from Tokyo via courier and they messed it up. We were probably the 1 in the million case. The front desk staff Hayama-san took over our case and she personally worked with the courier company to ensure that the luggage was re-routed to our next destination. I would have missed entire days, if I had to stay back at the hotel to work with the courier company. It helped immensely that she spoke to them on our behalf, negotiating the language barriers and explaining what needs to be done. She also kept on updating us by email throughout the day. Thank you Hayama san!
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and a friend stayed for 3 nights. We don't walk around the area a lot and mostly just check-in to sleep. The area is quiet and not too crowded when we're there. Convenience store and Kyobashi station is very near. Our room is standard twin. The room is clean and big enough for me and my friend. No view outside of the window. The bathroom is nice, clean and big enough for two people. Tried to connect to the wi-fi, but the signal is too weak. If I have the chance, will choose to stay again and explore the area.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When you're going to a few different hotels in Japan, you will notice that they are tiny compared to the western world. This was the only hotel out of three that I went to where the bathroom felt big enough for two people. Which is a massive bonus for when you want to relax after a long day of exploring. It's located directly next to a bridge (that actually connects to the hotel) that goes straight to a food area, or straight to two train stations, with a third relatively close. It's close enough to everything to be worth staying at, and the beds were comfortable, where most beds in Japan are stiff, this one was a nice change.The pricing was also amazing, I wasn't expecting what we got for the price. I would suggest asking for a view window, as we didn't (expecting to just be given one, due to the pictures) and we pretty much got a wall. So, make sure you ask!The entrance is amazing and feels so much more expensive then what came out of my wallet. Reason for 4/5 is staff didn't stop the teenagers running up and down the corridors at 1AM for the whole 3 night stay I was there. I had to go out and attempt to speak chinese to make them stop.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed only one night for its onsen. Disappointed as it closed at 2200 which was too early for tourists who spent the evening for shopping and meals outside. It does not re-open until 1100 which is the latest check out time. So it is not service minded particularly for tourists. Comparing to another hotel we stayed before with onsen open 24 hours. Service provided at the Reception varied among staff.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very very nice. Almost seems like a luxury hotel and I got a great deal (100CAD per night). It is walking distance to osaka castle which is really good, and very close to the subway (kiyobashi station on the JR line). However, aside from osaka castle it's not near any other attractions and you'll have to take the subway everywhere. It's not that big of a deal though and the subway is pretty quick.Anyways other than the location which is only good but not great, the hotel is fantastic. very nice and clean and you will definitely be comfortable. One thing though is that the pillows are a little hard lol.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You can walk in to the hotel from Kyobashi station but its 2 stops away from Osaka which is one stop from Shin Osaka where the Shinkansen's stop. Its a 10 minute walk from Osaka castle one of the most serene spots in Osaka. It is in the city centre and is flanked by serenading canals . Pls ask for a room with a canal view. The city is beautiful by night so don't miss the sights. We were in a viewless room the first night but staff graciously shifted us to the top most floor where we had great views. The hotel had a great Breakfast buffet with Japanese New Year delicacies that gave us an opportunity to relish the ethnic cuisine.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of four stayed here on our first trip ever to Japan. We found the room acceptably large, large enough for the two extra beds that were added for our convenience, and very clean. (Each day that you agree to reuse your sheets, you are rewarded with a bottle of water per bed.) We received complimentary passes to the spa for everyone every day (sadly, we never used them) and a discount on the excellent breakfast (both French and Japanese cuisine). The location is ideal for visiting Osaka, right on the local loop and walking distance from Osaka castle, with a post office nearby. Recommended for first-timers and families; you will be well taken care of. Only flaw: Don't bother with the Chinese restaurant, or really any restaurant, inside the hotel. Go to the other side of the Kyobashi station and there are better places that are more fun.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I think this is a city hotel for business travel. As I'm on vacation of 11 people staying here for 2 nights, no big surprises for me. Very convenient for me to walk to Osaka Castle Park, thus I choose this hotel. Nearby also have various restaurants for food and 2 MRT stations are available within 10 minutes walking distance.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traveling with three people in one room is difficult at best in Japan. Then we found Hotel Monterey Lasoeur for our night in Osaka. The staff was helpful, the hotel itself is well located over a walkway from the train station and the art deco designs give it a glamorous vibe. Our room though, was the star. The bathroom was huge and we each had our own bed, not a trundle or mat. There was enough space for two comfy sitting chairs, a small refrigerator and a vanity. I wish we could have stayed longer.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've now stayed here several times and find it difficult to fault. Clean, comfortable and easy. Furthermore it is so well positioned near to railway, Osaka Castle and to the great places around the Osaka Business Park
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is easy to reach. The breakfast is delicious and lots choices.The accommodation is clear. Staff can speak English well and are friendly to help us resolve difficulties. I will choose this hotel if I travel in Osaka next time.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They add/replace toiletries, everyday which is good. We always come back to a clean and made up room.Hotel is walking distance and is connected to Kyobashi station and i think it's very accessible. However, our breakfast buffet has been the same for 3 days... better if there'll be a change.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would put my rating as average - as our negative experience may have been a 1 in 10. We booked the semi-double from the website - reasonable price, ok looking room. When we arrive, the room was not at all bad, but somehow bizarre and a little odd. The decor seemed out of place with the rest of the hotel, and we had a peek to other rooms being cleaned and none of them looked like ours. On the top floor, and on the last end of the wing of what seemed to be a full hotel, we barely can hear people and so there was an eerie feeling about the place. In our room there was an odour in the bathroom and close to midnight, we found ourselves restless and unhappy with the room - so we upgraded to the suite as it's the only room available. The suite was a lot better - I would believe we were staying at the hotel we booked. The bed was comfortable enough and the view was great. There was also a dedicated toilet near the entrance, however none in the main bathroom on the other side of the room. Staff is very helpful and the breakfast buffet is pretty good. Also a short walk from Kyobashi Station - but beware, Kyobashi Station is a unattended maze and the West Exit is not easy to find. Walking distance to Osaka Castle and there is a Family Mart attached to the building. Very unlikely for us to return, but won't discourage people to stay.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located at little bit away from the hustling Osaka city. I booked a double room single occupancy and the size was adequate for a 3* business hotel. Not too big and not too small. The room itself however has no charm as visible on the pictures. Even though the hotel looks new the rooms are already slightly worn out. You don't have a side table at the bed so you have to use the table from the room. Improvisation talent is what you need. Very disappointing for me was the dirty day cover on the bed. Even though the rest of the room looked clean you keep this picture in your mind implementing there could be some more which wasn't the case. I wouldn't stay here the next time as they are alternatives downtown for about the same price in the same category.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our night at this hotel. Easy access from loop line and walking distance to the Osaka Park and castle where we spend the afternoon. The room had a good size, and amenities were plenty for our brief stay. We did not try the spa once it was paid (1080 yens for the day per person) but we relaxed at the bathtub. The room was clean and bed confortable.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband, teenage son, and I stayed there five nights. Having never traveled in Osaka before, let alone mainland Japan, it took a couple of days to get our bearings. But by our last night, we knew absolutely that Hotel Monterey Lasoeur had been the right choice for us.- Great neighborhood: Situated in Osaka Business Park, it's wonderfully quiet at night. It's directly across the river from a bustling commercial neighborhood with plenty of shopping, hole-in-the-wall restaurants, and other distractions. A covered walkway runs directly into the JR rail station, a shopping mall, and the Keihan mainline. The OBP subway station isn't too far off, and Osaka Castle Park -- a huge urban park with plenty of historic architecture -- is five-minute walking distance.Word of warning: We took the JR line in from KIX. The hotel's instructions on railway arrival are only good to a point. They don't tell you how to get to the hotel FROM the rail station, which is very disorienting -- especially when you arrive, jetlagged, after sundown. From Kyobashi Station, exit at the west gate and head straight past the newsstand onto the covered sky bridge. At the end, take a left to cross the river, then another left, staying on the covered walk. The hotel entrance is clearly marked a few yards away.- Great accommodations: It's hard enough traveling with three adults, harder still when you're sharing a room. Monterey Lasoeur has three-bed rooms that, while snug, still fit us very well. The beds were about American full, so while they wouldn't sleep more than one adult, you could still spread out. They were firm, but with some give (which I came to appreciate after some other hard-as-rock mattresses on other stays of our trip). The bath was western style, with plenty of hotel complimentary items. AC worked magnificently, a godsend given how hot and humid it was outside. Open wifi made our internet planning that much easier. Beyond the room, the hotel sports an Art Deco motif, very lovely. It has plenty of in-house restaurants and other amenities, though I can't say we partook all that much. We had the breakfast buffet: tasty and quite well-stocked, yet a little spendy. Directly downstairs is a 24-hour Family Mart, so we could always catch a quick morning or evening bite, when scheduling prohibited a proper sitdown.- Great service: We never had any real issues with language barriers; there was always someone on staff with very good to excellent English skills. Everyone was polite and beyond courteous. They held our bags for half a day, as well. Always appreciated.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was nice and was very close to Osaka Castle and a nearby train station made all of Osaka accessible. The restaurants, while good, were a bit pricey but the breakfast was amazing.The rooms were good and well kept. Consider this place if you want some peace and quiet
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel located near Osaka castle and subway station. Spacious and clean rooms with all necessities. Friendly staff that spoke English quite well. Breakfast was great with a wide choice of food (both Japanese and western).
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a 4 Star I expected from this hotel more. This is one of the Hotel located in nice area with lots of facilities, I expected them to have more options as a 4 star. The rooms were just ok. I would say average in my scale. Overall I needed a quick stay for a day before i headed back to Tokyo. So I would say not bad to stay for a quick nap. The Location is good. Ask for front side of the view room. The Windows gives a nice view of the outside Castle.The best is when i arrived it was before check in time. I had to go for a meeting so the reception staff really were helpful. They kept my luggage gave me a no card. And whole day i was out doing my meetings and all. So Later on when i got back they already put my luggage in room. The Staff done a good job all together.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not a great location if you're traveling to and from Osaka to other cities as a tourist. Very long walk from Kyobashi station to the hotel especially with luggage. And some platforms with no elevators so made it even more difficult. Osaka loop line is a very busy line so going somewhere between 8-9am was very tough. I would rather spend more money and stay at Osaka station. Rooms were okay. Nothing spectacular but not bad either. Around 15-20 minutes walk from Osaka castle.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed this hotel so many times for business and this must be last but I can clearly say male receptionists this hotel are 99% rude (1% is for someone I might have not met yet), female receptionists are nice and caring.I don't know the percentage but the rooms facing to other rooms are very close and need to keep close curtain all the time.I did like this hotel for its location, lots of green around, but really didn't like the attitude of male receptionists.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Monterey Lasoeur Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We originally booked a standard double room (at 175U$/night...) and ended up in one of the worst bedroom I have ever encountered in any 4/5 * hotels in Asia.Room was a cubicle, with a queen bed stuck in one corner and no possibility for 2 adults to walk freely without bumping into each other. No decoration whatsoever, not a spot of colour to remind you that THIS was not a Motel 6 in Nowhereville, USA.. The bathroom was even worst: dated back to the late 1960's, with a tub, no shower area per-se, a plastic tub curtain and depressing wall tiles...Add to this the numerous hairs from the previous guests we spotted all over the floor and tub, AS WELL as the bed bugs crawling onto the bed sheets, and you get a pretty good idea of how high the management holds its customers.After having shared our..annoyance -understatement- (crushed bugs in hand) at the reception, things definitely improved. The Front Desk lady, apologetic, courteous and efficient took the initiative to up-grade us.Our new room, a Deluxe something, was perfect, as if set in another hotel. In a few words, if staying at this place, go for the top rooms. If not, well, be ready for the worst.Beside that, good location, and GREAT F/D staff
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Attached to a subway, this hotel was conveniently located around the main shopping attractions in Osaka. The staff of the hotel, especially the concierge, was extremely helpful and efficient. Rooms were super clean and simple and the chefs from the restaurants were very thoughtful and creative in customising vegetarian options for me. Hands down, this is one of the best hotels in terms of quality, location, service and price in Osaka.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the premium room so there was reasonable space and nice seating by the windows. The rooms were renovated and beds comfortable and wifi worked well. The bathroom was fairly large with separate washroom with bath and shower. It was a nice quality hotel that was very clean but nothing special nor atmospheric or Japanese style. The hotel was very expensive for what it is and there are probably more reasonably priced options out there. The hotel location was excellent, right next to subway and walkable from many places of interest.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was well appointed and a short walk from the airport. Perfect place to stay on your first night in Osaka especially for evening/night arrivals. Breakfast included a really good variety of food including fresh fruit.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel! Beautiful hotel is the best location in Shinsaibashi Osaka. Easy access to main stations and also has own access to Shinsaibashi Station under the hotel. Hotel has several underground floors with restaurants and walkways that lead to station and Daimaru shopping mall. Super convenient! The rooms are gorgeous and have great amenities. Breakfast is served in 3 different restaurants and there is an upper floor lounge and bar. 5 mins walk from Americamura and 10 mins walk from Dotombori where you can go crazy with the amount of shops and food options. Had a wonderful experience and so happy I got the chance to enjoy some luxury in Osaka.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed on the premium floor and in a junior suite as there were 3 of us. Room is spacious and nicely decorated with good colour scheme. Windows are closed and opened by controlling with buttons at the head of the bed, same for lights. There is an area near the main door where we can park our luggages and hang our clothes plus a full length mirror. Bathroom is equipped with a good sized bathtub and adjacent is the shower. I especially like the control for shower heads, the off and on buttons, only knob is the one for temperature control Complimentary sets of bathroom necessities are aplenty, always well replenished day after day. The toiletries brand Mikimoto cosmetics is not bad but the body lotion is too liquid not really to my liking. The toilet is in a separate area and really is a proper toilet in itself with bidet and a tiny sink. Also like the Toto washlet with control buttons to enable flushing, cleansing and opening/closing of the toilet seat plus cover. Bed and pillow firmness are just right and beds face the window, which means we can look outside at the city from 28th level. Able to see the Ferris wheel from the room. There are 2 TV sets, one in the sleeping area and the other in the sitting area. We all love the Bose SoundLink Bluetooth speaker in the room and ended up buying one from BIC camera;).As One Harmony members, we were allowed to eat breakfast at 3 different restaurants which serve Japanese, intercontinental food. We kept going back for the Japanese breakfast because of the yummy tempura. But if we went late only the veggies tempura were left.;( Our welcome drinks became farewell drinks as we had the drinks on the last day of our stay. Had dinner at the basement of the hotel on a few nights and enjoyed them thoroughly. On the day of our check-in, we were advised to book limousine bus tickets to the airport on the day of our departure, which we did. We are already thinking of staying here again the next time we visit Osaka. Can't wait!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay the night especially if you land in the middle of night. Quick three minute walk from the airport through the overpass. Service is excellent and the business class room was spacious and well lit. Hotel is conveniently located with a convenient store outside and restaurants in the mall. Hotel is on the old side but very good overall.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I lost ¥35000 inside the room. We left for breakfast at 9:30am. I left my body bag with my wallet inside on top of the bed. When we came back at 10:13am, there was a cleaner fixing the bed. We went to Umeda Sky Building and as I was going to pay for our tickets, I was surprised that I only had ¥3000 in my wallet. I counted my funds the previous night and I had ¥38000. I reported this to the manager and they confronted the cleaner who denied getting the funds. The manager adviced us to go to the police if we wanted further investigation.The manager upgraded our room to a very nice and spacious suite. The hotel is nice but ...
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located within walking distance of several tourist attractions and is very reasonably priced. The rooms were Western style and had good wi-fi speed. They were clean and the showers were excellent. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in the main street of Osaka City centre which houses many top designer boutique outlet. Very comfortable and well kept. The staff are well trained and very energetic and helpful. Highly recommended for business and family stay.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I go to Japan a couple times a year but this was just my second visit to Osaka. Hotel Nikko has got to be my favorite hotel in Japan. The staff is extremely friendly and their rooms are impeccably clean. The hotel is well located... close to Shinsaibaishi so my girl loved how easy it was to go shopping. Bed was a bit small, but really liked the bathroom... was very clean and had a deep soaking tub. The best part about the experience was the amazing breakfast buffet... had a choice of Japanese or Western buffet to mix things up. We preferred the Japanese, but wouldn't have been disappointed if only the Western buffet was available. The breakfast buffet was one of the best we've had in our travels.The service level at Japanese hotels are typically top-notch, but the staff were friendly and helpful throughout our stay. I wouldn't hesitate to go back to this hotel again. during my next trip.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time we stay at this hotel and love the hotel and its location. Very warm welcome from the staff and the room . We stayed at the Premium Twin room. The room is very spacious and cozy. This hotel just located in the centre of the city area and you can reach the famous Dotonburi area just by walking distance. There is also a couple of minimart that located just behind the hotel.Never dissapointed with the Nikko group hotel and really love to come back to stay here.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located in the hear of one of major shipping place in Osaka downtown, Shisaibashi. Hotel faces the main avenue of Midosuji, but very quiet in the room. My stay here was for business, but still I could enjoy some shopping near the hotel in my spare time. Room was relatively clean and well equipped. Only concern of mine was a weak functioning of the fan in the bath room. Otherwise my stay here was very good.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel room is a bit small but cozy. Very very clean room. Everything was very new and had the nicest bathroom of all 3 hotels we stayed at during our tokyo and osaka trip. Spacious shower! The hotel was only a half a block walk to the subway station
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After 19 hours of flying. This hotel airport cannot be easier to reach and a sight of welcome. Rooms are big , clean and the staff are extremely polite and pleasant . Will stay again. Restaurants close by and also a foot massage place .
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just above Shisaibashi subway station with a lift (B2) to Hotel lobby(level 2). Near Shinsaibashi shopping arcade to Dontobori(famous Glico man sign), street wear shopping area nearby, high end shopping boutiques and the famous Luke's lobster which the queue isn't that crazy like what I read and saw(youtube) in Tokyo.The AC is really a bummer, call the front desk and was told switch on if you want it to be warm?!?! The AC control is useless.. We gotta use that humidifier small AC like to cool ourselves, prop up a magazine on top of the equipment to channel the cool air to us(the machine vent blow upwards)...Space (1 Large Twin Bed194-sq-foot (18-sq-meter) room with city views) was decent that we can open up two 32" luggage. + Sofa and small table.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Didnt managed to get an early check in but was graciously given a later check out by Mr Ono as we have a late flight to Tokyo. The rooms were acceptable and amenities were good. We also got a birthday gift from tje hotel and the help from the concierge was impeccable. Water temperature was good, sleep quality and all was up to expectations. All staff always have a smile on their face and ever willing to help.The location of the hotel is smack in the middle of action, minutes of walking and subway is linked to the hotel, staying here was easy and never a hassle as it was a direct line to Namba or Shin Osaka. First timer to Osaka, stay here, seasoned travellers, also stay here.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is convenient--right above a busy subway line and close to several great shopping areas. But the hotel itself wasn't such a great experience. The rooms were small and austere even by Japanese standards. The windows didn't open and the temperature could not be adjusted below 64 degrees. Frankly, the room environment just felt stuffy, hot, and uncomfortable. No amount of thermostat adjusting changed any of that. We booked our room with Chase "Ultimate Reward" points and were treated as if we had used Priceline or some similar third party vendor. These are apparently not the guests the hotel staff extend many courtesies towards. And then when they learned we were a same sex couple seeking one bed, their attitude bordered on incredulousness. Again--I guess it's location, location, location which was great. The restaurants and bars were WAY overpriced. You can get far better value and food quality in the nearby commercial areas. We've stayed at Nikko hotels before--all which were nice, but I'd give this one a solid C-.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location, location, location. This Nikko Hotel is definitely in a centralized location but that’s where my compliments end.This hotel fails the high quality standards we’ve come to expect of the Nikko Hotel brand. Let’s start with our check-in. After sorting out how many room we had actually reserved (They showed four. We had two since we were traveling with family. Thank goodness we had a printed copy of our reservation as proof), the front desk kept insisting that we have two beds in our room. My husband and I (we’re a gay couple) kept telling them no, we want one bed in our room. Keep in mind Japan is supportive of LGBT rights plus, the Nikko Hotel is a transnational corporation so my recommendation to the corporate HR folks is better training. Once we got into the room, we were even more underwhelmed. The room showed its age. Since it’s winter, the hotel doesn’t have air conditioning, just heat, which means we got into a stuffy hot room. The only thing that cools down the room marginally is a portable humidifier/fan. So that basically stayed on the entire time we were in the room which cooled the area down to about 75. There was mold around the room’s air vent and the bathroom looked like it hadn’t been updated in years. The uploaded pictures show the mold plus some holes in the bathroom tiles from some prior repair work, I’m guessing. We saw large groups of tourists in the lobby so my guess is the hotel caters to tour groups more than it does to the individual travel. If the hotel wasn’t linked to the Nikko brand, is give it a higher score. But because it is, it only gets ⭐️⭐️. Probably wouldn’t come back to Nikko if I returned to Osaka. There are probably other hotels close by that cost as much with better amenities.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have actually read all sort of review about this Hotel. Let me state my own View & Experience:It does not look very new, but everything is still ok.Staffs are generally helpful.Room? I have asked for a huge room for my family of 5 (two kids), and we could stay in comfortably, with extra pillows and blankets.Hotel Dinning? Plenty of choices. Many restaurants in the hotel.Location? About in the city centre. Can reach everywhere by train or walk around very conveniently.Charges? considered reasonable, i think.This may not be the best hotel at Osaka city centre, but I don't mind introduce to others. This is quite a comfort full fledge Japanese hotel....unlike those Station Hotels...We had a Happy Stay. Thanks to Management.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 2 nights because we want to explore rinku factory outlets which only 20 mins by bus from the airport. Nikko hotel is basically connected with Osaka airport and connected to the train station. It is very convenient, especially for travelers who have limited time transit in osaka, Nikko hotel is very recommended.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: DO NOT STAY HERE!!Hotel shows it has option for Heater or Cooling in room. However, rooms only have Heater function during cooler months. It is very hot in the rooms and the option the hotel gives is to switch off the heater and sleep in the sauna of a tiny room that you're paying hundreds of dollars for. Tiny windows are all sealed so there is absolutely no ventilation. Hotel Nikko is obligated to state this to guests prior to booking or to highlight this on their website, but they would rather deceive customers.ALSO, HOTEL NIKKO IS NOT ACCESSIBLE WITH A JR RAIL PASS!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and we love this hotel. It’s located strategically within Shinsaibashi area and we can just walk to the market and shopping areas. Front Desk & Concierge people have been very friendly and helpful. The room is relatively small for 3 people but this is considered to be normal here in Japan as most hotel’s rooms are smaller here. Toilet is neat and clean and bed is fairly comfortable. We tried the Japanese breakfast buffet on the 3rd floor and we like it. Overall it was a good stay for us.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've spent only a night here but really impressed by everything. The location is superb as it is located in Shinsaibashi, plenty of boutique stores for you to enjoy walking and shopping. Moreover, it is in a walking distance to Namba, the very famous shopping area as well. The hotel provide everything you need it, and staff are so nice. They are very enthusiastic to help you out for every request you made. The higher floor provides a better view of Osaka skyline.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed a few times. This time in an upgraded room. It was a great improvement. More spacious, good lighting, extremely comfortable bed, well equipped bathroom. Also location of hotel is excellent. Breakfast as always was great.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Triple room is big, 2 beds + 1 sofa bed. Bathroom is spacious, free bottled water, location is excellent and near dohtonbori, train station is also near. My only complain is that the room is dusty. Staff can speak good english
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nikko hotel is well known for its service. Nikko Osaka is located right above Shinsaibashi station. Only 9 minutes by walk to the famous Dotonbori tourist area. Shops, restaurants. For those visiting theme park and loves to shop then this hotel is an advantage. Room is clean and spacious for Japan standard. Breakfast buffet is fresh and delicous. Staffs are friendly and professionals. Very helpful for those first timer visitor, provide clear maps and explain to you in details. Worth value for money too. Definitely a come back...
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can’t beat the location as close to everything. Booked early the room so very reasonable prices. On my arrival got upgraded to the next room category and many thanks to Ms. Minako Hoshina to greet us personally and take great care of us. Also a special thank you to Ms. Teruko Nazato and her team to help whenever needed for a restaurant recommendation or just have something written in Japanese. The rooms reasonable spacious for Japan and very comfortable and newly renovated. Stayed here 3 years ago and for sure will stay here again on my next visit. Many thanks to the whole team and great job done!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for one night at this hotel as part of a tour group from the UK. Very smart hotel, and well located for getting out and about. Room was smaller than expected however had a good nights sleep and it was clean and in good decorative order. Breakfast was good - plenty of choice for all tastes, well presented and cooked well.Good location to walk around to the shops and restaurants at night. Good views from the windows and staff attentive and professional. A very nice stay.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: booking with this hotel on s short notice for our family trip should have researched more and looked up more online comments staff got attitude problem room is small plz reconsider when you are booking this hotel
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff are really helpful and friendly. Location wise is quite near to the famous area which is the Dotonbori. Only a few blocks away by foot (5 - 10min). Breakfast was really delicious too! I love it.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 4 nights and the experience was very pleasant.Location: Right above the Shinsaibashi Station with easy underground connection, opposite and next to big department stores, shopping street, restaurants. The subway brings you to everywhere of Osaka.Room: Bigger than the usual size of Japanese hotels, very clean and tidy.Breakfast: The hotel offers 2 types of breakfasts – normal and Japanese, both in buffet styles and offer many varieties (even ice-cream!), tasty and fresh.Services: Typical Japanese attentive, polite and pleasant.The only shortcoming is the hotel’s free WIFI, its reception was weak and unable to use. Throughout my stay I couldn’t use it but relied on my Softbank 4G sim.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a good location in the centre of Osaka and the room was relatively spacious. Unfortunately, we didn’t have the easiest time dealing with this hotel. Typhoon Trami hit japan as we were due to travel down to Osaka, so we requested that our two night stay be moved back by a few days. The hotel outright refused to do this. We contacted our travel provider who spoke to the hotel- the hotel only agreed to move our dates if we cancelled and rebooked. The hotel knew full well rebooking at this late stage would cost us more money, which it ultimately did. At check-in they provide guests with complimentary drinks vouchers to have a free drink in one of their bars. All fine if you’re prepared to pay the 1500 yen table charge for the pleasure....!Avoid this hotel!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Strategic location, great choice of food and beverage outlets and nice charming room. Staff was very eager to assist. Great help in coordinating my courier from Tokyo to Osaka. Very thankful for all your help.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the location of this hotel. Above a station and within walking distance to shops, restaurants, the Dotombori area, America Mura and not too far from Namba. We had a room with 2 double beds and a nice bathroom with shower and bath behind a glass door which I liked. The main room had a desk with a hidden mirror which I loved to used for hair and makeup while my husband was in the bathroom! Concierge helped with a restaurant booking at Masuda and were very nice in general. Convenient to everything and a wonderful stay!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pretty central to the city, easy to walk into all the main areas of this amazing city.Room was bright, spacious and modern - with all the amenities to hand if required.Breakfast was ample with lots of choice in large but busy room.Recommend for any type of visit
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our first trio to Japan. We tried to chose the hotel based on quality and location. The Nikko hotel scores very well on both accounts. It is located near the Dotonburi sector where most of Osaka's restaurants are located. The hotel is also near subway stations (you can access from the hotel basement) and is directly situated on the luxury shopping Avenue. The staff greeted us with warmth and kindness and our room was very comfortable. I am glad to say that we finally have had the opportunity to enjoy a traditional Japanese breakfast. All our hotels included breakfast, mainly to prevent from having to hunt for a place that serves breakfast in the morning. We were looking forward to our Japanese breakfast but we were disappointed with the choices in our previous hotels. Not here at the Nikko hotel tough. There is a restaurant on the 3rd floor where they serve only Japanese breakfasts in the form of a buffet. Grilled marinated salmon and mackerel, sardines, steamed vegetables, cold soba noodles, Japanese omelets (made to order), Okonomiyaki, steamed rice and more items I have forgotten about by the time I am writing these lines. Quite amazing. Exactly what we have been waiting for.Great staff, great location and amazing Japanese breakfast
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel located near Shinsaibashi shopping area, just cross the road. I traveled alone so I book for single room. The room is comfortable with fine space for one person stay. The staff are friendly and helpful. I drove the car and the car park is 1,400yen per night for staying guest. It is about one and a half hour drive to the Kansai International Airport.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in a very strategic location. Near to many point of interests. Metro, department stores, shops, restaurants are all very near and walking distance to the hotel. Actually Dotonbori is walkable from the hotel. It is connected to Shinsaibashi Shopping Street, which is covered and offered many shops, restaurants. We found Starbucks, Mc Donalds, Daiso, our favourite ramen shop, a delicious tempura shop, and to get our fresh fruit, we go to Daimaru. Most importantly, we were very impressed with our room. Pleasantly spacious, and always clean. The beds were comfortable, the bath and shower were great. Accessories/amenities were always replenished sufficiently and clean. Housekeeping staff were swift in responding to our needs. We can also reach the hotel from the airport with the airport train. So far, this is our best hotel stay in Japan.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1. Above shinsaibashi station 2. Opposite Daimaru 3. 3min to 7Eleven and Family Mart4. 10mom to Doutonburi 5. Large rooms with 2 queen size bed 6. Knowledgeable concerige Really enjoyed the central location and proximity to train station, Starbucks (next door) and shopping Malls and boutiques. Cosy and comfortable room which is large for 2 adults.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Junior Suite with the 4 kids. They had enough room to play in the living room. Bathroom has shower and bathtub. Breakfast is ok, they serve Japanese and Continental food. Its very accessible to the subway, just on the basement. Across the street is Daimaru Mall, if you love high end shops.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrive at the hotel at 7:00 am , after a 6 hour sleepless flight . And we have 3 children with us . I asked the reception if we can have an early check in . Because the kids didn’t get enough sleep . They say I can have a early check in at 12:00 pm but I have to pay extra . So we waited until 2:00 pm and yet ask us to come back at 2:30 but they cannot confirm if we can check in . The children are sleeping in the lobby and nobody even bother to help us .
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The main strength is the location and the size of the room. This is our second visit to this particular hotel and now i remember how their AC is the “real” cooler not like other hotels. So dont expect icy cold room. In fact we had to turn on our little fan to help us to sleep . This is one of the hotel that needs to fix how they distribute the air of their air conditioning. Its really below standard of most hotels in general.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second stay in this hotel and this time we wanted to stay longer to enjoy Osaka and its neighboring areas of Kyoto and Nara. It is undeniable that this hotel has the best location if you want to check out the shops and restaurants in Shinshaibashi and Dotonburi. Daimaru Department Store is right across the street, most of the high-end boutiques are on the strip, America Mura is close by, as well as one of my favorite stores for knick knacks, Tokyu Hands. There is also a Starbucks and a McDonald’s nearby which is a big help when it comes to feeding picky kids. The subway also runs beneath. However, that’s about it. This hotel is expensive and you are paying for the location. The rooms are small, although very clean. The air conditioning in the room was horrible! I could hear people’s footsteps upstairs, the breakfast buffet is mediocre (for me at least), and the worst part is the the airport shuttle only stops intermittently and only on some selected hours. If you have an early flight out of Osaka, for example, there is no bus and the hotel does not have its own shuttle. They will, however help you rent a van for exhorbitant prices! After all this, will I stay in this hotel again? *sigh* Most probably.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were clean and the facilities decent enough - though, I was disappointed to discover that they do not have a gym or health club on the premises. However, it is very conveniently located adjacent to the Shinsaibashi shopping area and only a few minutes walk from Dotonbori.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is superb near Shinsaibashi area which has plenty of shops and tons of restaurants. The room and toilet were spacious and very comfortable. The Osaka city view from room is great. Bed was comfy. Staffs were very helpful. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here on last night in Japan, glad it wasn't the first one we stayed at, arrived at mid day and was told room wouldn't be ready until 3 pm. Staff really helpful as per Japan,Public areas not bad, but our room on south side was really looking tired, bathroom not lit well , room very small . In general the room needed an update
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Top location, very accessible to train station, walking distance to Shinsaibashi and Dotonbori. Many shops and restaurants around. Nice rooms but quite expensive. Not recommended for budget traveller.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had stayed at this hotel previously with a tour group and because of its location we decided to stay again. Unfortunately the room we booked was extremely small - standard double room. The bed was up against the wall, very little floor space and nowhere to put 2 suitcases.The bathroom was tiny, very few toiletries supplied. Wifi was good.Breakfast is 2 options - Western or Japanese. We chose Japanese for 2 mornings - it had changed to Japanese self service since the last time we came, but the selections and service were outstanding. Great breakfast.When we decided to eat in the Western breakfast we had to queue up for over 20mins just to get into the dining room. Selection seemed to be good, but extremely crowded so hard to get around and everyone rushing as they were running late due to having to wait so long to get a seat.The location is good and Osaka is a great, fun place to visit, but this hotel did not live up to the standards that we had enjoyed previously.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had only one night in Osaka and those guys spoiled it. Yes, the rooms are nice and well equipped. But that will be the only positive comment that I will make about this hotel. For the rest, this is an extremely expensive place for what it is, staff is mostly incompetent and very poor in English, there is was not enough room for breakfast hence a queue of about 30 min, bars do not allow for children even for a cola and check in was not possible before 3 pm. A place that I would certainly not recommend.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Nikko is very well located right outside Shinsaibashi station and across the road from the famous Shinsaibashi covered shopping street taking you all the way down to Dotonbori, for fabulous street food and terrific restaurants. Osaka is a food paradise and you will be spoilt for choice. For those who embrace the amazing Japanese train system : the hotel is directly connected to exit 8 from the South-North and South-South gates of Shinsaibashi Station of the Osaka Municipal Subway Midosuji Line; Shinsaibashi Station of the Nagahori Tsurumi-ryokuchi Line and Shinsaibashi Station of the Midosuji Line are connected by a walkway. The hotel is very nicely decorated and the staff are incredibly attentive and courteous. Our room, a superior double, was an average size for Japan, fresh, bright and immaculately clean. We had a separate wet room containing a shower and bath, then another 'dry' area with toilet, vanity, mirror and amenities. The bed was beautifully comfortable and we slept well with no noise.There are 2 family marts and a 7-11 store behind the hotel for small supplies, drinks, snacks etc, which proved very useful. Go out through the driveway at the side of the hotel and walk to the little lane behind the hotel. One of the Family Marts is right there. We very much enjoyed our stay at the Nikko and would definitely recommend it to anyone. In fact our family are staying there next month upon our recommendation.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, friendly staff, good for kids. Also very differse breakfast.The location is perfect for shopping and traveling around. We would visit again if we go to Osaka! The rooms are a good size for a hotel in Japan.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is well placed for shopping district and also the side streets for more typical shopping mall and many small restaurants. The hotel also above subway station and hence can move around Osaka with ease. My room had nice view of wide Main Street and was very clean and comfortable. Food options also good with Japanese and buffet breakfast and some takeaway options in basement level.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our 2nd stay at this hotel. Our request for early check-in was accepted and the whole process was smooth. Unlike most hotels, there wasn't any security check in the elevator using our room key. We traveled with 3 kids and the 3rd bed was a sofa bed. With that sofa bed set up, there wasn't any sofa seats in the room. Bathroom is a little dated and small as most hotel in Japan. No separate shower and bath. Their air-con is centrally controlled so if you are there between seasons (winter to spring), you have access only to heated air. You can set the temperature as low as you want, but only hot air comes out. The room was stuffy and the staff offered us a fan in the room. Wifi in our room was also terrible and it was a real problem for us since we still have some business emails to reply. The staff came with a router as a solution and all is good again. All in all, this stay fall short of our initial expectation but the service from the staff made up for it.
hotelName:
4    Hotel Nikko Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spending a few days at the St. Regis in Osaka was magical. It was possible to experience the strength of the brand in every detail. Comfortable room, fluffy towels, excellent service, extraordinary food. It was hard to leave.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: one of manificent hotel i ever experience all staff Excellent service very accommodating, specially Sari san his vert kind person, approachable professional attitude. also thank you much Mr, jason san your full support from day 1 up to departed i will never forget youFrancis and rolly
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service was very good!The room was very clean and modern!And The location is exceptional!I had 3 nights stay in St. Regis Osaka and I checked out with a bright smile. Thank you St. Regis Osaka! If only I didn’t forget to take a photo of the room, I only have videos. ㅠㅠ
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alawys like the excellent service of St.Regis. It's the right decision for choose St. Regis OSAKA. The view is good and the suites room is much more bigger than others in Japan. Location is good and can walk to anywhere you want, the Sky gardon of the hotel is amazing.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've had the good fortune to travel a bit...for both work and pleasure, and the St. Regis is one of the best hotels I've ever had the fortune to stay at. I've been here 3 times --and the service and amenities have remained top-notch for all of the stays.This is the way you hope you'll be treated at a hotel - as a welcome, featured guest. Everything about the staff is professional, polite, and courteous. The rooms are old-school luxury, and ooze class. The amenities and food are fantastic. I can't imagine a better place to stay in Osaka. Rooms are large by European and Japanese standards, and mildly over-sized by US standards. The ones I've stayed in feature walk-in closets, which is great if you're packing for a multi-day stay.Net: If you have the good fortune to be able to choose the St. Regis as your hotel in Osaka, don't pass it up.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We started with a great driver picking us up at the train station. He was wonderful.His name is Tsuji with Nihon taxi company. He was responsive and informative along the way to the hotel. He spoke English, yeah!The check in process was so professional. Yuki was so helpful and he asked Koji Terashima the front office manager for assistance. I am a privilege member. They were gracious to upgrade us for the three nights.Going for my two hour massage, cannot wait.Aika was caring and did a great job. I hope that I can make time for another massage.I just got to our suite and met David Rewerts. He is charming as well as very very good being our butler. He was trained in Lucerne Switzerland. That is the Gold standard of hotel management. It definitely shows in David. Frankly that Gold standard approach is evident from all the staff here at St Regis. Can you believe I have a choice of 11 different pillow types. I have never had that before.We are heading to La Veduta to celebrate my birthday tonight. I will write my review on the dinner after we return tonight.Chikako Nakabayashi our concierge is really helpful. She knows a lot and researches for more. To help with day trip to Kyoto. Also for helping with shipping our luggage ahead to Matsumoto.I needed help to find the name of our driver from the train station yesterday and she called us with that too.This is class way above the normal five star hotels. Thanks The pictures below are some of the options for the buffet breakfast. They look really good and taste at least as good.Tomorrow evening we are dining in Wajo a tepanyaki restaurant in the St Regis. I will be writing my review on Trip Advisor then.We have so far only had two of three days here at St Regis. It is an amazing experience.
