They have been wonderful.It is so nice to have old school classy treatment from the new young generation of service people.A special mention for Matsu who helped my wife arrange surprise birthday things like rose(he provided without charge), beautiful fruit plate, cake and candles. We arrived on my actual birthday and all these wonderful things were awaiting me. Thank you Matsu.It certainly makes me want to look for St Regis in every corner of the globe.I commend management all the way from the top down for how they select and train their staff. Thank you.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our last night in Osaka was spent here after 10 days of touring. Five star service from arrival to departure including welcome kits for children traveling with you. All staff speaks English and if you are a Gold or higher level of Marriott Rewards you automatically get late check out until 2pm - well worth it. Butler service at your fingertips and comfy beds and robes. We booked thru Hotels.com and got an incredible rate for under $300 a night. A must is a cocktail in the lobby bar. Stunning artwork and a serene place to kick back and enjoy a drink.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a few nights during a Japan trip. The hotel itself is in a decent location and in a newer building. Entrance is on the ground floor and front desk on an upper floor. Welcome was quite nice and we could check in right away. Front desk team was always very nice. Also the concierge service delivered a high standard and arranged several things in advance. The room had a great view and is equipped with a lot of amenities. It's already a few years old though. Room size was quite good also bathroom which had no rain shower. There is a butler box to service when you are in the room and don't wohnt to be disturbed great idea!The service in the bar on reception level was not up to par. It always took a while to get served and they were not always good organized (outside) . One evening it was even worse inside the bar. Could be a great bar with an awesome terrace but had been disappointed.There is no pool or jacuzzi available. Leisure outlet is very small in general. Expected more in this high end class and prices.In total a lot of good impressions and some which can be improved.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Marriott Titanium.I travel A LOT for both business and pleasure, and I've been able to have stayed at my fair share of 5 star brands and iconic properties. At this point and point, this stay and property has been my favorite in the world. You just have to experience it. Pros:Staff - polite, professional, and really good at guessing your needs before interacting with them. Concierge - was able to get us into a popular great restaurant on short notice. Bar/beer garden - actually very fairly priced with great bartenders On site restaurant - only did breakfast there, but the food was all great as well as the waitstaff. Rooms - spotless, especially in the bathroomsLocation - great location and you're right above a subway lineCons:This is something that the hotel really can't control and won't change my mind. But some guests are very rude and don't understand the concept of lines and shared spaces. Every morning at breakfast there were groups of people who decided to cut the lines at the hostess stand and seat themselves as well as letting their kids run around free screaming through the restaurant. If the staff could be more vigilant about looking out for that putting that to an end it would be great.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is good, walkable distance to attractions. Excellent concierge!! All staff are very helpful and pleasant. Room was nice and clean. Love the bathroom with tub and shower. My only choice of place to stay in Osaka from now on.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The property is really nice! this is not the problem. In my opinion, this hotel requires more professional or better-trained staff members, there were too many mistakes made that same day:- A long wait for a simple salad and club sandwich at the lounge, wrong food was delivered again more time waiting...and I finally had to cancel...but then no apologies from the lounge manager at the time, he preferred to send the waitress... this is unacceptable!- Very dirty fitness center, no water, and no wipes...- Waited in my room for 25 minutes to get more soap and shower gel
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 현재 방문 중입니다.체크인 후 짐이 한시간 이상 오지않아 버틀러콜로 전화했지만 가고 있다고 하길래 끊고 기다리는데 또 삼십분 이상 오지않아 12층 컨시어지 데스크에 물어봤습니다. 짐이 아직 아래있다면 신발만 꺼내서 외출하고 싶다고...그랬더니 크로셋에 넣어놨다고 하길래 다시 방으로 들어가 찾았지만 어디에도 없어서 남편만 방에 남아있고 저는 12층에 있는 직원에게 다시 없다고 전했습니다.1층 직원과 통화하는듯 하다가 기다리라고 하고 그 직원도 다른곳으로 가버리고 답답한 남편이 방에서 다섯번정도 통화했는데 계속 옷장이 있다고만 하길래 내가 지금 방인데 없다고 화를 내자 그제서야 상황을 모르는 작은 여성분이 캐리어 두개를 가져왔는데 남편이 기분나빠하자 당황스러운 표정을 짓고 쏘리 하고 갔답니다. 화가 나는 부분은 계속 방에 넣어놨다는 거짓말을 하면서 결국 아니라는 걸 알았을 때도 제대로 된 사과도 안 하려고 상황 모르는 작은 여자직원을 보내 이상한 사과를 하게 했다는 것입니다. 실수는 할 수 있습니다만 이정도 호텔이라면 제대로 인정하고 정중히 사과했어야 할것입니다.Staff told a lie and they didn’t apologize me rightly.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and had 2 rooms. The hotel is very conveniently located near the train station making it a great place to base you travels in Osaka. Overall our experience was positive but did not meet the St. Regis expectation we had from our stay in Mumbai. The positive, the rooms are very nice, spacious, comfortable and well stocked. The concierge in the front went above and beyond my expectations, as when I asked for information, they not only provided me the information I was looking for (where to eat, what to see, directions) but also printed out information and highlighted other things that I can do there including shopping, restaurants, how to go from one place to another. They were all fantastic. It helped given we spoke English and else would have had a more difficult time navigating. Now for the let downs, I had communicated it was my daughter birthday and they were bringing a cake, and when they did they said happy birthday to my wife, also the butler service was not great, e.g. we would order coffee but it would come with no milk or creamer, and when I asked for it, it took extremely long that coffee was cold and it happened multiple times. The turndown service was also inconsistent, one day they would restock the bar, and one day they would miss something. Again nothing was bad but it wasn't what you expect when you book a St. Regis. I would stay at this hotel again and I would recommend it but they have work to do
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mother and I stayed at the St. Regis Osaka and had an absolutely wonderful experience - the staff were excellent, attentive and always willing to help. The rooms were also beautiful and the location is excellent. I want to make a particular mention of Kazuyoshi Matsubara, who is the senior concierge at the hotel and who assisted us immensely during our stay there. It is really rare to come across a member of staff who is extremely knowledgeable, funny and kind - for example, he helped us with putting together personalised itineraries to visit different cities around Osaka and even walked us to a restaurant himself so that we wouldn't get lost. I would wholeheartedly recommend the St. Regis Osaka to any person who asks given we had such a wonderful experience.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Genuinely one of the best hotels at which I’ve had the privilege of staying. The building is beautiful and the staff are attentive from the minute you step out of your cab to the moment you leave. In house dining is wonderful (albeit pricy), and the rooms are spacious with great amenities and views. I would happily go back to Osaka just to stay at this hotel again.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let’s not talk about St Regis’ prices, we all know they are at the top, let’s talk about the brand and what we all expect when staying at this prestigious hotels. Certainly, not what we found in our hotel. It’s well known the phrase “in details you find the quality”, well, judge by yourself... please see the photos attached. Old stuff, like the tv set, or the telephone.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Never stayed at St. Regis before and now am a fan bc of the butler service. First we arrived very early but was allowed to check in few hours later. Rooms were very spacious and nicely organized. Butler service was excellent!!! We did not need to use a tour guide as a result and visited many nearby cities in the area. They recommended itineraries and we had a lot of questions and last minute restaurant recommendations and changes. All the restaurants were spot on ( locals only places and specialized regional foods). We utilized the ironing service and pillow service ( who knew there were so many different pillows to chose from). We had a flawless stay in Japan and would return to St. Regis again!
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let’s start with the positives first: the hotel property itself is pretty faultless, with immaculate & beautiful public areas eg lobby & gym, and spacious, luxuriously appointed guest room. It is also located in a very convenient location for Osaka, with a metro station right beneath it. A covered walking street full of shops and extremely good restaurants locals eat in is literally around the corner. So, what went wrong?- We were offered a welcome drink by our butler upon check-in. We opted for iced coffee but apparently they ran out of skimmed milk. We were rendered speechless, to be honest.- The concierge team was well-meaning but lacked the level of efficiency & courteousness one would expect at St Regis- A dinner at La Veduta was adequate but ultimately very forgettable. In a nutshell: Good service, OK food and awful decor (especially the chandeliers!)Might stay again for the room and location, I might...
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 2 nights in early Mar. Good location. Directly connected to Hommachi station, Umeda & Namba are both a short ride away. You can even walk to Shinsaibashi.Service is top notch especially at check in. The gentleman is so lovely and spoke very good English. Got a corner room on level 25, fantastic view of Osaka from both the room and bathroom ;)Concierge recommended a French restaurant in Kyoto and made reservation for me. Turned out to be the best meal of this trip in Japan!One little annoyance: You have to take the lift down to level 12, then walk past restaurant, bar, lobby...to get to another set of lifts to go down to ground level...Yukata provided in room is so good I wanted to buy one. Unfortunately they don't sell them! Bah. Might have to go back and see if I can somehow get my hands on one...
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel. We had a stunning room with a jaw dropping view of Osaka. With just the touch of a button our automated blinds opened to reveal the most beautiful view of the city. We were staying as part of our honeymoon and the butler brought us a lovely piece of cake to celebrate. The bed was incredibly comfortable and we slept like babies. The staff were very helpful and we absolutely LOVED the location of the hotel. It was perfect walking distance from Dōtonbori (25 minute very easy and fun walk through Shinsaibashi-suji, a covered shopping street that is north of Dōtonbori) so we could experience all of the incredible craziness of that neighbourhood in the evening, but then head back to the classiness of the St. Regis which is located along Midosuji street which has a reputation for being akin to the 'Champs Elysées' of Osaka. The hotel is also a half hour walk to Osaka Castle or a very easy 10 minute taxi ride away. Also, like all St. Regis hotels, the lobby just smells expensive and delicious. It was such a treat coming back to this hotel after a fun day exploring the city!
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent three nights at the St. Regis Osaka and it is wonderful! My room was spotless and spacious, with a great view of the city. The staff was kind, helpful, and unobtrusive. Breakfast was fantastic, with a wide selection of quality food and a quiet, peaceful atmosphere. Importantly, the location is great. It's right above the Hommachi station, which is convenient for metro access. But it's an easy walk to the areas I wanted to visit as a tourist. I would absolutely book the St. Regis on a future visit!
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second time staying at St. Regis Osaka. I'll skip reviewing the room as it is the St. Regis standard, spacious, comfortable and clean. The St. Regis lounge is worth mentioning as I love the giant paint near the bar in particular, which illustrates all historical big events that happened in the past of Osaka, and the whole set up of the lounge made me feel relaxed having breakfast and afternoon tea there.The service was excellent. Mr. Okada provided one of my best experience at hotels with his hospitality. It looks he really cared about guests by heart and managed to provide the best help he could offer. Overall, it was such a great stay there and it has become the go-to hotel whenever I would stay in Osaka.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just completed 2 nights stay at St regis Osaka from total 6 nights in this trip. Before we move to St regis, we just completed fantastic stay at Westin Osaka with huge suite room upgrade. As Ambassador elite member, we have been upgrade to Grand deluxe which is one catagory higher than my booking. It is slightly disappointed for small upgrade since there are many higher catagories room available in Marriott application. Anyway, it is not a big deal. Platinum elite and above will have complimentary breakfast and 3,000 y per night minibar credit which is nice. Check in is smooth and room is in good condition but nothing spectacular. It does not have feeling on high end brand like in my other st Regis Experience. Unfortunately, I have met one bad experience during the trip on my 2nd day morning. Eventhough this is my personal vacation, I would like to spend my short time to greet with one of my VIP Japanese customers in the hotel. After I finished breakfast, I go to check with front desk and ask where in the hotel I can find the space like lobby lounge to have a cup of coffee with my VIP guest. One of the lady replied me with slightly impolite word that our hotel does not have place like that!! I might be confused with Japanese calture or it is limitation of Staff English communication. It felt pretty disappointed particularly when I am top tier Marriott member. At the end of conversation, she suggested me to go to Breakfast restaurant and have coffee there. My VIP guest and I go to ground floor restaurant at 10.10 am and we just ask tables and order 2 cups of coffee. During our short conversation around 20 minutes later, same staff that recieve our order told us that restaurant is closed and we need to leave to sit outside now which is pretty cold. I am very flustrated and want to make a bill immidiately but my VIP guest is ok that we can move to sit outside. After we finish meeting and one of staff said that they will not charge for coffee since they need to ask us to leave restaurant. For me I would rather pay for (only) 2 cups of coffee and sit inside. The rest of stay is fine. Concierge team is very nice and they always are very helpful. Breakfast is good selection. In overall, it is OKAY stay but you might expect more from St Regis brand.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 典雅高貴不會太過張揚 讓人走進大堂的第一時間就非常舒服升等1717套房 空間很大 可惜有時水龍頭會發出奇怪的聲響 音量還不小 這個應該不是偶發狀況 有點可惜不應該安排這樣的房間給客戶早餐可以選擇主菜 很訝異當日被告知烤魚供應不足 距離早餐結束還有45分鐘呢整體來說可以再更好一些，期待更好的大阪瑞吉One of the faucets in Room 1717 makes strange noice sometimes. The noice was loud and scary. May need further maintenance and surprisingly they allocate this suite as an upgrade.Fish was told sold out at breakfast, there was still 45 minutes before end, never thought would happen at Regis Osaka. Beside above all very nice.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property exceeds expectations, from the check-in experience, to the rooms, the facilities and the general design of the hotel. If you're travelling by train, it is easy to get to from the JR line and well signed. The moment you enter the hotel from the side door or from the porte cochere, the staff will assist with your bags. You'll then be welcomed and escorted to the reception / lobby. The rooms are very large with a huge bathroom and walk-in wardrobe. Floor to ceiling windows open up to an amazing view of the city and surrounding mountains. The bed was a true kingsize and comfortable for Japans hard standard. Each floor has a full butler service. All you need to do is call. We had pre-dinner drinks in the bar which was beautifully designed. Cocktails were prepared well. Access to public transport is great since the property is above a train station. My only annoyance was getting in and out of the property. You take a lift down to the lobby, then another lift down to concierge, then walk out to the street. It was a little time consuming. Next time you're in Osaka, I would recommend considering The St Regis for your stay.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The St. Regis in Osaka is a beautiful property. There is a roof garden outside of the lobby, and each of the rooms has lofty ceilings with floor to ceiling windows. Despite its small size, the gym here was also very well stocked. It is 24/7, which is one of the main things I look for in a gym, and had complimentary water, fruit and towels. The space has a diverse cardio setup and free weights up to 20 kg. There are also 4 resistance machines : 2 for upper body, 2 for lower. On the flip side there's no bathroom in the gym, and the weight range is pretty limited.This is still my favorite hotel in Osaka when I come for work, and I would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yes, so I have visited the Hotel recently in late December, and it was the first hotel I stay in for my Honeymoon trip. They greeted me with open arms, they spoke good English, and made the communication way much easier, and as soon as I entered the room to settle in, and let me say it was truly spectacular, the butler knocked the door and handed me a complimentary chocolate cake to congratulate me for my wedding, and that was really a cute thing from the hotel staff to prepare. Overall, they made my stay very comfortable, and would definitely come back to the same hotel on my next Osaka trip !! and of course I totally recommend it strongly !!
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yes, expensive hotel. Room was lovely. Great bed. HUGE picture window. Shower/bathroom was like a spa. Butler service -- exceptional. They helped us with many things we needed including giving specific directions to a cab driver. The hospitality staff was wonderful - on New Year's Day there was a special ceremony with sake and mochi (traditional in Japan on that day) for the guests. The restaurants - even if you do not stay there - are marvelous. The Italian chef and his creations are sublime.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: what a great hotel. From the amazing staff to amenities to the great breakfast this was simply an amazing place in an incredible location. I would strongly recommend it to anyone who is visiting Osaka
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brought my mom there to enjoy the holidays. The hotel entrance its a bit hard to find but I like the design how they separate concierge desk on the ground floor so its more private. There’s only two desks and lobby area is a bit small. But they did it nicely by having us resting on the sofa and one of the staff did the check in for us while we were relaxing on the sofa. Operator speaks very well english and responded our request very quickly. The room is a bit old you can tell from the design. But it doesn’t bother me, I am here for the brand and enjoy the service which St Regis Osaka didnt let me down. Thank you all for the good job and we will be back.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the hotel was excellent and the team members of the reception were super helpful.I would like to specially mention and thank a reception team member who i forgot his name but I know that he spent some time in Birmingham.I would %100 recommend this hotel if you looking for something special in Osaka and I am looking forward my next stay!
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The classic st regis hotel with a rude service.Celebrate new year eve there. And we totally regret choosing st regis osaka.The price in restaurant is over price.Quality is fine but taste was awful:(..
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We usually stayed at Ritz Carlton but this time we decided to try St Regis, and were pleasantly surprised by its service and quality. The hotel definitely lives up to its 5-6 star status. We’re escorted by the manager to our room, which is on 30+ floor and has a very nice view of the Osaka city skyline. The room is very spacious and comfortable - 2 double beds, large washroom and even a walk-I’m closet. To add to our delight was the breakfast. Plenty of choices plus a “main”, foie gras on steak for me. The hotel is just few steps from Shinsaibashi and nearest station is Hommachi. To go to Kansai Airport, we took a cab from hotel to Umeda station (less than 1000 yen) and rapid train.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Travelled with my partner and a toddler in our birthdays in late October. Arrived hotel with a warm welcome and smooth check-in. The Hagi Suite that we stayed in was wonderful. The Butler team was amazing. Really enjoyed the stay and definitely visit again.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very thoughtful paid attention to detail. We were a group of five. I didn’t call room service for extra brushes. I found them packed beautifully. Color coded so we didn’t get our brushes mixed up. Brilliant attentive polite staff. Well-done to everyone at St regis Osaka! Shopping district 15 minute walk away. Naya park osaka one hour away by train.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My girlfriend & I came to Osaka & had an excellent time at the St. Regis. The rooms were well appointed, breakfast was fabulous, concierge was also very helpful. The walking garden was very peaceful, the bar was classic, all staff was professional & spoke multiple languages.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first time staying with St. Regis brand and was a highly pleasant experience. Location between main area was very convenient for me that I had to visit both Namba area and Umeda area in one day. On top of that, their butler service was exceeding my expectation with great service inclding their ironing service(important for me for that I had been traveling over a week by then) and welcome drink. What I have found out on my last night of stay was that you can even have butler make a bubble bath for you! You guys should try. I rarely leave any review on Tripadvisor but this one was worth my time! Thank you St. Regis!
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From arriving to leaving, the customer service at St Regis Osaka was exceptional. Staff were very friendly and helpful, from arrival, through to a very useful concierge service. The rooms are very clean and well equipped. The location is excellent, just a 2 minute walk from Hommachi Metro Station on the MidoSuji (red) line, just 12 minutes ride to Shin-Osaka JR Shinkansen Station. The taxi ride from Shin-Osaka is just 15 minutes and approximately ¥2,000.Overall a great experience and look forward to returning.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: my stay in this hotel is amazing,great location,great facility and also great services. Thumbs up for one of your employee, Angelina who help me and provide me information getting around in Osaka. she gives me suggestion about famous spots and best foods around Osaka as well as arranging some of my needs.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Regrettably we only stayed two nights in this interesting city, made specially so by this hotel. It’s location is ideal, in the middle of little shops and arcades, and all kinds of places to eat local and international foods. The rooms are superb, expertly designed, with high end bathrooms directly accessible from both sides of the well dressed king size bed, spacious closets, etc. Top notch. Our group of ten loved the bar, where a wonderful US pianist crooner held court with soft, lovely melodies while we drank cocktails and wine.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel already decorated for Christmas. Great customer service everywhere in the hotel. Comfortable, beautiful and spaces rooms. Food at breakfast is excellent. Not far from the subway & great restaurants.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We traveled from the Aman in Tokyo (incredible) to the Ritz in Kyoto (pretty fabulous) to this hotel. The service, the food, the room, the spa etc. have all been so below par it is shocking. We cannot wait to check out.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located on top of Honmachi station - red line. Can walk to Shinsaibashi On foot with two subway stations to Umeda. Front office on the 12F with a Japanese gardenBreakfast egg Benedict is so delicious.Only stayed one night then continue my trip down south to Okayama, Naoshima.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you to all the staff - the butlers/ concierge/ reception staff/ parking attendants/restaurant- in fact everyone!An amazing experience- we were treated with so much respect and the staff could not do enough to help us. A beautiful hotel from the furniture to the artwork. Our room had everything we could possibly want - as mentioned in other reviews. Located in a convenient location with a station/food/shops - all nearby. Would highly recommend it. A fantastic way to start our trip in Japan. A true reflection of the warm and respectful culture in Japan. Thank you very much.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrive at the hotel for a week with the family, my wife and my infant. Start from arrival at the hotel, the service is 5* from the reception, concierge and restaurant, service was Excellent!The room was perfect with a very nice view, the baby crib standard to asian hotel size, a bit just for western size baby but works at the end. Room service was good and with fast reactivity for request.We were absolutely taking care by the Chef Concierge Matsubara San and his team who were amazing and give us the best addresses for restaurants and sites to visit. They really help us for our stay from finding good restaurants for my pregnant wife and a good nanny to watch our infant while enjoying a night out.The Director Marie was fantastic and give us the best service I ever had. Totally available to help us during our stay.Restaurant was good and service too. Only one bad point would be the breakfast which is limited for seating and can make you wait a few minutes. However this was settle on our last day when they opened the second floor for breakfast.To resume, a very friendly and professional staff with great location close to the shopping street and amazing sushi restaurant. Thanks again Marie and Matsubara San!!!
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very conveniently situated about a railway station, and close to an arcaded shopping strip, this is a beautiful hotel, with lovely common spaces, an excellent (and very expensive) bar, and a 12th floor garden. The room we had was spacious enough, had a large bathroom and walk-in robes as well as a floor-to-ceiling window with views over the (very clean) rooftops – which resembled, I thought, a work of art in themselves. Breakfast was very good, in a smaller space than these hotels usually provide, and did not feel as if everyone was desperate to eat as much as they possibly could. Not the usual bun-fight, in other words. Customer service was, of course, excellent. I did think, however, they were very mean with the in-room coffee capsules: just two were provided. Although, of course, you could always ask for more.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very luxurious, stellar customer service, and great location. We were fortunate to have butler service in our stay, and they were very accommodating throughout. The breakfast is delicious. I highly recommend
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed primarily in 5-star hotels during our vacation in Japan and this was the very best! Every detail was in order. We were guided to the room and offered welcome drinks with an advice for a drink based on the time of day and the temperature outside. Also, the sheets and bathrobes were incredibly soft. We slept like babies! Moreover, the spa treatment was excellent with a variety of choices and staff that saw to our every need. At last, the inhouse fine dining options and cosy bar (with garden terrace and live music) made the stay complete. If we go to Osaka again, this hotel will definitely be our first choice again!
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an opportunity to stay at this wonderful hotel in Osaka. It is a 5 star hotel that for the most part, lived up to its expectation. I book the resort via SPG (basic 2 double beds) while my friend booked via Amex FHR. I got a decent rate and was excited to see if this hotel lived up to the hype. I contacted the hotel using the butler service and was able to have them help with dinner reservations. Overall a nice stay.Hotel/Location: This hotel is located in a nice area with many eateries near by. IT is about a 20 min walk to Dotonburi with lots of shopping and eating along the way. ITs still a 45 mins car ride/bus ride to KIX. The area is quiet. Most of the cab drivers knew where it was. There was also a fantastic Ramen place about 10 steps away. Biggest gripe was the elevator situation. YOu have to take 1 set of elevators to the lobby. Then walk to another set of elevators to take to your room. A bit of a hassle. Checkin/Service: When we arrived, I was a tad confused by the check in process. The concierge desk is on the first floor and they ask for your passport and info. We arrived at 10am and they told me that my room would not be ready til 4pm. I was ok with that. However, my friend (who booked via Amex) said that he had early check in. She didn't know what he was talking about but she took us to the 12 floor (which is actually the lobby). She didn't allow our wives to come up (didn't make sense). So we followed her up and found that there were 2 registrations desk. The workers politely had us sit down and began explaining things to us. Initially the first gentleman didn't know what he was doing. He tried explaining things but was confused. The manager stepped in and corrected things right away. We both got upgraded and our rooms miraculously was ready. This whole process took approx 30 mins (way too long). But we were given water bottles in the meanwhile. WE were then escorted up another set of elevators to the 18 floor and shown our room. Soon after, a butler appeared with welcome drinks and gave us the tour of the room. From then on, service was really good. Anything we needed was quickly attended to. We were given daily comp bottle of water. 2 articles of clothing were available to be pressed free of charge daily. Turn down service was nice. Comp coffee can be arranged to be brought to your room daily. Everyone was polite and gracious. Valet guy even walked us to the ramen restaurant and helped us order from the vending machine. Great service all the way around. Room: We got upgraded to a corner room grand deluxe. It did have 2 beds, not a big deal. But was huge compared to our other hotels in Seoul. There was a walk in closet with ample room to hang our clothes. The bathroom was huge with a big tub (had its own tv), separate toilet area, and big shower. The shower had 5 nozzles with the best water pressure I have ever experienced. My showers lasted 200% longer due to this. Towels were soft and ample. The bed was comfy. There was a pillow menu that you could choose from. Lighting was great. Ample plugs. No USB charging station. Wifi was fantastic. There was a coffee/tea station, but we didn't use it cuz we just ordered coffee. The view was amazing. I loved the room.Amenities: I utilized the workout room. IT was ok. There were 2 treadmills, and 2 elipiticals. There were dumbells that went up to 20kgs. But it was kind of small. There is not pool. I didn't utilize the restaurants.Overall, an amazing stay. I would return.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in a prime area just walking distance from the convenience stores, restaurants and main tourist sights. Rooms are comfortable and service at F&B were impeccable. Breakfast was great too.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The St Regis has a wonderful bar, good staff and the rooms are nice. The location is excellent, with lots of shops within 50 yds of the hotel. The breakfast is one of the only faults as it’s a bun fight that wouldn’t normally have in a top end hotel. Equally it does need a swimming pool, bar that it’s a very good hotel.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Picked St. Regis because of a great summer special rate. I would say the hotel itself is well maintained and has a nice polish to it. Very tasteful decor and does not feel dated. The main lobby is on the 12th floor....and the concierge/bell service/buffet are on the first floor....so you have to go up 2 sets of elevators to reach your room. In some cases, this could be annoying but this hotel was not too big, so the amount of traversing is not that much.Rooms were standard U.S. size...bathrooms were spacious. Our room was on the 19th floor and it was a corner room, with a view in the bathroom. i liked the butler service....you get free pressing for 2 garments a day, which is really nice.Internet was reliable and free. Amenities were high quality and there were enough US. sockets in the room..and location for sockets are well thought out. they provided a welcome drink after being escorted to the room which is another nice touch...and you get 2 complimentary water bottles a day. Toto bidets...standard issue. Shower is nice...strong pressure and have horizontal jets. There is a cool butler closet so they can deliver stuff too you like ironed shirts and laundry without ringing the doorbell and you answering the door.....they have access to this closet from the outside. very cool.Location-wise - Ideal if you like to stroll to the dotonburi and shinsaibashi stretch. Its literally at the end of shinsaibashi....so, you can walk all the way down to dotonburi....then grab a subway (midosuji line) at namba station and ride back to Honmachi station. The honmachi station exit 3 is literally across the street from the hotel.....so, after a long walk...you dont have to double back...you can take the subway for 180yen back to the hotel.....and continue the next day and just ride down there if you want to continue where you left off.....2 more exits down at Dobutsuen-mae station is Shinsekai...which is really cool shopping/eating area...highly recommended and has a very local feel. So, if you are just staying around Osaka...this is great. But if you are using Osaka as a hub, and going to Kyoto, Nara, Kobe daily....you will have to take a subway to Osaka station then take another one to nara, kobe or kyoto. This is not that big an issue, but an extra step....in this case, i would probably choose a hotel closer to osaka station if not inside the station to reduce this extra step....the problem is, it wont be as nice as the st. regis...and service will not be as good. Overall..if you dont have bad knees like me....and dont mind the extra subway ride....then St. regis is worth it.service wise - Excellent friendly service all over. The check in was a bit slow but it is probably because of the Obon holiday, and there were a lot of people waiting. We also arrived during check out times so, it must have been really busy. But, regardless, i feel they should have more than 2 tables to accommodate for more people...i mean, in other top brand hotels...theres no front desks anymore...just a bunch of people holding ipads and checking you in as you sit in the lounge. anyways...no big deal...but the system could be more efficient.Concierge - i want to give a special shout out to the concierge team...especially Kazuyoshi Matsubara, the Sr. concierge who was great at setting up my nightly dinners and making sure im taken care of.The Bar is very nice...although i wish there was more selection of cocktails. But the bartenders were very skilled to whip stuff up to my liking. No Pool....so if you have kids, and you are travelling in the summer months.....this might be a deal breaker. I opted not to get the breakfast buffet package...even if they were giving it to me for a discounted weekly price. Thought about it, but read from previous reviews it was not that great...i should have tried at least one day to form my own option. Next time.Overall....i highly recommend this hotel....would go back.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The St Regis Osaka exceeded our expectations in every way. Every aspect from the staff to the facilities were outstanding....we'd recommend this hotel with total confidence. The location was great and the warmth of the staff made us feel special.
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first stay in a st regis and this did not disappoint! A corner room, one of the best we have stayed in, so many plus point to the room itself and an amazing view! We really enjoyed the city it has a great vibe and will definitely be trying more st regis hotels!!!
hotelName:
5    The St. Regis Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel rooms are very clean and spacious. My favourite is the open air onsen pool at the top floor. It is very therapeutic to sit in the hot water bath after a tiring day.The hotel is next to the train station and Universal Walk. Very easy to go Osaka town. Finding food to eat was simple too.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here with group of families in April19 (cherry blossom's season). We moved from hotel in Uehonmachi’s area to this part of USJ for 3 nights. The rooms here are indeed very spacious compared to the last we stayed. Is clean, comfortable and modern. Here are the following points about the hotel.Pros :1. Conveniently located. Once you get off the train at Universal City Train Station, The Singulari Hotel is right at the exit gate.2. Very spacious (with additional day bed), clean, modern and comfortable beds and easily can accommodate up to 3 adults size.3. Plenty of restaurants, cafes (ie Starbucks), pharmacies, convenient stores and shopping shops nearby ie GAP and Hard Rock. Recommend to try one particular restaurant ie “RA-MEN” Produced by Kotan (if not mistaken located at 5th floor Universal City Mall). Is tasty and value for money.4. They have a skyspa (Onsen) (both indoor and outdoor) and is free to hotel’s guest which is a plus point. Great relaxing place to dip in our tiring legs and bodies. However do check beforehand for certain peak/crowded time)5. Good Japanese branded toiletries such as body soap and shampoo provided inside the room. Other toiletries stuff such as razors, head bands, sponge and etc are freely available at the lobby for Hotel’s guest. No body moisturizer provided though. 6. Excellent water/shower pressure.7. Close to USJCons :1. No complimentary drinking bottled water provided. Were told tap water is safe to drink. 2. Bit far from downtown.3. Sound proofing not too good. Noises of guests walking through the corridors could be heard.Others :1. Can’t comment on breakfast as we choose to eat out.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had booked this hotel a few months in advance based on room size (in comparison to other hotels in the area) and a quick read of the good reviews. I was shocked to see so many negative reviews just before we were to arrive. I still felt optimistic and glad I was as the stay was great. The room was a double and it was large! Having travelled over a week in Japan it was one of the largest rooms we had (as you may know Japanese rooms are normally on the small side). The room had lots of suitcase space on sofas that line the side of the room. The room was clean and downstairs they clearly provided all extra amenities that you could need. A lovely little addition was that you could purchase an English movie on their TV for 1000yen (£6) to watch and this was so good given we had been travelling japan for over a week. The staff were helpful at reception regarding universal studio plans / tickets (we had pre bought ours online), however, we did wait approx 5/10 mins to be served as it was busy most times. The breakfast was average but included many good simple foods (pastry’s, toast, fruit, cereal) along with other dishes (pasta, eggs, sausages- not just as good). However, the ‘hot’ food wasn’t overly hot. Other than that, the restaurant was clean and served its purpose... It’s all you really need going to the park and it was nice to sit and have a coffee & food before a busy/long day.  They have a skyspa (Onsen) separated by sex. We didn’t have time for this but it did look great. We used the laundry facilities (washer/dryer machine on the top floor) and these were relatively good but they don’t fully dry your clothes in one shot (we did a second Dry only go and this got them 95% there... there are hangers in the room for the last 5% :)) Overall, the last few negative reviews seem alien to me after our experience. Would happily go back if visiting Universal Studios Japan again! :)
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is fantastic. Once you get off the train at Universal City Train Station, The Singulari Hotel is right at the exit gate. Very relaxing and clean spa at the top floor. Enjoyed the Ofuro Bath at the Spa. Easy to go to Osaka station too, from the hotel.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel sold on the "Sky Spa" onsen and the promised "Luxury" pitch on their listing. I originally booked a "City View" and was placed in an extremely tiny room with a view of the Refinery factory next door. When I asked about it, front desk supervisor told me there was "No such thing as a City View here". Our bathroom smelled like sewer and vinegar to which the Supervisor noted that "All bathrooms are like that here." The walls are Paper thin! We were woken up abruptly every morning around 6:30a- 7am, by what seemed to be a Rugby team in the room above us. The worst part, upon check in- I was given a notice that I could not use the onsen spa upstairs due to my "tattoo" on the back of my my neck. The rooms do not offer complimentary coffee, and you will have to grab all toiletries downstairs at front desk. The only upside was that the hotel is literally right above the Train Station, so it was very accessible, however, the train station operates early and makes lots of noise. This hotel was definitely not worth the $850 for 3 nights
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very pleasant and modern. Our room was very spacious and clean. My favorite part was the free open air Onsen and spa on the 14th floor. This is the hotel nearest to the USJ train station and the walk to Universal studio is less than 10 minutes. The Universal Walk beside has lots of food outlets and convenient store.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just next to Univerisal Studio station. It is like 30 secs walk! The hotel is fairly new, clean and big compare to other hotels we have stay in Japan. We also have a sunrise view of Osaka Bay . Definitely value of money if you are going to Univerisal Studio
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pretty big room for 3pax. We got a corner room. Basic for a Japanese hotel under Candeo group. Was surprised with no proper cabinet space except hangers. Guess they are expecting USJ guests with short stay. The spa on the 14th floor is a plus! Go during off peak when all the guest leave to USJ so it's not crowded. Same as the laundry room. Only 5 machines. Don't expect the dryer to dry your clothes! It's not a gas dryer. With people waiting, you can't leave your clothes in the machine. Even 1hr for 2 kg of clothes it doesn't dry!! Compared to a gas dryer.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location of this hotel is excellent for visiting Universal Studios. It is right next to the train station. It is brand new and we had a great stay. All hotel rooms are Non Smoking so it gets an extra star! Staff speaks English and the amenities at this hotel is ample. Check in and Check out was smooth. They let you store your luggage should you arrive early or departing late. Onsite onsen was clean and great place to relax after a day at Universal. Rooms is modern and quite spacious for Japanese standards. We had breakfast at the hotel and there was a good variety. Overall, we enjoyed staying at this hotel and will definitely stay here again next time we visit Osaka.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything about the Singulari speaks of quality. Friendly staff who speaks English, hotel amenities that include a sky spa (onsen for guests) and clean rooms with view make the stay pleasant.Of course, the location must be the main reason for most. It is just outside the Universal City JR station and a walk away from Universal Studio Japan.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the singulari king room for one night then the normal king room for the next four nights. beautiful nice modern and comfortable stay. Very good location, next to the train station. Walking distance to universal studios and connected directly to it by the shopping area universal city walk. Lots of food places in the area. we love the singulari king room, top class facilities with a private onsen as well. The breakfast was ok, not a big variety, seating capacity was small so we had to queue for a while before we can get a seat. One unpleasant experience we had while checking out. We woke up slightly late and couldnt make the very unusual 11am check out timing. We rushed and managed to check out by 12noon and they charged us 2000yen for late checkout. I tried to plead with them to waive the charge but the staff at the reception couldnt understand what i was trying to say, we had to leave so we just paid the 2000yen.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just outside the train station and a 5 min walk to.USJ!Small rooms but functional with a sofa bed which can easily accommodate up to 3 pax. Very clean rooms and toilet, beds and pillows were comfortable.Quite a new hotel, help yourselves to the basic toiletries at the lobby.Nice breakfast including a variety of western and Japanese food, very tasty.Only negative would be the extremely low sink, which can be quite a pain literally to bend down when brushing your teeth and washing. But it seemed low sinks are quite common in most Japan hotels :(Overall for the price and location, it is really value for money and i will consider this hotel if i come back to USJ again.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the suite with the private outdoor bath. The room is clean and small (expected) but my main issue is the use of space. 1. There is a huge outdoor seating at the balcony area and also a couch in the room. After the bed, there is hardly any room to open our luggage (it's too cold to take it outside in autumn). I would prefer to forego the couch for more space instead.2. There is no safe. We wanted to take only the essentials to USJ but alas, no safe to put our valuables.3. There is no towel rack. We had to leave it on the couch instead -_-4. The size of the wastepaper basket is too small. Couldn't fit anything else after throwing a plastic bottle.5. Weird placement of TV. It is at the side at the corner of the room.6. The coin laundry uses the same machine to wash n dry and it doesn't dry well. I'm left with wet laundry in cold autumn with no where to dry them. I would suggest the hotel to get a separate dryer machine. It worked better when tried at other coin laundry in Osaka.Anyway there is also good things about the hotel worth mentioning:1. Big outdoor bath. Comfortable to fit 2 adults. 2. Location wise very convenient. Not the closest to USJ but it is next to the train station. 3. Staff was very helpful n accomodating.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: - Great location! (Right NEXT to the Universal City train station) and a couple of minutes walk to Universal Studios entrance. - Comes with a rooftop onsen (both indoor and outdoor) to soak in your tired body and legs after a long long day. (u need that, trust me) - Skylounge with nice sofa and full glass window view of the port- Variety for breakfast should be improved though. I'm sick of having the same dish for 3 consecutive mornings. **Tip: Book the room without breakfast. there are lots of breakfast choices just outside the hotel (at Universal City Walk) and much cheaper too!
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a ‘deluxe room’ which I think is their entry level because it was very compact even by Japanese standards and didn’t have a closet or safe. It did have a mini-fridge and kettle so you can have your own food/drinks there (you can stock up from the convenience stores you pass on the way to the amusement park). The room wasn’t a major problem for us as it was merely a base for going to Universal Studios Japan, which is literally a couple of minutes walk away. It’s also right next to the station entrance/exit so no problems finding it. You can buy your USJ tickets at the hotel reception to save queueing at the park entrance.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a new hotel and everything just works beautifully. The staff are lovely, The deep bath tub was truly amazing. A comfy bed after a great day at Universal Studio was a welcome sight. This hotel is situated perfectly for those wanting to spend time at Universal Studios. All the restaurants and shopping are right at the door. The train station is also right at the doorstep. A great choice.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was on a business trip, spent 2 nights in the hotel, in the place of a spartner, excellent service, Japanese cuisine is available, breakfast was pleasant.rooms south facing the cityI recommend that you visit the hotel
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We choose this hotel for the excellent location, you just walk to the train station (one Minute) and you can go anywhere! Osaka Train Station gives you all the shopping and eating opportunities. The hotel is modern, reasonable sized rooms, great breakfast.We did not book this hotel for the Universal Studios, but for the location.Staff does not speak English though, but there is a Parking Supervisor ,Miss Chow, who is from Keelung, Taipee, and speaks fluently English , helped us tremendously. Only minus point was that we paid for the breakfast, but had to leave 5AM in the morning for the airport and Hotel was not willing to give us a sandwich instead, Breakfast opens at 7AM.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommended. Easy access to the city centre via connectingJR train stations.This hotel next to citywalk it's shopping area near to universal studios only the problem to us is to catch the bus to airport timing start from near hotel is 910am so we took the taxi to kansai airport about 9000 yen.The hotel staff is nice but English need to improved.Jr is complicated but still good to explore to the city. Not forget to visit NaraVery near to Starbucks ,Hard rock cafe,Lawson convenient shop etcStay hear you won't regret The only thing is could not wear swimming suit to the pool at level 14 a bit shy for non Japanese culture hope they change the rules there.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: New hotel, rooms are spacious, bright & clean. Wonderful location next to train station & 5 -10 min walk to Universal Studios Osaka. Spa & Laundry facilities available. Most hotels in Japan have heated toilet seats- love it! Highly recommended. Easy access to the city centre via connecting train stations.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed at the Universal Port Hotel and that one was farther compared to this one. Since its new, I didn't expect too much. However, the hotel was just right in front of me once I came out from the Universal City train station, so that was a plus. The lobby was classy looking albeit abit small. Toiletry supplies were strangely left at the lobby area as well, so you'll see many guests, or not, grabbing many items, though there was plenty to go around. There is a skyspa but never had time to try. We got our USJ tickets here too. No hotel restaurant, but quite a number of restaurants outside the hotel, around Universal City, but they close at 9 or 10pm I believer, so after leaving USJ during closing hours, we had to grab food from the nearby convenient store, which was very crowded during late nights coz everyone had the same thought of needing food/supper after 10pm. Not the hotel's fault tho. The room was great, very spacious for my family of 3 and even had a lounge type cushion that could fold into an extra bed Only issue I had was that the AC remote was all in Japanese and not sure why, but the AC would switch off randomly for no reason. I had to wake up to turn it back on again so I guess it was faulty. The pyjamas provided were very nice quality and designed. One more thing, the lobby staff English could be improved a bit more I think.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Their standard rooms are pretty small. But for the amount you pay for it worth it. However I find their staff completely lacking in English communication skills, for a hotel with this caliber I was expecting better, especially compared to other hotels I have stayed in Japan. They even double charged me for the room. I only realized it when I left the country. But it would be a nightmare to try contact them as no one speaks fluent English at the counter. One thing that bothered me is I found some old slippers and some rubbish under our bed. Location wise this is the perfect hotel if you are visiting universal studio. Only a few minutes walk away.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a couple of nights. We had a twin room, the room was super clean, modern and minimalistic. The beds were super comfy, so was the lounge/futon. The room was quite spacious, as was the bathroom. The bathroom was clean and the shower had great water pressure. Amenities were great...in the lobby there is a bench where you can freely grab all the extra amenities you need.Location is perfect! Right next to the Universal City train station & a 1 minute walk to the beginning of the Universal City with tonnes of restaurants, cafes, etc.The staff don't speak much English, but enough to get by. They were all really nice. I'd definitely recommend staying here and would stay here again!
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at the brand new Singulari. It was so convenient to USJ, CityWalk and the train station to get around Osaka. We were visiting Osaka to see USJ, so this was ideal for us. I loved the room, simple, modern, and very comfortable. They provide you with PJs every night, so no need to pack on your own! This is very exciting for US travelers not used to these amenities. We loved the proximity to CityWalk for nightlife and dining. We went to Starbucks every morning right next door so we didn't eat breakfast at the hotel to save some money. The front desk staff spoke decent English, and we had no language barrier issues.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this hotel from USJ official website. This is one of their partner hotels. This hotel is also very new. Everything about this hotel is perfect except the parking is really expensive!! We paid about 3900yen for overnight parking. And this amount turns out to be the most expensive parking we paid throughout our 12 days driving trip. The check in is fast, the staff are friendly & prompt in answering any queries. We have book a room for 3 pax. And our room comes with 2 super single beds and a couch by the window. They have provided 3 sets of towels and toothbrushes but the couch doesn't comes with blankets or extra pillows. We were too tired to call for extra blankets and pillows so the 3 of us just slept on the 2 beds which is still quite comfortable. They have a public onsen on the top floor which is really perfect & what we need after a day of fun & action at USJ. Just 2 minutes walk from the hotel is a mall full of restaurants, I think there are 3 storeys all full of restaurants, also a takoyaki museum and we also saw 2 Lawson nearby. No worry about meals at all.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We actually booked a different hotel (Keihan City) for 2 nights but since we had a bad experience with them on the first night, we decided to transfer to Singulari for our second night. Definitely no regrets from the additional cash we have to pay. Hotel is very modern (just opened Aug 2017) and room was very comfortable and spacious. Complete amenities, with a Sky bath and relaxation room on the 14F that sets it apart and unique from other hotels along USJ City Walk. Hotel is literally beside Universal City Station, then USJ City Walk. No need to cross a street. Would highly recommend to anyone!
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights during our trip to Osaka. Good points:1) Location is great, just next to JR station and 3 mins to USJ2) Nice, new and clean hotel3) Good room size4) Japanese spa is included at top floor of the hotelAverage points:1) Room sound proof is very poor.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a station for going to Universal Studio Japan, I have chosen this new Japanese Hotel which open in Aug 2017. One of inspected is that it has a sky spa and which is automatic . It consists of both outdoor and indoor part which open from 15:00 to 11:00 . The smart TV can show you the status of the spa which crowded or not. The Hotel restaurant only provide breakfast but there is a lot of restaurant nearby also the railway station.
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really like this modern Japanese hotel. It's very young, just one week old since opening. The reason I choose this hotel is because 1. It's just outside Universal Studio Japan, 2. It has an amazing public bath. Staff is friendly and I did not mind they have to bring out their cheat sheet to talk to me in English, most of the guests are Japanese. It's ok they are doing the best to communicate to a forginer. I do not find that unprofessional as long as the message is clearly communicated. Room is clean and comfortable. You can obtain a lot of information form the TV system.Public bath on the top floor and it's so good, open air bath was very refreshingBreakfast is typically Japanese style international breakfast, food variety is good, no egg station, no sunny side up, no omelettes but they have Japanese pan fried egg rolls which is fine for me.After midnight, access to convinent stores needs to walk a little bit, then there is 3 Lawson convinent stores
hotelName:
6    The Singulari Hotel & Skyspa At Universal Stud...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From our 3 week travel through japan, this was one of our favorite hostels!Really nice and relax atmosphere, everything is clean and location is also great. It's about a 10 minutes walk from Dotonbori, but the hostel itself is actually located in a very quiet and relaxed location. The staff was super nice, friendly and helpful. I injured myself late at night and they were so accommodating and did everything to make sure I got proper treatment.Highly recommended!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the staffs are kind and friendly.from public space to your own bed are neat and comfortable.the location of Mitsuwaya is quiet convenient. there are subway station, 7-11, and local shopping street nearby.be honest, i even wanna stay there for a season!!!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is located in a quiet and safe area which is close to the party district (Dotonbori). Getting there was quite easy from the airport. You can easily access 3 different metro stations from the hostel depending on where you’re going in the city.The hostel is extremely clean, the beds/capsules are comfortable (I am 1,86/6feet1 tall) with 4 power sockets, a box where you can keep your valuables, a reading light as well as a curtain for tour privacy.The common area is very nice with books and Lonely Planet in different languages. There is also a rooftop terrace if you want to eat, drink or relax after a long day of sightseeing.Tea and coffee are available for free and a vending machine for the thirsty ones. Free breakfast every morning.I would like to thank the staff. They were amazing, made every single one of us feel welcomed. They were always available to help. I would like to thank Mako for her proficiency in French ! It was great speaking my mother tongue with her and helping her practice in the process.I made friends from all over the world and I would definitely stay at Mitsuwaya on my next trips to Osaka.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From being welcomed to leaving, the staff was so great and friendly to have around. Recommend this place to people who would like to have a good experience with meeting staff and other travellers. Clean, comfortable and they even had a small free breakfast. Could not ask for more. Thank you!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is, without a doubt, the best place to stay in Osaka. From the moment you arrive at the hostel, you are greeted with warm, welcoming and happy faces from those amazing people who work at the hostel. Once you have checked in, you are walked up to your dorm (they also have single sex women dorms if you are travelling as a sole female) and provided with all the essentials - from a toothbrush/paste to towels - you need for a pleasant stay. The dorm we stayed in slept six people, which was absolutely perfect and housed within each capsule bed is a secure safe where you can store any of your possessions. It’s absolutely perfect! Onto the atmosphere. The atmosphere and vibe of the hostel is second to none, and if you are looking to meet lots of different travellers, this hostel is the place for you. As soon as we had checked in, my partner and I were chatting away to the other people who were staying in our dorm, all of who have become lifelong friends. The best part for us, was the common area where all travellers could relax and unwind; this was where the true magic of making friends happened. If you are looking for an outstanding hostel where you can make lifelong friends and be based within walking distance of the main attractions of Osaka including Dotonbori and Osaka Castle, this hostel is the place for you. I can’t recommend this hostel enough, it truly is amazing.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The facility was really clean and fresh, and had a great atmosphere. The staff were really kind and even gave me suggestions on restaurants, cafes, and other places to go.It’s located in a quiet neighborhood so it’s easy to sleep at night. Also, there are many train stations nearby and not too far of a walk from Dotonbori. The roof top terrace was also a nice bonus.Free coffee and tea all day plus free toast in the morning were nice perks.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Probably the best hostel I've stayed at. Staff was extremely nice, and easy to talk to. The place was clean and the beds were comfortable. I loved that you could lock your bag in your capsule.I stayed in the ladies room which was calm and clean. we were only two people in an 8 bed room, so it was very nice!- only minus was the breakfast. Kinda boring. But! the free tea all day was nice.Thank you for a lovely stay! I will definitely come back if I go back to Osaka someday.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were so friendly, and the hostel itself is well-kept and looked after! The room is nice and the amenities like the bathroom are very clean.The hostel is located in a quiet area, but it is within walking distance to the excitement of downtown.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, 10 minutes walk from 3 nearby metro stations. Nice common area and well-equipped kitchen. Rooms and bathrooms are amazing clean.Only downfall is the pillow are way too soft but nevertheless a fantastic hostel!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel was great for my one night stay. It covers the basics but also goes above and beyond in terms of cleanliness and hospitality. The staff was friendly and communicated well. I was pleasantly surprised by how much this hostel feels like a Japanese ryokan. My one suggestion: thicker mattresses.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hostel! Location was perfect and staff were very friendly and helpful. All common areas and dorm rooms were super clean, great showers and free breakie. Altogether it was a very comfortable stay, definitely recommend.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stopped by here for 1 night before heading to Kyoto. Met by the reception with warm welcome. Extremely clean shared bathroom and toilet. Most important of all, the whole place is, despite of the fact it's shared by everyone, odourless. Because I stayed in another hostel in Kyoto so I can compare fairly. I would say the cleanliness is remarkable in this one.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff at the hostel were very warm and welcoming. Place was situated abit further away from stations but area was quiet and serene. The dorm was clean and very comfortable. Overall a wonderful experience, one of the nicer hostel in japan.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I only stayed in Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka for one night but the staff were so incredibly friendly and the hostel was very clean and modern. The complimentary breakfast was a great perk. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a place to stay in Osaka!!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed at Hostel Mitsuwaya for two nights, where we booked two beds in a six bed dorm. This hostel is just straight up gorgeous, pure quality with lots of wood (which also adds a very pleasant smell) - check the photos! It's small and quaint and does not offer very much (e.g. pub crawls or a tea workshop or whatever), but what it offers, it does at an extremely high level. The location is great, Dotonbori/Shinsaibashi (arguably the most interesting area of Osaka) is easily reachable on foot in 15 minutes or less. Facilities are top notch; shampoo, conditioner and shower gel are provided in the showers and there are also hair dryers available next to the sinks in the shower area. A small kitchen (with free tea) is provided for those who prefer to cook their own meals rather than go out. The nooks for the beds, which contain a box for your belongings (I think padlocks can be rented at the reception) and a reading light, provide privacy, and the beds themselves are comfortable. The staff is extremely attentive and friendly, always asking about your day and your next plans, providing suggestions (in fluent English) if needed. You can even rent bikes for a small fee to get around.To summarize: Hostel Mitsuwaya is, without a doubt, a place I will visit again should I return to Japan, and it is among the best hostels I've stayed at over ten years of backpacking.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You are greeted by the friendly staff of Mitsuwaya hostel as you first arrive at the location. Definitely felt like home and will be sure to come back when i visit Osaka again. The place has everything you need and really clean. Staff always available to help out and providing tips on good places to see around the area. Cheers guys!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel was really cute, I loved it's style. The staff was really friendly and they spoke really good English. The place was also really clean. I would say tho, that this hostel is probs better suited for solo travellers or young people rather than a family.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love this little hidden treasure! It's a bit of a walk (only about 10 min) from a subway station, however I love the peaceful neighborhood that it's in. The staff were super friendly and nice, and the hostel was very clean and quiet. It doesn't have an elevator for the upper floors, but the staff will help you carry your luggage if you ask. :) They actually have free breakfast here (tea/coffee and toast) here. Sometimes other hostels advertise free breakfast, but it's not really free. I wish I could have stay a few more days here to check out the local restaurants that were recommended in a little book in their dining area. I would definitely come here again the next time I'm in Osaka! Thanks for the wonderful stay, Hostel Mitsuwaya!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed with my girlfriend. Very nice interiors, with great shared spaces. Staff is always very helpful, ie: when we came it was raining and they quickly brought us towels to dry out. They also hand out good recommendations.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really friendly and helpful staff! They made my stay in Osaka great. Hostel is super clean. Nice showers and they provide free coffee plus bread/jam in the morning. Only complaint would be that the mattress is pretty thin. Could just be my personal preference. Otherwise great stay there and would recommend it!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All staff are friendly and very welcoming. I love this hostel and will definitely stay here again! Its near Dotonbori about 10-14 mins walk just dont get lost if its your first time traveling to Japan!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i was nervous about staying in a hostel but i met wonderful people. close to dontonbori but a little distance away from osaka station. loved the roof top area and the staff were super kind even when i got stressed about getting to the airport. lovely facility, 100% would stay there again.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's the perfect place to stay in Osaka. Convenient location, amazing staff, cozy common space and great amenities like laundry and kitchen.The staff is warm and friendly and always went an extra mile to help. May it be welcoming the guests into the hotel, helping with the directions, transportation or even finding a bookstore in the city. They called the store to make sure they had what I wanted! It was wonderful!They also had booklets with suggestions for food and restaurants. I tried a few of them and they were great! There are travel books on Osaka and on Japan in the common area..I would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great, being a short ways from nipponbashi, amerikamura, namba, and shinasaibashi. Neighborhood is nice, a lot of good restaurants. The beds are nice, interior area is nice and relaxed, a lot of good places to sit and relax in the morning or afternoon. Rooftop area is really nice. Staff is really helpful and generally cool people.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is one of the best hostels I’ve stayed in. It is about 8-10 minutes walk from the Tanimachi 9-chome station. There are other train stations that are a bit farther away but very walkable, which makes this hostel a very good base when exploring Osaka and nearby cities. It is situated in a more quiet part of town but not too far from dotonbori or shinsaibashi (15 mins walk). There are convenience stores nearby and good cafes and restaurants, just ask the front desk! They have very good recommendations. Hostel is very clean. Sleeping area is big enough and offers privacy. Mattress is not so thick, but for me that’s not a problem. There is a small storage area for your valuables (bring your own lock). They have coin operated washing machines, dryers (free detergent). Good sized common area where you can meet other guests. There is free coffee/tea in the kitchen all day, free toast with jam every morning. Most of all, the staff in this place are amazing. They go out of their way to help you and make you feel welcome. Thank you saki, mako and to all staff of Hostel Mitsuwaya. Thank you for the hospitality! We hope to return to Japan and stay with you again. どうもありがとうございました! See ya!Love,Barbara Kellie, Carla, Joana and Jacqueline.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a lovely stay at the Hostel Mitsuwaya.I was greeted very kindly by staff every time I came/went and they helped with navigating and recommendations. The location in my mind is perfect. About a 15min walk from Namba- quiet but with enough local charm (Izakayas, udon, market/mall) to keep my interest. The areas to sleep are roomy. The single bay is bigger than any hostel space I’ve stayed in before. The mattress is thin, but I personally had no issue. A roommate had difficulty with the hardness and hostel staff were able to accommodate her by providing a second foam mattress for extra cushion. I’m not sure if this is a normal occurrence or not. Because it’s further from Namba, it didn’t feel like a “party” hostel. That being said, the common space gives a ton of opportunity to lounge around and meet people (and there is beer in the vending machine) and the roof top patio is quite nice to hang out on. Lastly, the hostel design is gorgeous. With All the basics covered (very clean, feel safe, great staff), I would absolutely recommend staying at the Hostel Mitsuwaya.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel was really nice - clean, nice staff and lovely common area. Beds were nice and private in the dorms. Only thing was that the doors were quite noisy and they also weren’t weighted so that they closed automatically which I didn’t think was very secure since some people in the room would just leave them open.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my stay in there, bunk beds were very spacious and comfortable with big shower blocks. Hostel is very close to Nanba and Osaka station, few minutes by metro. Osaka Castle is walking distance.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
