Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was here for two nights and loved the place. The staff were so nice and helpful, the atmosphere was great, I had everything I needed and felt relaxed being here. This is probably one of the best hostels you can find.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel was very clean and has an excellent location. Showers were hot and strong and the bed space had a lot of privacy if you're the shy type. The staff were incredibly helpful and were willing to go out of their way to help. They could translate Japanese for you and would help you make bookings for places that required you to call (If you can't speak Japanese yourself). All in all, an excellent hostel and would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pro:- Super clean, well secured dorms- Great kitchen area- Showers were hot and strong!- ¥500 Bike Rental!- Great location, it’s a straight walk to the hot spot of town!- Vending machine in the lobby- The rooftop is Devine for morning chill out.- Very homely vibe.- THE STAFF!!Cons:- The wooden floors are very well sanded to the point were I slipped over a few times haha.My story:I stayed here for 3 nights with my buddy Sam and it was a delight! Loved this hostel and all the staff. The staff know Osaka very well and can give you awesome recommendations, they’re also very very eager to help and even go that extra effort to make sure you’re doing well. I was constantly leaving my phone and other items around and the staff knew it was mine and would always return it with a cheeky smile ( ◠‿◠ )! I was super super sick on checkout day and they let me sleep it off in the lobby way past checkout time! Even giving me cold towels for my head and checking up on me when I left.Thank you so much Hostel Mitsuwaya! I’ll never forget the times we had together!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Mitsuwaya is a smaller, boutique hostel that is priced super competatively!The staff are amazingly helpful, the "beds" have plenty of room and there are not too many facilities, so a closer community feeling is easier to establish.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights. The place is modern but has an authentic wooden Japanese vibe. Everywhere felt very homey and warm (hand drawn signage and cute decor).Breakfast was available with an array of tasty jams, coffee also provided.Location was great, 10-15 min walk to Dotonbori for nightlife, and a short distance walk to Train station.The best part of the experience was definitely the staff! They are a group of young individuals who are very friendly, accommodating and treated everyone very well. I would definitely stay here again if I’m in Osaka.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was indeed a great stayover. The personell always geesteswetenschappen us with a warm welcome and are very sociable. It's close too Dotonbori so everything is in reach. Thank you very much and take care! You were great
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in a 6-bed dorm. One thing I like the most is they offer a locker right next to your bed. The room is spacious & super clean. On the ground floor, they have a big common area and plenty shower room & washing machine. Staff speaks good English and nice.I have been to Osaka several times, I would say this is the best hostel I have exp. The location is not close to the subway (10 mins walk required).
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay in Osaka was even more pleasurable because of this hostel. This place is immaculate and feels like home when you walk in through the doors. The hostel's friendly and professional staff would put any five-star hoteliers to shame with their heart-felt and caring concierge service.As for location, it's perfect if you like to take a breather from all the tourists and tourist areas. It's still close enough to many tourist attractions so I walked around everywhere. The major benefit of this, other than saving money on transport, is that you can shed some of that okonomiyaki off. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean and modern...by far the nicest hostel I've been. The sleeping pods were cozy and a first for me. The staff was incredibly personable and helpful which made my stay as a solo traveler very comfortable. One day they grilled up takoyaki after I had mentioned not having any while in Osaka, what a treat! They also had bike rentals and I had an awesome time riding around Osaka Castle and thru the city.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 10 days here and it is one of my favorite stays in Japan. It was clean and extremely comfortable, but that is perhaps not unexpected in Japan. I stayed in the female dorm and had enough space to sit up and move around comfortably in the beds.The real draw is how peaceful the location is and how friendly and warm the staff was. Coming back at the end of the day really felt like coming home to your quiet corner of Osaka. The staff never failed to greet me, ask how things were going and offer help.I will certainly return the next time I'm in Osaka! Keep it up, everyone!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My review is true.The hotel here is very tidy and the staff is kind. And at the end of the day, he can enjoy drinking with his employees, and Jamet can play and talk. It was the happiest trip of my life.From. Kazuki Tokunaga
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved staying in Mitsuwaya. location was good (walking distance to crowded area, but still very local in small street) Staff was so friendly too, were willing to help guest anytime:) very clean, and they had shower room for only women as well.And I loved atmosphere in tanimachi(area that Mitsuwaya located) will stay there when I visit Osaka again!2주 지내는동안 거의 동네에서만 머물렀습니다. 깔끔하고 24시간 라운지 이용한 곳을 찾다가 발견했는데, 나무랄데 없이 좋았습니다. 도톤보리쪽 가깝지만 개인적으로는 스태프에게 추천받아 동네에 있는 식당이나 바 가는것 추천드려요! 동네 안에도 굉장히 많아요. 로컬분위기 느낄 수 있고 한적하게 여행하실 수 있으세요. 강추합니다!また行きたいでーす！みんながいてくれてすごくいい時間になったんです。ありがとう：）
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was super great, the building, new and comfy. Everything was so clean, warm, and hospital that I couldn't really believe it was true. Plus, the "woody" and tatami atmosphere was simply magnificent. Hostels like this are hard to come by, and most hotels cannot compete either. Can't help recommending this place, a safe haven in the middle of the busy Osaka, close to Doutonbori, many Arcades, and subway stops.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is very comfortable, clean and safe. You got a small locker inside your “capsule” and at your bedroom there is a passcode locker, so aside those inside your room nobody is allowed in. I must make a special kudos for the staff, they were very friendly with me and are always giving grit chats, it fells like you are at their home. The hostel is not a 5 rating due to the location. Everything is like 500/700 meters away, including food and subways. However, if you want to cool off and relax, this should be perfect as the neighborhood is quite calm. If at Osaka again I would stay there again.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All in all, a pretty great hostel. I stayed in Osaka for only a couple of days but found Mistuwaya to be pleasant and lovely!Service wise - everything was pretty good. The staff are incredibly nice and helpful. And just great people to talk to. Good wifi here too. You have all the things you expect, at a really good quality - bathrooms, free breakfast, comfortable areas to relax, a good bed etc. So the overall service and features are pretty great.Location - initially while I was researching and Googling this place, the location kind of worried me - but I found this place easy to find and getting to a from many tourist spots is really easy. I would say around 15-20minutes walking. So if you're sceptical about the location for whatever reason - it's pretty good.There's no bar here as I know come with other hostels but it was never really an issue for me.Sleeping was good but I found the room to be a bit compact at times. Not anything thatt bothered me because I only use it for sleeping - but i know this made affect others.I think overall, this is a hostel that gets right all the neccessities such as great staff, clean bathrroms and resting areas, a comfortable bed and etc. And I haven't even mentioned how cool the place looks. It doesn't neccessarily try to do too much. But what you hope for (and then some) is there, and its really great!!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly, the staff at Mitsuwaya are incredibly helpful and lovely! Mitsuwaya is a great hostel to stay in. It's a quick walk from Dotombori and has the comfiest beds and amenities. A must if you're staying in Osaka!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just wanna tell you guys that Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka gets great staffs and clean environment. The Bagpackers from all over the world love to share their experiences and thoughts with all of us. The bad and the WC, shower rooms are great, also.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a great place where I stayed in Osaka... the hostel is so clean and tidy... the staff r so nice, talkative, social and cooperative. they guided us a lot on places to eat, to hang out and to buy things... all their recommendations were useful.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed in a few hostels during my 12days trip in Japan, all these hostels shares the same cleanliness and comfort levels( as far as I can see). What set's Mitsuwaya aside from the rest is their sincere hospitality, staffs are super friendly (Saki I'm talking about u!), they make u feel warm and fuzzy the moment you stepped thru the door. It's also rare to see guests actually talked to each other, you can always hear laughter in the common area where we had fun sharing stories and making friends! I had a blast staying here! And I would definitely recommend them to all my friends and family.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel staffs are great and the staying persons are so friendly. The facilities are simply superb and its an ideal place to stay at low budget. The lighting and air conditioning are so nice. The kitchen facilities are overwhelming.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was very friendly and helpful and there was a very nice shared area. The rooms and showers were clean and free toasts and coffee/tea were available for breakfast. I would definitely return there!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an amazing hostel. So clean, many shower and bathroom facilities and a beautiful terrace on the roof. The commob area has some great beanbags for chilling out. The beds are very roomy and have locker available if you need. The staff were lovely and always very happy to see us. They were very helpful if we ever needed to get somewhere. Thanl you!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located 7-8 min walk from a metro station close to Namba city center in a nice quiet residential area with nearby grocery stores. I was able to watch locals play baseball on Sunday :) beautiful Japanese style design guesthouse, full of natural light, spotless clean, all facilities at hand, many showers (really to be mentioned) and rooftop terrasse. Clever bed separation system and private lock box by each bed. Above all, friendly and helpful staff. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Top notch hostel! The hostel is roughly 15 minutes walk to Dotonbori which makes it very convenient if you want to do an all nighter. The hostel is very clean and its modern, contemporary Japanese design creates a fantastic and welcoming vibe. The layout makes it very easy to socialize with guests. I find that other hostel lacks this type of intimacy. In which hostel Mitsuwaya does an excellent job in.We stayed in a mix 6 bedroom dorm and its layout is very spaceous. Floor space might be a problem, however it makes up for it by providing a bunk layout where you have your own personal space which is very helpful. The bunk beds are twin sized. Very spaceous and does the job.Toilets and showers are clean. No issues there.What made the experience that more pleasant were the staff!! Very friendly and always willing to help. They are also free to have a friendly conversation. Best hostel of staff have ever met!I will definitely come back to the hostel and I strongly recommend this hostel to anyway when visiting Osaka.Special thanks to, Taka, Jay, Hazu, Mako, Akiko, Masa and Saki.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My stay in Mitsuwaya Osaka was a really wonderful experience! All members of staff were kind and helpful; the design and decoration of the house was unique ; the bed was spacious and clean. On my arrival, I made a cup of tea which was provided for free by the hostel and kept staring at the cherry blossoms in front of the window. And surprisingly, there's an awesome night cherry blossoms celebration in the neighborhood.I used one day to Osaka Castle where I saw endless cherry blossoms and another day to Shinsaibashi for shopping and eating. Both of these places were just 15 minutes by walk.In a word, according to my experience, I want to highly recommend Mitsuwaya Osaka to people who wants to see cherry blossoms in Osaka!
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly and impeccably clean. Shared rooms and showers, but reasonably private with large roomy wooden cubicles. Probably a little noise from other people but I slept through it soundly. Conveniently located near lots of subway stops and in an interesting part of Osaka - to one side a number of smaller temples and to the other small shops and bars, some quite hip. Easy to find and lots of llight as it looks onto a schoolyard. No food provided but a kitchen area to eat in or good recommendations for local restaurants and cafes.
hotelName:
7    Hostel Mitsuwaya Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights. Close to Osaka Shinsekai. Dotonburi is about 20 minutes walk. The complimentary smartphone with Google Maps and internet was good. If you join the Hotel WBF loyalty club, which is free then you can use the dining area in the evening with free noodles and sake!
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although the rooms are a little bit small, the accessibility to everything outweighed this disadvantage. It is walking distance to Restaurants, train stations especially the Namba station. I was able to get hold of Vinyl records collectibles managed by very accommodating staff which are always a walking distance from the hotel. The place is clean with good, healthy food on their breakfast buffet
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay in very good location. The room was a good size for Japan, comfy bed . Free wine, sake and ramen when you join the wbf club which is free. Great choice of hair products all for free.15 minute walk to river and all the neon.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly the location is good, a short walk from the subway and only a 15min walk from Dotonbori with all the nightlife, shopping and restaurants.We had a twin room which was quite spacious for a Japanese hotel, but quite basic and budget so don't expect any frills.Breakfast was included but did not have any western options, so enjoy rice and chicken with your coffee and juice. It would benefit from some pastries an a cereal option but it was ok.We made use of the laundry facilities which were cheap and easy to use.Staff very friendly and helpful. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was a bit small but clean and comfortable. The breakfast was simple but quite delicious. Also, it's a hotel with good location and friendly staff. And if you join their membership when check-in, you can enjoy free Ramen & beverage at night.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located on a big street with a subway station, but when arriving from the airport it took us quite a while to walk there from Namba Station. The hotel is about 15 minutes walking from Dotombori so if you're after the Osaka nightlife you should stay closer to that area. Rooms are pretty small with a small bathroom.You can choose from a variety of soaps and shampoos in the lobby to take to the room.The price was the selling point for this place, as no other hotel in Namba could offer the price I got for this one.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel staffs are very kind and considerate. During my first stay in 2018, there is a young Chinese staff even got up at 3:00 the mid-night helping me hail the taxi on the street. Or I won't be able to catch the baseball game. I have a delightful breakfast every day during my stay, totally worth the price. Also, provide delicious Ramen as a midnight snack for free!This was my second time staying in this hotel, but the room is close to the railway. Maybe the sound insulation of rooms near the railway sound be improved. The noise making me hard to sleep. The room is small and you won't have enough space to open your luggage on the floor. To whom it may concern, if you don't mind the space of the room, this hotel provides you a reasonable price and excellent service. And don't choose the room near the railway.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is quite nice but the services are not good enough. The rooms are not cleaned and the smoking area it's a mess. They are kick you out of the restaurant at 11 pm, even if you have your own drinks. The personnel is nice and helpful but they have some stupid rules
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed from 27 Feb to 1st March. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated with art. Fantastic lounge that has free ramen tasting from and free beverages. This is the second time I stayed at WBF. Would stay again.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very small, but sufficient room with tea cattle, Macha tea and all very good toiletteries. Comfy slippers and pjs, 1 big and 2 small towels pp, but only 1 pillow pp, not very comfy if you want to sit in bed and watch TV. Great perks for the members (and you can easily become one upon check-in) you are granted an access to restaurant area with free coffee /tea/white and red wine/water and sake. Between 21 and 22 you can order ramen as well for free, but don't expect normal size portion though, still better than nothing (which is what other hotels offer). I think it is also a nice touch that they have real size shaving foam in the bathroom, so men don't need to bring their own. Great veriety of the shampoo/conditioner that you can borrow at the lobby. Well now that I'm a member will definitely stay here again
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is just a block away from station and just 1 to 3 stations to owl cafes, world spa and Dotombori. Very convenient location. Room is small but has the usual amenities. Lightning is good. Bed is clean and comfy but pillow is small. Hotel provides free flow of coffee/ tea/ wine in the very nice breakfast area and also free session of kimono trial event on a certain day (Thursday).
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and comfortable to stay. The staff is helpful though could not speak straight English. There were a lot of variety of shampoo and conditioner that you could choose to use and the overall experience is good.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel on an interesting looking street in what’s known as “Den Den Town”. Room is small (usual for Japan) but well designed. Comfy bed and quiet for the 2 nights we stayed. The free ramen/wine/coffee/tea from 3pm each day is great and there’s a useful 7-eleven convenience store across the road. The hotel also gives you a phone to use which is really useful for finding your way around Osaka. It’s well located for public transport - we walked from Namba Station which can be accessed using the JR Rail Pass.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for two nights.5-10mins from Nama and Doronburi. Close to nearest tube (mins). Clean though room v small. Good internet. free drinks in evening and ramen 9-10pm. All round comfortable stay. Would recommend to anyone wanting a good value stay in a fun part of town.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent service, hotel staffs are very helpful and nice, perfect location, convenient shops and restaurants near by. You can just walk for 2 minutes to reach 7 eleven which is opposite of hotel. You can walk for about 15-20 minutes to Doronbori to explore fashionable shops. I like this hotel and the environment. I will visit again for my next trip to Osaka.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walkable location to JR station around 10 minute and 5 minutes to subway. Service is good and caring, hotel will provide free tea and coffe, red and white wine for free from 1500 to 2300. The rooms are reasonable size and you can make calls and browse internet for free from mobile device
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is small as usual in Japan but is very clean. The staff is polite and helpful. The location is excellent and is within the walking distance to Namba. Plenty of restaurants and shopping opportunities are just around the corner. They offer free tea, coffee and wine in the afternoon. Worth recommanding!
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment I walked into the reception, I had the sinking feeling that the hotel was not going to be good value for the money, and I was proven right.Perhaps I am picky, but the room was incredibly small and the toilet had not been cleaned -there were hairs in the shower and the basin. This is a rarity in Japan - a country renowned for its cleanliness, and it is a disappointment.Service was average, nothing memorable. Lounge-restaurant area feels right out of a backpackers' hostel, and does not feel commensurate to the price point of the property. Property seems understaffed as well.Maybe the hotel fills a market niche, but I will not return. There are better places in Osaka for the same amount of money.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So glad we chose this hotel. It was within walking distance of everything we wanted to see with the exception of the castle but the metro is just out the door. The room is smallish as is usual in Japan. We had twin beds which were clean and comfortable. The bathroom works very well and has a nice deep tub. A bonus after walking in this heat all day.Everything was spotless and worked. The staff friendly and polite. The AC works. Dont buy breakfast get it at the 7/11 across the road.You get to choose your shower gel.and shampoo in the foyer and theres free wine tea etc in the afternoon.Really happy with this choice.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The toom was big in comparison to other hotel rooms in Japan I have visited in. The bed are comfortable.Although the stuff does not really speak English they were extremely nice and willing to help in everything we needed. We stayed there 4 nights, the room was set (with beds, sheets and new towels )every day, but only was vacuumed on the last day. Our room had no mirror, just a small one in the shower.Overall it's a good hotel, about 15 min walk from a JR station and 3 min walk from a subway station.There are 24h shops all around.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I searched the good hotel in osaka more than 2 weeks, and one of my friend recommend this hotel for me.This hotel has so many advantages, but I'll only write some of them.First of all, this hotel provides perfect breakfast. They provide rice and some traditional japanese foods with high quality, and some breads and salads. I've visited many other hotels around the world, and I can guarantee that this hotel is the best hotel i'vr ever been.Second, they provide free wine, coffee and tea during the day time. They open the cafeteria from 3 to 11 so that the tourists can come down to cafeteria and get some rest. Also the quality of coffee, wine and tea is perfect.Thrid, they provide free shampoo and conditioners and body washers, which are pretty expensive if you buy them outside. It's all free. And they also provide one of my favorite sampoos. Believe me, this hotel provide you with all the best.Lastly, the staffs can speak Korean and english. I had no problem during my stay. They always provide the best things to me. I HAD PERFECT MEMORIES IN HERE. I STRONLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ALL THE PEOPLE WHO VISIT OSAKA!!!오시카를 방문하는 여러분!! 이 호텔은 제가 여행하면서 다닌 수많은 호텔중 가장 만족스러운 호텔입니다. 조식도 간단하게 빵만 주는 것이 아니라, 일본식 커리, 오믈렛, 샐러드(각종 과일과 아보카도가 들어간!!!)가 나옵니다. 오후 3시부터 11시까지는 무료 와인 커피 차가 제공되서, 여행하다가 잠깐 들려서 한두잔씩 마시기 좋습니다. 또한 여기있는 직원분들 대부분이 한국말이 가능해서, 제가 여기있는동안 모든 어려움을 해결해주셨습니다. 오사카에 방문한다면 이 호텔에서 꼭 지내세요!!
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right in between 2 main attraction shinsekai and dontoburi. Walking distance to both the locations. Less than 5 minutes walk to the nearest metro station Ebisucho Station. The hotel room is also very clean and quite comfortable although its a bit small.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a nice hotel, with all comfort. The room it is small but you will find everything. Almost 13 minutes by walk far from the subway and 15 minutes from the center! For budget people it would be a nice option.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located off Dotonbori which was nice because it's not that noisy. Plus, Dotonbori was only a 15 min walk! Kuromon Market was 7 mins walk and the nearest station (Ebisucho Station,exit 1-A) was 4 mins walk. Getting around the famous landmarks was easy too. If you want to bike , you can rent 1 for free for 3 hours from the hotel. Breakfast comes in heavy and light from curry rice , English breakfast and a salad bar. The best thing was the free flow of wine, coffee and tea from 3pm- 11pm . Room was comfortable but would not recommend if you 're bringing 2 big luggages. My friend and I actually fit 2 small luggages and with our shopping , the walking space was just right for us.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has rooms all with art done by children whose parents suffer from AIDS, an interesting concept and impressive how they managed to paint all the rooms. The cleanliness is ok in general, beds are clean but the floor not, and in the room there is always a weird smell as well as in the corridors, reminding of cleaning chemical used a bit too much.Also they change your bed sheets every day which is a waste of resources and not environmentally friendly. When they tidied our room they threw away some of my plastic bags that I needed to transport stuff so I really would appreciate if that the staff don’t just assume what lies on the ground is garbage.Overall 7/10
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is new and clean, room is big enough to put 2 luggages. It serves free hot and cold drink since 3pm to 11pm at restaurant.  The location is not very near to Namba station, the nearest is ebishuo. It takes around 5-10 minutes to reach Namba station, but it’s near to kuromon market, we had breakfast there every morning. Also it is near to shinsekai, which is best to visit during evening. The best part is this area surrounded by comics, game and toy stores.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was too small but everything needed is provided. Tea session is a bonus, with unlimited free red wine, white wine and coffee provided from 3-11pm. Location is great - just 2 mins walk to metro station and 5 mins walk to countless famous and traditional restaurants.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great hotel in a convenient location. If you like Japanese toys and comics this is a great place to stay. It has a nice lounge with free drinks which is nice for the long walks around japan as you can fill up your water here.Overall a good place to stay.Keep up the good work!
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recommend this hotel if you come to Osaka! it is near to shinseikai, and Ebicho subway. Very convenience. Opposite there is a seven eleven. Nearby has plenty restaurant. Like the design of the hotel very much!
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, near subway. There are convenience stores and restaurants nearby. Hotel is obviously new and very clean. Basic toiletries are provided. Staff is very helpful. Unable to check in early but they let us leave our luggage.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pro:Nice new room. Very friendly and helpfull staff!Free tea, coffe and wine ! each night 15:00 - 23:00Con:Quite some noise from other guests and the cityRoom advertised as city view but was "no view".
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel, looks really chic and modern and the art paintings in the room add a nice retro touch. Receptionist was very helpful and kind and even allowed us to check in early - you can sign up for free membership and there are some perks that come with it. Location-wise the place is near Den Den Town and Namba station and only 10 minutes walk to the main shopping district. Beds are nice and comfortable and feels great to sleep in. The toilets are clean and well stocked with towels and shampoo. All in all a really nice setup!
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Found it hard to find a twin bedded room for our stay in Osaka, but found this hotel and had some favourable reviews and it was in our price range. As we usually only end up sleeping in the room, no point spending too much!Pleasantly suprised to find it's virtually new, and hence clean. Wifi is excellent, great spot just a few doors down from a subway station. Cheap breakfast available at the ground floor breakfast room (they only do breakfasts about, basic but sufficient buffet and befitting the price. Walkable to Namba.Smack bang in the middle of the gadget, gaming, collectible toy/models, retro vinyl records, shopping precint. Very happy. Would highly recommend.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked 2 rooms and arrived late in the night, also because their location on Google Maps was not correct so we went 3x around the block with the taxi driver till I finally spotted it... Staff at reception were flexible with payment on checkin, which was nice. Rooms were clean and simple, just what we needed as a base while we explored town. Their breakfast is very basic and their not flexible on timing: breakfast ends at 1000 and you have to be in at 0930 to have breakfast (very early in my opinion); laundry machines useful, the portable wifi rental and 7 Eleven across the street very convenient. Great central location. Check-out time is 1000 and they charged 1000 yen per hour after that. For someone who spent 14 nights there was little flexibility by reception.
hotelName:
8    Hotel WBF ARTSTAY Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my family for 3 nights. Hotel situated 10 min drive from Osaka station. The hotel has a fantastic to & fro free shuttle service to the Osaka station. The staff at the front desk is extremely cordial & helpful. Room size is big. We got a room which had 4 comfortable beds, and a seperate living area. Bathroom is good, with good toiletries and good quality bath linen.Breakfast is not the best and very less options for vegans and vegetarians. The biggest minus point about this hotel is that the usage of pool and the gym is not free and is exorbitantly priced. Where in the world is this facility charged for ?Overall a good stay except the pool & gym was chargeable.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: o The rooms are pretty large by Japanese standard and offered all amenities a traveller expects in a 5 star hotel. However the interior/decoration of the room does not really make you feel home or cosy. o The bathroom is interesting as it comes with a pretty short bath tub (normal in Japan) and a “6 star toilet” with a heated seat, water jets etc. (often found in Japanese hotels). o Special: the hotel offers a free smart phone which is located in your room. This allows free calls and internet use!o The hotel is very far away from Kansai airport. It takes 1 hour drive early in the morning to reach the airport. The taxi to the airport therefore is costly and was 13.000 yen (107,-- Euro)o I had breakfast and dinner in the hotel. Both were offered as a buffet and tasted good with a relatively wide variety. The price was not cheap but within the price range which is to be expected for such a breakfast/dinner in Japan. o The staff was very friendly and helpfulo Check in is at 3 p.m. only. I could get into my room at 11.00 a.m. but had to pay an “early check in fee” of 4.700 yen (approx. 38,-- Euros). This I find ridiculous bcs. I pay the room for 24 hours but I am allowed to use the room only 21 hours. I informed the receptionist of my even shorter stay of 15 hours only (calculated from 3.00 p.m. to 6.00 a.m. the next morning), but he still charged the “early check in fee”. In this regard the hotel staff is flexible like a railway track and did not make me happy at all (to express it in a very, very polite way!!). I will not stay in this hotel again!
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I revisited the hotel after 6 years . Had stayed earlier in 2005 and in 2013. This time I opted for a room in their west wing. The rooms are bigger , brighter with the bath room split in two. The left facing bathroom was a complete loo except the bathtub. The right facing loo had the bathtub and the washbasin console. Different from the usual rooms. In the room we were only given tea satchets(green tea , roast tea and kelp plum tea-more like a clear soup). There were no options for coffee & cream/milk satchets. I had to buy it from the nearby grocery store. The lobby of the hotel is always busy. The restaurant for breakfast is usually full between 7:30 am to 8:30 am and needs increase in capacity. The location of the hotel is perfect with close proximity to the Osaka downtown and station area. There is a shuttle service from the hotel to Osaka station regularly. The grocery stores Seven Eleven and Family mart are about 100 metres from the hotel for grocery requirement. Thereis a fancy shopping centre in the basement of the hotel selling upmarket clother primarily for females.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice hotel with shuttle to osaka staion. You can get an airport limousine bus to osaka station and hotel pick up is outside starbucks. Staff are very helpful and speak good english and other languages. Wouldnt recommend any of the restaurants for the budget conscious. But lovely food places at the station you can get cheap food. The bakery, Melissa, is fantastic and cheap to buy a pastry or 3 for breakfast. Recommend for couples rather than familys. Lovely toiletries. Reasonable sized rooms and bathrooms. Would stay again.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very average hotel. Not good value for money. The lobby and outside of the building are beautiful but the actual room was dated and very average. The most disappointing aspect of this hotel is that even if you are hotel guest, you must pay 3,200 yen (~$30USD) per use of the pool and over 6,000 yen (~$60USD) per use of the gym. Ridiculous and a total rip off. I have never heard of a hotel charge for standard amenities like pool and gym. I would not recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this is a great hotel, the rooms are fine, very clean. En suites are quite big for Japanese hotels. Breakfasts are very good and there is plenty of choice. There is a fitness room and pool there. I took advantage of the bus to Osaka train station, it runs about every 10 minutes and it is very prompt, you can catch the return from the station easily. So I travel to Osaka in future i will try to stay there again
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this Hotel for 3 nights in a single room. The Hotel is located centrally very close to the Subway. The staff is very polite but not friendly (exception was the lady who carried my baggage to the room, she was also friendly). The room had a good size, was clean and had a comfy bed, it met my expectations to a hotel in this price range.Breakfast is good and there are a lot of options, western and Asian style.The hotel has a gym for which they charge more then 6k per use. This is an absolute no go. I used Gold’s Gym a few streets away for 23k.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a quite spacious room, which is not typical when you stay in Japan hotels. Excellent services and they also provide a shuttle bus to Osaka Station, which is very convenient. Decent shops and 7-eleven also located on the lowest floor. All in all, it is a great hotel to stay when you visit Osaka.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unless your a chain smoker with a taste for 80s renovated hotels don't waste your money on this one - it's awful! I haven't stayed in anything this bad ever. The smell of smoke is everywhere, and of course enters your room via the out of date centralised ventilation system - I spent three nights and regretted the high expense and the fact that the best thing about the room was the free fabric spray!
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The good news: fantastic pool and spa (though you pay extra), delicious food, friendly staff, convenient if you're attending a conference at the conference center.The bad news: I booked a single room, which was not much bigger than the bed. I then payed extra for an "upgrade" to a room that would be considered standard anywhere else. The bed was overly firm. It feels a little dated; updates and renovations are needed
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean and comfortable bed. There was a nice little work desk. Two separate bathrooms, one with shower and toilet, the other with bath tub. Welcoming staff. In addition to hairdresser, bridal services and restaurants it was also a convenient store in the basement.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I needed a hotel last minute and found this one online. The price was right and the location was near where I needed to be for a business meeting the next day.Upon arrival I was greeted by the doorman who handed me off to a Front Desk rep who took my luggage. There was a mixup with my reservation from my travel agent, however, the staff worked with me to quickly resolve the issue.My room was on the 'Natural Comfort' floor and had a king sized bed, a good view and every amenity one could possibly imagine.I enjoyed my stay there and would go back again.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here because it was recommended and has good reviews. This hotel is in a great location and has a shuttle to the JR Osaka station. There is also the option to walk a lot of places safely. The staff was very friendly and the concierge staff especially Alice Nakamura and Kenji Yamato were very knowledgeable Both gave maps on where we should go, things we should do in the varied surrounding cities and even specific trains to get on and the stops to get off. Our stay was awesome and this hotel had a lot to making sure of it. I did not give it 5 stars because WiFI was not good. Unable to remain connected and moved very slow when connected. The room was just big enough for 2 people, we stayed in the twin bed room; if u have a lot of luggage it may be too small for you.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tricky one this as there was nothing inherently wrong with this hotel. But I'd paid more than for the other half dozen on my trip and it wasn't worth the extra. Staff were helpful with local information and very polite. But check in was way, way too slow. Okay so it is a huge hotel but don't tell everyone to check in at the same time. I waited longer to check in here than the other 9 stops on my trip put together. At least on check out as I'd already paid i didn't have to queue. The room was disappointing too but as I was only staying one night it wasn't a problem. Be nice to see some reference on the hotels.com site to the shuttle bus to Osaka station, if it is there it isn't obvious!
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, good bathroom, OK view of river, courteous staff but nowhere to put suitcases in tiny room. No lounge for guests to sit and discuss strategy for business presentation without paying for expensive drinks. So went to Cellar Bar. Old fashioned. Bill for 3 drinks and 6 olives, 4 tiny slivers of cheese 57000 yen!! Outrageous.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking into having a nice bed to have your beauty sleep, this is definitely the hotel to opt for. Although the location is not strategically within walking distance from major train station, but the shuttle bus transit turn out to be just fine! The room we gotten have 2 bathroom (1 bathtub and 1 shower) . If it wasn’t for the extract bed, the room would be very spacious. It is a big hotel, they have grand lobby, arcades (include 7-11) on the basement floor, a swimming club in another tower and few nice restaurants. Their lounge is another perfect place to hang around too especially in the morning when they served some small breads and yogurts. They even have a massage chair for you to relax! I would definitely come back if I ever visit Osaka. Sometimes quality hotel makes a lot of difference in our journey. How many of us do remember the hotel that we stayed so clearly that makes you wanted to go back or even to recommend? I think RIHGA deserve my vote! The photos explained everything! Enjoyed!
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were unfortunate enough to experience the quake yesterday. The whole building seemed to move in circle. We were up on the 7th floor. The hotel doesnt seem prepared for this kind of thing— considering that earthquake is something that happens frequently in Japan. The announcement was made in japanese about the earthquake.. which i failed to understand. For someone coming from a place where such earthquake never happen... i was really shocked and panicked. We called the front desk. Our call was answered by someone who sounded really worried too .. which made us even more worried. We asked about the possiblity of another earthquake.. she cant answer. I asked what should we do.. she sajd.. will get back to us later. After a whileShe called back n told us to go down to the lobby. We went down quickly by the stairs. There were puddles of water. In the midst of all that, i have to compliment one of the hotel staff.. Ms. Buell.. she explained things clearly, helped us with our questions and what should we do next. She made us feel less worried. So we were able to catch a taxi and then shinkansen to tokyo thanks to her aid. Improvements should be made for such hotel with many foreign visitors and they should be more prepared should such thing happen again
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don’t know whether it applies to the entire hotel but we were pleasantly surprised that our room at the west wing smelled and looked brand new.. you could tell that everything has been refurbished - the carpet, furniture, bath tub etc. the rest of the hotel did look a tad old fashioned so the room definitely stood out. I didn’t give this hotel full marks because i am not a big fan of the location - I prefer to stay at our previous hotel in the Namba area
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Rihga Royal is a very good mid-range hotel to stay in Osaka, it is a well appointed older style hotel that meets all needs and some. Room was good and spacious (#9956), the bed extremely comfortable. The breakfast was great with a large range to choose from. There is a free hotel shuttle bus from Osaka Rail station and back which is great. The rate was good and I can happily recommend the Rihga Royal.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a short trip to Osaka. I booked a superior room as I wanted breakfast included. The lobby to these rooms were at the 23rd floor. Everything in the room was precisely prepared. Tea, food and beverages were served at the 23rd floor club including drinks after 5 PM. One recommendation can be the changing of the ground carpet at the main lobby. This was a good stay at the city center.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rihga was a quite pleasant stay. The free shuttle from Osaka station to and from the hotel was really good.The hotel is massive and contains a mini mall within it along with convenience stores, bakeries and much more.Rooms are a decent size and staff are very friendly. It seems to be a very well organised hotel.A negative is the pool and sauna facilities are not included for guests and have a daily fee which is over 3000 yen. This was quite a surprise as the pools were not that great by any means.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got in about an hour before the check-in time but the front desk lady told us she would help us get a room right away and also upgraded to the a suite! When you step in the room, there is a small foyer, bathroom to the right and the bedroom suite to the left. The concierge got us a map to the local areas and after having dinner, we came back to the suite. It was so quiet, you could hear a pin drop. Needless to say, we slept like a baby! Luxury hotel with outstanding customer service! We shall be back again.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visit Japan last February 2018,, from tokyo to osaka using Shinkansen ,, then stayed at Rihga Royal hotel ,, love this hotel,, lobby hotel are so big,, comfy lounge ,, room hotel are ao big too,, the amenities bathroom complete,, and have bathtub too . They also have handy phone free during our stay .They served two kinds of breakfast,, japanese style or ala carte . This hotel have luxury shopping place too,, nice place
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a huge size hotel. I chose it because it was fairly priced among the 5* hotels of the city. Reality is, this is an outdated hotel that is in great need for some updates to be at the standards of international hotels.For the price I paid, more than 160USD, I expected better on the size of the room and bed. Though I knew I booked what they call a "small double bed".There is a free shuttle bus that takes you to the train station, which is quite convenient.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable beds, fast internet, quick check in/out.Since it was winter heating was on. The room was quite warm, so I wanted some fresh air. That’s when I discovered that the ventilation system only churned out hot air and could not be turned to supply cool fresh air.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a massive hotel. Older style but still good. We were given a smoking room first and after requesting a non smoking room all was fine. We had 4 beds and a separate toilet and bathroom which worked well. There is a bar fridge. The bathrooms are really well stocked with everything you can imagine. There is a shuttle (free) bus that runs every 6 mins from the train station. There are always weddings and conferences on. We treated ourselves to the afternoon tea which was a nice experience. The breakfast had a good array of western and Japanese style food. Lots of expensive designer shops. A great bakery and even a 7/11 store in the basement.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From Osaka Station, we caught Rhiga's free shuttle to the hotel (Shuttles are at the station every 6-10 minutes or so.) We were dropped off by the main lobby and greeted by a dude in a top hat (Classy lol.) Check in was easy, and we even had someone escort us to our room (her name was Allison, and she was awesome..) Allison showed us everything we needed and answered all of our questions. The suite was very clean, and we had a great view of the river. It included your basic necessities: Soap, shampoo, face wash, lotion, razors, shower caps, toothbrushes, and toothpaste. In the basement level, there's shops and a 7-11 which was great for reloading our ICOCA cards. They also have restaurants and 24/7 room service. Rhiga also offered free shuttle service to Universal Studios, (you have to RSVP for this. We took the first one out at 730a. There are other times you could pick from.) Overall, great experience!
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At rhiga royal, expect to get royal treatment. They have beautiful staff and they treat you really well. Its located in quite upscale locality. Room and amenities are very modern. Only problem we found was room size, it’s just too small to trigger claustrophobia. Am taking out 2 stars just for room size. Please check room size before booking, if you could getting decent room size Rhiga royal is excellent option.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Rhiga Royal hotel is certainly not the worst place you can stay in Osaka. Average, however really seems to say it all.In terms of pros and cons:- outdated and old interior, carpets, floorings - average location, quite central but not best location- friendly staff- mass tourism oriented but not yet overcrowded- price-performance average - however that is a tricky thing in Osaka these days. Way to few good hotel rooms and the number of visitors exploding
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room at this luxurious hotel was spacious with 2 wash areas for family of 3. Room was well lit and had numerous USB ports. Bathroom fittings looked new . The conceige was extremely helpful with suggestions of where and how to go; Mr Yamatomo even printed a brochure for KokoEn garden in colour for us.Frequent shuttle buses to Osaka station, 10:00 to 21:00: every 6 minutes, 7:45 to 10:00 and 21:00 to 22:15 : every 15 minutes. The journey takes about 10 minutes : we found it worthwhile staying in this hotel than one near Osaka station because of the spacious room. Would return to this hotel on our next visit.If you are a non-smoker, specify a non-smoking room : the passage way can reek of cigarette smoke.Our family of 3 stayed for 2 nights in late Sep
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This seems like a great hotel from the lobby. However the room is very disappointing. It was small and outdated, with not a good view. The price was not modest for what you get. I am sure there are better option in Osaka.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for two nights during a week in Osaka. (Not consecutive nights) with a special room rate. Excellent hotel, comfy beds and superb staff. Disappointed that I was unable to arrange an earlier check in than 3pm
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has a grand entry / lobby but the room we had (c wing) was old and needed an update. A small room with a small double bed one side table and no room for your bags. Needs an update. Staff were helpful and the shuttle bus was great to get you in and out as it is a little remote. We booked it as it had a gym only to find the gym does not open till 11.00am and the pool at 10.00 am. Not acceptable to us. Overall just ok.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In Japan, the name of the hotel is quite known as the Imperial family used to stay at this hotel. However, compared to the many international hotels, the staff are not trained nor attentive enough to please global travelers.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The RIHGA Royal Hotel is an upper-level hotel characterized by friendly service and its location on Nakanoshima (island) in central Osaka. The location is, well... complicated, for several reasons. It's not really close to anything of the note (besides the Convention Center), and although Nakanoshima station, a private rail line, is nearby, it's not the most useful public transportation in Osaka - certainly not as convenient as being close to the metro, which is about a 15-20 minute walk off of the island. If this type of thing doesn't matter for you, this is a better choice. The atmosphere does feel a little more like a business hotel, although I did see a fair amount of families. The neighborhood is prettier at night. There is a handy free shuttle bus that makes the 20-25 minutes drive from JR Osaka Station to the hotel. You should save a map of the pick-up location, as JR Osaka Station is pretty expansive and could be confusing for a first-timer. Once I arrived, the friendly staff quickly greeted me; check-in went smoothly and I had no issues communicating with the front desk. There appeared to be many international guests in the modern, spacious lobby. There are a plethora of shops inside the complex, and they all looked expensive. I found an online deal for my room, which I suspect contributed to it not being too large, but it was comfortable and clean nonetheless. The free wifi worked ok, and the TV wasn't very big, but acceptable. I had a double bed I believe, and I slept alright. The bathroom is the typical standard sized Japanese affair, which was good enough, and the amount of sink space wasn't bad. The housekeeping seemed fine, and the staff responded pretty quickly when I requested an ironing board and iron. Checking out on the last day went without a hitch. Overall, this is a good hotel; due to the location, next time I would probably stay at a hotel closer to the metro, but you could certainly do worse than this place.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed in this hotel over 50 times over the years. It was the premier hotel in Osaka until the Ritz and Westin opened. Well, they are back on top. No service equals this hotel, the restaurants too numerous to mention, the rooms in the tower are very large, modern decor yet comfortable. The lobby is fantastic with a stream running thru it. Highly recommend. Will hold its own with any hotel in Asia that is 5 star
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying here at my last night in Japan..at the beginning of May...Situated in the heart of Osaka..This luxurious hotel is kind of modern n nice hotel ..I saw it more as a business hotel...Luxurious lobby, many elevator n lift..Spacious, clean n modern roomBoutique n luxurious shops at the basement...Few. Chainstores...N the staff very warm and helpful..What special for me was the breakfast..A very large variety of food.. asian, japanese, western menuwith great taste!!..And it takes only few minutes from here to many popular tourist destination such as Osaka castle, Shinsaibashi shopping arcade, hard Rock Cafe, etc..Very recommended!!Would definitely go back
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We laughed about it after approximately the 10th time we were told "No."This is a hotel geared toward Japanese businessmen with large expense accounts.Definitely NOT FOR FAMILIES.Do not bother trying to let children of any age use the pool. First, at check-in, the manager informed us that "run-of-the-house" did not include the pool. Later, when I asked the kid at the desk to show me the pool he said, "NO." Just "No." I asked why not, he said there are no windows. Then he showed me a floor plan of the pool. No problem. Just walk me in. "No." Why not? Only pool wear allowed. I went to my room, changed into pool attire, and returned. I said, "Show me the pool, please." He huffed and told someone else to show me the pool.Later, I returned with my kids (in pool attire) and offered to pay the approximately US$30 each for them to use the pool. He said "No." Why not? They're not old enough. I showed him the same floor plan with rules which clearly stated that my kids were okay to use the pool. He reluctantly let me pay the ridiculous fee to use the pool.Again, he reluctantly allowed my kids to access the pool. My wife suggested we use the nearby spa to get a massage and relax. It was a good idea.Later, we called the front desk to make reservations for dinner at the nearby Italian restaurant. They called back and -- you guessed it, said No.At this point it was a running joke, so we we walked to the restaurant, were told that they had tables available, and enjoyed a most wonderful meal.The reason they get 3 stars is because the room was very spacious and the bell staff were excellent.Don't expect a nice family place.I will post my review of the AMAZING restaurant separately.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service is excellent, lots of restaurants and food options, great garden, large rooms, fantastic shower!!. free shuttle bus to the Japan Rail train station. We had an easy walk along the river through a great rose garden walk to the Osaka Castle, we also walked into the city centre from the Hotel.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel with a nostalgic old world charm, and quite well maintained. Reminded us of the grand old hotels we visited as children. Comfortable spacious rooms, helpful and courteous staff, lovely quiet neighborhood along the river. Though the hotel is not very close most tourist spots, the frequent shuttle service to the station was a huge bonus. many stores and a 7Eleven in the basement was nice too.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is not particularly well located in Osaka. That said, a train does run to it (but the last stop) and the hotel does provide a very regular and convenient shuttle to Osaka Station.The hotel is stuffed full of restaurants and shops, so one could spend time there, but we ate at cheaper places downtown.The room was small - we knew it would be when we booked - but still comfortable. Would have like a couple more pillows and some coffee in the room, but it was clean and comfortable.Rihga hotels are usually well-priced and have a high quality feel to them, and this one in Osaka fits that. Plush in the lobby, bars and restaurants. We only tried the bar and it was okay, although pricey and allowed smoking, including cigars.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow! This old school Hotel in Osaka is simply wonderful. There are shops of every description, more places to eat that anyone could want, and some truly delightful taverns as well. My Bride and I wandered down to the Cellar Bar for a night cap last night and found ourselves surrounded in a delightful Old English Club atmosphere featuring a piano bar. The prices were quite reasonable. We are planning a wedding here in June so we spent most of yesterday arranging everything from rental Kimonos to western clothing, flowers, meals, invitations, the whole thing in one place.The all day restaurant Remone offers set meals or buffet style meals. You can purchase breakfast coupons very reasonably, The in-house bakery is top notch, two florists, and you can even purchase your new Bentley or Rolls Royce in house if you like. All-in-all this is a wonderful place to stay. The staff is friendly, it is easy to find english speaking staff, or most any language for that matter.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I liked the room I was given. It was spacious compared to one you will get in most Tokyo hotels. I liked the interiors though I must say the t&b was a little dated with the. 4-inch square wall tiles, shower curtain and all. It was clean though.The breakfast buffet was sprawled in a large area with pockets of dining sections . One was even separated by a bridge and was surrounded by a pond. I think the sectioned dinner plate-trays were cute.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having staff speaking solid English that we're happy to make calls for me and get travel plans sorted was impressive. Entrance is beautiful with a lovely waterfall to relax by. Room was fine and nothing special at the rate. The hotel is attached to the convention center so often have massive groups. Note shuttle to JR is also available.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For the price and the title of the hotel, do not expect to be staying in a royal hotel. Ventilation is bad- we came in winter time and the room felt like it was summer. The aircon is actually a heater and the dehumidifier does not do the job. The room is very very outdated and unclean. I found numerous hairs on the floor and even in the bathroom (the short kind!!!) if you plan to take a hot shower or bath, be prepared to feel like your in the sauna as there's no fan. The carpet is rolling up in places, the flat screen is tiny, and the internet constantly drops out. The only saving grace was the staff. If you want something for the year 2017, go elsewhere!
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came to Osaka for a conference and chose the RIHGA primarily for its proximity to the convention center. Room was average-sized but comfortable, so I can't really complain on that front. It's a little warm inside but we found that to be the case all over Japan so just cracked the window the let some air in and humidity out. The taxi stand outside makes for easy transport to various places. The Keihan railway Nakanoshima station is also right outside if you want to negotiate the Osaka subway system—we walked most places.Breakfast buffet is really good but also really expensive (~$50 for two people), so we opted most days to just grab things from joints in the area. They also did our laundry for us and the rate was quite reasonable.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was a little disappointed by the atmosphere of the hotel. Really small rooms and the overall impression is not modern to me. Old 90's style with carpets everywhere. Also the breakfast was generally average.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been in this hotel for work , and i had a seminar in the congress, nice place in fronte of the river, with a good view, i get a dinner in one of the many japenese restaurant in the gallery.The Subway is close the hotel, so will be very easy, visit the city Good service, and clean room
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is by far the best hotel I've stayed at in Osaka. The room was big and comfortable. There's even background music in the room. Clean big super King sized bed with beautiful view at the window. I was most impressed with the laundry service. They were efficient and detail oriented. The wifi was strong and straightforward to log in. Only improvement I guess is that the pillows could have been more firm. All the pillows sank in as soon as we slept on it..Also, the location was mediocre. It is right next to a subway station but you'd have to change a train from Shin-Osaka Station if you came by Shinkansen. Getting around RIHGA is easier by car or taxi if it is nearby. Namba is a 15-20min taxi ride away and should cost you no more than 1600¥. Hotel is great for family holiday and business travelers. Very comfortable stay throughout.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Early check in at noon – ¥8,460 (Over $80.00) was not advised there would be an early check in charge. I arrived from the airport and was told “your room is ready” no extra charge was mentioned, If I had been advised of the charge I would have declined, ¥8,460 is overpriced for a couple hours wait for a regular check in time. This is completely unacceptable.Check out: I was advised by my group organizers I could stay in the room until the time the car came to take me to the airport, 7:30 pm. I made my way to the lobby only to be told my bill would be paid by someone else. I did some checking and confirmed with my group the hotel bill was my responsibility and NOT someone from the group. It seems there was some miscommunication. Finally only at about 7:30 while my car was waiting in front, I was able to convince the front desk staff I was responsible for my bill, not the group. When I saw the bill I was outraged at the early check in charge and the FULL NIGHT charge ¥42,120 for late checkout on Sunday the 18th, neither of which I expected NOR was I directly advised of by the hotel staff. These 2 EXTRA charges were over $500 USD nearly 1/3 of my total stay for 4 nights. This is completely unacceptable. BTW- Weekend rate Sat & Sun nights was nearly 2X the weekday rate.I went to Tokyo that night and had to pay another night hotel in Tokyo, so paid for 2 nights hotel Sunday the 18th.Upon paying I was advised by the staff that after 6pm checkout was a full nights charge. Well had I known I would have and could have been in the lobby to check out at 6 pm no problem! I had packed at noon and I was back in the room 100% ready to go at 6pm just waiting for 7 because the car was coming at 7:30. The point is for a simple miscommunication of the late checkout time and missed by 1 hour, the penalty should not be 1 night stay at over ¥42,000, ($420.00) this is ridiculous. I should have been advised prior to check out time. I had to pay the bill because at this time due to staff not accepting my payment at 7 pm and my car waiting I was going to be late for the airport. Breakfast wait to be seated daily. Worst was Sunday over 30 min. wait. Room keys are made of cheap paper/cardboard material. if you get it a little wet they don't work. I got mine wet... They will attempt to charge you for replacement key if you ask to have it replaced. Don't misplace you CHEAP key or get it WET it will cost you. I wanted to give management the opportunity to fix this issue before posting strong comments on trip advisor and any other social media. I wrote to the GM and I received a reply from the "front desk". The reply was they will check the travel agent the booked the group. I will hear back in a week. Also unacceptable, I write the GM with a complaint and the reply form the front desk is they will check with someone else. More miscommunication, I am complaining not the travel agent. No reply from the General Manager.If you stay here beware of hidden fees and overcharges without prior notice! I don't like this kind of service and I will not stay at Rihga Royal properties again.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel really maintains the Showa-era vibe of old-school Japanese hotels, right from the decor of the lobby. The room was a decent size by Japanese standards and was very clean. The room fixtures are largely old and small -very 1980s. I didn't have time to try the breakfast but I would imagine it to be the standard Japanese hotel fare.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent hotel. It is located in somewhat a business district, but it is far from commercial establishments like restaurants and shops. We stayed in a deluxe room so it was roomy and with separate bathroom and bedroom. Internet is fast and easy to access. There is a business center where I was able to use the computer to do my work, with a printer. The breakfast buffet is good, but not extraordinary. Staff are very courteous and friendly.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very average food and not the most interesting selection. They also could have used some diet soda. Very nice hotel from what I could see otherwise . We stopped here with a tour group and we did not use any hotel facilities aside from lunch
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: RIGHA was pretty convenient, with quick and free shuttle bus service to and from Osaka Station, a location near the river, and a convenience store nearby. There's a slightly expensive bakery next to the lobby that sells some interesting items, too. There isn't much else to do in the area, but once you hop the shuttle to the station, Kansai is your oyster.Our room was pretty comfortable, with hookups for charging via USB. The bathtub looked like it had seen better days, though. Our room was small, but cozy.One thing I couldn't figure out was how/why the hotel charged nearly $30 per person for a breakfast buffet; about $20 if you just wanted a continental breakfast. I'd never heard of large hotels doing this to their guests. In addition, if you wanted to swim, you had to pay about $30 per person, too. My wife and I are not big breakfast eaters, so we never partook, but she especially likes swimming and was bummed to find it was ridiculously expensive.
hotelName:
9    RIHGA Royal Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a good, clean hotel in a nice area of Osaka, quite close to Osaka Castle. It is far from the crowds, but pretty close to the subway. We had wrongly booked a smoking room but the hotel quickly made some arrangements, despite being full, and gave us a non smoking room, which was really nice from them. My only complaint is that rooms are really, really small, but I guess this is what you get in Osaka. Overall, a pretty good stay.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location, cleanliness, wi-fi , reviews & price are the main reasons for selecting our hotel stays. This hotel was in a quieter area but perfect for us. Arriving at KIX airport we chose to take the bus to Osaka Umeda (Hanku) Station approx 45 mins & approx $19 AUD each, then chose to take a taxi to the hotel approx $18 AUD. Painless exercise rather than navigating the unknown subway at night. Come daylight it became apparent what a good location we were at. Turn left from hotel walk short distance to end of street to the start of one of the entrances to Osaka Castle - brilliant. Turn right from hotel & short distance to end of street was the subway, purple line - Tanimachi 4 Chrome Station (T23) to one of the main connecting stations Higashi-Umeda (T20) 10 mins. max. Hotel service was excellent from reception to room cleanliness. Hotel is not new, but is well maintained. Room size was bigger than expected. Only down size was the bed was really hard, but otherwise no issues. Wi-fi operated perfectly in the room. Breakfast was amazing . We felt it was definitely in a good location for us to take the subway to all the major locations in Osaka and did not need to purchase any passes prior to leaving Australia. We would definitely stay again if we were to return to Osaka
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were okay but rather small with one side of the double bed up against the bathroom wall which disturbed my sleep. Quiet room with the usual appliances, small TV though. Conveniently located next to subway and the Castle around the corner. Breakfast was good with good variety.Lady staff in the breakfast area appeared quite aloof. When my wife asked if the egg was boiled she replied 'no' quite abruptly and appeared disinterested in helping. I ate one of the eggs and it was boiled.Location is quite far from the nightlife in Dotonbori. Can take the tube there or taxi....not much difference in price with a 4 people. However, this hotel seems the best value for money being a bit further away. Other hotels around Dotonbori are either capsules or overly priced.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm a fan of this hotel. So many positives:1) There was actually space to walk around the room2) Money Exchange Machine in the lobby3) 10-15 walk to Osaka Castle4) 7-11 and subway station around the cornerThe front desk was friendly and they spoke English. What was unusual is that they actually gave you a key with a tag with the room number. Not too safe if you lose it but then again at least the hotel name isn't listed on it.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose this hotel because of its great reviews on Trip Advisor and Google. Overall, it has met my expectations: a minute walk from the subway; clean, comfortable, adequately sized room, less than a minute walk from the nearest convenience store, offers breakfast from 7am - 10am with a great variety of foods both western and japanese; all for a very affordable price. Happy to recommend to family and friends.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came back for the second time and still think this is one of the best value hotels in Osaka. Room was larger than the average size in similar hotels and it was very clean. Staffs were friendly and service was great. Our luggage arrived a couple of days before our arrival and by the time we checked in, it was already in our room. From our experience staying at many hotels in Japan, luggage delivery to room is not a standard practice even in much better hotels. Location wise, the hotel is only 1 min walk from station exit and Osaka Castle is just a short walk. Convenience store is just nearby.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights as a base and travelled to other cities via JR trains. The location is very good, though not near the JR Osaka station or Umeda station, it's near subway which is convenient to connect to the main stations including the Tennoji station. Osaka Castle can also be reached by foot. Not in shopping area, but there are eateries and convenient stores nearby. That makes it a quiet hotel to get rest after all the shopping and sightseeing. The rate is very good for hotels of its grade in Osaka.The room is spacious, clean and well equipped. Will come back and also recommend to friends when visiting Osaka.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located really close to Osaka Castle, and about a 1minute walk from the nearest underground station. We stayed on a non-smoking floor and our room was perfectly nice; clean and tidy, comfy, not the most spacious room ever, but fine for a short stop over. The shower was really strong and the toiletries were decent too. Other tourist spots in Osaka are just a short underground ride away. I’d recommend this hotel if you’re makijg a short stop over in Osaka.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is not by any means a luxury place. But the rooms are spacious enough and the location great if you want to visit Osaka and Kyoto without having to pay Kyoto prices, which can easily be twice as high.To get there, if you have been traveling on a shinkansen, you go from the Shin-Osaka shinkansen station to the Osaka train station and then take the Osaka loop line to Morinomiya ststion. You exit the station and cross the street to the Osaka Castle park. You walk about one and a half kilometer towards the NHK and police headquarters buildings and you are almost there. It's just a bit farther down. The walk across the park is very nice. And then you know the way back to get Shin-Osaka station and to Kyoto, which is less than an hour away by bullet train.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
