review_body: We stayed here for three nights. Room is clean and quiet, well equipped with coin launderette in basement which is handy.Good location, 5 minutes walk to nearby subway station, for train to Dontonbori and Osaka Aquarium. 10 minutes walk to Osaka castle. Staff are friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was located only a few minutes walking from the metro stop and as we walked to it we could see views of Osaka Castle. A nice modern hotel, the room was lovely and clean and the staff were very friendly.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sufficient room space, convenient and extremely close to Osaka park. Close by to metro station. Excellent breakfast. Will definitely consider to stay here if I return. Friendly staff and clean premise.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall very nice hotel, but the WiFi has to be reset every hour or so. Many US websites blocked (e.g. Google.com, MUST only use Japanese version!)Rooms adequate, breakfast excellent and varied day to day.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Plus points to this hotel. It withstood an 5.2 earthquake tremor - admittedly the epicentre was some hundred and fifty kilometres away in the Wakayama are, but certainly was a weird sensation as my 10th floor room gently shuddered! Location to Osaka Castle and Park is excellent. Also there is a subway entrance 1 minute walk from the hotel which connects you easily to the rest of the city. Generally the hotel is clean and rooms are a decent size. Negative points - I had amended my booking to a non-smoking room, but on checking in this was honoured. At first the hotel seemed inflexible but after some protest I was upgraded to a larger smoking room - there was still the slight musty smell of smoke but I put up with it otherwise it would have meant the hassle of changing rooms the next day.. Overall a good stay
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice little hotel, the rooms were of a decent size, modern and clean.Great location, right next to Osaka Castle. We stayed in Osaka just for the night, so it gave us the time to visit the Castle without having to take any public transport.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights. A nice clean friendly hotel in a good location. The subway is a few minutes walk away. Osaka castle is about 5-10 minutes away. Family mart and Seven11 is a few minutes walk away. The room was nice and clean and spacious. The bathroom was spacious and good powerful shower.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Because of a change in our flight schedule I booked The Lutheran at the last minute. The room size of 18 m2 was the largest of the 3 different hotels on this family trip of ours for Osaka and Kyoto. We were given our rooms ahead of the normal check-in time of 2 pm. The hoteI is well located, only 1-2 minutes' walk from the subway station of Tamachiyonchome (Tamachi-4 Chome), 5 minutes' walk to the Osaka Castle and the park and the Osaka Museum of History. The park was beautiful with autumn colours. There are 3 convenience stores around the hotel and a Sukiya restaurant. The hotel provided complimentary self-heating eye masks which my daughters loved. I would recomnend this hotel.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff were all Great, allow us for early check in and help us alot in all possible ways (Really Big Thanks) - Room was good and spacious - Close to Metro station and attractions - Breakfast was great - Highly recommended
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just had a one night stay and was very pleased with The Lutheran. Staff were very helpful and efficient, the room was quite large by Japanese standards, beds were firm but very comfortable and I had a great sleep. Can't comment on breakfast because we didn't eat there. Nice body wash, shampoo etc in the bathroom.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is basic but functional. Everything is in working order - the rooms, the restaurant, the staff. Very close to Osaka Castle and subway. People at the desk are very helpful in spite of limited English - although some speak better than others. But even the ones who do not try to do their best to help
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Efficient check-in and checkout. Hassle free and smooth. Flexible breakfast. Can change breakfast ticket to lunch ticket if overslept and cannot make it for morning breakfast Check-out is at 11am, an hour later than the typical Japanese time 10am. This is awesome Bed is very comfortable. Bed sheet smells good Air conditioning works wellShower has good temperature, hot enough Breakfast spread is plentiful Near subway Good partition. Cannot hear any sounds from other guests at all Able to sleep so well 30 sec walk from convenient store I can't say enough praise except keep it up!!
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No problems , no bad smells , a little mold in the corner of the bathtub but it appears to be under control. Two beds in a non-smoking room were waiting for us upon checking in. I would stay here again. It was a 2,500 yen taxi ride from the train station. Has a fridge and tv in the room . Working WIFI. Not a palace but decent place at a fair price.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The name might be a little bit strange to me, but it was a very good location for two nights. Just around the corner from the Osaka Castle and still close to restaurants. The bathroom and the room where not that small for Japan. Very good standard and clean. Can strongly recommend this place!
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is well located and the staff is very accommodating. The only down side for this hotel for us was that it was off the subway rather than the JR line. The room is ok sized and has everything you need for an easy stay. They were able to hold our bags for us before check-in, which made the trip much easier.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a pleasant stay at this hotel. It is located at 3 minutes walk from the station.Rooms are big and comfortable. Vending machines and Reception available 24h.Cleaning is not 100% perfect, but it is surely not bad (you are still in Japan)They lack a little with English but their efforts to help you fill the gap.No noises, no troubles, quiet nights and relaxing moments are what you can expect from your visit to this structure.Wifi super, beds amazing.I do not put the 100% score just to avoid to mislead the reader: this is not a luxury hotel, just a normal good structure.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here briefly while passing through Osaka. Room was clean, comfortable, and well-outfitted. Staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was much better than others we endured in the region. All in all, the Lutheran is an excellent value. We would stay again.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall, good value for money. The room is bigger than most of Japanese standard within similar class, and very clean. Service was also very good. We sent a couple of luggages by courier from another hotel in Osaka a few days before check-in. When we arrived at the hotel, they have prepared the room with our luggages waiting inside. When we had to check out early, the staff stored our luggages in the lobby and was very kind to keep our cheesecakes in the hotel's fridge until we're back in the afternoon. She also helped to book a taxi to airport then carried our luggages to the taxi. Location wise, the hotel is quite convenient. Only 1 minute walk from station exit, and there's a minimart nearby. Osaka castle is just a short walk. However, it's a bit of walk within the station itself from Tanimachiyonchome to Osaka Station, so if travelling with heavy luggages, maybe taxi is more convenient option. Would happy to return to this hotel next time.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As the title would suggest, yes ideally located right next to the metro station and also within minutes of the Osaka castle. Bathroom was tight and outdated actually the whole hotel needs a new look. However its the price you pay that bugs me, it is overpriced and that is the major reaon its getting a low rate from me because there isnt really anything significantly wrong besides that.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely stay in this hotel. Next to a tube station and with all facilities in the room you can imagine. The staff at reception is polite and helpful and they kept our bags on departure day. The views from our room weren´t anything special but it was on a high floor and you feel less overwhelmed by the building sourrinding the hotel. Arround the hotel there is a couple of cafes and bars&restaurants to have something and even in the hotel they serve breakfast (chargeable). A good value for money in Osaka
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I made an excellent choice. I booked two rooms for a family trip in mid-November. Although quite small in size, the rooms are very clean, well maintained. Beds are comfortable. The location is a short walk from the Tanimachi subway exit. A 7-11 store is right beside this exit and it proved very helpful - due to our late night arrival at the hotel, 7-11 had all what we needed for our dinner. Osaka Castle is nearby too.One negative point in this hotel is that their reception staff are efficient: we had a quick check in and check out - but lacking in customer interaction. Poker faced, aloof, seem to have no time to greet staff.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room is very spacious by japanese standards. The cleaners are fantastic in maintaining the cleanliness of the room. Location is conveniently near Osaka castle, Umeda and Tennoji major subway stations. Need to switch lines if you are going Namba though. All these at an incredibly affordable price ! I came across the staff as quite aloof, perhaps they don't feel comfortable serving non Japanese guests. However, this is a small shortcoming to an otherwise perfect stay. Every essential need is met.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Awesome hotel close to the subway but not the busyness that goes with it, very clean and tidy, good food, reasonably priced. Seven eleven is a 1 minute walk, the main bus stop from the osaka is only a $10 cab fare away. The entrance is grand for a smaller hotel but don't let the size fool you.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are very helpful and the hotel is well positioned. We had some issues with the Internet and after trying to fix it and not succeeding, they upgraded us to a better room, on a different floor, where the Internet was indeed working. Would highly recommend.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you're looking to tour Osaka Castle in the early morning before the summer sun burns up, this is probably the nearest accommodation on the map. We stayed 2 nights and found this hotel very clean, a bit roomier than the average size of other hotels. But notice that there are not many ideal restaurant choices. You might need to go to Namba or Shinsaibashi to get more food choices.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Hotel! I decided to stay here one night after arriving at KIX airport and before going to Kyoto. Great location - 2 min walk from Osaka Castle Park (which has a running path that was awesome to jog around). A little hard to reach from the KIX airport - You have to transfer once or twice, which involves lots of stairs.Washer was 300 yen, no need to bring laundry soap as it's part of the machine.I got the breakfast (1200 yen), which was worth it- Japanese buffet. Lots of options (all in Japanese) and great coffee. Everything in the hotel is in Japanese, no English.Great location, price was decent, staff was helpful, coffee was good! What more can you ask for? :)
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A bit dated of a hotel but comfortable and fully functional for everything you need. Located in a key spot, 3min walk from Osaka castle park and right off a metro stop on the pink line. Being japan, of course you have plenty of 7-11 and family marts nearby to grab breakfast. The room was large enough for us to comfortably get a pack and play set up as a crib. If you need to catch an early flight, it's not the most convenient as there is not a direct airport connection - easiest way we found was to take the pink line to Tennoji and catch the airport express to kansai from there (starting at 6:37am).
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is 5min close to a well connected subway station (Tanimachi 4-chome Station) and 10min from the Osaka Castle. It does not have a lot of places to shop/dinner around (only minimarkets for snacks) and is 20-30min from most shopping and dinner areas. For tourism, you may get better locations in Namba and Umeda, but likely at higher prices. The rooms are fairly sized and you are sure to get quite and comfortable sleep nights. We did not have any issues regarding smoking smell (as reported by other travellers) in my non-smoking floor. The staff speaks moderate English but compensate with their willingness to help. The hotel also offers free wifi.In sum, great value for money!
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose to stay at Hotel the Lutheran mainly due to the availability at reasonable price when I plan the trip. The hotel location is closed to the tourist spots of Osaka History Museum and Osaka Castle. It is also closed to the headquarters of Osaka police and Osaka government. Though it is just 3 minutes walk from entrance of subway, it will take more than 30 minutes from the hotel to shopping area like Shinsaibashi, Namba, Umeda, etc. If shopping is the first priority, the hotel should not be the preference. However, if Osaka Castle is your main purpose of visiting Osaka, the hotel is a good choice. There are several restaurants and pubs near the hotel. However, after sunset, there are not many people in the streets nearby. It is quite a quiet place. Since it is closed to the headquarters of police, it is safe. The hotel room is small and simple. There is a microwave oven at the ground floor and 2 sets of washing machines and dryers at the underground. The room is equipped with hair-dryers and air cleaner. The free wi-fi is good as a router is located just outside my room. The problem I have with this hotel is the bad smell. The room I stayed is a non-smoking room. However, there was strong smell of smoke in the room. Even the air cleaner was always on, the smell was still there. That is why I do not give a high rating of this hotel.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for two nights on a holiday trip. Was our first hotel in Japan and we are very satisfied. Was very easy to locate from the metro station. Staff were very friendly and helpful, with decent use of English. Room was surprisingly spacious and a generous space for bath as well. Amenities well supplied. Bed is comfy too. Noise level quiet. Non-smoking room does not smell funny. Free wifi that works really well.This hotel has a cafeteria, but we did not dine there. There's an ice machine, trouser press and even coin operated laundry room, which was very convenient.Very near to Osaka Castle and history museum, a good plus. Around the hotel, there are numerous eating places, but being non-japanese speaking, it was quite hard to find one that we could understand. In more touristy areas, they do have english menus, and even if they don't, at least menus with pictures. Overall, a very satisfactory stay, and a decent start to a japan holiday.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for two nights whilst on a business trip to Osaka. The hotel is nothing special, quite simple, and yet the rooms are comfortable and well equipped and the staff were friendly and helpful. There is a café onsite (Olives) but I did not use it as I ate out for all my meals. The hotel is very good value at just 17,000 JPYen for the two nights (which is circa GB£95.00)... Amazing for a Japanese hotel. There is a Subway station within a 2 minute walk of the Hotel as well as a convenience store and places to eat. The famous 'Osaka Castle' is just a 5 minute walk away as is the Osaka History Museum. There was Free WiFi available in the room and in the lobby which worked okay.I would recommend this hotel for both business and for exploring Osaka as a tourist.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here just before the New Year, made a last minute booking, so unfortunately, we were assigned a smoking room (and we're non-smokers). Aside from this, we enjoyed our stay. The room was very spacious based on Japanese standards. No complaints. The hotel is located in a business-type area, not much around it, but it's only a couple stops to Shinsaibashi. As others have said, the hotel is located near the Osaka castle. We didn't try the hotel breakfast. For the price, size and cleanliness of the room, I'd stay here again.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The breakfast is amazing for such a rather small hotel with very moderate prices. The rooms are japanese standard but very clean and cosy. You even get rooms with view of Osaka Castle. And the Hotel is very quiet, the walls seem to br insolated very well.The staff is very friendly and gave us an early check in for free.Right outside are the Tanimachi and Chuo line with which you can go anywhere. We would come back gladly
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Resonalble and fine hotel.It's very near Osaka castle and not difficult to get city center.Little narrow but good to stay for 2ppl. Just fit in.And staff is very friendly.That hotel would be recommended for sightseeing.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was located very close to Osaka castle (5 min), was a block from the Tanimachi subway line and close (5 min) to the Chuo subway line. It was close enough to everything, but far enough away at the same time. The rooms were quite clean and spacious. The staff were fine - not super friendly or outgoing...I guess it depends on what you want... Overall, the hotel is nice and worth the cost.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Despite of its name this hotel doesn't seem to related to the church. However, I'm sure they are really into charity because they are offering large rooms in a busy Japanese city with very reasonable price. I'm really amazed!The hotel is located in Osaka's business district. It's quiet at night but doesn't feel deserted, for there are several convenience stores and fast food restaurants just around the corner. Hotel the Lutheran is classified as a "business hotel" or medium budget hotel. However its room is quite big for that price. Not the spaciousness of a five star hotel. But for a single traveler, it was enough to make me feel a little guilty, considering that I was staying in one of Japan's largest cities. Also the room is clean and cozy, decorated with warm-coloring interior design. I never had chance to complain about it during my four nights of stay. Also the room featured a very large working table. It's even larger than my own desk at work. So it would be convenient if you are here for business. The hotel also features a laundry room with large capacity machines. Usually hotels in Japan only provide small capacity laundry machines for guests to use. They don't function normally if you put more than like two T-shirts in it. But with these large capacity machines i think you can put many clothes in at once, good for a long time traveler.The breakfast is OK for its price. But since it is in a business district, you can easily find some place to eat if you want. The subway entrance is only few steps away. However since Tanimachi line does not pass through Osaka's main tourist districts, you need to transfer at least once to get anywhere except Osaka-Jo castle, which is directly observable from some of the rooms. Overall speaking if you are looking for a high cost-performance hotel and don't mind to be slightly away from the busy districts, this one is definitely recommended.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights before we flew home from Kansai. The hotel was pretty good value for what you get. Nothing too spectacular, but everything is well appointed and clean. It is also right next to a metro station on two lines, however finding your way from the metro to the hotel can be a bit tricky as there are no signs point ing to the hotel. (For reference, 1B is the best exit - keep walking straight out 1B and it is about 25m on the left. Exit 1A is also close and has a lift / elevator, if you have luggage).The hotel is built beside / on top of a (presumably Lutheran) church, though the door was locked when we went to look at it, so I cannot confirm whether it is in use.It is walking distance from Osaka castle, which is a nice attraction (if a little fake given that the current structure dates from the 1930s).To get to Kansai Airport we took the metro four stops south to Tennoji and then took a local train to the airport (¥1030, 45 mins, about one train per hour). There was also an express from Tennoji which took 37 mins and cost about ¥2,000, but we had more than 8 minutes to spare so we saved our cash.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had other accommodation booked that fell through 2 weeks prior to our arrival on a very busy weekend in Osaka. The Hotel Lutheran was the only hotel I could find at a reasonable price that I could get 3 nonsmoking rooms at. I usually prefer to stay closer to the action and prior to arriving I was disappointed that I wasn't staying near Namba/Shinshibasi area as previously planned. However the location turned out to be absolutely fine and only a few stops on the metro from Namba or Umeda. The hotel being only 5 min from the castle grounds was nice location for a morning walk/jog. There are also quite a few restaurants around the hotel and we ate in 2 of them during our stay and both were good. I didn't have any issues with the Internet while I was at the hotel as suggested by the previous poster. Overall a reasonable hotel and I would probably stay again in future.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Osaka for a friend's wedding, so we picked the hotel because it was very close to the place that the wedding was held. The room was clean and quite big as we reserved the twin room, because they did not have baby cot to provide us. In total it was a nice and clean hotel as most of the Japanese hotels. The breakfast buffet was tasty, but not something extremely special. The area where the hotel is located is very convenient as there is a convenience store very very close and a subway station. In summary it was a pleasant stay
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: hotel the lutheran is located in the business district of osaka. during the day, there's plenty of hustle and bustle but come night, it's pretty quiet. however, as other reviewers have mentioned, if you don't mind the subway ride (or even the walk for you more adventurous types), this hotel is right on the money. i stayed at another, more central hotel (see my review of Via Inn) and hotel lutheran offers PLENTY of room compared to Via Inn. Internet access is readily available but be sure to bring your own cord. Note to Wi-fi freaks, it is not available on any room floors. Wifi is only available in the lobby and be sure to ask for the password from the front desk.rooms are clean and, as mentioned, quite spacious. a hearty breakfast is served every morning. one may select from a western breakfast such as scrambled eggs, bacon and croissant. there's also miso soup, rice and assorted japanese foods available too. the staff speaks basic english but they are quite attentive. it may be worth to know that osaka temple park is located only five minutes away by walk. if you stay at this hotel, get to the park early for a brisk walk. there are plenty of tour groups that meander around this park in the afternoon.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there for one night only. This seemed like the best place I could get for value during the busy time of sakura and it delivered on every aspects. The hotel was quiet, clean, the rooms were nice. Nothing special stands out particularly. The English spoken at this hotel is basic at best - I had to change my reservation by phone and it was tedious but we got through. I had tried to write them half a dozen time before to arrange the matter and got no answers whatsoever - quite frustrating.This hotel is next to Osaka castle park. It made for a very pretty late afternoon walk, but we were too late to visit the castle.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a decent, clean and comfortable business hotel in the heart of Osaka. The check-in was a quick and friendly and the room was clean, new-looking, spacious (for Japan) and well appointed.The hotel location is great for visiting Osaka Castle, and there is a subway station approximately 5 minutes walk away.Generally I found this hotel was very comfortable, without shining out amongst others I've been in.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed two nights at your hotel and we really enjoyed our stay. It was a very friendly atmosphere and the staff helpful. The great thing for us was having internet access and computer in the room so we could check our emails in comfort. The rooms were spacious and clean. Another bonus for us was the close proximity to the station, just take the B2 exit at the Lutherin Hotel sign and it was just up the street, which is great for us and we didn't know the area. We both agreed that we'd stay at the Lutherin again.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel looks brand new. The size is like any typical japanese hotel rooms. there was pc provided in the room and there was also free internet provided. breakfast was not too bad...a combination of japanese and american breakfast. overall the hotel is not bad and is located near the osaka castle. the surroundings of the hotel is not bad as well.
hotelName:
10    Hotel the Lutheran
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I enjoyed our stay here. It was inexpensive, clean... your typical Japanese business hotel– which was exactly what we wanted. We had first thought we'd stay in a hostel-type situation, but were able to stay here for less (and it was infinitely nicer). The neighborhood was great. We enjoyed exploring the local izakaya, where foreigners almost never go. There were tons of cute restaurants, cafes and bars in the area that had a great local vibe. And it's about 5 min away from a good subway station, which made travel and day trip convenient.Would definitely say again.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located not far from subway - Midosuji line, Hommachi stn, exit 2. Hotel provides everything we need, including pyjamas & even hair band. The room is small but the highlights should be on the cleanliness & amenities provided to give total comfort to guests. It has a nice restaurant, serving affordable buffet breakfast. Also, this hotel goes extra miles to cheer her guests up by serving free ramen every night from 9:30pm - 10:30pm.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It can be a little bit difficult to find the hotel the first time so it's useful to use Google Street View to familiarise yourself with the street before coming. The hotel is clean and it's facilities are good (guests have use of a smart phone/WiFi device) and the free ramen in the evenings are a winner. It's convenient for Yodaibashi Station which is convenient to get to Kyoto on the Meihan line for day trips. There are a few convenience stores and eateries nearby. Walkable to shinsaibashi.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is easy to reach the hotel via Kansai airport. Just take the Nankai Airport express JPY 920 per person to Tengachaya station. Transfer to subway Sakaisui Line at K20 station (about 10 mins) and get off at Kitahama Station Exit 6 where lifts are available at this station which is especially useful if you have huge luggage. It's about 10 mins walk to the hotel from the station. The entire journey takes about 1.5 hours. The room is clean with slippers, coffee/tea coupled with electric kettle and bathroom amenities provided. However, I'm quite disappointed with the housekeeping as they do not wash the coffee cups when you used it. Also, my friend actually stain the bedroom slippers but they didn't even change it. The room is so small that I couldn't even lay down my luggage . Well, they do provide free ramen every night from 9.30 - 10.30 pm. There are also coin laundry at 300 Yen and dryer at 300 Yen but I rather go the public laundry shop that is located 2 min away from the hotel since you don't have to queue. It cost 500 Yen to wash 10kg of clothes and 100 Yen for every 10 mins of drying. Check-in time is 3 pm and check out time is 10 am and if you wish to extend, you need to pay extra. The front desk staff could speak limited English and quite fluent Chinese.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tiny room but full of facilities, free warm ramen for guest at cold winter night is a big plus. good location near the Metro station.free smart phone.strong wififree lending good shampoo and body soap (beside the soap that available in bathroom)
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff service was generally good.But one male staff rejected outright our request for clothe hangersLocation was close to train stations and other attractions!There's additional shampoo to use tooOverall the experience was beyond expectations
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first time staying in this hotel in Nov 2018. Initially we were attracted by this hotel given it was a chain hotel and newly opened in 2018, yet after the experience we had with our stay in this hotel, we definitely had changed our mind. This was quite normal to put personal care items including facial cleanser, toothbrush kit etc (which were all our newly opened ones) in the washroom as we didnt prefer to use hotel supplied ones. After the first day hotel room cleaning service, unfortunately we could not find back all our personal belongings which were initially placed in the washroom. It was a very inconvenient experience to us that we lost the personal care items on first day of travel given shops all closed when we realised we lost them and couldnt enjoy our stay in this hotel. On same day night, we reflected our concern to the hotel staff to investigate the issue we lost our personal belongings in the washroom. However, not all staff could understand English well and it seemed that they were quite green in handling guests enquires/ resolving guest problems. After several days of our follow up with the hotel staff, the hotel manager just reverted a comment that the cleaning staff would not throw away personal belongings of the guests and they showed no sincerity in following up our issue any more. After this experience, we had to keep the washroom empty with our things everyday to avoid losing our personal things anymore. Hence better take our experience as a reference when choosing this hotel. We would not choose this hotel chain anymore in the future after this unhappy experience.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are lucky to find an affordable accommodation near Namba area. Namba is 2 stops away from Hommachi station via Midosuji line. Rooms are small but clean, and they have free udon every night from 9:30-10:30pm for guests.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has free coffee and alcoholic drinks at the restaurant. It has many restaurants nearby and it is a few minute walk to the train station. Very nice and cozy room as well! I love the restroom! :)
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staffs were helpful, nice breakfast and free supper (remen). If you are member of club WBF, you can have some drinks,snacks, coffee and wine at their lounge. Free Haagen-Dazs when do the review. If you don't mind walk 10-15min to train station, this is the best choice you stay here.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Central area with easy access to rest of Osaka. The room had nice amenities. The room was stocked with tea and coffee. Free ice in the lobby as well as really friendly staff who are willing to lend a helping hand.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nearby the mrt station, clean and cozy room. Our stay at Wbf is very comfortable. Ameneties are superb & it's location near namba is strategic. A complete package :) shall definitely stay at Wbf during my next visit to Osaka.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its a Great stay. Clean & good service. The staff were all very friendly & well mannered. The rooms were small but has everything u need. Only 8 min walk from train station. Situated in a very quiet place but yet still convenient.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff friendly and helpful.still have room for last min booking. Room and toilet small but clean and tidy. Will stay here again at the next visiting to Osaka. 600m walking distance from 4 nearby train station.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is near the station, and there are a lot of facilities.The staff are wonderful.The staff are wonderful, really kind! It's a shame they do not have cafe latte in the breakfast, but you can always make a request for hot milk and do it by yourself.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoy stay in this hotel. Not only the room is clean but the location is also very good. For those who like to walk like me this hotel is your bet. It took me only 15 mins to arrive to shinsaibashi-suji (kinda like a long market place before you reach dotonburi). And what i like from this hotel is that they give u free ramen everynight, and they also give u free selection of shampoo that u can choose. Just love it.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is clean with nice minimalist design.The staff is nice and friendly. The plus poin is we can get free drink and snack at tea time from 16.00 to 21.00 and free ramen from 21.30 to 22.30. But the minus is the room is a little bit to small.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice bathroom, comfortable bed, excellent services, hospitable staff, good wifi connection, free ramen for guests and walking distance from the subway. Overall a very good hotel despite the room size.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel. I love this hotel so much because of the location which is near subway, restaurant and bus station.There are 3-4 metro stations nearby.Friendly staffMoreover, free ramen for guest so better than expected. Recommended !
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Couldn't ask for anything better for the price paid. Very clean, quiet and staff are extremely helpful. Biggest tv in a hotel room in Japan so far. Free ramen and close to public transport. Would recommend this hotel for free ice cream.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice staff, clean room, comfort bed, and free delicious ramen every night.. the hotel has great location also!! near the homanchi station of osaka metro subway.. i really enjoy to stay here.. will come back here when travel to osaka again!
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a great value. On our honeymoon we visited a number of cities throughout Japan and this hotel was by far the cheapest. The amenities were nice, the lounge was nice (free booze!) and there was free ramen at 9:30 when we stayed! It looks like it's billed as a luxury kind of setting with a cheaper price, so you definitely notice the parts where they went the extra mile when you know you're paying less than other places.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Did a solo trip and I stayed at Hotel WBF Kitasemba West. Out of the 4 accommodations I stayed, I got the most for the bucks I paid. Friendly staff, free noodle from 930pm-1030pm, free usage of their smart phone. The location is within 10mins walk from several stations. Late night hunger is not an issue as there are many convenience stores around the vincity. Highly recommend this place!!
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very professional with fantastic standards. The best value for money I've seen in many years. Awesome staff, comfortable beds. Rooms are cosy but with excellent features. Location is in the heart of Osaka, with the river a short walk away. Everything is spotless and in impeccable order.Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed the atmosphere and the pricing was enticing. Rooms and decently sized with pleanty of ways to charge your device's. Me and my friend thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Really thought the breakfast was second to none. :)
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very good service people food . We like the room all furnitue , The W F is very close at subway for go to the others place thai the important to see join happy and funny hope to see come again and again . Five Star Five Service .
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very central and metro station is nearby. Very clean rooms with aircon and air cleaner humidifier. Double bed room is a bit small for two people. Barely impossible to open two luggages at the same time.Unfortunately, wifi is unstable.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very new and clean rooms, although small.. everything is complete. Not too far from metro and Hommachi station is only few stops from Namba, Umeda etc.Free ramen every night!! Wooots.. no complains really.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Place is near the subway station. Excellent staff. Room is small but very clean, free sleep wear, and ramen every night. Also great coffee and tea for free. This will make you go back and love Japan all the more.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A hotel located in a very strategic place... 5 mins to subway station 15mins walking to Shinsaibashi shopping street. Room is clean except the unseen area. Room is too small for us as we have travelled in Japan for so many days, and we have a few of luggages with us. The hotel provides free tea time & ramen everyday when you register as their member for free, its a great choice by the hotel. Overall is great! Will stay again next time
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great value hotel with nice lounge were you get free coffe and drinks. In the evenings they offer free ramen for guests. Great washing service and clean rooms. Highly recommended with great location close to food!
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Free RAMEN TIME: 9.30PM-10.30PM.We checked in after 9pm. And we got free RAMEN, SO NICE!!!!Front Desk staff were also kind enough provide us with a map guide to nearest stop which is Honmachi Station (Midosuji Line) it's around 600m (10minute walk).
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at hotel WBF kitasenba west for 4 nights during our trip to Osaka.We found the staff friendly and able to speak excellent English. The room small but very clean and with all the ammenities we needed for our stay.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location allowing easy access to both north and south Osaka. Friendly staff and clean modern rooms made for an enjoyable stay. Ammenities such as bathroom and laundry were clean and easy to use.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice Food, great Ramen...Very delicious...Free Ramen Every Night so Awesome.....Traveling for the first at Japan, n stay here for 2 nights is so Great...Cozy place, at the middle of dottonburi and Universal Studio...
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Worth every penny! Complete with complimentaries and near to subway. The handy phone for tourist was such a big help! :) Will definitely book here again. ❤️ PS Loved the free ramen every night! Such a tourist friendly hotel ⛩
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They provide complete toiletries and they even change your toothbrush with a new one everday. the free ramen every night is fantastic. Staff is very helpful. They have clean rooms and the hotel close to 3 subway stations. There is 7/11 store nearby.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Warm welcome by the staff. Appreciated that. Will recommend my friends to stay to hotel WBF group when they visit to japan. Location is very convenient to access to subway station and restaurants is all around. Highly ideal location for travellers who visit to osaka in futute. Hotel provide free membership which allow guest to having access to hotel lounge and enjoy free supper.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are wonderful, really kind! It's a shame they do not have cafe latte in the breakfast, but you can always make a request for hot milk and do it by yourself. The hotel is near the station, and there are a lot of interesting restaurants on this periphery. People who like walking can go to Namba. It's just about 30 minutes :) I have a really good time here. スタッフは素晴らしい、本当に親切です！彼らは朝食の中でカフェラッテを持っていませんが残念ですが、いつもはホットミルクを頼んであなたのことで作ることができます。ホテルは駅のそばにあり 、この周縁には数多くの興味深いリストラがあります。歩くのが好きな人は、難波まで行くことができます。ちょうど約30分です:)私はここで本当に楽しい時間を過ごしています。
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1st of all, I really really appreciated the free smartphone service. It literally saved me from the hassle and worry of travelling without internet. I love the Japanese sleepwear too. It easily accessible to subway station. Definitely on the top of my list when I get back to Osaka.
hotelName:
11    Hotel WBF Kitasemba West
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arietta Hotel is located in the middle of Osaka’s business district. There’s office buildings all around. While it does not cater to foreign tourists, it does provide for a comfortable and pleasant stay. Breakfast is free. They serve mostly bread and danish in small portions, cereals, and yogurt. Coffee is available the whole day. The rooms are clean and just the right size. However, it’s quite a long walk to the nearest subway and bus stations and to shopping malls. But service is efficient. Staff is not the friendliest I’ve encountered but helpful; the lady at the front desk (Kinichi?) helped us a ton on the day we checked out. Because our flight was early, we had to leave the hotel at 6:00 am. She made sure to get us a cab and already served breakfast (usually served at 6:30) so we can grab a quick bite before we took off. Thank you!
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed here for four nights recently and were very happy with the facilities and service. Reception staff were efficient and accommodating although English was sometimes not spoken so learn some Japanese:)The deluxe single room was small but big enough for us and the bathroom was great with big bath and toiletries galore. To our surprise, they cleaned our room every day and replaced sheets and towels!Breakfast was included and although not very healthy, it was sufficient. We also enjoyed the free coffee and international newspapers available at reception 24/7.Very good location not far from train station and the dombori shopping precinct. We walked everywhere and took train when necessary. Definitely recommend.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel at first look is nice and clean. Locations is neither good nor bad. Rooms are supper small and bed mattress are hard, my back was cracking in the morning. Breakfast is super basic, if your planing to stay for a week or longer you will need to look around to get a better one, as one provided wont do!!!English speaking staff, but this always can vary i guess.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is decent. The rooms are small, as Japanese hotel rooms usually are, but the bed was quite large and comfy. Breakfast buffet was fine. The staff are helpful. The location is excellent. It's on the subway line right in the centre of Osaka. It's two stations from Umeda and 2 stations from Namba.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Non-smoking triple room booked. Room looks a little small after open the sofa bed. Two types of pillow in bed. Blanket soft. Mattress supportive. Both regular and sofa bed are double-sized bed, around 4 feet wide. Bathroom relatively big, bath tub and shower available. Room clean, housekeeping up to standard. Towel without smell. Shampoo and bath gel did not cause allergy. Wifi free and good. Walkable distance to both Hommachi and Sakisuji Hommachi Station. Staff attitude good. Breakfast free but limited choice. The only thing that I feel disappointed is they will not help you to call the restaurant to make reservation.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Chose this hotel for the location but was happy with the room and amenities over all. The hotel staff is very nice and helpful. Don't expect a full continental breakfast but you will find the basics that are fresh. The room was spacious (for Japanese standards) and there was a very nice large bathroom. I would choose this hotel if I was to go again.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's modern western style hotel in Osaka, you can find they've tried many solutions to enlarge the space, so no matter the room, corridor or lobby, you will feel relax and comfortable. (the bathroom is really big)The location is quite good, 5 mins from station and 15 mins can reach 心斎橋shinsaibashi.The breakfast is lovely and simple.Oh, there is a convenient store and Karaoke just nearby, also, you can easily find a nice restaurant.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the first hotel we stayed at on our trip around Japan. The hotel itself is located between Namba and Umeda - we walked from Namba station which took about 15/20 mins. The nearest tube is Hommachi station and takes about 5 mins costing under 200 yen. The hotel is very compact with the reception area also being the breakfast buffet area. We arrived at 10am hoping to check in early (say 1pm) but they were unable to help us and insisted that 3pm is the earliest we could check in. This wasn't what we wanted to hear after a 13 hour flight and in need of a quick nap. Most hotels in Japan stuck strictly to the check in times during our visit. The room we got was quite nice and averagely sized. It was clean and was a non smoking room. The breakfast buffet was terrible - it was hot drinks, yogurts, fruit and pastries. Nothing special and most of it completely average. It was super busy as the reception area doubled as a breakfast area. Overall a good location for most sites (20 min walk to Osaka castle) and well connected on the subway but rooms and service average.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good priced hotel in the middle of Osaka city that is only a three minute walk from the Hommachi subway station (Midosouji line which heads directly to Namba station that connects to Kansai airport and the JR Shinkansen station, Shin-Osaka) Breakfast was light, but good enough to start the day, and the room was a decent size in terms of Japanese hotel rooms. Would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arietta meets the brief in terms of location, great service, cleanliness & safety. It's located in Honmachi, close to the St.Regis. Great access to the subway and the shopping and eating district is a little over a km away. The room and the hallways were extremely clean and the breakfast though sparse was sufficient. I'd readily go back and stay and recommend to others as well.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was quietly tucked away from the mai. Street just a short walk from the subway station. It's very well located in Osaka and surrounded by a lot of good Izakayas. We were warmly welcomed upon arriving and quickly checked in.The beds are certainly firm but still got a good night's sleep. The room wasn't giant but that's to be expected in Japan. What was surprisingly big was the bathroom. Which came with a huge bath tub and some really good provided amenities. The lobby also had a few free products as well if you had forgotten your comb or other feminine items. The breakfast was suitable. It's not some Grand buffet but it has a good selection of pasties and some cereal, yogurt, and salad. Coffee, tea and juice were also available. One of my favorite things was the green tea bread. All in all for an extremely reasonable price this hotel is great. I will warn those coming from North American, you may want to get the upgraded room with the larger bed. The standard bed will likely be a little small for you. Thank you to the staff of the Arietta for making the stay most pleasant.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very accessible to the subway and theres a bar, coffee shop & family mart within the vicinity. The best part is that check out is 12 noon!The only downside is that we have requested for a non smoking room but our room is on the 5th floor which is just right above the smoking (4th floor). We can still smell some stench.But overall, we would still here again - with request for a higher floor.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service seemed a little stiff. The roobms and bathrooms felt cleaner than some same range hotels at which we stayed. Washer/dryer on one of the floors is convenient. Buffet breakfast in lobby in morning for guests. Great location for walking through Osaka.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel. I like that the whole floor was nonsmoking. The staff was super helpful. Close to the subway. Very clean and new. We would stay there again. The only thing I wish is there was a Lawsons closer. Room was exceptionally quiet. We felt it was a very good value.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location and overall really good value for money for a hotel in Osaka. The subway is really close and convenient to reach all the main sights and markets. The room was big with ensuite bathroom. They offered us a small complimentary breakfast that was ok and welcomed. The hotel is brand new with fresh and super clean facilities. Friendly staff and I really can recommend this hotel if you stay in Osaka
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have absolutely nothing to fault about this hotel, it was the best one we stayed at out of our whole trip!! The room was really big and spacious - even for a western standard - and it was clean, the staff were really friendly and it was so easy to catch the subway around because it was right in the middle of Osaka and Namba. The breakfast included was also really nice and the rates were really affordable so we could not believe how amazing it was for what we were paying!
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A pretty hard to find hotel, but once you know it's place you'll find it a great location.It is just a few minutes walk to the next subway station. The rooms are big according to Japanese standards. The bathroom is really awesome. A major turn off is the breakfast, eventhough it is very well assorted. But you can not serve it on disposables!!!The personnel at the front-desk hardly speaks English, accept for the two young girls.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were happily surprised by Arietta Hotel Osaka! Pros- Less than 170 metres from Hommachi Station (see tips for hotel directions)- Helpful and friendly staff- Clean rooms with free WIFI- Complimentary bathroom toiletries (shampoo, soap, toothbrush, toothpaste, etc.)- Coin operated washer and dryer (11th floor) - Restaurants, shops, convenience stores at your door step- Quiet at night- Free buffet breakfast (coffee and pastries/salad/yogurt) Cons- Hard to find from Hommachi Station (see tips for hotel directions) - A few train stops from the tourist areas (but not far)Recommendations/tip- From Shin-Osaka Station, take the subway to Hommachi Station- Directions to hotel from Hommachi Station: Exit Gate 1. Once outside, turn left as hotel is 170 metres away.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very central and provides a good service at a very good value . The rooms are clean and comfortable. Check in is 15.00pm which is always a pain . We arrived at 1pm and asked for a room , they panicked a little 3pm is 3pm in Japan . But they where very accommodating and let use have a room early to shower change before sight seeing . Very friendly and smiling . The breakfast was in the lobby which is kind of strange but all in all was lots to choose from. A very pleasant stay and will recommend all our family friends to stay here , well done keep up the good work .
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our 3 night stay at this hotel.Arietta hotel is well-located. It's about 5 minutes from Hommachi station Exit 1 (exit left and head straight about two blocks) with easy access to the main shopping and dining areas of Umeda, Namba and Shinsaibashi. The hotel lobby is easily accessible via stairs and lift. The hotel itself is chic, cozy, airy and bright. The free hotel WIFI worked well.We pre-booked a quiet, non-smoking room and stayed in room 910. This corner room was comfortable, quiet and clean, although slightly cramped with our two large bags and two day bags. Nice touches in the room include anti-fog bathroom mirrors, heated toilet seat and a full-size bathtub. We woke up refreshed each day due to the firm bed and effective blackout curtains and cooling.The hotel breakfast was limited but very nice. In particular, the yoghurt, UCC coffee and fresh salad were very nice. The hotel very kindly allows guests to have their breakfast in-room.The reception was very friendly and helpful. They held a package for us and also helped organize our luggage to our next destination.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was small and dingy. Smelt of smoke and the view outside was no existent. It was a construction site literally right outside so the sunlight was extremely limited. Although the location was convenient, that was about it. Most of the staff (although they cannot speak any english) were generally helpful, however, one receptionist was extremely rude and kept laughing at our request for a non-smoking room even though she could speak english!
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay 6 nights in arietta hotel.The hotel is very well located for shopaholic like us . It provides yummy and simple breakfast start by 6.30 am.Its very convenient to travel anywhere by midosuji sub line which near the hotel.The staff couldnt be more helpful and friendlier :)Mr. K. Takeda profesionally take care of sending our luggage to the airport.He's even give us complete detail about how and where to take the luggage.Obviusly i will stay in this hotel again when i travel in kansai area Thank you for the warmness and care service
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is within 5 minutes walk from the Hommachi station, can easily find eateries and convenient stores along the way as well. The staffs are courteous and helpful although not many of them can speak English. Nice cozy room with spacious bathroom, definitely a good choice to stay over with affordable price.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arietta's rooms have been very well maintained since I stayed there two years ago. It's surely one of the best budget hotels in town. Value-for-money choice for (1) its proximity to Honmachi station (exit 1), (2) its location at the one end of Shinsaibashi shopping street, which takes you to Shinsaibashi in 10 minutes on foot with hundreds of shops along both sides of the street, (3) reasonably big room with large bathroom, (4) plenty of one-seater sofas and space in the lobby for you to wait for friends and repack your luggage after final shopping, (4) simple energy-charging breakfast served from 630 to 930, and (5) efficient check-in and -out. My only complaint has always been the hardness of the mattress (harder than the average you find somewhere else) and I know they won't change it in a short time.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had an amazing experience here at Arietta.. I had left my reading glasses at a previous location that only spoke Japanese and the entire staff was so helpful in calling and re-calling that location and setting up a meeting place for me to receive it ! Ever so grateful !
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here three nights and it was the perfect base for us to explore Osaka. It is cosy yet spacious (especially the bathroom) for a business style hotel. The free breakfast had a small, basic selection of pastries which was fine for us. Also notable were the staff, who tried to help us in anyway possible, including by calling our next hotel and helping us with mail. Would definitely recommend staying here, the location is also great in terms of proximity to major areas in Osaka, it is close to the station and therefore easy to get around via train.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booking was easy. Getting there from Shin Osaka is just a few stops on the subway to Honmachi. Leave at exit 1 turn left and it is about 400 yards on your right. Easy to find especially at night as the hotel sign is illuminated. The staff were friendly room was a good size for us both with cases. The breakfast was good. Ideal location for wandering around or getting about using the subway. As a base in Osaka would really recommend.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 12 months ago. We chose this hotel based on the superior twin room having a double bed and a semi-double bed. There wasn't much space left in the room with 2 beds in it. The bathroom was quite large, we actually put our suitcase in there. Room was clean & comfortable. Breakfast was good and included in the price, making it a great value stay. They were happy to store our suitcase as we broke our 2 night stay with a night in Hiroshima in between. The location was probably the wrong choice for us as it is in a business area and we would have had to take a subway to get anywhere. We were mainly using Osaka as a base in between visiting Hiroshima/Miyajima, Himeji and then moving onto Shizuoka.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Osaka, is massive so be very carful where you book! this hotel is within close proximity to the station as this is the only means of getting around the city - i usually like to walk but i realised that if you want to see the sights you must rely on the transport ......its that big
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at this hotel. Judging from the other guests, I would say that this hotel caters mainly to business travellers. Our twin bedroom was roomy and comfortable. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. There was a free continental breakfast which had breads, hot drinks, yogurt, and…a salad! Despite the slight oddness, we quite enjoyed breakfast in the comfortable lobby. There is also a self-serve laundry facility. The location was excellent, two blocks from the subway. As we learnt, it makes a huge difference which subway exit you take from the station, so do check for the hotel on the area map in the subway. We seemed to be only two or three subway stops from any place we wanted to go in Osaka, so it was perfectly located. We also walked to restaurants within ten blocks of the hotel.The only problem with the hotel was that there were no closets or even drawers, only two wall hooks, so we couldn’t unpack. Otherwise, it was a great hotel and I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 2 nights at the Osaka Arietta with our 2 teenage sons in 2 very comfortable and spacious rooms. Bathrooms are equally huge, and have a shower over a large bath. In room wifi is free (making teenagers very happy). A simple western breakfast is included in the rate and is served in the lobby (or can be eaten in your room). Location is great, right next to Honmachi station on the Midosuji line, which runs north/south and links Namba and JR Osaka stations. We would stay again.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 4 days, 3 nights and had an amazing time! We loved how we can walked all day, all night to nearby Shinsaibashi Shopping District up to Dotonbori area. It's also a few minutes walk to the nearest train station. We also liked their free breakfast -- missing those breads and UCC coffee! :) Definitely worth the price we paid. Though if you're not a smoker, just avoid the smoking rooms as you will smell it all over the floor.All in all, a recommended hotel!
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here one night coming from KIX on our way to Kyoto.Pros:-Super easy check in even though we arrived late at 11pm. Very easy to get to from the KIX airport bus. The bus drops you at Hotel Hankyu International, and you can take the subway 2 stops to the metro stop near the hotel - after that it was a 2 minute walk. The sidewalks even have ramps to help with your bags!-Free breakfast (pastries, juice, bananas, etc)-Very charming appearance with greenery and climbing vines-Very easy walk to Osaka Castle, the aquarium, etc.-Great rate!-Windows in the room actually opened!-Nice amenities in case you forgot your toothbrush, razor, etc.-Bathroom was really quite large but had the pocket doors typical in Japan. Cons:-As with all rooms in Japan, the room was very small. There wasn't much room to maneuver-Beds were rock hard, but again, this was the case everywhere in Japan-Keys must be turned into the desk if you leave the hotel to sight see, eat, etc.I think this hotel was great for a few nights but I think the tight space and the hard bed would get to me after a while. However; the price was nice and the ambiance was great! We had a pleasant stay and would definitely consider Arietta again if we're in Osaka.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 days and 3 nights here. Staff were so friendly and accommodating! Every littlest thing we need or any concern we have they do their best to serve us, answer us, and make our stay comfortable. They even kept our big luggage while we had our side trip to Tokyo! Location: It is within a safe and quiet neighborhood, so getting a good night's sleep is a not gonna be a problem, especially if you have a fussy kid like me; 3-5min walk from a nearby train station (the train line - Midosuji - is within 2 or 3 stops from Namba (Dotonburi), Shinsaibashi, or Umeda!); there are a lot of nearby Japanese and fusion restaurants, AND a nearby Mini-Stop (convenience store/mini grocery) :)Room: average by Japanese standards; CLEAN and NEAT, all basic amenities in a hotel room are availabel; BIG bathroom by Japanese standards :)Another Plus point: we arrived very late (11:30pm) and the front desk staff were still waiting for us to welcome us :)Thank you for your Japanese hospitality!Will definitely stay again here on our next family trip to Osaka!
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The reason i choose Arietta because i want to stay away from those crowded area but still convenient. just 1 or 2 metro station to those shopping hotspots. I'd stayed the 13/F double room for 3 nights. Spacious room with "big" size bathroom (compare to other same budget hotel). you can even purchase spa salt from reception to enjoy spa. I like the window view that you can feel the commercial atmosphere from morning to night. Also sound insulation was good that i have good sleep during my stay.Staffs are friendly, polite & always come with smiles. Simple breakfast but good enough. Only one elevator but didn't seem have any problem.if you carried heavy luggage to airport like me, recommended taking (Midōsuji line 御堂筋線 - Honmachi 本町" station exit 2 which have elevator directly from street to the station concourse)
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just like previous reviewers, we found the spot to be an excellent to to begin our stay in Japan. We found it quite easily by public transportation after a long flight in. It was hot - the air conditioning was appreciated. The breakfast was just as others have described - an assortment of fresh baked pastry, cereal, yogurt, fruit and salad. The service was great. BUT pack with small bags as there is no room for big suitcases in these small rooms. But they are great rooms, quiet and private, for your rest before embarking on your adventures.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is the best. Arietta is locates between namba and umeda so going either way was very convenient for us. The hotel is too good for its valie with free breakfast in the lobby. Shower quality and room quality were great great great. It was totally what we looked for. The front desk people were also really helpful.Would return again.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arietta Hotel is conveniently located near to Mido Suji, the main street of Osaka and only 5 minute walk to Shinsaibashi shopping avenue which will lead you to Dotonburi, the city's most well known place for foods and entertainment. If you are a good walker, you can walk along Shinsaibashi to Dotonburi in about an hour. Hotel staff are friendly, helpful and can speak good enough English to serve you. The room is sizable for Japanese business hotel's standard. It's clean and well equipped. You can choose non- smoking floor as well. Breakfast is strictly continental but the croissant and pie are nice. I stayed here with my family and we have a good time. If you are planning to visit Osaka, this hotel should be one of your option.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel for 8 nights with our 6 month old baby and it was very good. The location, Honmachi is excellent, halfway between the two main districts of Namba and Umeda, which meant we could get to both easily. Travelling with a baby meant that sometimes we would walk to our destination and then catch the subway back (or vice versa), and being in this location made it easy to do this. Honmachi is a business district, so relatively quiet compared to Namba and Umeda, which was well suited for us and baby. One Saturday evening we went out to an izakaya and it was actually empty because it was the weekend, so baby was able to join us and relax without getting over stimulated by noise and disturbed by cigarette smoke.The rooms are spotless and modern, with super fast WiFi. We had a standard single room, so it was very small, but had a double bed so find for a couple. In hindsight, we would probably take a twin room, for the extra bed and the extra space. In the single room, it was tough to find somewhere to sit when baby was taking a nap and having a bigger room would most certainly have helped. Special mention of Pola toiletries in the bathroom, which is a treat.Breakfast was also included. It was just simple and basic - breads, fruit, yoghurt, coffee, juice. But it was delicious and sufficient. Those that know Japan, know that is actually difficult to find breakfast, so this made it easy, and gave you a kickstart to the day. Overall, I have no qualms about staying here again or recommending it to others.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights of a quick Osaka-Kyoto trip with my friends. We are very pleased with the room and mostly the spacious bathroom which consists of separate bathtub and shower. Pretty amazing compare to small hotel room which is common in Japan. The location is great since it is very near to the Hommachi subway station. Just a little tips to find the location from the subway station, take the 3rd Exit, turn right and go straight until you see the first alley, turn right again and just go straight, you will find the hotel pretty soon. There are lots of convenience store along the way to the hotel as well which is quite handy if you wish to buy water or small food such as onigiri, sandwich, etc.They provide many amenities such as shower cap, hair band, comb, etc. They also provide free breakfast as well. Most important thing that makes me love this hotel even more is that they found and kept my mobile phone once I left it in my room once I checked out from the hotel. Appreciate it so much.I recommend this hotel to everyone and probably will stay here again if I ever visit Osaka in the near future.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is no doubt very conveniently located to Hommachi subway station, about 3mins walk, but it is sort of in the middle of a business area. And since we planned a lot of side trips which required us to switch to JR or Kintetsu trains from either Namba or Umeda, it became a bit pricey towards the end (a one-way trip to Namba was already 180 yen).Nonetheless, the other amenities were great. We were placed on the top floor which was great. Rooms were much bigger than those we stayed at in Tokyo and the toilets were very spacious for Japanese standards. Staff were helpful but spoke very limited English (only one girl who helped check us in had good English). We didn't try the breakfast since it was simple bread and cereal so we had rather saved our stomachs for something else. Overall, our 6-day stay at Arietta was quite enjoyable.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this hotel. It was very close to the subway so it was easy to visit Osaka Castle. Great local restaurant nearby. The hotel was very very clean. Our room was large enough for two, but lacked a clothing closet. The new looking bathroom with a deep bathtub was wonderful. The staff spoke excellent English and were very helpful. We would stay here again.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the said hotel for 3 nights highly recommended if you are going around the kansai region. It was my first time in Japan with my family, I thought it was difficult to find cause we were in Osaka at 10 pm from KIX but luckily it was not difficult to locate. April 18 to 21 2014.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hotel is located in a perfect position for getting around the city of Osaka. It is located a 2 minute walk from the Hommachi metro station which is very central. Only a few stops either way to all the sites of the city. Also only 5 stops to Shin-Osaka if you want to catch the Shinkansen high speed train. The staff are very friendly and generally the english is fine. Rooms are small but thats normal for Japan. Very clean and overall a good experience.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Conveniently located just above Hommachi Station, which allows you to easily access almost most tourists' spots in the city. Take Exit 1 and turn left, and you will see it on your right of the 2nd block. It's quiet at night as it's in commercial area. What excited me is how close it is to Akachan - an ideal place to do shopping for infants and kids, which is within 5 minutes' walk. After shopping you don't have to carry your stuff a long way back to your room. Cons: (1) The bed was not soft enough for us to get deep sleep. (2) The adapter/sockets were all out. They seem to provide a small number of socket adaptors for borrowing. You should get yours ready. Other major concerns are discussed in other reviews and I'm not repeating.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Arietta Hotel after a stay in Kyoto. We stayed for 3 nights and had perfectly lovely stay. The hotel is pretty simple, and breakfast is okay with bread, pastries and yogurt, so it meets all of your basic needs. The hotel does NOT have wifi, but if you bring your laptop, it does have connection in the room for internet, which is helpful. There is also an area in the lobby with computers if you need to look anything up, which is great too.My only complaint is that the pillows were the hardest thing I have every experienced. The best way to put it was like it was sleeping on a sack of flour, which was not comfortable at all. I knew the mattresses would always be firm (this is Japan), but the pillows threw me off a lot-make sure to bring your own when you travel here.Make it a point to also stop by the St. Regis Bar, it's right down the street. A BEAUTIFUL way to indulge!
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I like the rooms and the location. The atmosphere is welcoming and warm. The rooms on the higher floors are nicer: better view, better light. Breakfast is simple but good: they serve bread, pastries, yoghurt and cereals, juices and salad. It is not too far from Shinsaibashi area.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good quality inexpensive hotel centrally located close to a couple of tube lines. Staff friendly, and the rooms are clean and well equipped. Air con hits you like a brick wall when you enter the lobby, but sometimes that's a good thing. Room is well air conditioned by perhaps the quietest system I've ever come across. Quite possible to sleep with the air con on, unlike every US hotel I've ever stayed in.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights. Great location close to subway and some yummy restaurants. Easy to go to anywhere in Osaka from this point. Staff were pleasant and helpful. Rooms small but clean and tidy and with great air con. As the rooms are so small it would be good if there was a multipurpose room with a little space - I like to practice yoga but seriously couldn't in the room it was so small.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are extremely courteous, though communicating in English can be difficult. The turn around for the one(1) lift catering in excess of 9 stories can also be challenging. However as wandering travelers, our moods were quick to lift upon discovery of an awesome bathroom, some bread and coffee for breakkie and excellent overall customer service. This puts things into perspective and there is no faulting the internet computers, Wi-Fi in the lobby or ice and vending machines on lvl 4. The hotel is easily located from Shinsaibashi, Dontonbori and especially the Honmachi Subway Station. We have booked to stay here again before we fly out, simply because it is a cheap, excellent short-stay option.
hotelName:
