12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Arietta for one night, but it was a great hotel. Easy to get too from the subway and close to shopping and great Osaka night life. Room was clean and had great amenities. Only downside is the lack of Wifi, although they do offer a LAN connection, but who carries a laptop on vacation? Other than that I would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room size was above average for Japan and quite clean and modern. Central location being close to subway and convenience store. Staff were friendly with the little interaction we had. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I travelled to Osaka in October 2012. My first time there. My daughter had been before. I had no idea what to expect. I needn't have worried. The hotel was in a central location. Very little noise from outside however. Staff were delightful... and very patient with the Englishman who spoke very little Japanese. Nothing was too much bother. Breakfasts were limited but absolutely fine. Fresh fruit; juices; pastries etc. The rooms were spotlessly clean. No complaints at all about our time there. In fact, if I was going back to Osaka - I would try and stay in the same place. Reasonably priced too. Thank you to all staff! Konichiwa! :) Colin & Emma.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Arietta is really well located, very close to Exit 1 of the Hommachi station on the Midosuji line. There are plenty of places to eat close by, and there is also a Mini Stop (convenience store) just down the road. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the light breakfast provided in the large lobby is great.We were fairly happy with the room. While on the small side by Western standards (there was barely enough room for our bags and the bed), it was nicely appointed and contained everything we needed for our stay. There were also items that reception can loan you, such as nail clippers and chargers. We are pretty hard to impress in terms of room cleanliness, but we were super impressed with the Arietta on this aspect. It was spotlessly clean on arrival, and returned it to this state every time they serviced the room. The bathroom was fairly spacious on comparison to the room, and included a bath and a toilet with many electronic functions ('music', bidet, etc). The toiletries provided were lovely as well.We only had two complaints about the Arietta: firstly, the bed was VERY hard. My husband eloquently described the pillows as sleeping on a sack of sand. Secondly, the size of the rooms. Being 'Westerners', we often felt like Gulliver in Lilliput. Overall, however, it is a great hotel and location for the price.
hotelName:
12    Arietta Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is very close to Shinsaibashi Shopping Center, and just outside the hotel, there’s a subway exit. Breakfast buffet is delicious and rooms are pleasant & clean. Enjoyed the free toiletries they offered near the elevator but there are more than enough offered in the room. Room size is very small however. Had a hard time opening my luggage.
hotelName:
13    Vessel Inn Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good things sometimes come unexpectedly. And Vessel Inn proves just that right at the main street, just a few steps away from Sinsaibashi. The room is moderate in space (19 sq metres), but the designed function is great. Staff hospitality, premium grade amenities, clean bath and shower and comfortable mattress with an adjustable pillow makes a good stay and perfect sleep. Breakfast is tasty. Free hot and cold drink are generously and plentifully available all day and night. Highly econimcal, best value dor money, and above all comforting and revitalizing a hard long day of journey. Strongly recommend
hotelName:
13    Vessel Inn Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This location is prime, close to numba and all walking areas. There are many streets to wondering around and very convenient. Room is clean and well design. Great time here Great staffs and very helpful. Alot of new cafe near by. You will fell like local compared to numba, touristic area.
hotelName:
13    Vessel Inn Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our third time staying here at Vessel Inn shinsaibashi. We really enjoyed our stay here. Although Hotel room is slightly small, but they have everything that you need, bed are really comfortable and the room is clean. Staff are polite and nice too.
hotelName:
13    Vessel Inn Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It has been my second time staying at Vessel Inn Shinsaibashi! It's very accessible: 1) Just right outside the subway exit (North 5) 2) Very near to Shinsaibashi Suji. Moreover, I like a very new and clean hotel. The room might be small, but the bed is comfortable, the room is tidy, and everything is very clean.Staff is very kind. And they are very flexible (eg. you may check out later by paying a bit extra, but you will have to contact front desk before regular check out time to confirm whether it is alright to check out a bit later.)Certainly I will stay at Vessel Inn Shinsaibashi again next time when I travel to Osaka!
hotelName:
13    Vessel Inn Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: decent hotel, room was a little small but good enough for a solo traveler.i was happy that i got a room on the highest floor (level 10) but was shocked when i open the curtain, i got the view of the next building fire escape stairs. the building was built so close, i was afraid to open the curtain, so there was no natural light coming into the room during my 3 nights stay. the area was close to a lot of restaurants that's opened till late at night, but it's a little far from the train station—maybe a 10 mins walk with my luggage.for some reason, they don't enter the room to clean them everyday, i was told that they'll leave fresh towels outside your room instead. overall, my stay was pretty pleasant.
hotelName:
13    Vessel Inn Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: my mom and I book a hollywood twin this time, this was my second visit to the hotel, stuff are friendly and they do speak english, room was clean and near to the shopping area, no complains, will come back again next time.
hotelName:
13    Vessel Inn Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: New modern hotel, great location in Shinsaibashi, Easy to find from the metro exit. Room is cleanliness, but it is a bit of small.Free movies are available in room. Complementary drinks are served at the lobby. Staffs are friendly and helpful. Fluently English speaking. This is a smoke free hotel but there is distinguished a smoking room at the lobby floor.
hotelName:
13    Vessel Inn Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: GOOD:Clean and in good order (it's quite new)Staff were cheerful and helpful, there was always an English speaker around.Location is near shops, bars and public transportLaundry facility is useful and cheapBreakfast was of a good standard and only 1000 Yen although western food is limitedRooms have air purifiers which is a nice touchBAD:Rooms are small, smaller than they look. No cupboards or storage. Two people and two suitcases were a very tight fit!No English TV channels, only on pay per view although there were a number of movies in English available free of charge.
hotelName:
13    Vessel Inn Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Realistically I found the teeny room to be a pleasant little oasis at the end of the day - and it was very comfortable. Saying that, there was no outlook at all from the dark frosted over ‘window’ which made it a bit claustrophobic. Otherwise, the staff were very friendly and accommodating, the room was very clean, the deep bath was lovely, extremely comfortable bed with the most luxurious fluffy doona, nice heated toilet seat :) and the in room humidifier was great to prevent that typical hotel stuffy dry air feeling! I found the pillow a bit unusual though - as did my friends. Hotel is in a great location and room is ‘quite ok’ for a single person. I wouldn’t recommend it for a couple though - as my two friends found it just too small.
hotelName:
13    Vessel Inn Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really glad I found this hotel near Shinsaibashi. It's quiet, a 5 mins walk to Shnsaibashi and along the main street. Safety is of utmost importance as a solo traveller. Though small, I am amazed how creative they use the space to make it cozy and practical. They even have an ioniser! Everything is new, clean and modern. I paid for a day's breakfast as I was attracted to the variety the provided. I was not disappointed as the Japanese fare tasted really relish and fresh. One small issue I had was the staff was not very good in English thus my email correspondence with them to find the hotel was difficult. But for the enjoyment I had in this hotel, that wasn't a big issue. Thank God for google maps and friendly Japanese. Will try their other outlets in other prefectures next time. My way of locating the place is to look for Daimaru and go to the street level where H&M and Uniqlo are opposite each other. Cross the road to the other end and turn right, it's next to Tokyo Hands.
hotelName:
13    Vessel Inn Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I noticed upon arrival that the service provided to international guests was of a lower standard than which was provided to locals. In addition, we were placed in a smoking room after requesting a non-smoking room and they refused to change rooms. The bathroom had no ventilation so there was no way to improve the smell. Restaurant food was also only average. Do not reccomend unless there are no other options.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Caught the subway here after an international flight. Fast check-in, very friendly. The room was clean and had everything needed. Breakfast had a range of options. Everything in the hotel was good quality and style was evident. It has a calm feel and the staff are excellent.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel in Osaka.Rooms are spacious, quite big and clean.Good service.Included breakfast is not that good, you can eventualy enjoying other restaurant inside the hotel..Rooftop SPA is quite nice and relxing
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: City Plaza Hotel, OsakaOK, after a week in Kyoto, I was back to Osaka. For a bit longer than one night this time.It is 14 storeys, modern hotel with the top 2 floors looking like an UFO has just landed on top of the building. (Do not confuse with Singapore).It is rather interesting place: located in Chuo – financial district and tourist areas – it is as modern as weird. In the amusing, positive way.Location suited me fine, as it is away from Namba, Minami and Amerikamura, which are just over – rated, proverbial Tourist Traps.City Plaza is enormous; it has 200 rooms and most of them are single or twin. The UFO on the top contains an Onsen (Real One = with real minerals), also an outdoors Communal Bath and beauty Spa.There is also ‘OE’ – Japanese Restaurant, ‘Rivage’ – something European sounding and Sake Bar.No comments as I hardly ever use Hotel provided food and drinks.There is ‘Tully’s Café’ at the Lobby; they make very good coffee and serve strange food as Hot Dogs with Bolognese topping and other gems like that. Surprisingly good and the service is great.Also, this is the only place at the whole complex, where you can smoke outside.About the rooms > Japanese descriptions are always rather confusing, therefore – their range starts from: Standard Single =16 square meters, Deluxe Single = 18 square meters, Double= = 20 … and it goes up to Plaza Suite = 53 square meters. Mind boggling.I stayed at the Double 20 (I think) and it was very comfortable and spacious for Japanese standards.There is a lot of green feature walls in the rooms and dimmed light. You can open windows a bit if you wish. All pretty tasteful.Bathrooms? The same as everywhere else: small, but functional and well equipped with all you need. The foyers on various floors have similar, subdued/greenish décor and they also play some version of Whale Songs for your comfort. Cute. They also have those see-through, futuristic elevators, where you can watch the mechanism work before your mosaicked and mirrored box arrives. Fun.The weird thing is the actual entrance to the hotel: it is very wide and long and decorate with kitschy flowers and garlands. Apparently, this is a popular place for Wedding Receptions, so there is even a Booking office with endless videos of happy couples streaming endlessly. Funny, but not offensive.Front Desk > the same again: they are super friendly, but language difficulties.I have absolutely no problem with it as it is I who visits their country, therefore it is my duty to learn few words, no? Which I did, but obviously not enough.Besides; English is my third language, so all my support goes to those nice people who do their best.Plus, we all have our APPS, no?Back to location: it is NOT in the tourist hot spot, but only 15 minutes’ walk to Osakajo > 16th.century Castle with grounds surrounding that will blow up your minds.Across the intersection from that is Osaka Museum of History: 10 floors super modern building that takes you through the volatile story of this town. Not to be missed.OH! Transport!There is a Subway on every corner. Literally. The hotel will supply you with good maps and iffy directions every time you need to get somewhere. Taxis are cheap.If you need to return to Kix; you can catch the train or bus to Namba Central and then get the Shuttle to the Airport. But it is rather hard to find the Shuttle Terminal over there, as it is a bit removed and on the first floor of some building with no signs in English. Abbreviations only.So, I got the City Plaza Hotel to order me a taxi. It is only $1400 Yen or so and no need to drag your stupid bags around asking for directions. Delivered @ the right escalator; the ticket to Kansai costs a bit more than the taxi = 1500 Yen and the trip takes about 50 minutes. Depending on traffic. So, good Hotel; not in the middle of all the tourist madness but not far away either.Highly recommended unless u can stay @ the Ritz.I like Osaka very much, but as there are some unreal, modern buildings that look like large scale sculptures – it could be anywhere. I am sure it does have a soul, but I had not enough time to find it.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I liked this hotel, although don't expect too much English to be spoken. It was a good value, and a somewhat larger room than expected for the price. It is a little inconvenient for public transport, as it is a good 7 to 10 minutes walk to a subway station. There are, however, 3 different lines less than 10 minutes walk away, so that makes up for a bit of a walk. That also makes it a little inconvenient getting to/from the airport, as a taxi will likely be needed to get to whatever station the airport train drops you off at. Namba station is likely the closest, then a taxi cost maybe $14 one way, but the savings compared to hotels close to Namba or Osaka Station will quickly pay for itself right away, as this hotel is a good 30% cheaper.I stayed here because this hotel has an authentic and REAL natural hot springs ONSEN on the roof. It is not simply hot tap water, it is actual mineral water pumped up from the ground. It will have a slight sulfer smell up there, so you know it is real. They have both indoor and outdoor baths. Men and women are separated, and it is required to bath in the nude, in the Japanese tradition. It is incredibly soothing and relaxing. They are open I think from 7 am to midnight, with some closure during the middle of the day. One thing that is truly spectacular in this hotel is they have a few rooms, I think 10 total, where you can have the genuine hot springs water delivered right to your private bathtub, in your room. These are technically handicapped rooms, but you can enjoy the ONSEN experience in the privacy of your room, 24 hours a day. These rooms are an incredible value for the experience you get. This type of room is a true rarity in the world, especially inside a large city, at a reasonable price. There is a 7-11 convenience store at the hotel entrance, and the food in the restaurant was great, and the buffet a great value...both western and Japanese food.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights in April 2018. Great hotel, friendly staff, close to subway and some great places to eat. Do try the public bath - the hotel supplies detailed advice and the staff are helpful. Fab breakfast - loved the French toast! Would definitely return.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel with a fairly good location in Osaka. Room was fairly nice but a bit of a squeeze for 4, but we were only staying for one night. Hotel was very clean and well presented. There was an amusingly informative brochure on bath (onsen) etiquette, which explained the basics for us foreigners (gaijin) to understand. Would return again.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is beautiful. It is not located closely to a train station, you have to walk several minutes to get to one. The lobby has a small restaurant and big seating areas. Right outside the lobby, there is a hot water where you could dip your feet after a long day.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely modern hotel. Good size room, clean and functional. Great restaurant on top floor with good views and a Tullys coffee shop in the lobby which was good for breakfast. Onsen available but we didn't use it. Good location, not a far walk from the castle and history museum.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's my 2nd time to stay with this hotel, for 4N this time. it costed me are US$120 per night but the stay with them were joyful and relaxing. It were almost all Japanese residents when I stayed with them last year and there are a few more foreigners who this year. Anyways the hygience is good, guest serving is excellent, I enjoyed much the time there
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was great.The hotel was located in a good place.I was there because the tour guide picked this hotel.I actually liked her choice.7-Eleven is right next to it. Dotonbori was cab-accessible.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I didn't understand why all the reviews were complaining about the location. It's not a secret, you can google where it is. It is about 15m walking distance from the castle. My disappointment was:Minuscule old looking rooms, very tight for 2 pax, you don't even have room to put the luggage. The Bathroom looks like it got suck in the 90s. Decoration is also pretty bad, worse than Ibis. Staff is average, rather inattentive and unfriendly for Japan's standards. You have to pay not only for the pool (I knew this already) but also forThe fitness center (major reason why I booked the hotel) and it is expensive (around 25€ per use). I wouldn't stay here again neither would I recommend it.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice hotel,The rooms are clean, everything just happens, all went well. The breakfast buffet was nice. The views were nice.I would recommend it. Plus there is a 'Family Mart' just across the road so you can get all you want and store in the bigger than many fridges.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, very nice breakfast. Don't take the (boiled) eggs though, there are raw. as it says on the card, which I didn't read. They are for the Japanese breakfast. Very nice hotel, very nice rooms. Pity I couldn't use the onsen because I didn't have time.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Surprisingly prices of food in the restaurant within the hotel is still way cheaper than those in Namba and Uemeda and the food is delicious too! There's a convenient store (Family Mart) just outside the hotel if you want something simple or forgot to bring along some stuff with you on your travel.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I stayed here as part of a group.Location:- it is about 5 mins walk from the Sakaisuji Hommachi subway station (not to be confused with Hommachi station)- although we were near some major expressways (seen from our 9th floor room), noise wasn't an issue- there is a 24h convenience store outside the hotel (great for snacks and quick lunches)- the hotel hosts many wedding functions so the lobby level is full of displays- it's about 5-10min walk to Osaka Castle- the rest of Osaka sightseeing can be seen by taking the subway eg. Dotonbori district- it's strange but there is a 1am curfew (not that we were out that late, but there were warnings in the room)Amenities:- breakfast was a great spread of Asian and Western items (eggs, sausages, rice porridge, noodles, pickles, fruit, salads, pastries)- we did not visit the gym or onsen, but many of our friends enjoyed the onsenRoom:- we were lucky to have a very large and spacious room, but some of our friends didn't seem to fare as well (from their descriptions of the amount of space around the bed) - we had a small sofa and table, a separate desk for working, and the toilet was separate to the shower- climate control worked well- free wifi- there was also a large wardrobe with iron, safe, slippers, and a small bar fridge with tea making facilities- the room was quiet and comfortable with plenty of lightingBathroom:- the shower/bath was separated by a door from the sink and make up mirror... it didn't seem to make much sense taking a shower by moving the nozzle to point over the bath because it just sprayed everywhere. However the design of the separate room appears to be that you are supposed to shower on the FLOOR in this separate room (and take a bath in the bath). I couldn't get used to this, so I still showered in the bath... but be prepared for wet floors! This doesn't matter so much because the sink is outside, and the toilet is somewhere else, but it's still pretty weird- there was a laundry line inside also- it was nice to have a small chair and table with the make-up mirror- the toilet was across from the shower room, and had an individual sink (however there was no soap here, so it was a bit annoying to walk across to the other sink to use the soap)Overall, having stayed at two ryokans and sleeping on tatami mats on the floor in Tokyo and Kyoto, it was nice to come back to a Western-style room with comfortable beds!
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For a relatively new hotel, my room was a bit tired. Fabulous shower pressure though! Among the strongest in the world!!! If the room rate was around or below 10000 yen I would have had no complaints, however, I was paying something like 16000 yen and by adding extra 4,5000 yen, I could have stayed at the St.Regis or the Ritz-Calton so......I guess I won't be coming back here.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a few night in March, the spa is amazing, staff are friendly and helpful.There is a cafe with lovely cakes.Located about 5 mins walk for the station, was a good stay.Will definitely visit again.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were carrying big luggages so we exited from no.15 with the lift. It was a bit of a walk from the red midosugi line to exit 15 and we got a bit disorientated as our original plan was to exit from no. 1, which is much nearer to the red line. On hind sight, no.1 might be possible with escalator to ground. The hotel has free Japanese bath and that was a plus since we were tired from sightseeing. The receptionist were really helpful in giving us advice on sightseeing routes and helping us get our luggage delivered.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Spa is excellent! And the staffs at spa served pretty better than those at the front desk. How come?I couldn't communicate with some the staffs at front desk in English, and they seemed scared and anxious to help us. My friend had to leave earlier, and we took his box to ask for packing assistance. The staff helped nothing but borrowed us a type and a marker. But on the check-out day, there 4 elegant females help me a lot pack my box!The hotel seems that located at housing area which meant that except Lawson and their restaurants, no other food are available nearby. The room renovation is outstanding. The view is wide and the sunshine is delightful. But there is a problem: no water available directly in the whole building exclude the SPA area. I can't believe it is a 4 stars hotel in Japan. The hotel owns the whole building. Can't they manage there water quality?
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The City Plaza hotel is an efficient hotel. We stayed in room 1001, which is a very small room with a single double bed. Room door is 33 in. wide. Bath door is 34 in wide. Bathroom is large, approximately 6 ft x 6 ft with a roll-in shower and roll-under sink (27 in clearance). Tub height 18.5 in. Toilet/Bidet ht is 15.5 in, seat up. Bed height is 18 in.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is pretty small but I guess that's standard in Japan. Location wise, it's quite far to walk to Dotombori street. We walked there to collect our luggage (we stayed in other hotel in Dotombori/Namba street before we went to Kyoto and back to Osaka again). It was a long walk. If not mistaken, about 2km +- from my google map.The onsen in this hotel is good. There is also a sitting area on the same floor of the onsen. overlooking the night view of Osaka, and three massage chairs. It wasnt crowded and I waited about 15 -20 mins to use the massage chair. It is a walking distance to Osaka Castle. We walked there the next morning. About 15 mins.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You will love this hotel if your intention is to rest and not shop. A little far from shopping area although there is a tube station about 6 mins walk away. The rooms are clean and reasonable size. We booked 4 rooms but it's strange they put a room in betw each of us. We would have preferred adjorning. Perhaps this is on purpose hence worthwhile to state your preference at booking. We wanted to extend one room till evening on the last day before we flew back but they claimed the hotel is fully booked. A little disappointed.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location . Lots of night-life around . Rooms were comfortable and clean . The Donkey shop ( for cheap buys ) around the corner is open all through the night . Breakfast was average - alot of chinese food and basic other food especially for vegetarian .
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed the night in Osaka and were looking for convenient hotel after staying 3 nights in a row in Ryokans. We had rather low expectations of this hotel due to the price. However, arriving there we were rather surprised finding a very modern and new hotel. Although they do not have WIFI in every room, the hotel will provide you which a router you can setup yourself (takes less than 2 minutes). The rooms and bathroom are big for japanese hotel. I will stay there again next time I will be in Osaka
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed our last 2 nights in Japan here. It is a big hotel with lots of spacious rooms.Beds are great, bathroom also spacious and its really quiet.The breakfast is complimentary, and too much you can handle! Japanese and western style. Everything was perfect.You really should go to the onsen at the top floor of the hotel, its just soo relaxing!I would really recommend people to stay here. I would if I would travel again through Osaka.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is some kind of funky wedding hotel in Osaka. There is a chapel and everything.As always this is about expectations: we were expecting better than a 3 star hotel...Pros:-Nice clean rooms-Nice lobby-Friendly enough staffCons:-Plastic bathrooms found in much cheaper hotels also found here-View of the freeway-Breakfast....ouch... dirty tables and very limited (western) selection. Cold water was empty both days we ate there (it´s not that hard to check it...)-No Wifi
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first time at this hotel. Whenever I'm in Japan, I prefer to stay in a place with an onsen. I chose this place as its top floor (14th fl) was advertised to be all onsen facility. It did not disappoint. There were several tubs to choose from, but the outdoor one was a real treat in mid winter. The hotel appears to be brand new. Its amenities are somewhere between "business hotel" and full service hotel. The rooms are somewhat spartan, but vey efficiently designed. The only negatives are that it's not so close to Osaka station (two transfers via subway or 1300 yen cab ride), and that I had a room facing the highway and I could hear the cars going by.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here recently for 2 nights over the weekend. Booked a semi double room thru the hotel website for Y9450 for sat night and Y8400 for sun night. This is excellent value for money ! City Plaza Osaka is a modern hotel with all comfort one can expect from a 4 star hotel. Room is small and compact with a small double bed which is suitable for asian couple. We find it a snug to share a small bed but its okay for us. The room has a big window and this help brighten up the small compact room. I find the room very clean and comfortable.Room has LCD TV, fridge with free mineral water, water boiler with free tea, hairdryer, a humidifier, and even a massage chair ! Pajamas and slippers are provided too. Bathroom is big in relation to the size of the room and toiletries are provided too.Location wise is okay as you are a short subway ride from the bustling namba area. There arent many dining options around the hotel, so we ended up going to namba for food every night.The best thing about this hotel is the spa on the top floor which is free to hotel guests. Every night we find ourself at the spa, soaking in the outdoor pool.....so blissful !For the money we paid, this is an excellent hotel. We thoroughly enjoyed our 2 nights stay here. Love the spa here !
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As others have mentioned. The hotel's location is a 5 to 10 mins walk to the subway station. I just want to add that it's also a doable 20 mins walk to Osaka Castle with several nice eateries along the way.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Travelling with a bad back creates problems in most hotels, City Plaza gives a great room and furnishings to make access and rest the easiest possible.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for about a week, very new hotel with a great finish. I liked the corridors with relaxing music and aromatherapy oils. Great value for money. It had an excellent gym (you need to pay 1800 yen though) and onsen (hot spring bath) on the roof top was fantastic! Free use of onsen and massage chairs (which was outside the onsen). Very close to the station, about 5 mins walk. I will definitely go back there again!
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I only spent one night here, but for my first night in Japan I was very comfortable. The room was small but comfortable. Pajamas and essential toiletries included. Very good Japanese breakfast buffet. As for price and location, I cannot comment because I don't know.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife was in Osaka for work, and I and our two small children came with her for a week. The hotel arranged interconnecting rooms, which were small but comfortable and well-equipped. They provided a free cable to use the hotel's internet connection, and there was a useful fridge in each room. The hotel restaurants were expensive, but there are several convenience stores nearby (the hotel provided a map!). Location was fine; about 10 minutes' walk to either of two subway stations. The real highlight were the (single-sex) top-floor spas; not suitable for children, so we took turns once they were in bed! Hot pools, steam rooms, sauna, massage chairs; very relaxing after a long day sight-seeing. The in-house bakery was also good for breakfast.
hotelName:
14    City Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are lucky to get the introductory price. We booked the Moco-Moco Room. Its quite spacious and has wide bed.The hotel is kid friendly. There are bean bags and small table if you want to its your snacks. We have a view of USJ park.The shower and toilet is separate. The toilet bowl has warm seat and has controls for bidet water pressure.The shower room has bath tub. Part of their amenities is 2 sachets of bubble gel.The staffs are friendly and can communicate in English.All rooms are non-smoking. But they have smoking room located at 2nd flr. The room key cards are needed to access the elevator when you go up to your room. Just tap it on the black sensor when you get inside the elevator.There is also a coin laundry and coin dryer at the hotel located at the 2nd floor. There is also vendo machindm for detergent soap where you can buy at the laundry area, so you don't need to bring more clothes when you visit Osaka and stay at this hotel.There is also vendo machine for drinks like sparkling water.You can also buy Universal Studio entrance ticket at the hotel.We had an awesome experience at the hotel and will definitely go back here.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Universal Port Vita
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in excellent location, USJ is almost just across the road, the subway station is on the other end of the hotel and next to it is a small to moderate sized shopping mall which you can find varieties of restaurants and gift shops and convenient stores that you can spend half day in... the hotel room is clean and is bigger than a normal hotel room I've ever accommodated at in Japan...After all, the most impressive part is the hotel staff. We arrived at Universal Port Vita on the 3rd day we entered Japan, my daughter was sick with high fever not going south in that many days, we used up all the medicines we brought and her sickness seemed not to improve, we seeked help from the hotel and 2 staff came to our room, one girl in fluent Mandarin and another young man in fluent English, after discussion the girl suggested to accompany us to a local hospital as our interpreter, so we were rest assured and started our way at midnight, the girl was actively helpful all the way until we went back to the hotel at 3am, at that time I just knew that she was supposed to get off work at 12am, that's a 3 hour OT... That morning, I woke up at 7am and called the front desk for some other information, that's the same girl who answered my call! I'm really appreciated and feeling thankful.THANK YOU UNIVERSAL PORT VITA, THANK YOU MR. YOUNG MAN (SORRY I FORGOT TO ASK YOUR NAME), AND MOST IMPORTANTLY, THANK YOU VERY MUCH 向晴佳さん
hotelName:
15    Hotel Universal Port Vita
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a great location. I would say it’s a 5 minute walk to Universal Studios Japan if you take your time, about two minutes from the Universal City train station and about 8-10 minutes to the airport limousine bus stations. The hotel itself is beautiful, inviting and the staff is very professional. The first thing I noticed was the appearance of the staff, from head to toe, it was a well represented image for the hotel. They also spoke clear English and was very courteous. The best part of this stay was the noise control. We stayed on the tenth floor with a beautiful view of the park, it was close enough to see the park, but far enough from the loud noises. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Universal Port Vita
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoy stay in this hotel, bed very comfortable. Room is a little bit small compared with universal port hotel, the sister hotel. Buffet dinner is good, many choice of food. I like the Japan homemade honey. Will come back for sure. Each guests will have lucky draw. I got Dave!
hotelName:
15    Hotel Universal Port Vita
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was great. Brand new and shiny. Very clean, polite and friendly staff. Room was on the small side but not unexpected for Japan. Room was bright and well appointed. Water bottles replaced daily. Not a lot of room for luggage if you have several people but I found a way. Has a Lawson attached to it and is just a few minutes walk to Citywalk and Universal Studios Japan.
hotelName:
15    Hotel Universal Port Vita
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is wonderful, its clean and very spacious. The rooms are very comfortable and there is an amazing view of Universal Studios. It is less than a 5 minute walk to USJ and is surround by amazing restaurant options and shopping. All staff at the hotel were extremely polite and helpful. I would definitely stay here again
hotelName:
15    Hotel Universal Port Vita
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is well located near metro stations and tourist attraction (Dotonbori area).The room was extremely humid and hot. The AC was controlled centrally, and would shut off about every 2 hours. We couldn’t sleep well because of the heat and humidity. We will not be staying here again. I think we can find a better hotel with that price range plus, the room was kind of dusty and the pillows very hard.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a westerner (USA) it is a bit of an adjustment to stay in small, Japanese hotels. That said, we stayed in other similarly priced hotels and found that while small, their rooms were of much better design than the WBF Namba Kuromon. Our double room was very tight and uncomfortable due to poor design (and we're both small people). The Namba Kuromon seemed to be a new hotel made cheaply and quickly. For example, we called our bathroom the "trailer" because it felt like an afterthought in the room. You had to step up to enter the bathroom and once inside it, it felt very temporary. We also got unlucky and had a room with a depressing view and a neighboring pair of rooms that had a loud party our first night. However, those last two things could really happen anywhere. In addition to the our issues with the hotel itself, we wish we had stayed further from the Dotonbori. It is very, very touristy and each meal we had within a 5-10 block radius felt lackluster and sometimes predatory (table charge of $3 per person, food from a fridge/freezer). In our opinion, Osaka's charms are not in this neighborhood -- which is better suited for a quick walk through to see the lights and crush of people. We kept finding ourselves wanting to get as far away from the hotel as possible to sightsee, eat, etc. Not a great setup. Overall, we just found the neighborhood too hectic and dirty and the room too small and poorly designed to comfortably rest or relax during the day or at night, which is a really key part of travel. I think we could easily have found a better value.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has an excellent location! You can reach the subway station within a minute by foot, and the famous Dotonbori is just a 7 minute walk away. Also, the famous Kuromon Ichiba Market is just across the street, and the shopping mall Namba Parks is a 10 minute walk . A long the way to the mall, you’ll walk past several streets that is full of great japanese resturants! The hotel room was nice too, but maybe a bit small for two persons with a big suitcase each. But hey, it’s Japan, and we made it work! No biggie. The minus though was that when we checked in we were recommended to go see their rooftop bar with the nice view, but when we went up that same night, the rooftop was only for lounge guests. That was a bit disappointing. But besides that, we had a great stay at this hotel!
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was clean, looked quite new, and located on an arterial road. Just a few steps to a convenience store, and Namba market was before our eyes. Namba station was on walk distance, as well as Shinsabaishi and Dotonbori. The bedroom was small, though I booked the superior rooms, which was only 1 (one) room on each floor. On the contrary, the bathroom was very spacious with the shower in a separated room. The amenities were amazing, it had masks for tired feet. The staffs were very helpful, and some of them spoke English fluently, but the housekeeping did not replace bottled water daily.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we spent 4 nights at this hotel and used this location as a base to tour kyoto, nara, himeji, and wakayama before moving to hiroshima. the good:- a short walk from the station coming from kansai airport- clean room with basics- good wifi- there's a cell phone with data in room for guest to use- right across the street from kuromon market- 0.7km from dotoburi/ebisu bridge- 1.1km from jr namba station (a bit far if you don't like to walk)- convenient stores and restaurants nearbythe bad:- our "holywood" room is very small, two single beds side by side with barely a meter space around them, if you have large suite cases, good luck!- hotel's definition of kid's free stay with parents is under 6 yr old. over 6, 20usd a day extra!- samll bathroom- a bit expensive at 100usd a night for such a small room. i guess japan isn't very budget friendly to begin with
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location :We found the location to be perfect for us. There’s Nippombashi metro right next to the hotel , like about 2 mins walk .There’s a market right across the street 7-9 mins walk to Dotonbori street and the Gilco sign board . Lotsa food and shopping options Near to Namba station, and Namba express bus stop(From Itami airport ) Hotel looks quite new from the outside There is a family mart and Lawson just adjacent to the hotel Staff :The staff were friendly and helpful, however they have difficultly understanding English .Facilities:We were able to use the Yamato transfer to send our luggage to Tokyo, it’s Super convenient as we were hopping a lot of places before we reach Tokyo from OsakaThey only had like 2 washing machines and 1 dryer , hence we had a bit of difficulty finding time to do the laundry Overall , it’s worth it :)
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was probably the best hotel we stayed in whilst in Japan. The location was close to a main station and the Kuromon Ichiba Market It was also a quick walk to Dōtonbori for a night out. The staff were friendly and helpful.The room was fairly small, but well designed and had most things you need e.g a fridge and a safe. (Although the free coffee/tea facilities were located in the lobby). The best feature was a free smart phone which we could take out with us - ideal for checking things online (maps, train times etc) when exploring Osaka and beyond, without having to worry about WiFi or charges.The hotel also has a Sky Lounge which, for a small fee, residents and guests can spend the evening in - drinking and eating with no further charges.I would recommend this hotel, and would certainly check out their other hotels in Japan.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Attentive staff, clean room although housekeeping can be improved. Loved the Handy smartphone provided, we used it as wifi hotspot at 300Yen for 24hrs. Good connection.Location is great! Walking distance to everything from the market to shopping streets and two main train stations, Namba and Nippombashi.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Kuromon market is just opposite the hotel. Close to Nippombashi Station and a short walk though shopping alley to Namba train station . Lots of shopping and eating places around. Dotombori just a short walk away. Double room is spacious but toilet space is tight . Hotel should supply non slip bath mat in bathtub as it can be slippery and dangerous . Housekeeping is very inconsistent. One day they forgot to supply toiletries and another day they forgot the pajamas and they didn’t replenish the teabags and wash cups. The TV channels are all in Japanese and we couldn’t understand at all and didn’t turn on TV throughout our stay. There’s complimentary coffee and tea at lobby which is very good. Overall, the staff at reception are courteous and helpful .
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brand new modern and stylish hotel in a very central location in Namba area. Closest station is Nipponbashi but more convenient is Namba Station which is either a 1-stop subway or 10-15 walk away (via underground passageway). Very close to lots of restaurants and shops as well as Dotonbori street and canal. On the positive side: location is the main draw. Staff are friendly. Rooms are a good size (by Japanese standards), and rooms provide kettle, fridge, pyjamas and a mobile phone with data- - which is a great benefit. Free hot coffee machine in the lobby.On the slightly negative side: Cleanliness could be slightly improved (on more than one occasion I found hairs that were not mine in the bathroom and on the bed). Storage isn't great; there is no drawer space and only one small coat rack with 4 hangers. Also, there is no bedside table or nightstand which is a bit odd because is just an an empty space between the two beds which would perfectly fit one. Day or night the lobby was always filled with noisy guests just hanging around. Not sure for what reason. They will store your luggage but keep in mind it's not kept secure, so all the luggage just stays in the lobby.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was great, staff, location everything was awesome...Markets are everywhere, and i mean everywhere it was great for shopping. And train station was close by... and there is a fish market across the road and they have the most amazing food, and a 10 min walk there are huge anime stores that sell everything and i mean everything.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location of hotel - very convenient. Many restaurants/Dotombori market within walking distance and Nippombashi Station 5 mins away.Hotel provides free tea and coffee from 6am-12am and a WIDE selection of different shampoo and conditioners, all in the lobby (free to use). Breakfast wasn’t as great as expected after reading other reviews, but still has a nice view from the 15th floor.Rooms were smaller than expected and struggled to walk around after opening 2 medium-large sized suitcases. Bathroom was also small but still managed to fit a bathtub.CLEANING has to improve!! Rooms were very dusty, above the headboard had a layer of dust which my sister had to wipe down herself and the pyjamas/bed sheets had strands of hair from previous guests. Pillows were too hard for my liking but can choose more from the pillow menu provided.Air conditioner made a lot of noise, even when not in use. Upon arrival, rooms were very hot and stuffy so I decided to switch on the AC. Then realised it was on heat mode and when I asked staff at lobby to change it to cool mode, they said it was centrally controlled by them but insisted we open a small window instead. A day prior to checking out, they finally changed the AC to cool mode, probably from all the guests’ complaints.Overall was a decent stay here. Staff were friendly-ish and the hotel in general was very clean and modern. Handy phone was provided with 4G unlimited internet and 30 mins of free hotspot (or could pay for 24hrs). Wifi in hotel rooms - very strong + 5G. Need the room card to use elevator and the main hotel entrance locks after 1am for safety - can only be entered with room card.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel rooms are tiny I just stayed in tokyo in a similar price range hotel infact I got a better room rate there and what an amazing room. I had read great reviews about this hotel so I booked it, however after a tiring long day of all day traveling when you come to this room to sleep you end up waking up because the room gets stuffy and suffocating and when you call the staff they say you can’t control the Air Conditioner it’s centrally controlled by them. Thats the strangest thing I’ve ever heard and when I ask for the hotel manager they say its Sunday so theres no manager. In hotel business there are no Sundays , you have to have one senior authority on duty every day and in a country like Japan thats so advanced I don’t understand how I’m facing such a problem that I’m awake in the middle of the night because I’m suffocation cause of the heat that too when Its winter. I don’t recommend staying here at all.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is great to stay, very clean and silentplace. I had good sleep and staff is very kind. It is very close to kuromon market, super great. Alsi close to namba, dotonbory. I want to stay this hotel next time
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visit with my family in April.very convenient location-just in front of kuromon market.the room has enough space .the room is clean and tidy.the staff is very nice and friendly. there are lots of shampoo choice.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was larger than expected. It could be that my expectation wasn't high but it's comfortable enough for 2 grown guys. Service was great and the location is perfect - many choices for breakfast within walk distance. Bathroom size may be a bit small but again it's alright. Will come again.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location for metro journeys to Nara and wakamaya. There are many drug stores and shopping malls nearby. Breakfast food is nice-looking and delicious.Rooms are clean and quiet. Front desk ladies are nice and adorable. But the room is not very large for us, a 28-inch suitcase cannot be unfolded completely.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Advantages:1.The room is comfortable and spacious2.The bethroom is clean.3.The metro station is near.Disadvantages:1.The air condition could not be controlled by myself and sometimes it turns-off suddenly with no reason.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location near Nipponbashi station. Walkable from Namba station underground through shopping alley called Walk - take exit 5 (staircase or elevator) from Nipponbashi. Very quiet for relaxing sleep. Rooms are small, hence we opted for a superior room.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came here for an extended weekend stay to enjoy our favorite food, much of which can be had at the nearby Kuromon market. The hotel has a great location - the market is just across the road, and there is a supermarket next door. The Japanese breakfast has quite a good spread and is served until 10am (last admission 09:30).Each floor has one superior twin room - one of the key differences is a larger / semi-separated bathroom, see picture.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel located next to Nippombashi station which is a exchange station that can let you reach to other place very easily. On the other hand, the room is very clean and that can let you have a nice trip.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, friendly staff, close to the shops and tourist areas, but super tiny rooms, probably similar to most hotels in the more populated regions of Japan (We stayed in a room with barely enough space to open up 2 luggages at the same time and requiring lots of 'matrix' like manouvers to get to the toilet).Only complaint is that wifi signal doesnt work on 14th floor where we stayed, had to resort to using phones for hotspot most of the time.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel agents were great since we first arrived! Our room was very clean and has a decent amount of space. The service we received from the staff was very friendly and their English was very well spoken.The rooftop bar is beautiful and they have great breakfast and meal options.Would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my girlfriend came to Osaka as the last stop in our 6 city trip. The hotel had nice staff letting us check in a little early, and the rooms were great with the best pillows we've had. Very close to the Dotonbori.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Close to subway station 'Nipponbashi' and 'Kuromon Market'. And easy access to tourist sites.Also, staffs were very friendly. And in hotel room, there was a free mobile phone to explore tour information. It was perfect service!! Very convenient during the trip :D
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable room, convenient location. You can access this hotel in 5 minutes from subway station by walk. And there is a late-check out service for free. Price is so reasonable. I recommand for anyone who inviting Osaka
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location. 5 MIN walk to 千日前站Exit 5 & many restaurants around. Right opposite to Kuromon Market.New hotel with good facilities & breakfast with many varieties for food. Excellent. Helpful staff. Free coffee & tea
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall pleased. Kuromon market is located right across, and a lawson is beside for easy access. My room was clean, and the location is good (near nipponbashi exit 5). Only flaw is the design of the sink, which is not deep enough for me.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, just right beside Kuromon Market.I have no trouble finding the place even though it was my first time here. Hotel is in walkable distance to dontonbori and other places to go to. Many restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked 1 day more after staying with a 7-room-group. Hotel thought I “forgot” to check out after 6 other rooms did. All personal stuffs.. dirty underwear/passport & cash in Safe... were thrown out of room.Manager Ueda did not show up till next day after 2 serious complaints but the apology seemed sincere.在跟朋友一同七間住一夜前，自行加訂一晚。但於其他六間退房後，櫃檯因作業失誤，以為我‘忘了’退房，於12:30清空房間，將私人物品含鎖在保險箱的護照與現金取出。在當晚六點/八點要求經理道歉，才約到第二天下午由經理當面道歉。I see several problems that shows some front desk are not capable and rude.Hotel staff lacks sufficient training to ensure basics even like booking a room.Ignoring “do not disturb” sign and passport/cash in safe, front desk Ueyama instructed to throw my stuff into giant plastic bag at 12:30 pm; i.e. rude & poor judgement.Complaints were made to front desk at 6/8pm, manager Ueda said he was only notified at 8pm.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reasonable walking time from JR even with a 5-year-old kid.Tidy and neat. But found used map from last visitor behind the humidifier that cleaning work is not detail enough.A convenience store just next to the hotel. Will be more convenient if bottle water can be provided.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff. Near kuromon market. Free coffee. Also near train station and there is a lawson beside it. Easy to look for. They also lend free travel phone which is nice if you need wifi and mobile access.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon

review_body: Friendly Staff (Can Speak English)AccessibleCleanSpaceous RoomdGenerous AmenitiesResonably PricedI was worried to book at first because the hotel seams fairly new and it might be pricey but I was able to get good rates.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon

review_body: It’s just opposite the Kuromon market. Very convenient and near the subway station. Check in very fast and easy. The only downside is they don’t provide the mineral water in the room so you have to bring your own water bottle.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located at just a few min walk from the subway. Convenient location. Greeted by friendly staff and the reception. Hotel room is clean and neat. Comfortable bed. Toilet is a bit small but still includes a bath tub.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easily identifiable black building with a clean lobby. The check in process was fast. Though the hotel room walkway was spacious, the door height is a bit short, perhaps 190cm may need to bow slightly before entering. The overall room is clean but the bathroom feels small due to the bathtub (I love it though). The bathtub is great after a long walk in this cold weather.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location, easy to find. The hotel is near to the Nipponbashi station and dotonburi shopping area.Kuromon market is just opposite the hotel. Room is quite small but have all the things we need.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is neat and clean. Size of room is small but it is quite a norm for Japanese hotel. Helpful staff. Very near to Subway line Nippombashi and Namba station. Denden area is also walking distance. Plentiful of food area. Halal Ayam-Ya Nanba for halal restaurant.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon

review_body: Very comfortable and clean. The place is really convenient to the station you want. Definitely will book here again. Very good experience in Japan.very recommen everyone to live here for travel. We love here
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very close to Nippombashi station.It is very easy to find on the road.Thans to a Korean speaking staff, so we had a good explanation and checked in.If you sign up for membership at check-in, you will be able to check-in for one hour and check-out will be extended for one hour.It was very clean because it was a newly built building and it was easy to move to Dotonbori and Shinsaibashi. I will stay at this hotel again when I visit Osaka.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon

review_body: Fantsic location ,brand new decorations and room device, nice clerk service and considerate luggage placement.The basic service of water suppose to offer for each room, need to improve on this, others great,

review_body: Good location, good service, good room, good toilet,and good electric devices. Everything you need are in the room. It has free Wi-Fi in the room and free coffee in the Lobby. The reception of the hotel are very nice.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon

review_body: I heard usually Osaka hotel is so small. But this hotel is very enough to open our luggages. And so nice and clean. Especially loction is very nice. So quite and very close the good restaurant! Thanks

review_body: Amazing and friendly staff. Staff fluent in english. Nearby stations, restaurants and tourist areas. Approx 10mins away.Reasonable price. Definitely will go back here. I would recommend to all couple travellers

review_body: We were received with warm welcome. Staff is fluent in english. Room is clean and tidy. Room is quite spacious unlike other hotels that we stayed it. Room also has a modern feel to it. Location of this hotel is quite near to the nearest train station and popular tourist area.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were greeted with a warm welcome even if we arrived the hotel in the evening at 10pm. Receptionists were very detailed going through the steps and details on thr use of the hotels facilities.Room as very practical, complete with everything you need. Everything is working very well, hassle free. Sockets and USB port available for Charging for the convenience of a traveller’s stay. Most of all the hotel and the room we stayed in is all new and Very clean.We are very happy with our experience. Near everything we needed to be and Serviced like a 5 star hotel.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing and friendly staff. Nearby stations and restaurants. Kuromon market is just a few steps away.Free coffee at the lobby. Reasonable price. Definitely will go back here. Recommend to all couple travellers
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon

review_body: If you want to visit Osaka, WBF hotel maybe is one of good choices to you. There are well equipment , friendly staff, comfortable place,and the most important is it’s perfect location to travel and go shopping in Osaka.

review_body: Great hotel with clean room and top locationWe have a twin bed room in Feburary, the staffs are well polited and the room is new and clean. I asked the front desk to make a reservation of a restaurant with no problem. Eill come back again

Special request for pillow is available Location is just opposite Kuromon marketJust 5 minute to station

review_body: This hotel is very convenience for walking to Dontonburi and shopping area. Room was clean ans comfortable, hotel staff are very kind and cute, they've good service mind. Next time if you come to Japan i will stay this hotel again.

review_body: The hotel is in the walking distance from Namba station and many places including Kuromon market, Dōtonbori, Namba Parks, etc. Rooms are comfortable and very clean. Service is great. This hotel is a great deal.

review_body: Easy access within 2mins walk from subway 日本橋exit 10,have lift to take not have to carry luggage.Easy access to everywhere.kuro.Front desk receptionist can speak flunent Chinese don’t need to worry about lanaguage.

review_body: Nice hotel, clean, good service, good location. Will be back definitely Stayed here on the 7th & 9th of February, and returned for the last night in Osaka, on the 11th of February 2019. Had the best Okonomiyaki in Okasa which is located right behind the hotel. Glico Man famous sign is also 10 mins walking distance from hotel. Takashimaya is 10 mins walking distance from hotel. Will definitely recommend and return to this hotel for future stays !

review_body: room is very clean, but kinda small, good service. good location, with public transit, convenient store right around the corner, central to couple key osaka tourist hotspot. data cell phone to go while in osaka area. recommend!

review_body: Nice hotel, excellent location. Close to many food stalls and Kuromon market, easy access to metro lines. Rooms are small (to be expected for this price in a large Japanese city) but clean and well equipped.

review_body: It is best and nice new hotel in Osaka. Is just opposite of Kuromon Market. It is new and the best is the rooftop bar. Walking distance to Dotombori Namba and subway stations. I fully recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon

review_body: A place where nearby the market , public transport and 24hoyr convenient store . A room with nice bed pillow and toilet where u can rest yourself comfortably. And the most important thing is the price .
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location with only a few minutes walk to Dotonbori and right by the Nipponbashi metro station. Staff was very helpful and friendly. Good breakfast that was served on the 15th flood with a nice view of the city.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was the first time to Osaka for me and my husband, it was a last minute trip for us, we booked the flights and tickets 3 days before the date of departure. We are glad we picked Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon. Location We took the Nankai Line (¥920) from Kansai Airport which stops directly at Namba Station, travel time took approximately 50 mins.Value for MoneyClean, comfortable and well equipped. Complimentary Coffee and Tea at the lobby till 12am.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon

review_body: A place near public transportation and convenient stores. Near with dotonburi glico sign and kuromon ichiban. Love this place a lot and will definitely come back again for leisure. They even provide free coffee and tea at their lobby which is very convenient for coffee lovers.

review_body: This hotel is an excellent one. My friend and I are very satisfied all the services its provided. Staff are nice and helpful. It worths to live again! Helpful staff, good building, everything is good!

review_body: Close to subway and Easy to find great food.No step inside the hotel,so wheelchair is free to go everywhere.As for safety reason,the hotel will lock the entrance at 12.All the staff are very helpful.But the room is small.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good located and convenient. Service is outstanding, also gave us relaxing sheet and face wash after checkin, shampoo and body wash supplied in the room is top end brand. Recommended , but there are few wbf hotel in namba , make sure you navigate to the right one, accidentally walked to another hotel wbf in namba which is 1.1km away. End up took a taxi back to the right place cost me 660 yen. Sigh.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was good thanks close to amenities. Short walk to koromon market and about 10 minutes walk to Namba station. Room is clean and reasonable size for Japanese hotel standard. A few restaurants nearby which was handy.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Generally good, room size small as usual but very acceptable by Japan big city standards. Close to amenities and shopping streets. Lovely ramen shop nearby. Staff unable to find our booking for 30 minutes but eventually sorted.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 離日本橋和黑門市場非常近，走路三分鐘即可到達。有中文服務員，令人覺得親近；房間乾淨簡單，整體服務品質很好。 The hotel is very close to Nippombashi station and くろもんいちば, It only takes three minutes to the place, very convenient for tourists. The hotel staff can speak Chinese and English well, It is friendly to me. But breakfast here is predictable, there is still room for further improvement.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 每天的早餐大同小異，吃第二次就覺得很膩了，早餐的選擇性也不多，長住的話不建議每天吃。 The breakfast always The same every day. It is predictable when I eat Second day. Choice of the breakfast is not much. If you need to long stay, highly recommend not to eat breakfast Every day . You have other choice better than it.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This new hotel really provides everything you could have possibly need or might have forgotten to pack (even pajamas & slippers). If you join their free membership club, there are even more benefits! The room was small, clean and comfortable with everything we needed. It is conveniently located near the subway, restaurants, shops and convenience stores. They also provide free smartphone with internet that you can take with you while exploring. The customer service went above and beyond! The front desk employees gave us a map with popular sites, restaurants, etc. and gave us recommendations on where to eat as well adjusting the free smartphone to our language. One fun little perk here was a shampoo and conditioner bar, you can select from a variety of different shampoos and conditioners to take to your room and try during your stay. All we can say is “Thank you for making our stay in Osaka great and making us feel at home!”
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had such a lovely time staying at this hotel. It’s conveniently located right near Nipponbashi Station, and only a short walk to Dotonburi. There is a convenience store right next door. Breakfast was served on the top floor—great view and great Japanese-style breakfast buffet (not especially vegetarian-friendly, but there was enough to get by). The room was a great size for us, immaculate, and had a small fridge, kettle, hairdryer, shoe care things, and best of all, a Handy phone (a free phone with wifi that you can use for free, which was so useful when exploring Osaka). There are also umbrellas you can borrow at the front desk if the weather calls for it. The staff were always so friendly and always patient with our broken Japanese (the staff we encountered mostly spoke very good English anyway).
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my partner for 3 nights in January 2019. This was the end of our 5 week trip to Japan and one of the most relaxing, comfortable places we stayed. Standard Japanese sized hotel room, with very comfy bed and clean bathroom and shower. Unlike some hotels, the bathroom was an appropriate size, and I didn’t feel like a monster trying to squeeze through doors. The staff all spoke English and went above and beyond to help you with any request. If your package doesn’t include it, you can purchase a Japanese buffet style breakfast for 1200 yen. Very tasty selection, but not many vegetarian options. The hotel is about 30 metres from Nippombashi station, which is a short walk from Namba station, made easier if you go via the underground walkway called “Namba Walk”. We had a lovely time here, 10/10 would stay again.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for 9 nights as we like to use Osaka as a base of operations and take day trips through Kansai.The hotel is new and modern. English friendly hotel reception.Bedroom and bathroom are very clean. Fresh towels and toiletries every morning.We had a twin room so it was very spacious. Be warned though as the double is very small.Twin I could open both suitcases on the spare floor space. Double you cannot open any except on the bed.Right next to Nipponbashi subway. 10-15 min walk to Namba or JR Namba. Dotonbori and Shinsaibashi at your doorstep. Plenty of night life and food to choose from.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First travel with my friend. He search online and choose this hotel. The environment is comfortable and nice.The service is also good. Breakfast is good and there are many kinds to choose. We have a good time here in this hotel.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The service is very impressive,and the staff is polite and patient，giving you a thorough illustration . The room is new,exquisite,and comfortable. It’s a nice experience for me to stay in Japan and deserves recommendation.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 매우매우 친절하시고 제공되는 것들이 많습니다. 잠옷, 칫솔치약, 샴푸린스 등등. 호텔 시설도 깔끔하고 좋습니다. They are very kind. And provide many convenient things like shampoo, toothbrush set, sleeling clothes. Rooms are clean and wide comparing to another Japan hotels.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: People here were so kind and some services were imperessive. Shampoo and conditioner were provided free to use and we could borrow umbrella immedietely as well. Lawson, family mart ,convenient stores are right next to hotel.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 環境乾淨，大廳寬敞，交通方便，步行即可抵達心齋橋商圈、難波車站。The environment is very clean, the lobby is wide and cozy, traffic being convenient and visitor friendly. One can walk easily from the hotel location to 心齋橋商圈 and 難波車站 etc.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very modern and nice. The people are very kind, and the place is very comfy. I would totally recommend it! loved the place! All the furniture is amazing. I am sure I will come back again on my next trip.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my 4th times trip in osaka but this is the best hotel ever stayed. Brand new building and such a clean guest room gave me a postive first impression as well as kind staff. The price is very reasonable and you will know that there is no such place that you can stay with this price in namba. Trust me and try to stay with this hotel.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a wonderful surprise. Brand new, very clean, helpful and friendly staff. Location is just perfect; lots of key Osaka things to do nearby. Beds very comfortable. Great street food and markets just a street away. Highly recommend. I’m very happy.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very convenient with free phone with WiFi to borrow. Nice design, very new and clean. Across kuromon market easy access to many attractions and airport. Would highly recommend. Bigger than Japanese standard
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 房間很大，設備很新。交通便利：黑門市場對面，非常靠近日本橋電氣城;到難波站約10分鐘。我下次來大阪時會選擇這個房間。The rooms are big and the equipment is new. Convenient transportation: Opposite the Black Gate market, it is very close to Nihonbashi Electric City; about 10 minutes to Namba Station. I will choose this room next time I come to Osaka.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good, the device is so new.However, the services is not ready, many details are missing. The checkout time is too early, 10am. I never check out so early. The front desk English is poor, nobody can speak English. This is a hotel only service the real janpanese.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 非常棒的一間酒店！大堂漂亮不在話下，大堂更提供24小時咖啡，非常適合我，還有有很多種洗頭水可以選擇，太捧了！另外，這裏保安嚴密，要用房間的門咭拍咭才可以按動升降機，這樣就不怕有其他閒人進入啦！還有，這裏的職員好到不得了！細心解釋各種事項。進了房間，嘩，好好呢！浴室裝修十分之漂亮，可以舒舒服服的洗個澡，床鋪亦十分不錯，非常滿意這晚! This is a very great hotel, I recommend you all to choose this hotel!
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice room and excellent service!The room is very clean and the staff is very nice. However, it is easy to hear sounds coming from other rooms. To sum up, WBF will be a perfect choice for those who are searching for hotels in Namba. I would like to stay here whenever I come to Osaka again.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very near for Namba Station. And the room is very clean. So I think it is one of the best hotel in the Osaka City. And TV works fast, BATHROOM is very clean. It has modern design. Last, it has a USB ports.
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our experience in the hotel is bad. The hotel staff shouted at us for staying in the 15th floor. We didn't know that it was off-limits past12am but he was shouting "Out! Out!" Will not come back again
hotelName:
17    Hotel WBF Namba Kuromon
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you come in from KIX, alight at Nippombashi station and use the elevator to get to Nippombashi dori. Head towards Denden town and you should see Kurumon market on your left as you walk along. After some 700 meters or so, you should reach Sarasa hotel on your right. It looks new and the reception has English speaking staff on hand. Room size is decent for a Japanese hotel and bathroom amenities are complete. The hotel is also within walking distance to Dontoburi, Kurumon market, Hozenzi temple and Denden town. I would stay here again the next time I am in Osaka without. 2nd thought.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this hotel is about 10mins walk from namba station. it is easy to be location along a usy street.check in is possible at 3pm and you can drop your luggage at lobby. else you can also pay to get in easy at a price per hour.room is bigger then ibis Kyoto and I can open my luggage wide in the room. I have 2 single beds.wifi is not super fast but doable. as for eateries, there are a lot of shops along the small alley getting to the hotel. also a Lawson is nearby, within my vision. the famous wet sushi sashimi ( kurumon) market is only 2 traffic lights away so it is a very good place to stay.I will come back again...
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 有中文服務人員，鄰近有兩間lawson和大國藥妝。距離難波站較近，10點就得退房，wifi速度慢。About 5 walk mins to nanba station.住宿雙床房，隔音很差，打掃的吸塵器聲音聽的很清楚，敲門聲也是，房間木紋地板易滑。The bathroom is too small.房間空間適中，浴室很狹窄天花板矮、浴缸高，跨入不易，浴缸底部無防滑，又缺少扶手，不適合老人家。蓮蓬頭的水量強勁，水溫穩定是唯一優點。
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Don't expect too much from Japan city hotel. It's pretty small everywhere. For 3 pax, it's pretty good size for the price and near Namba station. It's near to Nankai Airport direct train station and exit. A long walk to other line but still doable. The hotel is at Den Den Town Nipponbashi, where all the anime you can get!
