Also near to Kuromon Ichiba Market, all you can eat kobe beef, sashimi and sushi.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. Smartphone, pyjamas and slippers are provided. The coin-operated washing machines, dryers and vending machine for drinks are on level 2. The hotel is near Kuromon market and between Namba and Nipponbashi stations. There are 2 Lawsons convenient stores and many food outlets around the hotel. If arriving by the Nankai train, exit from level 1, next to Takashimaya and diagonally facing the Tower Records / Loft / Muji building, turn right and walk till you see Namba City. Cross the roads and walk along the row of buildings with the 5-storey Diaso. Keep walking until you see 2 Lawsons - 1 on the left and 1 diagonally on the left. Turn right into Sakai Suji and Sarasa hotel is next to Business Hotel Kikuei.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was located decently close to Namba Nankai Station. The room had markings on the walls and the floor had a bit of garbage when I arrived. The toilet sometimes makes noises continuously until you flush again later. The bathroom is also very dark especially after closing the shower curtain to shower. The room was not soundproof at all, I could hear people in the halls as well as my neighbours. I heard conversations a family had with their child who was unwilling to take a bath. It wasn't a cheap stay either which is why i ranked it average. There also was no free water given in the room which was a perk I got at APA hotels in other parts of Japan. The TV was small and only had Japanese channels.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are extremely accommodating and helped me very much when I lost my phone in the shopping centre in Umeda, calling up the services there, arranging a pass and getting me a taxi. The room is compact, the bathroom very tiny, the view wasn't good. The breakfast was ok, specialised more on Japanese breakfast compared to Western breakfast but it wasn't bad. But overall the service given at the hotel was just brilliant and it's close to several stations as well as being about 10 minutes walk to the trendy Dotomburi area. Would recommend for a short stay
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a short walk from Nankai Namba Station (about 5-10 min) and was my base for 5 days. I feel safe around the area even travelling alone. Although the subway is a bit further away but I got used to it. This might be a problem or tiring for older folks but when travelling in Japan there is a lot of walking.I got a single room which is sufficient and the standard size of any Japanese hotel. The luggage stand was big enough for my luggage and there are drawers to keep my shopping/stuff away so the room do not look to untidy.Staff were friendly and greet every guest that return or leaving the hotel. My check-in & check-out was also very prompt and easy.I didn't book the room with breakfast so cannot comment on the breakfast. There are many small eatery around the hotel so getting breakfast was not a problem.The hotel also provide a free smartphone for use during the stay so that was helpful but I didn't use it.I'm not sure if the hotel store luggage for longer period, e.g. while I check-out and check-in again in 1-2 days. On the day of check-out, they keep my luggage and I picked it up later in the day when I leave for the airport (so I think that is quite standard service).
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is quite new and it is located in Namba less than 10 mins walking to Nankai train station. Rooms are pretty small, especially not enough space to manage 2 big luggage’s (you need to open them on the bed). Personnel is very kind but not all can speak English. The hotel does not have any specific facility
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed just 1 night on the day of arrival. It’s closely located to station and very convenient to travel around such as Dotonbori, Guromon seafood market etc. The room is small but it’s average size of hotel room in Japan.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No regrets to stay there. Just a bit far to walk from the station. Minimum 10 minutes depending on crowd size and traffic. If you don't have a lot of luggage to carry, I highly recommend it. Decent breakfast and nice staff.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was contemplating whether to post this review as didn't want more people to discover this hidden gem in Osaka. Well, here it goes.We opted for a Japanese-western room to cater to 3 adults and a child. Hotel room was ready when we checked in around 1 pm although the indicated time was 3pm. Thankful for that and rare in Japan!Room was immaculately tidy with 2 western beds and 2 beds on tatami ready. Am sure it can sleep 2 more pax if needed. There was also a couch, coffee table and dining/tea table. Room was super huge by Japanese standard for the price. Toiletries amenities were adequate throughout our 4 night's stay. Toilet and shower are separate areas.Very near to Namba station and away from the main hustle and bustle of Osaka which could be too overwhelming for some. Near to a handful of convenience shops and eateries. 5 mins to Kuromon Market for fresh seafood. Anime fans will love this area as it's surrounded by anime-related shops.Just one grouse. No place to hang towel and clothes when taking a shower.Definitely opt for this hotel again if coming back to Osaka.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 2 nights at sarasa, location consider ok because just near to namba station with walking distance around 5 mins, but if u looking take JR namba then will abit far which need walking around 15 mins + room is consider spacious for 1 person as they located me for twin bed room..but the cleaning service should need improved because found duster floor and some of the hidden place..bed a bit hard and pillow not comfort. Value for money..yes, because consider cheap.comparing to others 3 star hotel.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After having stayed in super cram hotels in the Shinsaibashi district, I'm glad to have found this hotel! It's easily accessible from the Kansai Airport (even if you arrive on the SQ night flight) - just take the Nankai train direct to Namba station. Once you exit from the Shinkansen tracks (you will be on 3rd floor), look for the escalators or lift to take you to 1st floor. Then look for Takashimaya or the East exit towards Den Den town (it's quite a small exit so do look out for it!) Cross the traffic light and there are a few ways that you can walk towards the hotel. You can look for SEGA down the road and walk straight past the carpark, the hotel just opposite this white unique looking building (some national archives) - inside the sheltered walkway along the shop houses! There's a conbini just across the cross junction so it's pretty convenient and there are many other shops just down the road to Namba station. I absolutely adore the wooden floors !! Instead of the carpeted floors inside the rooms which traps dust, these floors are much better and makes you feel more at home! :) Will definitely be back when I visit Osaka! It's a 15 mins walk to Namba Hatch if you are going to attend some lives there but have limited budget, you can stay at this hotel!
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As others have reviewed this is as good value and location as you can get in the Namba/Dotonburi area at $80/night. 10 minutes walk to Namba/Dotomburi and Kuromon Food Market (2 minutes) Clean and bright entry and friendly staff. Reminder 3p checkin/10a checkout. Small problem was just a dirty toilet area (rare for Japan). but everything else perfectly adequate. Lots of tourists so get ready for noisy and volume. Good for one overnight, but might not stay 2/3 nights. Breakfast restaurant looked average but well priced at $9. Good luck and enjoy.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A new hotel within a walking distance from Nanbai station. 5 minutes to Nipponbashi metro station. Very convenient to travel around by public transport. 5 minutes walk to 黑門市場, walking distance to shinsaibashi and 道頓堀. Good size room according to Japanese standard. It was cheap, might be because it was new. Room facilities were good. We just stayed one night, and did not know the quality of housekeeping. Yet, the room was clean.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in a deluxe twin with the sofa bed for a triple, very small room, barely enough room for 3 people with the luggage. Very clean though. Excellent location, near Kuromon market and dotonbori street, easy access to subway.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at a luxurious twin room with a sofa bed for 4 nights at the hotel it was comfortable, very clean, large enough for the 2 of us and our luggage it could actually accommodate 3 persons. But the bathroom was small it was pretty cramped taking a shower and there is also a wash basin outside the bathroom. The staff was very polite and courteous. But Breakfast was a disappointment there were very limited food choices.They had good wifi signal and a laundry room on the 2nd floor. There are lot of stores nearby the hotel Lawson convenience store and McDonalds are a few meters away. Namba and Dotonbori was a few minutes walk. I hope they would add some english channels on TV. Nevertheless, we had a very nice stay at hotel.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel had small rooms (which we expected) but it was impeccably clean. The staff at the reception desk spoke really good English. The laundry on the 2nd floor was very convenient. The location is awesome, easy walking distance from Namba stations, Dotombori and Kuromon market.We didn't eat breakfast here, there are lots of places to eat nearby or pick something up at the station if you are heading out and about. We wouldn't to stay there again if heading back to Osaka.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this is a comfortable hotel in a very good location close to Namba station. It was good value for money and the staff were friendly and helpful. the room was not very big but was fine as I was only staying a few days. The breakfast was good with a variety of food on offer. Very good wiFi
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I stayed here for one night in December 2016. The Hotel is walking distance from Namba station - once you figure out which exit to take and orientate yourself it is easy to find. It is on a busy street opposite what looks like an abandoned department store. It is a simple and clean hotel with staff that speak Chinese/English/Japanese. We had one 3yo and two adults in a room. While it is not large it was big enough for a night. The best thing about this hotel is what you get for the price. It is cheap compared to other clean hotels near Namba station. I would stay here again. There are plenty of places to eat and shop nearby.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The immediate surroundings of the hotel can be offputting - you've got to walk away from it to get some nicer vibes. The rooms were no nonsense - no coffee just tea bags, pillows were hard but staff were nice enough to provide softer ones upon request; hardly any English spoken but chanced upon the manager who fluently spoke English and was very helpful. Brand new hotel but lacks warmth.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked a triple room, it was big, clean and cozy. The hotel is close to the Nanba City and Nankai Electric Railway “Nanba Station”, quite convenience. The most important thing is the inexpensive rate! Highly recommend it.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in their special Ninja room and it was a pleasant one! The room was decorated with ninja paraphernalia and ryokan styled. The bathroom was a tad small but the tub was fabulous...toiletries provided were of high quality - Pola Gold series & room was superbly clean. Staff was friendly and one even dressed up as a reindeer during the Christmas season. Breakfast was decent, limited choices though. Conveniently located near many restaurants,shops and mini marts. Within close walking distance to subways as well. Had the best Tonkatsu ramen just 2mins away...no regrets!
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Getting around in Osaka isnt as easy as in Tokyo, good thing Sarasa is easy to find. From airport, take Nankai Namba Aiports express train, stop at Namba. Then walk about 350mtr or follow Google Map, Sarasa Nipponbashi should be there. The hotel is located in the heart of Den Den town, the anime culture area. Also close to Namba area, the second most crowded area in Osaka after Umeda/Osaka. Near the hotel there are Namba Parks and Namba City with many shops. Kuromon market or the fish market is also very close by. If you wonder why they call it Sarasa Nipponbashi, its because you can also get off at Nipponbashi Station which is 1 stop before Namba Station.When we reach the hotel, it was late in the afternoon. Greeted by the GM Mr. Tetsuya Nunoi, who is very nice and fast in handling our rooms. The rooms were roomy, we get the double bed with sofa bed for our family. It was clean and somehow advanced. USB plug was on the wall, 2 at the desk, and 2 at bedside. Make it easy to recharge your gadget.. I like it. The bed was nice and simple. The AC is motion activated so you wont get too warm or too cold when you sleep. Amenities was allright, and there are extre sink outside the bathroom (something you dont see at other hotel), so dont have to wait if the loo is taken.Too bad for the TV channel with only 10 channels available, no cable yet since this is newly open establishment.Breakfast was surprise because I thought it would be too simple. Yes it was simple, yet it was nice. A combination of western and japanese breakfast, with great japanese style black cofee and tea. The only downside is the tray and the plastic plates that they use is somehow too simple. The tray was also slippery, so watch out when you tilt it, the plate might fall off. Overall, I am happy with the breakfastWhat makes this hotel more convenient was the laundry and dryer machine available on 2nd floor. This made us easier since did have a long stay at this hotel. There are also plenty of food around the hotel, easy for you to try traditional japanese food, not mall food. In short, I would return to Sarasa again when I visit Osaka next time. With a short walk from the station, you can check in to a nice, simple and yet comvenient hotel to stay. I would recommend it for a family with either short or long stay in Osaka.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: New hotel with biggest room size and good facilities too. Comfort bed. Good location, it's not far from Nippombashi Station you can walk to hotel in 5 minutes. Can walk to Dotonbori ,Namba, Shinsaibashi shopping street with in 10 minutes, Around the hotel it's so good for game and gundum lover. And you can find food and convenient store alot. Yes, Kuromon market too.
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Newly opened hotel in Nov 2016, thus everything is still new!The service was prompt and free breakfast buffet for all guests! Food not bad.Room is standard small, slipper, pyjamas, amenities provided.Clean and prompt room service.Location is good, few mins away from Namba station exit E9.Do note though from station exit to exit E9 is quite a walk and confusing.We spent almost 15mins trying to figure out which way to go.Find sign pointing to Namba Den Den or Loft/Muji/Tower record.Turn left toward direction of Lawson and walk straight. Turn to your right on the crossroad of Lawson. The hotel is just one min away.Foods and small supermarkets/stores everywhere along the way.We will return if the price is kept low (we spent ard 140 SGD a night).
hotelName:
18    Sarasa Hotel Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, and superb service! The hotel is within minutes of walking distance from subway and train stations. Everything in the hotel was superb: clean, great breakfast, friendly staff, large lounge, convenient wifi password. It even provided a smartphone for guests to take outside. The smartphone had a free unlimited 4G internet connection and domestic/international calling. What more can they think of!
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were there for 5 nights. The room itself was very small for 3 people. The bathroom is reasonable size and separate toilet is good. We had to remove some of the furniture out of our room so we had space to put our suitcases. Friendly customer service. The location is ok. It takes about 10-15 minutes walking to Namba/Dotombori centre. I gave 3 star for small room size even though we have paid extras for bigger room.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is 5 minute walk from the subway station.It is surrounded by the supermarket,family mart,circle k and there are quite a lot of restaurant.The room is clean and tidy. It equipped with the handy phone.The front desk staff is nice and helpful.She try her best to exchange the coin with me and I really appreciate her!
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are adequate with the usual amenities and furniture. What is not normal is there are no bottles of water unless you choose not to have your bed linens changed! The staff and cleaners are very efficient and extremely polite as the culture of Japan dictates. The breakfast is substantial but I really missed the fruits as the fruits are of the frozen variety and a small bowl where after you scooped, you seem to have taken all the fruit! What I find really uncomfortable is that the cooked eggs are cold (from the fridge)!! I have to soak them in hot water or soup so as not to eat chilled cold eggs. Location wise, this hotel is strategically placed - there is a huge supermarket nearby, food streets just a few minutes walk and the Railway Station is 10 mins. The underground station is 5 mins. It is very convenient especially to/fro airport where the airport express rail is cheap and very regular. You cant miss the terminal stop of Namba Railway station.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decent size room with storage for the bags and proper bathroom size. This great value for money and easy to get around with a metro 500meters away and the Namba area 10 mins walk, great coffee at Brooklyn roasting company not far away, which was convenient each day. Staff where accommodating as we extended our stay and kept the same room with just an update to their system.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Sheraton and Westin before but this time we choose Richmond. The hotel is quite convenient and a 3-min walk from subway station and unexpectedly quit during the night time.Reception staff is very helpful and check-in was very smooth. We even joined the Richmond club and got the extension of check-out time till 12:00 noon.Similar to some hotels in this class, the room is a bit small. However, our bed is big enough for 2 adults and a kid. Will definitely try the other properties of Richmond!
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got a 3-bed room for 4 of us (2 adults and 2 kids). The room given to us was small already for 2 beds. How much more for 3 beds. There was no place to open our luggages. We had to open the big luggage by the entrance which makes it very inconvenient to go in and out the door. We found small pockets of spaces for the small luggages. With the luggages and the beds, there is pretty much no space to walk.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is so clean and thoughtful. We stayed 2 nights as part of a tour and were pleasantly surprised. The breakfadt is great with so many choices and every need of their guests is catered for. The staff are all so friendly and amazing. Would stay again for sure.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel again and recommend it for short stays in Osaka particularly if you plan to make exploring Namba the highlight of your trip.It's a short taxi drive away from the middle of Namba and is very affordable, one of the most well priced hotels during Golden Week that I could find. recommend
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at near a handful of Richmond's over the years and am consistently happy. Room was smaller than some locations but definitely worked. Breakfast was nicely done with good local variety which is something I have noticed they do in their locations.From the subway station it is maybe a 7 minute walk and maybe 15 to Namba station. The area around it has everything you would need for a late night snack or errand but since you are away from central Osaka or dotonbori you end up with a significant cost savings.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros (1) close to train station exit 1 subway station Daikokucho Station (2) Elevator - exit 6 turn left/ cross over the road towards exit 3 direction turn left (2) Convenience Stores 2 Family Mart (3) Buffet Breakfast is OK, in terms of combination of Japanese and Western styles. Healthy choice.Cons (1) Noise - Street, Parking Station low level guest rooms (2) no safe in the hotel room (3) no complimentary bottle of water (3) breakfast buffet restaurant is not spacious/ small. Guests had to wait in front of the restaurant (4) Staff traininig needed - I was in trouble, because the staff did not tell the taxi driver propety, where to go exactly, although I told them Osaka Station was a big station and there were many places to get on trains to the Airport.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are not very big but adequate and pretty new. Location is very convenient, about 10 minutes walk to Namba station and as well as the shopping malls and district nearby. Rooms are pretty well maintained and room keeping does a fairly good job in general. Easy to find food if you bother to walk around!
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This very modern clean and comfortable hotel ideally located near the railway station very close to vibrant night life and good eating places.A very warm welcome by all staffVery good value for money
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its a perfect stay for the price me and my wife paid. Stayed for 9 nights here. Very clean room. Not so spacious but i guess its normal here in Japan, unless you get a suite. Laundry is available at 400 yen, self service. Very friendly staff. They provide you with all charging cable for your gadget. We didn’t get the breakfast here, but halal food is available upon request. Halal restaurants closeby: Vitty, Honolu Ramen, Ayam-ya. Walkable distance. Very close to Namba Park and Takashimaya. For travelling around, the metro is just ard 500m away. Imamiya JR station is around 1km, if you are heading to Universal Studio Japan. The famous Dontomburi is around 20 min walk. Convenient stores are all around this hotel.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was located within an easy walk of Exit 4 of the Daikokucho station on the Midosuji line--the train line where almost everything is located. The staff is friendly and accommodating and the rooms are not only nice, but come with a smart device for your use around the city and universal chargers. The hotel is also located near several konbinis (convenience stores), a grocery store, and a non-tourist fish market near the Ebisu Shrine, which is also a short walk away. Breakfast has local and seasonal specialties. When I arrived in fall, they were serving takoyaki and mackerel for breakfast, among the usual Japanese and western offerings. Hotel definitely catered more to the business set, but I liked that. I'd definitely stay here again in Osaka.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fairly spacious rooms for a Japanese Hotel. Richmond Hotels have a few other advantages to other hotels - a laundromat and a device with free internet/phone calls that you can take around to travel whilst you are staying at the hotel. The "Handy" device has no range limit, as we brought it along to day trips to Himeji, Nara and Kyoto with no issues.This hotel is also very close to the Namba district, which I believe is one of the best places to stay. A few blocks from a train station. Only issue is that people that want to maximise the JR rail pass might want to stay nearer to Osaka instead (though I prefer Namba)
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: About 400 m from exit 1 of daikokucho exit. To check location look for the big sign - pachinko slots (arrow) - that is the corner where you will turn right. About 800 m to Namba naikan station (airport rapit train)
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose to stay here for 5 nights across the weekend. Main reason we stayed here is because of the reasonable room rate for a long stay and has self-service laundry. Our room size is about 20m sq. Although the room size is just enough, it does has a nice big television. Thumbs up!!Hotel is located near plenty of useful places such as 3 mins walk to subway station on the popular Midosuji Line. There are 2 FamilyMart stores nearby. A large supermarket (Life) on the other side of the main road. A great 100 yen plate sushi train restaurant less than 100 metre away. I would consider staying at this hotel again if I travel to Kansai region again.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After reading a few of the reviews, I was shocked to receive such excellent service with a very comfortable sized room and state of the art 5 star facilities in the room. There is a charger for every single type of phone by the desk and was quite easy to get to. If you like walking, it is walking distance (~20mins) to the famous shopping and food streets of Osaka!
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is quite good, but I think we had bad luck. We booked a non smoking room, but the room had an incredible smoke smell. It was quite disgusting.Apart from this, the hotel y good. Quite new, you can pay with credit card without problems. Is not far from Dotonbori street and is well communicated.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a business hotel in my opinion, a place for you to sleep and do activities outside all day. The location is nearby the train station (5 minutes by walk) and only 1 stop away to Dotonbori, but you can reach it by walk for sure, it was only around 18 minutes away. The room size in nearly normal, not as small as I experienced in Tokyo, so we could still have 2 big luggages inside, without have to waste our time in deciding who's turn to open the luggage :) But although they cleaned it everyday, I don't know why but the tables were always dusty. The staffs were nice and helpful and the laundry room is 24 hr. Only 2 minutes walk, there was a sushi restaurant where all the sushi are 100 yen, delicious with reasonable price. Around the hotel you can meet some bars and there was school nearby too so you could listen to the bells and kids laughter. It was a nice experience.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located with 5 minutes walk from Daikokucho subway station or 15 minutes walk from Namba subway station. There is a game centre opposite to the hotel entrance. There are many different types of restaurants nearby. The hotel room is clean and equipped with big TV, nice bathroom and toilet. The size is average in Japan. The windows faced a multi-storeys parking building. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful. However, we need to check out at the kiosk rather than at counter.The buffet breakfast is good and guests can take out coffee.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a mere 15 minute walk to the great Dotonbori area where you will find some great food and shopping areas.The rooms were a great size and the Pola amenities fantastic. Hotel staff were all so friendly and spoke english well.Our room included buffet breaky which wasnt great for westerner meals however I didnt starve and that being the only con i would most definitely stay again and recommend to friends and family.The hotel is around a 5min walk from the subway so easy to get around osaka and the Shin osaka station to catch the Shinkansen from is a short subway ride away on the same line
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Liked everything about this place from the complimentary toiletries we were gifted at check in, to the wide choice of breakfast (the best we've experienced in Japan) and the location- easily walkable from Namba shudder if the city which is where we tended to end up
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in double room including breakfast on 20 February. - Hotel is new but the room is too small- The bed size is about 4.5 feet wide. - Toilet size is normal but not enough table space for placing cosmetics and other things.- Self laundry provided on the 5th and 10th floor. - may choose cool or warm air inside room even in winter.- 10 minutes walk to metro Daikokuchō Station (大国町駅) , 20 minutes to metro Namba Station, 15 minutes to Namba Station of Nankai Electric Railway- Not too much shops or restaurant nearby, shopping malls mainly at Namba Station.- Free coffee and fruit juice available at the G/F restaurant before 6 pm.- Speed of computer at the lobby is a little bit slow. We had to print some document. They charged us 10 Yen per piece of paper but the printer did not work. The staff tried to fix it but in vain. To take some time, it printed out the document but it was blurred. We could not use the printout finally and they did not refund the fee for us.- We paid for the breakfast but it was general. The fruit was canned but not fresh one. Octopus balls were cold even in pan. To compare the price, you may consider to have breakfast outside.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are small but adequate as per japanese standards. However the the subway is a short walk away so its extremely convenient to get around Osaka quickly.The breakfast which was included was Japanese and superb. Namba district is only a short walk away
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When you happen to be in OSAKA, this hotel is a good choice! Great location - a short walk to Namba Park & mall as well as Dotonbori & Shinsaibashi areas. There's an amusement building/center (Pachinco) nearby but is not an issue at all. There are a number of various 24-hour convenience stores. There are also quite a few good restaurants within the area.Reception staff are all accommodating & friendly and can speak English. One of their female staff who welcomed us during check-in as well as the male staff who entertained us on check-out are both pleasant and service-oriented. Great customer service it is! What's nice also are the free toiletries ( ORGANIC and has good scent for BODY WASH plus black/charcoal-made cotton buds?) and they gave us also welcome kits of toiletries upon check-in which is an added plus! Of course, room size is not that big but a standard room is manageable for 2 adults. Nice bathroom. My husband and I slept comfortably for the whole duration of our stay - 5 nights! Their breakfast also is not that pricey and has good selection of both local & Western food. We enjoyed the breakfasts we had and their staff as well were pleasant to deal with - very helpful. They would ask if you want to take-out coffee in cups if you are leaving the restaurant. Cool! Would recommend this hotel and go back if ever there's an opportunity to visit OSAKA again.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel did not stand out for anything, good or bad. I thought it was a generic-looking hotel in a lifeless neighborhood. Just unmemorable and couldn't help but feel that there had to be better hotels in Osaka (Actually found a better option on my return to Osaka a week after -- see my review on Hotel Monterey Lasoeur).
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for two nights at the Richmond at the end of our stay in Japan. Our room was a Hollywood Twin it was compact, but well designed. Clean. Comfortable beds. Little extras like a welcome pack of beauty products, good quality coffee bags in the room and an electric pants press were appreciated - but the highlight was the toilet. The best in all travels in Japan. Automatic seat lift and pipped music, all the usual bidet functions and more.Two coin operated laundries on site - able to buy washing powder at reception. Buffet breakfast adequate. Very strict about checkout time - got a reminder call when we five minutes late and advised that if we did not checkout within five minutes we would be charged extra but they kept our luggage in the store room till our late flight out of Osaka.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location - 10min walk from centre of Osaka. Good breakfast buffet selection, ok sized rooms, very good shower, nice staff. Supermarkets and malls within walking distance. Taxis available outside
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Last May 8,9 and 10th 2016 my family spent part of our sojourn to Japan in Osaka where we stayed at the Richmond Hotel. The reception during check in took a bit of time but just worked out fine. Since our pick up for the next day's tour was quite early we asked if we could bring packed breakfast. We were told that if we would opt for take out breakfast we would be given a fruit cake and non other. Well what to do ,so we had to wait until the restaurant opened at 6am and eat with a great sense of urgency as our pick up was at 6:30am. The spread was very nice but one cannot truly appreciate it given less than 30mins to enjoy it. The rooms are cute but functional , the coffee in a drip bag was splendid . But the star of the show was the toilet bowl that blew hot nd old when need be, throw in piped in music when you are in the john. This is really nifty. It was quite a pleasant stay.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend recommended this hotel to me as he had a nice stay there with his family last year. The location is excellent. It takes approximately 3 minutes walk to the nearest subway station Daikokucho. You may also walk to Namba station in around 10-15 minutes. There are lots of restaurants which open till midnight in this area. We could enjoy a full meal in any nearby eatery after a long day of sightseeing.There are even a few big supermarkets nearby which makes it even more convenient. We could buy some snack and sushi to enjoy in the hotel room.The hotel itself is also very nice. It is newly furnished. Most of the staff are friendly and helpful. They speak fluent English so you don't need to worry about the communication problem. There are 2 desktop computers for hotel guests to use in the lobby. The hotel room well equipped with essential facilities such as the fridge, hair dryer etc. They also provide makeup remover, face cleansing gel, toner and moisturizing masks for ladies. The wi-fi here is very stable.One thing I would like to highlight is the self-service laundry facility! I used this facility and it's just so nice and handy. The cost is very reasonable. The breakfast here is also very nice. It provide a variety of food choice which includes local cuisine and western breakfast. I love the hot spring egg and the milk Motcha so much. If I didn't remember wrong, it only costs around 1500-1800 Japanese yen per head.I'll surely return when I visit Osaka next time!
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We traveled as a family occupying 6 rooms. Our ages ranged from 3 year old to senior citizens and this was the perfect hotel for us. The rooms were small but always kept clean and stocked with amenities. The breakfast buffet is incredible with a variety of cold to hot entrees and very reasonably priced. There are no dinner service but the hotel is located conveniently near many restaurants and a "Family Mart" with every type of snack available. Mr. Hirota and the staff were very friendly and professional. They did their best to put us together or close by to ensure safety and comfort. Thank you very much.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very lovely hotel that is near a subway station and about 10 minutes walk to Namba center. I think it is designed to be catered to the ladies as they provide a lady "care kit" that has masks and beauty related stuff when you checked in. But even then, the reasonable price, the location and the breakfast offerings make this a good hotel to stay in.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a night last week and found it to be pretty decent. Staff were friendly and helpful when asking for directions. Hotel provided chargers for electronic devices. Typical of hotel rooms in Japan, they are small. It is relatively close to the train station, about a 5-6mins walk. If you are taking the train there, exit from Exit 1 of the station, do a 180 turn at the top of the stairs and walk straight, the main road should be on your left as you walk.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights as part of my Japan holiday after staying in Tokyo and being a student, was a chosen for the price of the hotel. From the looks of it hotel is newly built and very modern.Location: Great location, 3-4 minutes walk from Daikkucho station which is where the main midosouji line is (red line) which stops at the main areas, Shinshaibashi, Namba/osaka station, and Shin osaka ect.. so getting to these places is cheap and easy! Theres a massive supermarket called life behind the petrol station opposite the main road of the hotel which we missed on the first 3 days and only found on the last day which is a bugger. Its called Life and has a flower logo outside so dont miss it! 10 minute walk to the bottom of the namba shopping area, if you keep on walking north of the hotel main road youll come across a lot of shopping areas and eventually end up in shinsaibashi. Room: Very clean and well equipped with kettle, tea, toiletries, fridge, large bath and shower, spacious room for a budget, very comfortable bed. Facilities: Hotel has laundry and dryer facilities which is great. Didnt try the breakfast here since theres a lot of food places nearby but its a buffet breakfast which looked pretty nice. Overall: Very nice, clean hotel with location as its best point. Im very picky about hotels since my standards are extremely high and this hotel met my standards. Good for budget travellers in terms of space in the room and good amenities. Would definitly recommend to people staying in Osaka.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is clean, comfortable and looks like a new hotel. The location also not too far from the nearest station. The reception staffs are kind, they gave me a medicine when i got a toothache. My husband love this hotel because they have muslim breakfast. What a good service and we love it.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: About 7 mins frm the nearest subway station, there's a Family Mart two blocks away; also a Lucky supermarket 5 mins away. This hotel is 15 mins frm Dotonburi, Shinsaibashi, & Nipponbashi areas.Room very clean albeit tiny & cramped. Requested for a non-smoking room (since the promo was for a smoking room), but hotel was fully booked so couldnt be accommodated. Plus side the staff were better at speaking/understanding English compared to Hotel Universal Port. Breakfast buffet selection was so-so. Room was provided wth amenities & PJs as well.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located near Namba station which is a main hub for many subway lines but its better to use Daikokucho, it's a single line station and also closer to the hotel. The rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. Free coffee and tea available 24/7 in the lobby. Lots of restaurants and shops nearby, also local bars. We had a spectacular meal at a local bar while staying here, no idea what it was as a friendly local ordered for us. Enjoyed our stay, would stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights here. A boutique hotel. Rather new. It's not exactly in the heart of Namba but one train stop away from Namba station. It's not a problem though. Room is clean and comfortable.Enjoyed the breakfast which cost ¥1,200. Selection is good and fresh.Will stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The rooms were lovely and clean and staff were so friendly. The hotel is in a good location because it is within easy walking distance to most touristy areas and close to lots of great eating places. I would stay here again
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 2 nights and I was happy overall with this hotel. However I was a bit annoyed on the first day because even though it was very close to the station, we needed to use the lift because we had luggages and the only exit of the station that had a lift was exit 6, and that was so far from the hotel. The location was not bad even though it wasn't in the most convenient area, just a little out of it. There are many restaurants though within minute walks of the hotel. The breakfast was good and the staff were all very friendly.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Two of us stayed here for one night. Please note that this hotel is not near to Namba station - it's a good 10 minute brisk walk. The room could barely accommodate two large suitcases. Wifi was slow and kept dropping out. On the other hand, the room was very clean and the bathroom was well stocked with toiletries.Overall, it was a pretty average stay.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Been a fan of this chain since I stayed in one of their properties in Matsumoto. This Osaka hotel did not disappoint as well. The rooms are tiny- barely enough space to move around- but are clean and functional. The toilet is one of those modular installations quiet common in Japanese hotels. The water pressure jetting from the shower is particularly commendable (try it). Had breakfast at the hotel for each of the 5 nights at the hotel- I never got tired of the selection.Location wise, the hotel is a stone's throw from Daikokucho station, which is just one station from Namba along the Mido-Suji subway line. Alternatively, its about a fifteen minute walk to the Dotonbori area. Umeda station is about ten min away by rail.Directions to the hotel from Kansai:(1) Take the Haruka to Tennoji Station(2) Go on the Mido-Suji subway line on the direction of Umeda(3) Disembark at Daikokucho Station, leave from Exit 1 (no lifts in sight)(4) Walk along the street towards Pachinko and Sons (5) Turn right at the intersection of Pachinko and Sons
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was good. Clean and staff was very nice. I have 3 kids and staff was very helpful even I had to pay more but they gave me extra bed, pillow and blanket. There were places to eat not far from hotel. Subway was not far also. Anyway, it was too far to walk to Namba. All in all, my family loved it there and we'll go again.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 2 nights at this hotel. It is about 5 mins walk from Daikokucho station. Upon reaching the station , take exit 1 to the ground level , then left towards a Red building with the big words "Pachinko & Slots". The hotel is slightly off the main road but still visible. As mentioned by many travelers , it is a relatively new hotel , clean and modern. Everything works well from the moment we check-in till we reach our room. However , the room is rather small in my opinion and we have problem finding a place to open up our big luggage without interfering with access. Other than this , every aspects of the room is well taken care of. I like to mention that if you have doubts whether to opt for the breakfast , do not hesitate and go for it. The variety they offer for breakfast , while not duly extensive , is sufficient with a good spread. They even offer "halal" meals which will be a plus point for Muslim travelers looking for suitable accommodation. After breakfast , the restaurant is converted to a lounge offering free flow of drinks to hotel guests throughout the day till 8pm. By all measures , this is a decent hotel with a good value for your money.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for four nights in a double room. Check-in was efficient and we used a self-service kiosk to pay for the room and get an extra room card. The staff here were very helpful and friendly. As per our high floor request in the booking, we received a room on the 8th floor. The hotel had many brochures that they had made themselves, with attraction maps and food maps, all in relation to the location of the hotel itself. These maps were great in helping us to find good restaurants around the hotel as well as which train lines to take to get to some major attractions, such as the Osaka castle. The location of the hotel is good. It is a 3 minute walk to the Daikokucho metro station. By taking the midosuji line from Daikokucho, you are one stop from Namba (major eating street Dotonburi and shopping area), one stop from the Tsutenkaku tower and about 8 stops from Shin-Osaka (where the Shinkansen departs/arrives). The room itself is great and a good size for a couple with two large suitcases, two duffle bags and two backpacks! There is a clothing rack to hang jackets, a desk, a bath and a toilet seat with a seat warmer! The bed is one of the comfiest I've stayed in and the television is huge (42"). However, there was only CNN to watch in English. But there was paid tv with movies, which cost 1000 yen per day. Check out is 11am, but we checked out at 12pm, which cost 1000 yen extra (it is 1000 yen per hour after 11am). Our check out was efficient and only took about 1 minute. Overall, it was a great stay and we would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quite standard, nothing special. Clean and quiet, but not much charm. There are some restaurants in the neighbourhood, but otherwise it is not really an exciting area. It is however within walking distance of shopping and restaurant districts. A decent place to stay but you can probably find something better for the same price.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel with my wife just for one night. The hotel is located at 10-minute walk away from Namba station of Nankai Line and 5-minute walk from Daikoku-cho station of Metro.The building of the hotel was like an apartment in an urban area. The room was very clean and sophisticated, although it was small for two of us who had two suitcases. After the check-in procedure at the reception, you have to finish the payment in advance at payment machine next to the reception. They offered the free drinks near the lobby until 20:00.If you do not mind the space of the room, this hotel is recommendable.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went to Osaka in Nov 2015 and stayed at Richmond Hotel for 4 nights. The staff there are very nice and helpful and very good in English. The room was very nice and looked new, it has a big and clean bathroom.The location is also good, 5 minutes walk to the nearest station, lots of mini markets nearby and a couple of big shopping complexes are within walking distance.The laundry rooms are also a plus.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a newly open luxury hotel which located nearby a lot of restaurants and convenient stores. Within 1-2 minutes of walking distance, you can meet conveyor belt sushi restaurant, Kura Sushi and fine dining Japanese restaurant, Kagonoya and both open until midnight. If you need to buy some raw material, just cross over the street and you'll find a supermarket, Life which open until 1am. Good news for late sleeper, huh? Plus, one important thing for traveler who travel using subway. There are 2 exit located nearby the hotel too.The hotel room is consider spacious if we measure it using Japanese standard. Spacious bathroom with big bathtub, heated toilet bowl and of course, a complete toiletries.However, one thing I wasn't satisfy is the quality of the coin laundry which located at 5th and 10th floor. The washing+drying machine couldn't even dry one of my jacket even after 2 hours drying.Overall, I would strongly recommend this hotel especially for those with high expectation when staying in hotel in Japan.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To be frank we were all disappointed by this place. The small double room cost 19000 Yen because it was saturday night during a holiday weekend. A twin room would have been 28000. They charge you ten yen per sheet of paper to print out your boarding passes....hmmmm.I cannot recommend it, sorry.It is indeed close to the Daikokucho station and Namba Nankai railway.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: About 5 mins walk to Daikokucho Station and 1 min walk to the nearest convenient store. Just located in front of a Pachinko Red Building so it is easily located. They have a couple of restaurants if you're feeling hungry at night but nothing is opened earlier than 11am. The hotel room isnt very spacious but it was enough for two person with two big luggages. The receptionists were very friendly and helpful but it was difficult to converse as they were not good fluent with english. Wifi was strong in my room which was on the 10th floor. They provided shampoo and soup and MOST IMPORTANTLY their toilet seat was had a built in heater! Felt amazing especially in the cold. Even though we put a "Do not disturb" sign so the cleaners wouldn't make out beds, they still left new bathing towels outside our hotel. VERY CONSIDERATE! I would recommend getting breakfast outside of the hotel. The breakfast buffet wasn't the best considering there are so much better food outside.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very gracious staff for this boutique hotel. Rooms are very small but quality of bed, bathroom facilities and breakfast make up for that. Nice lobby area for relaxing. Walk to train station and close to heart of restaurants and bars. Free Wifi throughout.
hotelName:
19    Richmond Hotel Namba Daikokucho
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 10 to 15 minute walk from Osaka station and 3 minute walk to nishi-umeda metro station. Staff are welcoming and accommodating and breakfast is one of the best we've had during our trip. The rooms are large and clean but slighty dated. The bathroom was clean and also accessible (no large step to get in the washroom... And the bathtub was easy to get into)The beds could've been better, the matresses are a little hard.My only real complaint was the wi-fi which we constantly had to disconnect and reconnect. Also, we only have access in our room and not in the breakfast room.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was really nice with big rooms and very clean. The colour scheme was warming with a theme of Cinderella with even a glass slipper as an ornament. It is close distance to train station and shops.The beds were comfortable and great showers with plenty of hot water.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel lobby is situated above ground floor. You can use the escalator or the lift. The breakfast is not so great, not that many choices. There are few ramen shops nearby if you want to grab something to eat at night. Also there's Lawson 24 hrs as well.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice hotel close to Osaka station and various subways. Good clean rooms and the included breakfast is a nice mix of east meets west. The staff were very friendly throughout the hotel and can speak english which was appreciated. Worth a stay and will do so when back on Osaka. Good value.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a direct access to the underground shopping street which also leads to multiple subway stations including JR Osaka station. And surrounding JR Osaka station are department stores and shopping complexes. The thing we like most about the hotel is we stayed at the junior suite room. The room is about double the size of normal room at Hilton hotel for about the same room rate. And Hilton hotel is just about two blocks away.We booked the room including breakfast but the breakfast is nothing special that we don't mind skipping the breakfast for couple of days.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel seems to have a concept of fairy tales. White floor, wall and red roses. For a senior traveler like me, it is a bit odd but the room is spacious in the middle of town and service persons are good and efficient. If you have teenage girls, it will be a perfect choice. For a business traveler, still, the central location and walking distance to the JR Osaka station is attractive.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel as it was close to Osaka station. We knew that it was possible to get to the hotel using the underground walkways. Unfortunately it was not that straightforward and we had to ask several times for directions. The Japanese are very accommodating. Having found our way to the hotel first impressions were very good, big open plan reception area and helpful staff at reception. Unfortunately the room did not live up to expectations. Although it was a good size for Japanese rooms it soon became clear that as we were overlooking busy roads it was going to be noisy. The road noise continued pretty much through the night and then the construction work outside started! We were glad we were only staying the one night. This was by far the worst night’s sleep of our holiday and not ideal as we were leaving Japan that day and could have done with a decent night’s sleep.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very modern and clean hotel, only opened 8 years ago so still in good condition.Rooms larger than expected for Japan. Very close to Nishi Umeda station for the subway and about 10 minutes walk from Osaka Station for the main lines.Plenty of eating options around the hotel. No porterage at the hotel. Staff helpful but not too much EnglishWould highly recommend this hotel
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located near the Nishi-Umeda station and is connected via the underground shopping street at exit C84. When arrived at Osaka station, look for exit 8 (yellow background and round in shape). Follow the sign till you see a "Danish Bar" selling pastries on the left, then look for exit 'C84". Go up the stairs and you'll see the sign to the basement floor of the hotel where the lift will bring you to the lobby at level 2.The hotel is nicely decorated since it's going to be Christmas and the room larger than normal (I was sleeping alone). It's clean and everything you you would hope for. The breakfast cost about S$20 but we chose to take it at cafes located near the hotel for that price. The wifi is stable and fast, staff friendly and speaks rather good English.The hotel is about 10 mins walk to the main Osaka station we didn't break a sweat in this cooling autumn weather.A very good stay and I'll consider staying there again if I am to visit Osaka again.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose one of the bigger rooms within the hotel and was not disappointed. Hotel was within walking distance to Osaka Station thus easy access to most tourist attractions via JR lines. Convenience stores and many eateries nearby. Great location.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms of this hotel are all non-smoking rooms.About 10 minutes walk rrom JR Osaka station and Osaka subwayUmeda station passing through underground all the ways.Hotel staffs are friendly and cozy rooms are good enough to toconfirm comfortable stay.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a night at this hotel. It is a great hotel very well situated close to the metro station. The hotel staff were really really helpfull. We arrived the day before our reservation and the hotel stored our luggage until our check in day. Breakfast could have a greater variety in food types.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Chosen for proximity to the station and with triple room availability. Exiting the station by the South Gate it is easier to walk the 10 minutes with luggage on the road, going past the Hilton Osaka clearly visible from the station exit. We used the subway route without bags due to the steps near the MCDonalds in the station. There is a 7/11 cash machine near to the hotel subway route path exit , C84, that takes Visa cards. The reception is on the second floor, close to the glittery horse and carriage. Then take the next lift to the upper floors with a good view out over the main road. The room was very tight for 3 people, essential the sofa is turned into a bed so there is hardly any room for luggage. The decor is a bit twee and could do with updating, but was clean. The room has a fridge, TV with western channels, not forgetting the sets of pyjamas and the interesting Japanese toilets , heated seat, water sounds and bidet, much more complicated than in Europe. There is an ice machine and drink machine by the lifts on each floor. The cafe is on the ground floor, but we didn't eat in the hotel. The first night we went to the Outback restaurant close by the hotel in the subway.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Like others, I used the very helpful directions provided by another Trip Advisor member to find this hotel - and even then, it was still a little tricky to locate. However once we found it and got our bearings, it was a good base from which to explore Osaka. Conveniently located within the train station complex, it was easy to get around and there were loads of restaurants and cafes to choose from. The view from the lift is spectacular and we were on the 11th floor so had a great view over the city. Overall, the staff were helpful, the hotel was clean and the rooms are adequate but it is looking a bit tired and could do with an update.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was larger than expected, unlike most hotels in Japan. It's awkward that this hotel didn't provide shower caps. Hotel staff seemed rather reluctant to help. Don't know if it's because it's more of a business hotel.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Again this was a beautful hotel. As with all hotels in Japan it was exceptionally clean and well maintained. The staff lovely and friendly and helpful. Rooms very spacious and nice decor. Bathroom small but we found all the bathrooms in all the hotels we stayed in were small. Room for one but tight squeeze for two people. We ate our evening meal here and the food was lovely. They did a buffet and there was plenty of choice.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything in Osaka seems to be underground, as if it were a freezing cold city. The subway tunnels are initially awkward to navigate and it is easy to go astray. (Not the hotel's fault!) When we eventually found the hotel, it was equally difficult to find the entrance to reception. The staff here were accommodating and arranged for a breakfast box for the following morning since we had to leave before breakfast started. However, there is no one to carry luggage to/from your room; you can use a trolley but this is not easy at 05.30 when you have five million other things on your mind. A minor detail, but one which I feel the hotel could and should address. The receptionist actually left his post to assist us with luggage down to the waiting taxi, so full marks to him for compassion.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel. Very clean and good sized rooms. Bed is quite firm though so I found it hard to sleep. Bathroom has lots of amenities which is handy. Friendly English speaking staff. Close to Osaka station (10 minute walk) and other trains with easy access anywhere. I wouldn’t recommend eating breakfast here though as eggs and sausages were stone cold. Overall though quite happy with our stay.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just left from the hotel after the vacation. The hotel is near the airport express bus station and just take around 10-15min to walk. The location is quite convenience. There are some convenience stores and excellent quality restaurant beside the hotel. For me, some of the points I dislike. 1, although location is quite good, it is far away from the Osaka station / some main interchange stations and the main department store like Grand Front Osaka. 2, the wifi is not fast and in low signal sometimes. 3, the tv placement is bad which locate near the window side not at the front. and i guess there is very limit channel they offered to the visitor. I cannot find one of the channel that about japanese drama.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Maybe it is because the decor is mainly in white, which would show the slightest stains and splotches, but the rooms looked a bit worn and unclean (e.g. scratches on walls and stains on the carpet). Service was also average and the staff, though polite, did not really seem to care.Although this hotel is close to Nishi-umeda subway station, travelling between Osaka station and and the hotel would most likely be done by walking as they are connected by underground walkways. However, this walk is not easy (15 min if you can find your way on the first try) as the signage is not always clearly labelled and the walkways are always crowded. Unless it is snowing or raining, it would be much easier to walk on ground level so you get better bearings. If your activities are centred around the Osaka/Umeda area, you may be better off finding a hotel in another location (e.g. Yodoyabashi) but closer to a subway station.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights. Pros - clean, decent, and comfortable. Cons - not many choices of food offered by the hotel but you can get good food choices if you walk about 50m and get into the underground shopping area where you get ample choices of inexpensive and good food. Getting to this hotel from main Osaka Station is quite a distant, again you can go via underground shopping area. Breakfast is a little boring, same food each day, not many choices but acceptable standards.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. The location was great, very central, near Osaka Station and Umeda Station. Very easy walk to the metro/subway, lot of restaurants, cafes, bars around, short subway rides to many places around the city. The hotel itself is very pleasant and has cheerful decor. The room I got was nice and had a good, firm bed, and also offered a nice city view. English at the front desk is functional. Overall I think this was a great choice.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was spacious, comfy bedsheets and good wifi. Hotel was within good walking distance from Osaka station. However, the room pressure was not regulated hence the aircon was screeching the whole time.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently spent 3 nights here and found the place to be very clean, not generous amounts of room but enough and quite a good location. It was walkable to the Osaka main Bus/Train station for arrival from the Airport and there was an elevator that takes you straight to the underground to avoid the weather if it isnt so pleasant. Plenty of places to eat nearby some sites walkable.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one night part of a wendy wu tour. It is a good 10 minute walk from the station. The room was adequate for our stay. Plenty of lights and power points. Bathroom was good.However the breakfast offered was very poor. Although western and asian food was offered the choice was limited compared with previous hotels. The staff were not attentive and did not clear our used plates from our table.Wifi was good.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location: I'll start off how to get here as I wasted alot of time with lots of luggage )':Tip: If possible, take a train to NISHI-UMEDA station. That's right at the foot of Dojima underground shopping centre and it'll be a breeze to get to the hotel. You can also get here from Namba station in case you took the Nankai line from the airport. From JR Osaka station:Walk towards the South gate, Yotsubashi Line (Blue colour).You will see Eki Marche on your right. If you turn right to Eki Marche, follow the path and go down the escalator on your right to Macdonald's. Follow the underground passageway with Murals on the walls.Follow until you see an Exit 8. This would be the one right behind the exit to Hilton Osaka. (It leads off diagonally to the left, assuming Hilton Osaka exit is on your left.) Follow the path to Dojima Underground Shopping Centre. Turn left into Exit C84 which has a Hotel Elsereine signage on top before the exit. Go into the lift lobby and take a lift to the 2nd floor, where you should find the reception lobby. (If you happened to walk towards Daimaru, go straight through the doors and turn right, there should be a small flight of steps up, follow that path towards the Yotsubashi line/Nishi-Umeda line and you will eventually end up in the scenario above where you look for an Exit 8 and so on..)From JR Umeda:Walk towards JR Osaka station. If you happen to get up onto a connecting bridge with LUCUA and Yodabashi Camera around you, take the escalator down to B1 and find your way to JR Osaka.Hotel rooms were spacious, although the carpet was a little worn out. Great view from my room on the 12th floor, and really charming Cinderella concept to the hotel. (Their main doors close at 12 am, wondering if it's a coincidence)Whole hotel is Non-Smoking which is great for me. I reached at 12pm and they let me check in early since they prepared the room. Normal check in is at 3pm. Nice. Took a night flight and they allowed me to keep my luggages there til evening when I left. Would be perfect if they gave a free bottle of water :) (All other amenities provided for.)Overall, great stay. But I really recommend planning on how to move around from Nishi-Umeda station.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed in Hotel Elsereine Osaka for 2 nights. The hotel is very convenient in location and can be accessed from Osaka JR station using underground subway in around 10 min. However, there are many subways around the station so make sure that you are finding the right way. You may look for Eki Marche near JR station and there is an exit C-1 leading to underground street. Then you can find the way to Hilton Plaza at the underground street and the subway between Hilton Plaza West and Hilton Plaza East is the correct subway going to the hotel. The Hotel Elsereine Osaka is just a few steps from exit C-84 and you can take an elevator to the lobby level from the subway level B1. There is no need to go outside after leaving the JR station so it is very convenient even if you carry many luggages or under bad weather. There are many shopping malls and restaurants near the JR station and you can absolutely spend a day or two just shopping nearby.Staff at the reception are very helpful and the check in and check out process are quick and simple. The room size is not very big but should be fine with 2 people and 2 luggages. The bed is comfortable and the washroom is clean with many toiletries provided. Kettle, fridge and hair dryer are also available. Just one thing making me a bit disappointed is that there are many stains on the carpet. Wifi signal is stable and the connection is smooth.We didn't try the breakfast in hotel but the environment of the restaurant seems very nice. There are many lockers available at the JR station and the nearby subway station so you can store your luggages at the station after check out to save the time from going back to the hotel to get back the luggages.I will recommend this hotel if you want a decent short stay and convenient location.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Several reviews talked about how far the hotel is from the station and times quoted were between 10 and 20 minutes walk which is a big difference. The hotel is actually 10 minutes walk from Osaka Train Station and less than 2 minutes walk from the nearest subway station - IF you know where you are going and without luggage as the underground area is very busy with local commuters as well as tourists going all directions, and the signage can be confusing and it will take longer if you have suitcases; there are escalators but you will need to find them which takes extra time.From Osaka station just head towards to Dojima Shopping area and then just keep on walking, then you will see the one of the exit signs with the name of the hotel. From there the stairs take you to above ground or to the lifts to the hotel. There is no need to go above ground from Osaka train station. The underground area has shops and restaurants so very convenient.The hotel seems to be more catered for Asian tourists as most leaflets were in Chinese and/or Korean. Receptionists spoke English and were reasonably helpful although they did not always seem to know how to go to some tourist places, unlike some other hotel receptionists in other major cities where there are lots of tourists.Some other reviews said the room was small. The room certainly wasn't big but there was enough room for two people and two suitcases (unlike the room I stayed in Tokyo, it was VERY small).
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is located near the Osaka main JR station, and had a few restaurants and convenience stores nearby.Room is nothing fantastic, simple,small and clean. It shall be able to squeeze in 4 people as there is a sofa bed.Breakfast is normal and nothing to shout about. However, given the price, it is definitely a steal.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 2 nights in this motel... great location to all trains and subways and food alleys.... the bath robes in the rooms were an added luxury... couldnt fault the cleanliness and friendly staff.... loved the cherry blossoms tour with AJT... and the guide Kim was a wealth of knowledge...
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you're looking for a place to just stay in without expecting much, then this is your hotel. Room is a bit cramped for us - we we're 4 in the room. Our luggages did not fit anymore so they had to be on top of each other. But this was the room that they gave us that is good for 4 they said. But the beds were comfortable, even the sofa bed. They have free wifi but it's only for your room. If you go down the lobby, you will be disconnected already. There's a vending machine & ice maker in every floor, this was the thing i liked about this hotel. The receptionist guy wasn't so friendly & not all can speak english, but most can understand. Location wise, it is near a train station, but we never went to that station since where we needed to go we had to always ride the main Osaka station. And it was a 10-12mins walk. This was a problem when it rained. There are convenience stores near the hotel & some restaurants too. Dotonburi was 15-20mins taxi ride, more if you take the train. Shinkansen station was just 10mins away by taxi. From the airport, it was quite far, about 1hr & 10 mins.Overall, this is a good hotel. They can do more on service though...more helpful & more smiles
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am not sure whether the travel agent saved the best for last but upon walking into the lobby, my wife and I had high hopes that this will be better than the earlier two hotels.Upon checking into the room on 11th floor, we were not disappointed. The size and the amenities available are much better. Still another 2 nights to go but we are confident we will enjoy the stay.Did we mention that it is a stone throw away from Osaka station?
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel lobby and restaurant are in off white colour with nice and fairy tale like decorations, it looks clean and attractive. Front desk staff friendly and polite. Our triple room is too small for three people, no room to walk or to open our suitcases. Room is clean and beautifully decorated, decent size of bath room. Hotel is connected to Dojima underground shopping center, about 5 min walk to nishi-umeda metro station and 15 min walk to Osaka station. Haven´t tried breakfast as it is not included in our room rate and it´s about 1500 yen per person.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is not far from the main train station and shopping centre. Hotel staff were friendly.The rooms were clean, but very small, there was not enough room to store and open one large suitcase.Overall it was good value.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is conveniently located near Osaka Station. Our room was small, but this was no biggie. Staff is friendly and helpful. There is plenty of things to do in Osaka, so being close to the station made it convenient for getting around.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's so lucky that I chosen this hotel when Ctrip China recommended it to me in the early of this month. Good location is an attractive point. Additionally, it has everything what business hotel requested: modern style, good decoration, fully equipped room, bigger space (than other hotels in Japan, I think ；）),variety buffet... Will choose Elsereine hotel again when I visit Osaka next time.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel looks contemporary with very sleek interior design. It's less than 10 minutes walk from the Osaka station. Lots of shops around. But the room is a bit on the small side. Other than that no complaint. I highly recommend it.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location. Hotel connects directly to the underground. Close to the shopping areas. Very good service from the staff. Rooms were clean and spacious. Toiletries and sleepwear all provided. Very nice breakfast selection.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is right in the centre of Osaka, just 500 metres from Osaka Umeda Station - walkable with a suitcase on wheels! (A taxi would be a bit of a rigmarole around the one-way system.)The hotel astonished us!
