Our impression was of almost dazzling overall whiteness with little bits of pink and glitz - white marble floors, white rough-casting, white grand-piano (the piano in a veritable sea of real pink begonias). All this, plus Cinderella's coach (turned back into an LED-lit pumpkin), and a strategically placed glass slipper (near the lifts). It felt like walking into a fairy-tale castle.Our room, however, was quiet, enormous and sumptuous. A corner room on the tenth floor, we entered via a hall-way which contained a full length mirror and a walk-in closet. This led to a small seating area, with table, two chairs and a standard lamp, situated at one end of the bedroom. Off the far end of the bedroom, was a bathroom suite: separate, fully-automatic toilet (opened and closed its own lid and flushed itself), a lobby with a hand-basin and mirror, and a separate wet-room with a shower and a bath.The extensive buffet breakfast is served at ground-floor level, around the grand-piano. There is a wide choice of Japanese and European foods in seemingly unlimited quantities.Staff were friendly and polite, with English speaking reception staff, and the whole hotel was immaculately clean. The room provided tea and coffee making facilities, including western-style black tea bags (although you do not get milk in Japan).Our only criticism is that there were no drawers - it would have been really nice to be able to unpack our suitcases! - and just four coat-hangers.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a ten minute walk from Osaka Station. The all white decor with pink accents in the lobby is certainly striking, but it also makes one very sensitive to any defects in cleanliness in the rooms. I stayed here one night and then returned for two nights a week later. The first room had a carpet that seriously needed cleaning or replacement, and the white decor emphasized this. I had a different room for my second stay, and the carpet was much cleaner. In both instances, the linens were clean and fresh. The people at the front desk spoke English. Breakfast buffet was very nice. In order to reach the lobby you must either go up an escalator which can be rather awkward with a large suitcase or find the elevator. I stayed here as a member of a tour group. If you plan on doing a lot of sightseeing in the Osaka area using trains and subways, I would compare prices as there are several hotels very near the station.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We buy the Yokoso Osaka Ticket at the Kansai airport. It includes Rapi:t and a one day pass (Normally cost Y800) for a total cost of Y1500. Get off at Namba, catch the Midosuji line to Umdea. Since this is our first time to stay in this hotel, it's easier to find our way on the street instead of going through the underground. We take the Exit 8 at Umeda Midosuji line (South Exit), Daimaru is on the right with Hilton Hotel on the other side of the road. Walk round Hilton Hotel along the road and further down about 2 blocks, Hotel Elserine is on the left.Once we get used to the surroundings, it's easy to walk to Osaka/Umeda station using the underground. Simply take the hotel lift to LG, follow the signs and this is the best way to go to the station on a rainy day.The large and bright lobby of the hotel is on the second level, on top of the open restaurant on the ground floor and can be accessed by using escalator or lift.The lightning in the room is one of the brightest Of all the hotels that we stayed before. Some like the room to be dimmer and more romantic, but we prefer to be in this way. The room we stayed is 22 square meter and got enough space for us to move around.The hotel is built in 2010, clean and modern with decorations of Cinderella. Be aware that there is no self serve laundry in the hotel. Highly recommended this hotel to anyone who would like to stay in Osaka.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We traveled as a couple in our 20's and stayed for 4 nights. Room 1204 on the 12th floor. Standard Twin Room.The hotel is located about a 8 minute walk from Osaka railway station and 12 form Umeda subway station and is accessible directly from Osaka's underground walkways. Just keep walking in the direction of the hotel until you see a big sign with the hotels name. It was raining most of the time while we were in Osaka so this was very practical. Nearby you can find tons of continence stores and Japanese-style restaurants.Check-in was quick and easy. We had already paid for our reservation through Hotels.com. We got our room key and was pointed toward the elevator. The reception is located on the 2nd floor and is accessible, from the ground floor, both with an elevator and escalators. The room was clean and bright. In the room was a TV, water kettle, hair-dryer, 2 beds, sofa-bed, a small table and a desk in front of the window. The view from the window on the 12th floor was okay, the big buildings in front of the hotel didn't allow for much of a skyline view. There were both regular curtains and black.out curtains to keep the room dark after sunrise. The beds were of the firmer type and comfortable to sleep in. Extra duvet and pillow was available in the room. There was an ice-machine and a vending machine full of alcoholic drinks next to the elevator on our floor.The bathroom had a bathtub, a Washlet-toilet with "oshiro" and bidet. Lots of toiletries: toothbrush, toothpaste (this tasted incredibly bad), hairbrush/comb, soaps, high-end one-use razor, shaving cream, hairnet, body-towel, cotton pads, q-tips, separate one-use shampoo and conditioner-packs. The staff made sure to refill everything daily, including the toothbrushes. This is always appreciated even if you don't use a new toothbrush every day it feels nice that you always have everything stocked up.The bathtub was bigger that that of a standard Japanese bathtub.We did not have anything to eat at the hotel so I cannot provide a review of the food but we did have one problem during our stay. The wifi in the room was extremely slow at times before disappearing altogether on the 2nd day. After telling the reception staff about this I got the wifi-password for the 2 adjacent rooms. Internet was still slow while sometimes disconnecting so that will be an issue if you're someone who likes to stream movies on Netflix etc.. The hotel had clearly printed out that the hotel had no guarantees that the Wifi quality would be good, so this doesn't affect my score a whole lot but it did take away from a otherwise great experience.The location, cleanliness of the room and price is enough for me to recommend staying and Elsereine Osaka.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What I liked most about this hotel is it's close to the Osaka station about 8mins walk and has an underground shopping mall to entertain along the way and keep you dry if it's raining. You step into the hotel off the subway tunnel. The hotel itself is really aimed at business travellers and weddings as opposed to tourists but if you mainly aim to sleep here it's perfect. The staff are professional, the hotel is 'fancy' looking, according to my 7 yr old. There's even a crystal like horse and carriage in the foyer. We had a triple room and it was very cosy. Which is 3 single beds in the one room. There's no place for suitcases other than against the wall in front of the beds but it left a little walkway to get past. At times we had to climb across the beds to get past if someone was getting something out of their suitcase but like I said, if you are just aiming to sleep here than it's fine. Breakfast was included in our deal and they have a buffet. This included, fruit, juice, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages, cereal, toast, pastries, sweet potato, dim sims. The food is not outstanding (although the pastries taste great) but it will fill you up until lunch. Espresso is included in the price. There are some restaurants within the hotel, we didn't eat there other than breakfast because in the underground mall outside there are plenty of restaurants that are cheaper. There's also a subway (sandwich place) and Outback steakhouse nearby if you want to eat something off a menu you understand for a change :) Price for the quality was good.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel in mid-May, and were immediately impressed with the beautiful decor of the restaurant and reception area.It's a short walk (10 mins) from Osaka station, and is centrally located between two main tourist zones.Around the hotel itself there are quite a few restaurants and cafes.Reception was efficient and polite, rather than warm, in the way of big city hotels.The room was large, clean and very nicely furnished, with good curtains and blinds especially. It was also quiet.Breakfast was very good, and had a wide range of types of food on offer. Westerners were well catered for.Overall this was a top class city hotel stay. Recommended.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Like the area where it's close walk to major subway station with lots of linkages underground to shops. Room is fairly small for a double room and added a rollaway bed for the third person in my room. Hardly space to put luggage and move. Vending machine outside of room has ice dispenser which is what I like.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a businesslike hotel in a stylish, modern building. Our room was spotless, sleek and of a good size for European standards. Location is excellent: the hotel is in a nice and quiet area, there are lots of small restaurants nearby and Osaka main station is just 7 minutes away on foot. We were very happy with our choice and would definitely go back. From KIX airport, take the Limousine bus and get off at Osaka station. This will take about 50 minutes. Then just walk to the hotel.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of Hotel location is awesome few minutes walk from Osaka Station, but best part is the food, right in the basement you will fine Mughal Resturant (Pakistani Halal) Food, and food is amazing!! Now Hotel Elsereine Osaka is no ordinary hotel, its new its clean and very beautiful hotel with easy location, get down you will find a cab and go to Shin-Shibashi dont bother with trains it will waste time and if you are family of 4 use the cab i guess it wont cost you more than 1000YEN I have stayed their twice once in August 2015 and then in March 2016 and yeh the background score in hotel is very nice classical music!! I love this hotel so did my family!! Highly recommend
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From outside looks all pinky, chic and classy, but has no bar, limited space for breakfast (I've been waiting 10 minutes to get a chair), rooms are small and cleaning is not so neat, with a perpetual bad smell in the hallwayCentral area located, near Hilton and Ritz....
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I arrived a few days ago, and so far my stay has been more or less good. The room is big enough for one person, with a sofa , which is quite nice to just relax after a long touristic day ! This hotel would have been perfect if little things like: translating instructions into English , English Channel provided instead of only one CNN and dubbed to Japanese !!!i have difficulties in finding plugs in the room but only to discover they were covered and instruction of course in Japanese !!! How difficult could translating be these days??? Internet works perfectly well, the staff ar very helpful although with very limited English . The pajamas are provided and changed everyday..Am staying in this hotel until the 16 th of March , but writing this review in advance hoping to get the attention of management. I suggest a little effort on translating menu's to English , instructions the room in English..etc..otherwise, a good night sleep is well guaranteed !!!
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for one night, in a room with 3 single beds. It was a tight squeeze but cozy! The hotel is in a very good location, less than a 5 minute walk to Kitashinchi station, and about a 10-15 minute walk from Osaka Station. Near Osaka station you'll find a lot of shopping and eating options.The room itself was very clean. Basic toiletry supplies were provided. The reception staff were helpful. We tried the breakfast buffet on one morning - standard hot and cold breakfast options were provided but I personally don't think it was worth the cost. There are many eating options around the hotel.To get to and from the airport, I would recommend taking the Airport Bus from Kansai Airport to Herbis Plaza, then walk about 5-7min to the hotel. It's a much cheaper than the train and about as long (1 hour). You can also catch the Airport bus back to the Airport from Herbis Plaza.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated on the main road opposite Osaka station.Within 10 minutes'walk from the station. You can take the underground streets in cold weather.Room is good enough for two, but a bit small for three. Particularly liked the air purifier and humidifier in the room, made the room less dry with the central heating.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is absolutely romantic, and amazing and very clean. The Breakfast was good, and the staff really helpful and friendly, even though they lack english skills, but when in Japan you have to be ready for that. The room was huge!The location is okey from my perspective only 5-10 min walk from Osaka Station.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a relatively new hotel in the center of Umeda, vey convinient to all shopping places and the Osaka enormous central railway station. Also convinient for the bus transportation to KIX airport. The hotel decor when entering is very light and white which I personally find not atmospheric and business like. But this is a personal taste. Nothing wrong with the room/ everything is there. Amazing to see that in such a new hotel the rooms already need renovations± the carpet is tarnished, and the pain (white again) on the walls is showing it's wear. However, I must say that the price was very attractive so I didnt really care. Reception speaks some English and there is a business center in case you want to print something (extra cost). I did not have the breakfast there as there is a Starbucks just around the corner. All in all recommended.
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this hotel located in the very good location. next to the hotel is shopping mall where you can get starbucks, mcdonald as well as 100yen shop. the room is quite small also the bathroom. nice stay anyway!
hotelName:
20    Hotel Elsereine Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel's location is super close to USJ on foot it takes less than 5 min. It is in Universial city as well. Hotel's decoration shows Fantasy as theme park hotel. Very clean and kind. Also, breakfast is quite good. As soon as Park open we could head to, Also at night after theme park closing hour we could arrive hotel and took a rest easily. No need to have transportation is super good while we stayed here.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed at The Park Front Universal Studios for 2 nights and it delivered what was needed. I was definitely worried about the potential noise factor, being in a hotel with so many children; but really didn’t hear much of anything once inside the room.For all of the lobby glitz, the room was spacious, but basic. I was in a park view room with 2 single beds. The bed were firm, which I love. Though it was a twin bed, it’s not what we consider a twin in the US, it’s definitely bigger. Two kinds of pillows offered: thicker and thinner- which was nice.There is a separate toilet room and bathroom. They were fine but nothing special. The bathroom consisted of a shower and tub room, so to speak. The towels were very thin.The safe was big enough to fit an iPad and something the size of a folder, which was helpful.The blackout shades, though helpful, did not truly blackout the light come morning.The room overall was tired and a bit dated. That being said, for the location and price, I was pretty happy. We were literally steps from the park and from the train...so convenient. For those reasons, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel if you want to be close to the park.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just right in front of the Universal Studios theme park and hence it’s the closest one can get to the Park! Our room besides being very comfortable and nice, also had a view of the Park from the windows! It was exciting indeed ! The hotel is also in the midst of many restaurants and eating places , also has several places to shop nearby , so in that sense it’s absolutely centrally located. The staff was very, very nice ! A very comfortable and memorable stay for us! We loved it! Thank you hotel team for making our stay amazing !! Loved it !
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is literally at the front of the universal park. From the lobby to the park entrance is about 5 meters max. You are pretty much staying in the park!! Hotel is amazing!! Atmosphere is fantastic. There is so much to do in the universal walk and so many restaurants. I would 100% stay here again everything you need is only steps away and the hotel is very reasonably priced for the amazing location
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for one night after a long, tiring day at the theme park.We dropped off our luggage on arrival then headed for the park.Returned at night to check in. Our cases were already in our room.The room was very large with 4 comfortable beds.Lots of toiletries supplied as well as a hairdryer and a sleep shirt and slippers.Breakfast was amazing. Lots of choice, including a chocolate fountain and sweets.A late checkout meant no rushing so sat in the window enjoying the views of the park.Wonderful!
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan

review_body: Can’t beat its price and location to USJ. Good spacious rooms and beautiful scenery. The major complaint I have is the laundry room. The dryer does not do its job despite gobbling up my yens, innocent few more tries and fruitless feedbacks. For that I minus a star from the review.

review_body: Take your time to enjoy a magical stay at Parkfront Hotel where you can see Universal Studios Japan was right from your room. Breakfast buffet was very good with a huge diversity of dishes. However, the buffet dinner was not so impressive. Overall, we had a great time here!

review_body: The hotel is very near universal studios so if planning to go there this hotel is a very good choice. It is also near their metro rail transit so after going to universal studios you can easily travel to a different tourist spot by using their train, which is comfortable, efficient and reasonably price. The hotel can further be improved by upgrading their facilities and renovating their rooms.

review_body: My family and I had a pleasant stay at this hotel. Universal city walk and Universal Studios are just right outside the hotel. So many restaurants to choose from in the area. Perfect place for families, couples and singles. The staff was friendly and accommodating. Room was clean and spacious.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here because it was close to the train, and it’s a nice hotel. We weren’t actually going to the parks, so it was a little silly for us to stay here. Going the opposite way as the park traffic every day was funny. I didn’t get the room I thought I was going to, but it was fine.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located literally 100 meters from USH gates.Some tips:- if you traveling with family from Kansai Airport, it is more convenient to go by bus to universal studio. It took less that an hour. From the universal studio bus stop it is like 300 meters walk to the hotel. If you travel by train, the universal city station is also very close to the hotel.- if you arrive early, the hotel will keep your luggage and they will have it ready in your room by the time you come back- you can purchase USJ tickets and express pass from the tickets counter at the 3rd floor (next to the check in counter)- breakfast buffet spread is awesome. There are an extended japanese and international selection. It is good value for money and best option before going to the park- for lunch and dinner there are numerous restaurants option in the universal city shopping & dining area. They are open until late.- there are luggage forwarding service (Ta-Q-Bin) at the 2nd floor. It opens from 7 am to 12 pm. I use it to send big luggages to my next hotel in Tokyo- They have a room with park view. It depends on your personal judgement, but after spending a whole day or two at the park I wouldn’t pay extra for that view. The room and bathroom is very spacious though- they dont provide iron & ironing board in the room but you can ask to borrow one.- there is lawson store at ground floor. It’s very convenient to buy some snacks, drinks and other stuff. They also sell electrical adaptor and other crucial traveling stuffs.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having a hotel nearby to go back to after a tiring day at USJ is awesome. The hotel room and the bath is big and I really enjoyed my stay there. I love spacious rooms (something that is rare in Japan).I didn’t go for the breakfast option as it’s quite expensive and there are a couple of good cafes nearby. I’m glad I didn’t as I see huge lines outside the cafe in the morning. I wouldn’t want to queue for my breakfast especially if I’m rushing to USJ. It’s a beautiful hotel and yes, I will recommend it if u are intending to visit USJ. Try the sushi place (revolving sushi) nearby as it’s pretty good! There’s loads of eateries where the hotel is. Try asking for the room facing universal studios. I think it’s more expensive though. However, from where I am (facing the other way), I could see fireworks display at night! :)
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel from 2nd till 3rd Dec 2018, Room 2202 and 2203. The booking was made via online through their website. Check in process is normal and can be considered average. There is nothing special of the services rendered by the reception staff. My main concern is that no one assisting us (I come with my family of 5) with our luggages upon our arrival. We arrived via taxi at the ground floor roughly around 7pm. There is only 1 lady staff at the small concierge unit. Not so fluent in English and just told my family “check in upstairs “. We have to carry out out luggage on our own to the lobby by the escalator. She is not telling us whether there is an elevator or otherwise and till today I really not sure about it.Nothing to shout about the room as I believe on par with other resort boutique theme park hotel. Main advantage is just the hotel is near to USJ and located along the universal walk. The rest I think is average and could be a bit expensive and not worth of money.Breakfast is ok. Maybe it’s time for the hotel management to consider halal @ Muslim friendly food as the number of Muslim customers are growing fast. Another thing probably the tv channel inside the hotel could provide ‘live’ coverage of the theme park for information of its patrons. There is a counter selling tickets for the park inside the hotel which may benefit the customers.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel's proximity to USJ and the bus station (bus to airport) is simply amazing. After 2 tired but fun days at USJ, having the hotel at a stone's throw away was great.It was also very fun to see USJ from our room window. We could see the queues, the crowds and the day/night scenes.The hotel had coin laundry facilities which was very convenient for us. The shops outside the hotel at Citywalk had a good variety of restaurants, supper snacks and souvenirs/gifts.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks for giving us room on higher floor, view was so great, we can see universal studio from window.Just 3 mins walk to the studio gate, very convenient.Surrounding by shopping & dinning areas, a nice hotel for family tour.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Osaka mostly for USJ and this is THE hotel to stay for such activity. It is located right on the heart of Citywalk just a couple of minutes walk to the park entrance. You can easily purchase the tickets and fast lane passes right in the hotel, so there is no need to queue at the park ticket counters. The room was huge and the view as even better. It was especially interesting to see what is going on after the park closes with all the preparations during the night. A must see for Universal Park fans. There is also a train station with quick access to other parts of Osaka. There was no desk or workplace for a laptop and given the room size, they could easily add that. There was a little disorientation by staff during check-out on where to go to catch a cab to the airport.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So much to love about this hotel, the decoration and the overall fun vibe really made it a unique holiday for us. We got very lucky as our room had a direct view of the park and was quite massive for two people, with a massive bathroom as well. You are able to buy tickets for everything through the hotel counter which makes entire experience very convenient, this is the most hassle free way to visit this park. The food was okay, could be improved, but not entirely bad.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've stayed at the Park Front Hotel @ USJ on last Sunday night. We chose this property as we thought we might stayed until the park closed. We did arrive in the morning to leave all baggage then spent time at USJ. The check-in process is not complicated and take just 2 minutes. When we came back to the hotel, our room was ready and luggage was delivered to the room already. The room is big compared to Japanese standard room. The hotel provided all amenities we needed and specially the foot spa pads, it's very nice after you walked all the days at USJ. The decoration may not be super-fancy like you stayed at Disney official's Hotel but it's fine for me as we didn't travel with children. There is vending machine, ice machine and microwave on the floor we stayed (28th floor). Breakfast, we didn't expect much on this so it's beyond our expectation. The line buffet is great, there are variety of foods and we're really enjoy. We did book the room directly at Hotel's website as it's cheaper than the other website. Even hotel is not located in the city center but, personally, I still recommended this hotel for the others, especially, if you have a train pass and mainly use JR, not subway. The station is just <1 minute walk from the hotel.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There was a ”dead bee” on my towel! Oh my, the towel was handed to me by their staff. I also asked for two extra pillow. The staff gave it to me without pillow cases. This proves their hygiene have problem.Breakfast was always long waited. Even I go down at 7:30 it's packed with people. If you drive there are hardly any parking space.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is the closest hotel to the park. The best location we could ever ask for. Lots of restaurants and shops around the hotel. We had a corner triple room and it was really roomy, not only had enough space for two adults and two kids but also 3 large fully opened suitcases. Huge bathroom with double sinks, big and comfortable beds, large windows provided bright light and a great view of the park. Check-in was easy and quick. Mr Mochido at the front desk was so helpful and polite, he made our stay a better one. Great value for money hotel, I will stay again at The Park front hotel when I visit USJ again.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got a free upgrade to park view. I love the lobby's decoration, live the noveltues in lift. The room is so big, the biggest in our visit in japan tbh. Breakfast maybe not as tasty at traditional ryokan, but the food choice is awesome. You could pick takoyaki, mini burgers or stick to traditional breakfast spread. The chocolate fountain with strawberry or marshmellow dips made my childish side very happy
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan

review_body: This is a beautiful hotel & only one minute walk from the park, but not worth the money. This was the most expensive hotel I've ever stayed in & there was nothing that made it better than the rest.Really uncomfortable pillows that meant a bad night sleep, breakfast was so unorganised that people were queuing for at least 30 mins while tables were empty but not cleaned, (it doesn't help that the breakfast area isn't big enough for the size of the hotel) then extortionate parking prices on top of the extortionate room costs.Hotel Keihan Universal Tower is right next door and cheaper so we'll try that one next time.

review_body: Pros. 2nd summer visits and celebrations for my husband. Close to USJ. Clean. Spacious room. Buffet breakfast ok.Cons. My husband brought some candies out for my daughter who did not goto conplmentary breakfast. A staff blocked his way and asked him to put back. I was outside & asked what happened. He showed me a sign & said loudly & rudely to me that this is rule not to bring any food outside.. My husband said a 3-year old child in front of him also got candies on hand was also asked to put back candies which made her cry. Why so rude? My husband then stayed for some more time. This staff talked & looked at my husband many times & laugh. This was the birthday of my husband & he had bad feeling. He said he would never visit this hotel again.

review_body: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights,reasonable rooms.....honestly I expected better rooms when I arrived at the hotel entrance...by the way the hotel always crowded as no wonder it’s steps from USJ ...and on the other hand steps away from universal city station....the hotel have a lovely big restaurant serving Asian and western food...if you take a walk outside you’ll find plenty of restaurant there’s also the city walk area full of shops and cafes you’ll see also Hard Rock Cafe ....etc.surely wanna be back again.

review_body: The rooms are huge and spacious and it was a perfect place to stay for getting to and fro from USS. Check in was super easy and fast. The staff was as usual polite.The design of the rooms are not spectular or fanastic but simple and clean. Looks pleasant.

It was included which was great considering its pricey all around you. It has a store attached as well and it has all kids of goodies not too overpriced.

review_body: My kids love this hotel, you can have the park view even you are not reserved the park view room..great size, great amount amenities, breakfast is fabulous, will come back soon. 2 night is just not enough..

review_body: Can't go wrong staying here if you want to go to Universal Studios. It is literally 100 meters to the entry gate. It is the closest one to it. Great view of the park from our side of the hotel overlooking the park. The buffet restaurant is probably the biggest I have ever seen its massive and does all the way around to the left hand side of the entrance. More food choices for breakfast than I have ever seen. Staff were great especially Koyama who went out of her way to print off some documents for me. Hotel is surprisingly quiet considering its location. Rooms area good size and very clean. Highly recommend staying here is you visit Universal Studios Osaka.

0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan

review_body: Closest hotel to Universal Studios. Very convenient to drive in and park. 1 min walk to Universal Studios. Convenient, lots of food and shopping malls around. Very good breakfast inside offered to beside the hotel. Good to take and charge up before heading to USJ.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located within Universal City, a stone's throw from the JR and subway stations. It's also within walking distance from the ferry to the Osaka Aquarium Kaiyukan and from the entrance to Universal studios. Couldn't have picked a better place. We were given room 2010 which had a great view of the harbor, ferris wheel, and neighboring hotels. The rooms are really large by local standards (ours had three comfortable single beds) and a nice bathroom with separate toilet (by that I don't mean shared, just its own separate cubby with door- really nice feature.) A good choice of restaurants and shops nearby.

21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the convenience of staying at the park front hotel. It is a especially wonderful for families with kids. Pluses:1. The location was superb for anyone visiting the Universal studios.2. USJ train station was right next to it.3. The Osaka bay ferry terminal about 5 minutes walk away. 4. Via a short ferry ride, one can visit the Osaka aquarium near by.5. The train station makes it convenient to go almost anywhere in Osaka, to Kyoto, to Nara. 6. It has more that 10-15 restaurants right around it so, food is not a problem at all.7. The most amazingly vast and varied breakfast Buffet with western, and Japanese cuisine. Especially fun for kids with multiple cereal, candy, fondue as well as ice cream options.8. The hotel has a time travel theme, and is a lot of fun for the kids.9. Festive atmosphere due to the location being right on Universal city walk.10. Very helpful reception and concierge.11. Huge spacious rooms with great views of the USJ Park and Osaka Bay area.12. Large spacious, and modern bathrooms with luxurious amenities.I could really so no negative, and had a great time. We loved this hotel and would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 5 nights at this hotel. The room is spacious and bed is comfortable there is even a humidifier in the room. The only down side is the toilet bowl and bath room is separated, am not used to japanes style. However the breakfast is great, spread is good there is even a chocolate fondue fountain. Kids will love it. JR Train station is 5 min away and easy to take airport bus down from kansai airport as bus stop is nearby. Overall a good experience here!
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked 2 consecutive nights and I was amazed at the price considering its location. It is right in front of the Universal Studio and the price is way much cheaper than the hotel in Tokyo. We have the view of the Hogwarts Castle and the USJ entrance. Surrounding the area are restaurants and shops wherein you can find affordable options for food and souvenirs. I will stay again, if given the chance.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is ideal for Universal Studios as it is less than a minute walk to the park entrance and the train station plus right in the middle of City Walk restaurants so was perfect at the end of a long day in the park. We chose a city view room but could still see 50% of the park. Rooms were clean, shower was extremely powerful, reception staff very helpful and you can purchase park tickets plus fast passes. Breakfast buffet provided good choice of foods including smarties, flumps, and a chocolate fountain! When we booked we were surprised at the low cost (compared to Orlando Universal hotels) however were amazed at the high quality standard provided. Would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is fantastic! Right next to Universal Studios!! We bought our park tickets here before heading to the park, and that saved us from having to wait in the line to buy tickets at the park. Our room was very spacious and our view was nice. There were two pillows on the bed, one was soft and the other one was firm. It was nice to have a choice. The staff was really nice and helpful! Breakfast was included for us and there was a good selection of both Japanese food and western food. I would stay here again for sure! Really great experience all around!
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan

Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel is amazing! You'll find it right as you get off of the train for Universal Studios. The short walk to the park, and being a part of Universal's downtown area, can not be beat. I will happily stay here again when I visit in the future.
hotelName:

review_body: Visited in May, and everywhere was very busy... but the Park Front Hotel was our little oasis just outside the park. Hotel is designed for families with kids, but is acceptable for all types of travelers. The best part was the location - just a 2 minute walk from Universal Studios. You can also buy your entry ticket and express passes at the hotel! Cons:- No gym or fitness center- Average breakfast- Small rooms (but on par for Japanese hotels)Pros:- Budget friendly- Amazing service- Close proximity to USJ
hotelName:

review_body: Stay in the triple room which have a good view of USJ with hotel and room cleanliness a plus. Near to convenience stores and restaurants and only a few minutes walk from Universal City JR. Worth a stay again.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel on a visit to Osaka with my family. The rest of my family are theme park fans and this hotel proved to be a very convenient choice because it is located right by the Universal Studios theme park. The hotel was very clean and comfortable and room sizes were good. When you exit the back of the hotel the universal city is right there , boasting of lots of different restaurants, shops, a huge candy store , a convenience store and many more. The train station is also located right by the hotel . If you mainly want to be right by the park, this is a great hotel since the park is a short walk to the universal studios park otherwise there is nothing else around the hotel, one has to either take the train or a taxi to go to other parts of the city. I was frustrated also because this is one of the few international hotels where very little orAlmost no staff spoke decent english. I think for being such a family oriented hotel with a western theme park, i think the hotel should be better equipped with a more multilingual staff. It was difficult to go to anyone , even to the concierge to ask for help with reservations or just simply to ask questions or make suggestions as to where to go other than the park.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Step of the train at the Universal stop and walk a few hundred feet directly to your hotel.The hotel is located right in the middle of the restaurants and shops. Go a little further to your left of the hotel is the entrance to the park.How easy is that????A very nice clean hotel with a convenient restaurant and services.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan

review_body: This hotel is amazing! Rooms are very spacious, modern and kept very clean! Great location for access to Universal Studios, Citywalk and the train station. Great value for money, friendly staff and easy check in and check out process. Will be back to stay at this hotel in the future!
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is just right in front of the park and the area has many restaurants and shops! Hotel breakfast was okay and inside the hotel has laundry room and a 24 hours Lawson below it! Staff were friendly and even we did not book a park view room we were given a partial park view room and it was great! Room was big and clean!The only down side is the tv as the channel are all Japanese and none of it was English or Chinese, no movie channel, if you want movie you have to pay additional which is not good as it’s the official USJ hotel but they did not provide any universal movie channel.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came to Osaka for my birthday and we stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It is just next to the train station so no need to drag our luggage for long and the other entrance is just in front of USJ! Very convenient esp when you want to be early for USJ. There are also cafes, dining places (both local e.g. ramen, revolving sushi, tonkatsu, omu-rice, etc. and international - steak, western, etc.), souvenir shops, clothing store, etc. surrounding the area. Our room is very clean and comfortable, and the staff are also very friendly and accommodating. I had a perfect birthday! We are very happy with our stay here and will definitely book this hotel again.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My adult son and I stayed 2 nights this week for 37000 yen booked through the booking.com.iWe caught the airport bus from KIX to the bus stop at USJ.Catching the bus was easy.Easy to find and a person to help you buy tickets from a machine.About 1500 yen each.We arrived early and they offered us check in at 1pm for no extra.Reasonable English at reception.We had a twin room on the 9th floor (905).Although I paid for a city view room (park views cost more), we were given a park view.The Hollywood Dream coaster looked really close and we could see the crowds gathering at the entry gate.There was no noise in the room .The room was in new condition and very large with 2 extra wide singles and a sofa bed.It didn't have a desk/chair.The beds were not too hard, with nice bedding and 2 pillows , one of which was soft for Westerners and one Japanese style.There was a separate toilet and a large bathroom partitioned into an area with 2 sinks and a wet area with a large bath and shower.We went to USJ for one and a half days.I was disappointed because not much appealed to me.I like Tokyo Disney SO much better.It was a 5 minute walk to the front gate which was wonderful for an early start and for returning late.Both nights we had food from Lawson's for dinner.We had a nice Japanese lunch in the park one day and a so so lunch at the Three Broomsticks the other day.We ate cereal for breakfast brought from home in our room.I used luggage forwarding on the second floor.They had enough English to help me.I can't recommend luggage forwarding enough.There is a self service laundry but I didn't see it.We took the bus to Itami airport on departure.It was raining so we took a taxi, lined up on the street outside the 2nd floor entrance, although it was only a short distance.We arrived at the bus stop 15 minutes early and there was already a queue.I highly recommend this hotel if the purpose of your visit is USJ.No negatives about the hotel at all.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great location outside of the Park and right next to heaps of restaurants. The service is excellent and the rooms were modern and very clean. We had two rooms adjoining for 7 nights and were very happy would go again.Self service laundry facilities were great too.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan

Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very good choice for fun family enjoying the adventure in Universal Studio because this hotel is just located in front of the park with 2 mins walking distance. Also, the train station is very close to, with also around 3 mins by walking.The hotel room is spacious and having great horizon views on higher floors.Only thing that tourists need to consider is that if we need to travel to city center of Osaka, this hotel is quite far from city center and needs several transfers by train.We will definitely go back to this hotel if we plan for a family trip to Universal studio Osaka.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was booked because it was so close to universal. It is close by taxi to the Osaka aquarium and LEGO land, however public transport is not so quick if your goi g from the hotel to either LEGO land or the aquarium as you need to change lines and they line to the aquarium and LEGO land is not on a JR line which means your JR pass won’t work (but only a small fee). Taxi from Shin Osaka to the hotel is approx ¥6000 depending on time of day. Getting into Osaka city is quick by JR Tain from Universal City. The hotel isn’t central to everything, but if your willing to travel a bit and have the money (not for budget trips) it’s worth the stay. Area surrounding the hotel is known as Universal City (Same Name as the train station). It has some cool shops as well as heaps of restaurants. Good pricing varies depending on where you go, however value is good in General. Hotel breakfast is great and can’t complain. Hotel is super convenient to go to Universal studios. We went on our last day just as the park opened at 10am. We checked out and left our bags at reception and went straight to the park. Lines where moderate and I’m glad we didn’t have to wake up earlier to get there from Osaka or further away. Once we finished at the park (around 6:30pm) we walked back to the hotel and got a taxi back to Shin-Osaka Would definitely stay again if I’m back.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was awesome. The nearest hotel to Universal Studio Japan. Located in front of Universal Studio Japan and Hard Rock Cafe Osaka. The room was spacious,new and comfortable. The view of USJ was stunning..Highly recommended.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan

review_body: The hotel room is nice and very clean. The room is spacious and suitable for family. The breakfast was excellent. The hotel location is just in front of Universal, make it convenient after a tiring day playing. Definetely value for money.
hotelName:
0     The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
21    The Park Front Hotel at Universal Studios Japan
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being right in front of the USJ entrance brings out a massive sigh of relief from tired parents coming out of USJ - and it was great to come back to a good hotel after a full day at USJ.Location - its approx 1 hour 15 minutes using the airport express bus from Kansai airport and it stops at the bus stop, about 5 minutes walk away. Its flat all the way so no problems with pushing those roller bags - you will be walking past the entrance of Universal Studios and then voila, you will see the hotel. We actually stayed a full week in this hotel even though we did not go to USJ each day. While its not in the main part of Osaka, you have the Universal City train station right next to the hotel. Getting to Namba is about a 20 minute train ride away, which for us was not a problem as the trains are frequent enough. We in fact did day trips out to Kyota and Nara without much hassle. The hotel is part of the Universal City Walk so there are plenty of restaurants to choose from. The hotel has a Lawsons convenience store in its premises, and there is another one just outside - if you get hungry, the Lawsons sells plenty of food - both hot and cold, as well as some of the most fabulous, value for money desserts. Try the cream puffs!The rooms are large and long - so for us, we had 4 beds next to one another, in a very long, slightly narrow room. No issue with the room size, it was comfy enough and pretty large for Japanese standards. Fantastic bathroom amenities, spanking clean, wifi was good. If you can, do get a room that faces the park. It is lovely to see the park during sun rise, and we could also see the fireworks every night from the Christmas show. At the same time you can see the Tempozan Ferris wheel, which is very pretty in the night. The hotel was great with providing accessories for our toddler - like bed rail, and stool which was fantastic. Tickets for USJ can be bought in the hotel and charged to the room. This was useful as you do not need to queue at USJ to purchase the tickets. We had the buffet breakfast each day - pretty good variety, with a Japanese/Asian slant, but quality is very decent, and plenty to eat. We love how they deal with the crowds very efficiently - so even during the peak hours, food is topped up, and queues are manageable. A slight issue would be the difficulty in communication in English, an issue that is not just in this hotel so its not entirely a criticism. We had problems trying to understand the USJ express pass system, and had problems finding a money changer (Which by the way is in the Keihan hotel next door) and problems finding a route to the airport without using the taxi.Our communication with the hotel staff was difficult due to the language barrier. While they were always polite, they were not necessarily helpful in providing proper instructions - again, likely due to language. So if you need help with directions, train schedules, train routes- use Google Maps. It was particularly helpful when figuring out the train system.
hotelName:

review_body: The room has excellent view of the park as well as Tempozan ferris wheel. The 2 wash basins and 2 toilets definitely is useful for sharing. The bathroom is spacious and clean. Conveniently bought the Universal Studio Pass Tickets from the hotel counter.

review_body: I’ll keep it short.Pros: - a extremely short walking distance to USJ. Staying late to watch the Christmas show knowing that the hotel is near after a long day was great.- check-in was a breeze.- I took domestic flight to osaka, round trip for limo bus was a breeze.- I like how their bathroom and toilet are separated. Cons:- universal city was fun to walk but limited choices of food. Need to travel out with at least 40 mins train ride. I recommend this hotel just for USJ stay for a night or two. Do travel light to get here (I.e a luggage will be sufficient for 2 to 3 people), it will be easier for you.

review_body: Just a few steps from USJ's entrance and the Universal City Station. Very good location especially after a very tiring day at Universal Studios. Got a standard quadruple room but was upgraded to a superior with park view!The room is big though with 4 beds a bit cramped but we don't mind. Bath room is separate from toilet and everything is so clean. There's also a lawson store with atm inside the hotel and a coin operated laundry.A bit far from Osaka proper but for us it served its purpose because we were already dragging our 7 year old after spending an entire day in the park. So overall it was a great stay and my kids loved it.

review_body: La mejor elección que hicimos para visitar el parque. Todo tan bien cuidado, limpio, habitaciones amplias y camas muy comodas. Beautiful Hotel! Best choice we made to visit the park. Everything so well kept, clean, spacious rooms and very comfortable beds.A pesar de que las camas individuales son casi como una grande, no tienen habitaciones con cama matrimonial. Even though the single beds are almost like a large one, they do not have rooms with a double bed.

review_body: I am very happy with the hotel, exceptional service。 Lots of great restaurants nearby And the food in the restaurant is one of the best I had in Japan, also way too cheap!! If I get the chance I will definately come back. Although i'm a bit dissapointed with the mens bath; only the women gets a jacuzzi.这个酒店太好啦！这里的服务真好，而且餐厅的饭既好吃又太便宜了。附近有很多的饭馆儿。但是只有女人的澡堂有按摩浴缸。
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Centrally located, quiet hotel with nice onsen, friendly staff. rooms are a bit small, and executive lounge is not much more than a fridge with soft drinks. but convenient. shuttle service to osaka station is great
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is situated in the business district, a few subway stops from Namba. As such, it is very quiet in the evenings! There is also not a lot going on in this part of town but, given it's closeness to a subway station, this suited us just fine. The room was clean and comfortable, a little on the small side (as is to be expected in Japan). We enjoyed our stay here. I was however, a bit confused on the room types and may have ended up booking a less nice room for the same price as an upgraded room not realising the difference between deluxe and comfort. Rooms on higher floors with access to the bar would be nice as the restaurant seemed confused when we popped in for a drink and a snack. In saying this, the sashimi was some of the best we ate in Japan! I would stay here again.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s close to the train station and they provide a shuttle bus which I did use. They also have a public bath and laundry facilities which I also used. Room was very nice and a good size. Bed very comfortable. It’s in Kita, a couple of tube stops from bright lights of Dotonbori. Closest ‘tourist’ attraction is Umeda Sky Building and the observation deck there. It’s a 20 minute walk and the view is no better than ok so don’t bother. Seven Eleven right next door
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for three nights in a good sized room for Japan which was very clean and had a fridge and kettle. The staff were helpful and polite. The free shuttle bus to the rail station was handy but I did think that the hotel was more a business hotel and was rather bland in the reception area. The bed was very comfortable but I found the pillows very hard, when mentioned to reception they did supply some more they said were softer, but it was difficult to tell any difference. There were restaurants within walking distance but not a great choice. Comfy, good value stay but not a hotel I would stay in for a holiday.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel. Perfect place to lay your head down after a busy few days of sight seeing. Request to stay in the upper floors to get access to the lounge for unlimited soft drinks and hot drinks. Rooms are clean and bathroom and toilet are separateI asked for a massage which was one of the best massages I’ve had in a while. The masseuse really knew where my knots were and did a good job at loosening the tension on my back.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was nice. The rooms were big (compared to Tokyo) and had nice amenities. The staff were polite and helpful. The free shuttle to the station was also really useful. The hotel is about a 5 minute walk from the subway which was convenient. Unfortunately the hotel didn’t have a great vibe. It seemed like it was located in a kind of business area so there wasn’t much going on there. The hotel also doesn’t have a bar which was a bit of a downer. We paid extra to stay on one of the floors which had access to the hotels exclusive lounge, unfortunately the lounge was literally just some couches in a room that had average views. There was some free tea and coffee there as well. Also I don’t know how exclusive it was cause anyone could walk in there. All in all I would say this is a nice hotel for a short stay but I would look for somewhere else for a longer stay in Osaka. You can probably find something nicer for the same price or cheaper.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is centrally located to local sights, Dotonbori. Shuttle bus allowed travel to stations for travel to further sights. Rooms are cosy (small) but adequate for return after sight seeing. Reception staff did assist in locating and directing to attractions.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, good value for money, room was very clean with a comfortable bed. It has a good location near transportation to all the major tourist locations in the city. Although the hotel is central and was busy the room was quiet and comfortable. Would stay again if in Osaka.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on our 1st two nights in Japan and it was a great location. Really quick access to the metro that then allowed us to visit anywhere. We ate in a couple of great restaurants but we struggled to find a cocktail bar. Everywhere that was advertising cocktails were essentially seeking gin and ginger ale etc... This hotel didn't even have a bar that you could for a drink. Rooms were clean and cozy.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed five nights in a superior room. It was the best hotel we stayed in during our 16 night tour. They have thought about everything a traveler needs, including the laundry facilities which were invaluable at the mid point of our travels. The room was spotlessly clean and the separation of the sink from both the toilet and the bathroom made it so much easier for two people to get ready!!! The staff are very helpful and speak English. There is a free shuttle to and from Osaka main station which is useful, particularly at the end of a long day of sightseeing and day trips. On first look the location looks like it is too far out to be able to enjoy an evening out but in fact it is really the opposite. There are restaurants and bars close by - certainly within walking distance - and Dotonbori is easily accessible by public transport.We plan to return to Japan and Osaka and will definitely stay at the Mitsui again.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Mitsui Garden Brand continues to impress with their impeccable customer service and amazing amenities. Choose to stay here due to my experience with another one of their properties and was not disappointed. Room was large for Japanese standards, but the entryway was a little awkward due to our suitcases with a genkan. Aside from that the room was flawless, and I really appreciated being able to have a separate area to put on my makeup as my husband showered.The public bath was amazing, but it is pretty crowded late at night (11pm-12:30am!) so keep that in mind.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel. I stayed in a Superior Double room, which was reasonably large and made good use of the available space. It had a great view of the nearby canal. The staff were helpful, and all spoke good English. Unusually for Japanese hotels, all of the various gadgets in the room were also labelled in English.The hotel restaurant is quite good, and surprisingly reasonably priced. Breakfast is a bit on the expensive side and largely focused on Japanese guests: the western-style options were limited, with the hot food being lukewarm at best. While the hotel is a little bit out of the way, this isn't a bad thing as it's very quiet at night. The closest subway station is only a 5-10 minute walk away, and quickly takes you to Osaka station or the centre of the city. Getting to and from Kansai International Airport by train is a bit of a chore though, requiring two transfers. Overall, I was very pleased with this hotel, and would stay here again.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location: 5* The Mitsui Garden Hotel is located 5 walking minutes from a subway station, perfect connections Staff: 5* The staff at the reception is very welcoming and professional. No problem with English and typically Japanese: very polite and friendly! Breakfast: 4*The breakfast room is quite ok, all dishes are fresh and there’s quite some choice. For a ‘western’ breakfast there’s also a few things such as croissants, toast, jam, cereals and you can order a la carte eggs as you wish.Rooms: 3-4* The rooms are tiny, but very clean! So you’ll have a great stay but rather don’t use a big suitcase ;-)Overall: 4* = great experience! Would for sure recommend this place.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room are clean and contemporary design. Glad to have clean onsen. Free access to lounge to get free drink and biscuit for guest staying 13 floor and above. Nearest train station is at Conrad which is 5 mins away. Not a bad deal for that price
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We caught the hotel's shuttle bus from the station - it was relatively easy, we only had to ask one railway official which side of the road it departed from. On arrival at the hotel, we were delighted to see a sleek modern highrise situated adjacent to a river. After a fast check-in, we were also delighted to see our bags in the room, given we had forwarded them 2 days prior. The room was fabulously appointed. Floor to ceiling windows with a beautiful river and cityscape view; stylish sliding wooden screen divided the bedroom from the foyer/bathroom; the best tiled bathroom - fully enclosed; good size bath and free standing shower; cupboards/dressing table/ basin and separate toilet, are in another area. The tones are understated, with textured wallpaper and the room was quiet and dark, with blockout curtains, ensuring a good nights rest.Thoughtful touches included free wifi and a free mobile phone, accessible for the duration of the visit - ensuring you were unlikely to get lost. A man made onsen on the top floor added to the relaxation. The restaurant on the first floor was first class. The location provided the opportunity for walks alongside the river, access to wonderful restaurants, bakeries and sweet shops tucked away in the highrises and walking distance to the Science Museum and Museum of Modern Art. The free shuttle bus linked the hotel to the train station, providing regular access. Our check out was outstanding - the young lady provided the fastest and most helpful and pleasant service, whilst organising the forwarding of our bags. We stayed three nights and were most impressed by the quality, style and value!
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Needless to say, I will not be staying here or at any other of the Mitsui Garden Hotels. Upon arrival after arriving in Narita and taking the Shinkansen from Tokyo to Osaka and being delayed because of a typhoon. I arrived hoping to just get some rest. Unfortunately, this would not be the case.I started by checking in and sent numerous emails months in advance that my room would be for just two people. I had to change which friend would be staying with me, since another was going to be arriving late and found their own hotel. This was discussed via email with the staff two months in advance.So, after clearing up this confusion, again. Even though two months in advance, they said they understood. I was told my room was not available. That only a King bed was, after I reserved a room with two beds. I was too tired from traveling for over 24 hours straight and a typhoon. I just said “fine” and went to my room.Before I stay in any room, I always check for bed bugs. This is a habit I have done since I started traveling on a regular basis since 2011. Quickly into my search, a bed bug was found, I recorded a video of it and showed the two young ladies at the front desk. I asked to speak with a manger. They said that no manager was there. This was the final straw and I demanded a refund and called a small local hotel that was bed bug free and stayed there. This was the worst experience at a hotel I’ve had in Japan to date. This was my fourth time in Japan and can’t believe how unorganized and unclean a hotel could be. If I could give zero out of five, I would.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hotel in a calm yet central business district, on Nakamoshima Island between two rivers, conveniently close to Osaka Station and with its own shuttle bus. There was a mix of tourists and business people, but I did not see any groups bigger than 4-5 people and they don’t have the spaces to cater to conferences. Pluses for me: they have a nice public bath, and you can open the windows in the rooms. I liked the restaurant both for breakfast and dinner. The staff are exemplary and even helped me with a personal issue. I would be happy to stay here again if I return to Osaka.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We started out 3 week trip to Japan in Osaka and after a very long journey to get here the Mitsui Garden Hotel was the perfect hotel to touchdown in to.Friendly and efficient service from the hotel team and the room on the 14th floor that we had was compact but perfectly formed. A super comfy bed (to get over the jetlag!), quiet and very clean, almost excessively as they changed our room slippers and wash cloths every day!The free access to the lounge on the top floor was great too for a relaxing afternoon coffee after a trip to the Onsen.As we were too tired when we arrived we chose to have dinner at the hotel restaurant which turned out to be very tasty and great value for a hotel meal.Location wise it's a short walk to the Higobashi subway station and a couple of stops to the action of central Osaka.Would definitely recommend this hotel and stay again!
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is wonderful hotel at Osaka. Beautiful common bath, with the spirit of Japan. Wery clean and extremly comfortable rooms, with private barhrooms. For me it was new expirince, their toilets with all ways for washing body . Thanks Hali Iwasaki for giving to me and mz husband such wunderful expiriance.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my partner recently on our first trip to Osaka. Our room had a nice view of the river, was quite spacious compared to other rooms we have had here in Japan and was modern, clean and tidy. There is a shuttle service to and from Osaka station which was super convenient for all of our day trips to surrounding areas, and also means if you have a JR pass you don’t need to spend extra money on the subway to get around Osaka. Only down side for us was the pillows weren’t that comfortable.Would recommend.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights, my partner, myself and my one year old. We got a slightly larger room so we could put up the portacot as lots of hotel rooms in Japan are quite small. Very clean and modern. Our room was quite low so had frosted windows with no view but that’s alright cause we were mostly out exploring.Very helpful front desk! And there is a free shuttle that runs to and from Osaka Station every half hour which links you up to everything. It looks slightly out of the way but may as well be central because of the shuttle. Would definitely recommend staying here!
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel in September 2018.Rooms were very clean and suprisly spacious. We ended up staying an extra night due to the typhoon. The staff at the hotel were fabulous and booked us straight back in after we tried to leave Osaka. We ate at the restaurant once and it was one of the best meals we had during our trip.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 4 nights in total. Hotel is clean, comfortable, rooms well appointed, staff welcoming. Thanks to previous TA comments we knew to get the free shuttle bus on our arrival outside Albi outdoor store, after exit Osaka station via Sakurabash gate. Walk half way down the store front and you will see busstop information signs for several hotels. The hotel is in the business district, and there are a few good hidden gems nearby for drinks, dinners, etc, particularly Manryo and Beer Belly, if that’s your thing. Hotel restaurant also seems to do good meals at lunch, etc. We opted to have breakfast there on 2 days. It was enjoyable, very Japanese as you would expect, we enjoyed it, tho it doesn’t vary much. This is standard for most hotel breakfast buffets world wide so not a criticism, eggs your way available, toast, cereal, so you don’t have to eat like a local. We were here when the second typhoon hit on 29 Sep, and pretty much the whole city began to close down as a precaution from noon. We almost got stuck in Osaka as even the metro started to close at 2pm. The hotel kept us informed via tannoy system about shuttle bus stopping. We had an early dinner reservation across the bridge at Manryo, and decided to brave the torrential rain as it was only 5mins away. The staff spoke to us on leaving to ensure we would be safe which was considerate of them. To be honest at 6pm it wasn’t that bad, much heavier when we returned 90mins later. We checked in with them on our return so they knew we were safe. This is a country that puts personal safety high, so it wasn’t a surprise places closed. The Seven Eleven’s were doing a great trade on food and snacks that night! Would definitely return as it is a great base. Easy to get to wherever, made easier with the shuttle service, and metro close by too.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stuck in the hotel with no means of leaving it unless happy to risk being blown over. Restaurant unavailable as limited seating and the hotel will not open up the additional lounge area for all the guests who have no option but to stay in their bedrooms looking at the storm outside. Apparently, though, we have the use of the vending machines which offer beer, water and soda....
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I truly enjoyed my stay in this hotel during my visit to Osaka. The rooms are clean and comfortable with a simple modern touch to its design. I booked the room with the river view which provides a marvelous view. The staffs are friendly and even accommodate my request to refund my one night stay when I told them that I have to check out one day earlier as my flight home has been diverted to Tokyo Narita as a result of Typhoon Jebi which disrupt flights in and out of Kansai Airport. The hotel also offers a free onsen experience at its Garden Spa. The hotel provides free shuttle bus service to Osaka Station and is also within a short walk to the nearest metro station. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Osaka.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: hotel is right beside the river in the9 business district, and is within walking distance to several subway stations. higoshiba station can take you south to shinsaibashi for food and shopping, and one station north is umeda with daimaru dept store, umeda sky building and osaka station. room is decent-sized with nice wooden floors and big window for view. onsen on the 16th floor is also a bonus.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very neat n tidy hotel. Ideal size and bed is comfortable. Just not direct access to Osaka train station but hotel provides shuttle bus. Hotel area is quite. Hotel with onsen and that is great. Price for sure is good deal.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Depending on what you aim to do this was a perfect hotel for us. The rooms are quiet and a reasonable size. It is not in a busy area with lots of night life if you want that, don’t stay here. However it is convenient for the subway 5 minutes walk across the river and there are plenty of genuine Japanese restaurants close by which serve excellent food for a very reasonable price. We did not try the hotel restaurant. There is a shuttle to Osaka main station(not the Shinkansen stop)which we used when we arrived. However we found that we could get around easily on the subway and buses with the aid of google maps. In addition there is an outstanding French restaurant ( Varier) which does a very good value lunch 5 mins walk away.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked 3 rooms this property at a high price and we expected a lot more. The reception area was really so so. The service was good, nothing much to say about that. The room was really small for the price, we expected larger rooms and that was the down side of our stay. The bed was comfortable and the facilities in room was modern. The highlight was the WiFi they lend you for your whole stay! What a great tool, we were there for a short stay so that made it way more practical to walk around and discover the area! The breakfast can be improved (food and service) for this type of establishment. The location is not the best but still ok
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had read favorable reviews of this hotel, and I will say, they were accurate: a very clean, midrange business-hotel property, decidedly within Osaka's business/financial district. There are a few things around, but take the free hotel shuttle to where the action is for shopping. The staff was friendly, not quite overwhelmed with a pretty busy day of guests,and everything worked out well--timing, taxi calling, luggage handling. The room was fine--clean, with a compact but nice layout. It was comfortable enough, but a squeeze for two. Would we stay again? Depends on what we do in Osaka, but if this hotel were convenient for our needs, it would be in the running.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay for 3 nights in this hotel. The room is Very confortable and Clean. There is a handphone in the hotel room for us to use around the city provided with Free wifi and Free call for selected country. The service is good and Very helpfull. We Have our dinner in the hotel restaurant. It is delicious. We Will stay in this hotel again If wE stay in Osaka.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The good about this hotel is still pretty new and lovely decor and big enough room for japanese std. Downside is location wise need 10-15 mins walk to subway station and its not mainline yotsubashi line. You need to walk further to main line which is midosuji line that connect you everywhere. You can connect through yotsubashi line but expect long walk. Love the onsen at garden spa 16th floor. Tried to booked smoking room but they ran out during my stay all smoking room are booked. They have smoking area at 2nd floor though. They provide free shuttle to/from osaka station south exit sakurabashi gate which is nice. But last shuttle from osaka station at 21.30. Nice overall stay just wish location is nearer to central subway line and got my smoking room.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
