review_body: This is a very nice, modern hotel. It is within a 500-800 metre walk of 2 different subway stations, or a free shuttle service to Osaka station roughly every half hour. But, it is located in a business area, and there is very few restaurants or shops near by.The room was very up to date, and as of now, is the only hotel that I have seen that had an available HDMI input port on the TV. If you stay here, I will let you know that the mini fridge is under the sink. I was upset that my room never had a fridge, until I discovered it only hours before checkout.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a pleasant surprise and the staff were incredibly helpful. Small room but done to a nice standard and the beds was extremely comfortable.The highlight for me was the on-site hot springs and exec lounge!
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my daughter's family and 2 little grandkids. Very clean and rooms are small but efficiently laid out. If you have a room in one of the lounge access floors, you can use their lounge on the top floor; the same floor where the large spa baths are located. We were able to take the kids up to the lounge where they had more room to run around. The baths are nice, not crowded in the evening, and very relaxing. Don't forget to take a towel from your room since they don't have towels for you to use! The breakfast buffet offers a varied Japanese breakfast as well as some Chinese and western options. Overall, a very comfortable stay. Its in a business area, so it gets quiet at night. There is a shuttle bus to one of the bigger Osaka stations (Umeda)but they do not run at noon time. Otherwise there is a small station nearby, and you can walk along the river for miles
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed my stay. Didn’t try the breakfast but dinner was lovely. The rooms are quite big comparatively. Ask for a room with a view. Convenience store and subway in high rise across the road. Just one problem, I read the reviews on how to get to kansai airport but the advice was wrong. You cannot jump on the jr Osaka loop and go directly to the airport. This mistake cost me $400 in taxi fees from Nara.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for two nights right in the middle of Golden Week 2018. Although the room was of a decent size for Japan and the bed was comfortable, we probably wouldn't opt to stay here again for a few reasons, but let's first start with the pros. PROSThe standard queen was a good size for two people by Japanese standards with good A/C and a fridge. However, those coming from countries where rooms are typically larger may find it a bit hard to move around with luggage. The shuttle to/from the Osaka train station (Osaka, not Shin-Osaka) was handy. If you have trouble finding the pick-up location at the station, just look for the Albi store (large outdoor shop) using the station directories/maps. Several busses and shuttles stop right in front of the Albi store and you just have to wait next to the sign posted for the Mitsui Garden Hotel (shuttle is a burgundy color). Check the hotel website for pick-up times, but note that there are no transfers for a couple of hours during mid-day. There is a small onsen on the top floor (separate for men and women). I don't believe I could go because apparently those with tattoos are not allowed (per past reviews, but I never tried or asked as I wasn't really interested). If this is what brings you here and you have tattoos, you may want to contact the hotel to confirm. They provide a smart phone to use throughout your stay. It's in the room on a charging pod. This is getting pretty big and we have had the same phones in other Japanese hotels, as well as hotels in other countries. CONSAs they say...location, location, location! While this hotel has a great view next to the river, it didn't fit the bill for the way we like to travel, particularly due to the bad weather while we were there. It's a 1.5 km walk to the Osaka station to catch the JR loop (or take the hotel shuttle or subway that isn't included in the JR pass) and 3.5 kms to Dōtonbori. Without rain, this would have been fine for us and we would have just walked everywhere. However, even with good weather, this makes getting around Osaka a bit more challenging for those with young kids. The last return shuttle to the hotel from Osaka Station at 21:30 was too early for us to catch (we didn't go back to the hotel until 23:00 or later both nights). While there is a Starbucks in the building across the street (to the right - kind of hidden behind the Family Mart), there isn't much else in the immediate vicinity. In summary, we just personally did not like the location of the hotel and would opt for something closer to Dōtonbori as we found ourselves there both nights during our stay. However, if you don't mind walking the distances and the weather is good OR it doesn't bother you to have to take the subway to get everywhere, then this hotel could be okay for you (especially at the right price).
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Terrible start to our stay here. Check in is at 3pm. We arrived at 11:30am. Our room was ready, but we were nonetheless forced to pay a $150AUD early check in fee. The only thing we needed to use in the room was an iron (as my wife was attending a business meeting before 3pm and needed to iron her shirt). This was clearly explained to the lady at the reception, who did not budge and refused to call the manager. So, we ended up paying $150AUD to iron a shirt. Massively unfair.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staffs as there always are in Japan. The room is in quite ok size comparing with other hotels in Japan. Nice breakfast with a lot of wonderful vegetables and small fish dishes. And fresh fruites and juices. also Porridges. Free access to the Healthy Water spa. Very nice.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has very informative website.FreeShuttles run between Osaka JR Station 2-3 times most hours the exact times are on website.The room was good size for Japan.We were in Supreme Double without view on 14th floor.I suggest you do not pay extra for access to lounge unless you drink excessive volume of coffee.. It is a very nice usually empty space with free Jura coffee and free Japanese soft drinks - small times of cold coffee or fruit juice mixture see my pictures.No alcohol. No sodas.No bottled water.The bathroom is typical Japanese style. It is a wet room with no separate shower.The very large flat screen TV has CNN.The only negative was the distance from shopping which is 2.2 km , in Japan pedestrian traffic that is a good 15 to 20 minute walk. The subway and metro is very little assistance in this regard as the walk to subway that takes you to shops is 700 metres then another 800 from closest station to the shops.There are many small good restaurants within walking distance.There are separate men and womens olsens on 16 floor free of charge for guests.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Compact room - ok size - clean Good onsen - ladies side had outdoor JacuzziRestaurant really good - fitted us in and we were very impressed. Location good as 5 mins walk to subway / station one way - 15 mins the other direction. Shuttle bus available but from Osaka station we arrive on Shinkansen to Shin-Osaka this is ¥3000 in taxi. My fault- hadn't done my research.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time at this japanese chain and the outcome could not not be better.Service is outstanding, staff responding above and beyond to customer needs. Polite, courteous and welcoming, perfect example of japanese hospitality.The only thing that maybe is not perfect is the location which is still a bit far by foot from the train station but hotel has a frequent shuttle to and from the station that clearly compensates this shortcoming.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Osaka was our first port of call on our Japanese trip, and we were delighted to be able to call the Mitsui Garden home for three nights.Upon arrival (a Saturday morning), we were a little surprised to find the area around the hotel so quiet, but it certainly came to life Monday morning (this being a business area).One thing business people need the world over is coffee, and there is a plentiful supply of cafes around the hotel. We sampled a few, as our room didn't include breakfast. All of which were really good (there is also a Starbucks amongst these, for those who want something familiar).Most of the areas tourists will want to access in Osaka, including Umeda and Dotombori are easily accessible by the two subway stations which are a short walk from the hotel.The hotel itself is fabulous, it has such a warm homely feel to it, thanks to the decor and the friendly, welcoming staff. The room are also well appointed, with lovely wooden floors (be sure to take your shoes off!) and are a good size for Japanese hotel rooms. Everything is fairly new and as you would expect for a mid-range hotel like this.Conveniently for travellers, there is an onsite laundry, a bargain at Y300 per load.There is also a public bath on the top floor. While I didn't use this, my partner said it was terrific.Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Mitsui Garden during our time in lovely Osaka. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights at the start of our 3 week holiday in Japan. The hotel was easy to get to as they have a free shuttle bus from Osaka station. The hotel is by a river and you can access the subway with a 5 minute walk. From the subway everything is pretty easy to get to in Osaka. The room was cosy, and had everything we needed and a lovely view of the surrounding area also. The cherry blossoms in the hotel garden had just started to bloom which was a nice surprise. There are a few restaurants within walking distance and a great little coffee/boulangerie in the Festival building opposite. They do have a restaurant in the hotel.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the first time that I visit Osaka, the hotel staff and the facilities of the hotel gave me a wonderful welcome. The rooms are cosy and they have a Japanese hot tub on the 16/F too. That helped me to relax after some stressful excursions and I definitely recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived at KIX around 8:30 pm and after reading on trip advisor, i understand the shuttle services stopped at 9:30pm so we took the cab from Umeda station back to the Hotel. It costs us around 680 yen. Check in service was smooth. Front desk staff were extremely helpful. Rooms are normal size as other Japanese hotels, and I think this is more spacious than other hotels I have been in Tokyo. LOVE the bathroom, with the toilet, sink and shower/ bath tub are seperated (I really can't get enough of it). The hotel is also very quiet at night, being away from the Umeda station.There's a convenience store right across the hotel that opens 24-7, including Sunday. Shuttle service was great. And nothing beats the convenience of Umeda station, with JR and all other subway/ train passing by. You can easily hop on the train to Kyoto, Wakayama and surroundings. There are also lots of department stores around the Umeda station. Although prices aren't as cheap as the shops at Namba but they are nothing but great.I've already planned my next visit in Osaka and plan to stay at this hotel again.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed in a standard double room, non-smoking, with a view. Location was good and lobby of hotel was nice. Decor was nice, modern and neat.Room was small, alot smaller than our equivalent hotel in Tokyo. Had 2 armchairs in it...why in such a small space? No tea/coffee facilities (or no tea/coffee/nespresso provided).Staff were courteous but not willing to go extra mile. Despite paying good money we were not allowed to use the spa later on the evening when we checked out. Our flight was late at night and in other hotels I've stayed at I've been able to use such facilities to freshen up. But here it was a firm no. Trying to organise a late checkout seemed like hard work.There are no international channels or any news channels on TV. Which seems crazy.Overall a pleasant enough stay but I doubt I'd go back.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located 20 minutes walk or 10 minutes by free shuttle bus or ¥680 taxi ride from Osaka station .Our Rooms have canal view and feel like in Venice .Though small in size they are clean and supplied with 2 free bottles of drinking water and tea and coffee . There are kettle and hair dryer . No iron but hot press for trousers .Timber flooring with small patch of carpet at entrance .Safety box at bottom drawer of cupboard .Strict check in (1500) and check out ( 1100) policy .Front desk service is excellent .House keeping staffs left room clean and tidy every morning .Free and always on time shuttle bus driver is always very polite and helpful with luggage. The complimentary hand held Handy device proves to be very useful to provide tethering wifi and free local and international phone calls .Spa access on 16 th floor prove to be very relaxing and enjoyable experience Competitive room rate makes it a great hotel to return for future Osaka stay
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located in Nakanoshima, which is one of my favorite neighborhood in Osaka. You can have a nice walk or jogging in the morning.The hotel room is not as large as the luxury ones but quite good in Japanese business hotel standard. It is new and neat and not far from the subway station.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are very pleasant and helpful the rooms are very clean and comfortable the breakfasts are deliciousWe found the location perfect, close to transport. We also walked to different places and you see lots of things a long the wayThank you everyone we will miss your hospitality
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is a bit far away from the main tourist spot but hotel provide shuttle bus to goto Osaka Station. Room is spacious unlike those mini one you find in namba. The best thing is there is hot tub and jacuzzi on the roof top. You can enjoy the hot tub and look up for the stars. Definitely will coming back. The only downside is there is no lotion in room which is important for ladies
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is well located, reasonably priced and offers comfortable accommodation.The service is excellent.The rooms are compact (i.e. relatively small), but comfortable. What I liked the most was the Japanese-style toilet and bathroom.Very large TV screen, though not in a very favourable position, as one cannot watch TV from the bed without having to turn one's neck. I guess the layout of the room doesn't allow to have the TV in front of the bed, but still. I found it very impractical. The choice of TV channels is as per Japanese standard, which means that CNN is the only English-language channel.I missed a bottle of water in the room.Breakfast caters mainly for a Japanese clientele, but I was pleasantly surprised about the toast, which was excellent in taste and with the right thickness. Not easy to find such good toast in Japan. Also the freshly brewed coffee was excellent and not necessarily expected.A few things that could perhaps be improved (though the position of the TV may be a challenge), but overall a hotel that offers a very pleasant stay at a reasonable rate.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located in a quiet location. It is also not far away from the Umeda/ Osaka Station area. You can choose to walk 15-20mins or take the scheduled shuttle bus between the hotel and the station. Lobby is big and bright. Check-in process was quick. While queuing, other staff were busying explaining the hotel facilities and rules to the waiting guests. This is good as it minimises waiting time for explanation later.For the room, the size is just about right. Small, but enough for us with our big luggages. And waking up to the river view every morning just lighten the mood. Bed and pillows are comfortable. Furnishing looks new and is kept neat by the housekeeper daily.
hotelName:
22    Mitsui Garden Hotel Osaka Premier
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceptionally busy from our arrival. Greeted by a talking robot at the concierge desk which amused us until rooms were ready. Very friendly and obliging staff. Numerous restaurants within the hotel complex, the Japanese one quite expensive. The Buffet dinner with drinks in the Hotels main dining room excellent value. here are many other eating venues in close proximity to the hotel if desired. rooms were small but comfortable, no coffee facilities but hot water and green tea available. Free WiFi. bedding was comfortable but with the inevitable hard pillows. Excellent buffet breakfast, quite outstanding. The only downside to our stay, was the long wait on our final day before transfer to the Airport for our homeward journey. I must make mention of the Guest Relations Manager, Sujan Adhikari who went out of his way to ensure our comfort, by providing a lovely waiting lounge with free coffee and tea facilities. Sujan made regular visits to us to make sure all our needs were met. A lovely area with a mock Japanese room and attire to 'dress up' was at our disposal, and many great photos were taken, mementos of our wonderful stay in Japan.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The simple & smallest hotel for our journey, but it's okay we need a rest a lot. We stay for 2 nights. Actually i didn't really remember the surrounding. But overall we love our trip to japan & stay at this hotel still part of that.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first Hotel with a group tour with WebJet. Comfortable beds that did have a sheet on top, not just the doona. Two double beds not singles.Lots of room and everything you needed in the bathroom.Breakfast European style was good.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights during my recent visit in Osaka. Staff are so friendly and helpful. Rooms are always clean and I love the toilet..it's small but very old Japan! Buffet breakfast is good but they can add more variety. Location is good, walking distance to train station, restaurants, and Donki. Feel secured during my stay in this hotel. Will definitely come back.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were recently travelling with a group around Japan and spent our last couple of nights in this amazing city. Although the bathroom in our room was very small and a step was supplied to get up into it, the location of this hotel was brilliant! Only 5 minutes walk to the station and 2 stops on the train to the centre of Osaka. A very popular hotel, so breakfast was extremely busy, but there was plenty of seating and the food choices were great. The hidden gem however, is the view from the roof terrace. WOW! We were extremely lucky to have the Manager - Adhikari Sujan Bahadur - personally escort us and we were not disappointed with the stunning view. Uninterrupted views across the river to the skyline of Osaka! A bar with stunning night time views only a floor below was an additional treat with a very good gin and tonic!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is difficult to rate, as it has some very strong and some very week points. First of all, it is located in the North of Osaka, fR from any point of interest. The walk to hotel from the closest station is through a bad area, a kind of Bourbon street. If you managed to get to the hotel, you are welcomed by an excellent team, determined to do all is needed to make your stay memorable. Now you think you are in... until you get to your room: the smallest you have seen and, guest what, with the smallest bathroom. Clean, but outdated, as if it had it’s best time about 15 years ago.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent only night at this hotel, This is a very simple, nice hotel with a warm welcoming staff service.The room is quite small but very neat but I am okay with that.I didn't try any restaurant at the hotel except the breakfast area. The Breakfast Buffet is the best among the whole family Trip in Osaka. The Buffet locates at the 1/F, where provides different varieties of food and beverages for you to choose. I had a full and wonderful breakfast there .
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great tasty buffet for people with food allergies. Food was clearly labelled and there were many options to chose from. Hotel staff were helpful and friendly, even with big groups coming through. Can also recommend 19th floor OUSAKA Teppanyaki restaurant for an amazing gluten-free meal cooked in front of you. Thank you Adhikari for looking after us so well.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed overnight in this Hotel and had comfortable beds with excellent cleanliness in the room.It was an easy walk to Restaurants from the Hotel. We were up high and had good views from the room. Staff very friendly.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here while on holiday to Osaka. The hotel is located a bit away across the river though. So we cabbed it daily to the main city area and back as well.Good especially on their rooftop restaurant was sumptuous with a personal chef to cook your beef steak or fish steak!Staff was good and friendly!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spacious room for a Japanese hotel. Well equipped, clean. Breakfast comes in a Japanese and Western option, the latter has table service. Which in our case was irritatingly slow. The hotel is not far from Juso station on the JR network. On leaving the station you pass many restaurants and a red-light district. My impression was that in spite of that it was perfectly safe, also for women.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Whilst lobby , restaurants and overall appearance is first class the actual rooms are very small and in need of refurbishment.Bathroom (?) is so small you can barely turn around but shower is good.Unfortunately we arrived late at night and left early next morning so could not comment on restaurants or surrounding area.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Negatives-(1) The Hotel was not centrally located for shopping (depending on what you wanted to buy) but you can always get a taxi at reasonable rates (there were 3 of us so we shared the fares). Wish had a longer stay.(2) The walls and ceilings are not sound proofed; you can hear sounds from other rooms especially from upstairs. But still 'manageable' though.(3) The hotel rate can be considered pricey but then again we're in Japan so yeah :P Positives-(1) I must commend they staff especially those at the reception counter as well as those at their souvenir shop. They speak good english and and were able to provide assistance and give recommendations and they were very friendly and attentive. (2) We only spent 1 night in Osaka and we checked in around 8,.30 p.m. after arrival from Hiroshima, I wanted to do a little shopping at UNIQLO & H&M... one of the female staff member at the reception helped to call a taxi but there was no taxi available so she asked me to wait at the nearby taxi stand and wrote a note in Japanese for me to show to the taxi driver. Everything went smoothly THANK YOU SO MUCH!!! (3) There is a duty-free store nearby the hotel. There is a taxi stand just next to the store.(4) There is a convenience store nearby too.(5) Their breakfast was very good with standard variety of Japanese/oriental as well as western dishes.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Of the different hotels we stayed at during our stay in Japan, this was slightly further than the others from it’s nearer station. But it’s still well within walking distance (less than 10min walk) and you get to see the neighborhood and it’s bars, shopping districts and eateries. Room cleanliness was good and the daily housekeeping kept it that way. The Iroha Guest Lounge is a fun place to hang out in with complimentary Japanese snacks with traditional Japanese and modern pop culture (anime cosplay) outfits that the lounge staff will help you don. You can then take pictures on their tatami floored ‘diorama’ of a traditional Japanese setting.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Osaka at winter ....This hotel is near from Osaka Station.. about 5 menit by Taxi (1000 Y) ... very clean n love the room size .... n many restaurant around .... recomended guys .... but U must pay for the onsen ... Lol..
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel itself is clean and rooms of a standard size. The breakfast was adequate and staff friendly. The room rates are also reasonable. Despite all of this, Juso area is typically known for its high concentration of love hotels and prostitution which was very obvious as I walked to the hotel from the train station
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A classic and rooms are small. It’s a Japanese cultural events found inside the hotel. Friendly staff and level 3 provides free drinks, snacks and Japanese cultural and traditional clothes for photos. Good food and not bad for an Osaka Hotel.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just 7 minutes walk to Hankyu railway stn , then 2 stops to Osaka stn and central city Umeda area .Larger than average rooms free wifi , Expresso machine in room , Clean and quiet . Good restaurants in area , Gym and pool are extra , did not use .
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel... small rooms, perfect restaurant and more than friendly staff.. The neighborhood is interesting but only the Winebar you MUST try... Cheaper restaurants you can find whitin 200 meters from the hotel
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location-7 minutes from Yuso train Station.good for Kyoto and city.good breakfast.very quiet.it is boutique hotel good for small groups of friends.rooms not too small.a lot of love hotels around.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for a week because it was convenient to my son's apartment and we were in town to spend time with him. We chose an executive twin and were pleasantly surprised at the huge room size (including a large leather couch with coffee table, round table and chairs, massage chair, two beds, and kitchenette, with space to spare). And the views from our 17th floor room were fantastic, with the river to the left and the sunset over the hills to the right. The place was big enough to entertain my son and his girlfriend a couple of times with no one sitting on beds! Those beds were nonetheless comfortable for sleeping and there was sufficient closet space. The bathroom was perfectly functional but lacking in aesthetics (a study in seamless tan plastic, just like I remember from an older business hotel my company used to use in Moriguchi). Overall, we were very comfortable and enjoyed our stay but don't expect luxury finishes and appointments (although it looked like some rooms were more updated). There are several restaurants on site; we ate lunch at the Japanese restaurant once and it was both very good and reasonably priced (plus discounts if you're a hotel guest). We'd stay here again in the same situation without hesitation.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first time to be in this part of Osaka. This hotel is located in mixed commerce and residential area of Osaka. Hotel is busy with business people and tourists. Half dozen buses are parked in the hotel parking.Hotel itself is old but it has been renovated so its not that bad. But parking spaces in B/F is small for cars of recent years.Rooms is OK. Amenities are a bit dated but still they function fine. Breakfast is also OK.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The pro:Room was ok, view was ok. There was no smell in the room, it was quite clean and nice.Service was ok as well, very fast check in and check out.Price was fair.The con:Not a good location to explore Osaka. It is close to a station, but you'll spend some time to make your way to/from the hotel to the Osaka center, so I would suggest a hotel in the center already. (I booked to late, there was almost no room in Osaka center, or they would be too expensive).Also, located among some love hotels.Solo Female Point of View:The room and hotel are safe and ok.But the location was not that nice. I did not like to go through the front of so many love hotels. There was no one in front, nothing happen, and Japan is considered very safe place. But that doesn't mean you can let your guard down. So I really suggest you go for another hotel, more in the center.If you have company, doesn't mind staying a little far from the center (trains in Japan are fast and great), this hotel is ok.So:Are you in a group and don't mind train travel? Stay here!Are you a solo female? Try somewhere else.With all respect to the workers of the hotel, they were all very polite and great! I would only stay here again with company and if the price was really a big deal compared to others hotel.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located at the edge of the Red Light District which is not nearly as scary as it sounds. Rooms are very tiny which is to be expected in a major city. It is a massive hotel and was popular at the time of our visit with school kids after a day at Universal. This was the last night of our study abroad adventure in Japan and we enjoyed a farewell dinner in a less than private dining area. Tough to make emotional speeches when you're competing for sound. Went for a run across the nearby bridge to get into the heart of Osaka to explore the area around the base of the Omeda Sky Building which we later toured. About a 30 min run but you will compete for space with bikes on the bridge so be careful. Not many of staff speak English so practice up on some Japanese. On a more positive note, at this point in our journey I was seriously craving a beer with flavor (not the same beer with a different label or can) and I found a nice IPA in the hotel gift area. Not cheep but tasty.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a very good location and when we Check in, it is so surprised to find that this year is their 30 years anniversary which is the year I was born! Is human is extremely kind and helpful. He not only solved our problem very quickly and also show our way to where we want to go. He is so sweet! Had a really good two days stay!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for two nights with our Nexus group. Room was very small but the bed was very comfortable for an excellent nights sleep. There was plenty of choice for breakfast but to get the attention of a staff member to cook and omelette was difficult.Is not located near CBD so it was a taxi ride to station or downtown. The hotel is also situated on the outskirts of the Red Light area. There were plenty of restaurants near by - plenty of choice from fast food to a proper meal.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for 4 nights with my parents. We came by bullet train and arrived at Shin-Osaka, and took a taxi to the hotel. It was close enough so that the fare was pretty cheap.Location:When the taxi was pulling into the area, I became pretty worried. We had just stayed in a nice area in Tokyo, and by comparison this area looked pretty sketchy. The area had several "Love Hotels", and was generally unattractive. I was pretty relieved when we finally arrived at the hotel, and it was the nicest thing in the area.Upon walking in, you could tell it was really nice and classy. We arrived too early to check-in, but the staff stored our bags for us while we went out. Then, there were no problems checking-in.The closest station is Juso, and it's not too far of a walk. There were a few restaurants nearby. We tried an Italian place, and an Okonomiyaki place, and neither of them had an English menu or English speaking staff. The staff was really nice though, and helped us as much as they could. I spoke just enough Japanese to get the gist of what they were saying, and we were able to have decent meals. The good thing was that Umeda Station (a big hub station connecting to Osaka JR Station) was only one stop away! So it was convenient enough to be able to travel to other places such as Nara, Kyoto, etc, Room:Our room was HUGE! We were really excited. Our hotel in Tokyo was tiny, but this room had 3-double sized beds, a lot of storage space for our belongings, and living-room area with couches and a coffee table. The only problem was that it smelled like smoke. The room was clean, but it had definitely been a smoker's room recently, and that bugged us. It bothered my mother a lot, so that night we told the front desk, and they were going to use a special machine the following morning to get rid of the odor. The next day, when we arrived, it still smelled. We went back to front desk, and they kindly agreed to move us to the next room. The room next door still had a faint smoker's smell, but not nearly as bad as the other room, so we agreed to stay. Food:The breakfast was buffet style. I was grateful there was an egg station where someone made your eggs to order. There were a lot of options to cater to several tastes, but none of the things I liked were high quality (scambled eggs, bacon, sausage, etc). I'm picky, though. But like I said, there were a lot of options (cereal, breads, etc). Every time we had breakfast before 8am it was extremely busy, and they stopped seating for breakfast at 9am. There were restaurants in the hotel as well, but they were obscenely expensive. On one day, we decided to have the Chinese Buffet. As usual, the staff was superb. But the food quality was low. For the three of us, it was about $100, which was not worth it, at all. I wonder if it was because we arrived at 8:30, half an hour before last order. Many of the restaurants closed at 9pm, which was pretty inconvenient for us because we are late-eaters. We were thinking about attending the steak place on the 19th floor because my parents wanted to see Teppanyaki-style dinner, but $65 per person for dinner was kind of steep for us, especially considering our crappy experience at the Chinese restaurant downstairs.Staff:The staff was really nice. They spoke enough English to help us with all our questions. We had no problems checking in or checking out. It was also nice of them to change our room. There were ladies assigned to hold the elevator for you, which was really cute touch. Overall, it was a good place for the price we paid.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for one night only in this hotel during my last family holiday. Since we were only staying one night after one day City tour in Osaka, we didn't explore too much this hotel. But overall, we enjoy this hotel. We can take a rest very well. And for the other day, we can take another trip to Kyoto with healthy mind and body. Thanks to the very kind hotel staffs.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent two nights in Osaka while driving from Tokyo down to Hiroshima. Travelling with an odd number of three, this place worked out nicely. We were able to get a small room with three beds. It was small - the beds were small, the bathroom was small, everything was small. But who cares? It was well worth it, as we were out and about all day sightseeing and really just needed a place to crash.I can't speak to the shops or restaurants, as we didn't really utilize them. The location is convenient to downtown.If you're planning to spend a lot of time in your hotel room, maybe opt for something roomier and cozier. But, if you're like me and are there to see the sites, this will do and save your wallet.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for a night, herewith a bad and good things:GoodNear Don Xing store where I can stop and buy some omyageClean and quite areaMany restaurant aroundBadSmall room and small bathroom (for a tall person like me)Thin bed cover (too bad for an autumn cover, felt freezing all night)Less Halal food for breakfast ( milk and toast then go)Near "rabu-rabu/love-love" hotel, many old drunk man passing thru while am on the street.Enjoy!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is good to look at but the room that I am in is like a student accommodation room, maybe slightly better than a back packer room. I suppose it is ok if you just want to have a bed to sleep in only. The shower module is just that, a module!! There is not much room to manoeuvre...pity a bigger person.Pick a wrong time to stay as most hotels been booked out.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there 3 nights with friends. The staff is very kind and helpful. They helped us for a pavkage we had to send and other little stuff like printing tikets. The room is kind a big after i've seen the Tokyo's hotels rooms standard but with quite old furniture. It is clean by the way but it's located not in a very good location. In any case you can reach other area with the subway or the bus which are not far from the hotel. Worth the price.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is o.k., but as a guest being charged for service at the bar (Le Point; which set us back for 3000 yen for just two beers) was quite a disappointment. Next time we prefereren a place in the area.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stay there for vacation with family.but was very disappointed when i checked in. the room smells. the carpet is full of stains. only 1 pillow per bed. tiny room that should not place 3 beds in it.the front desk is not friendly and feel discriminate against foreigners.the only positive part is the 1 older guest service and 1 older Bell staff is good service. the males front desk is terrible.the hotel is far from train station but not sure why other reviews says is close by. the hotel is surrounded by Love Motels, not recommended for family.any way not recommended. and will not go back.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 1 night only with a tour group. We arrived quite late in the evening after a long day at Universal Studio & Shin Sai Bashi and it's heart-warming to be welcomed with such hospitality by the hotel staffs. They speak English well so it's easy to approach them should you need anything. The room was so small, the bathroom was so tiny. I saw the gym facility was great, too bad I didn't have much time to try it out. Although the room was so small, but the room amenities were great. They provide all your basic needs, even the soap and the shampoo were Shiseido, one of the foremost brand in Japan. As most hotel in Japan does, the hotel really pays attention to the cleanliness of the surroundings so it was very convenient for me. The breakfast was average as they separated the venue for group & individual travellers. Maybe the served better on the other restaurant. However, the service for the group breakfast was amazing. Even though the restaurant was packed, the staffs were very fast in doing the buffet refill as well as clearing up the dirty dishes. They provide free wifi too in the public area and in the room. Overall this hotel is recommended for travellers who are intended to stay for 1 or 2 nights only.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was very comfortable, we slept very good here. Great view from the 10th floor over the river and city. Bathroom was ok, Shiseido body soap and shampoo, but has a somewhat steep exit. Free fast wifi in the room. Location is not great, some obscure hotels and bars in the neighbourhood, walking distance to the railway station, there you have to take the train to Umeda station: for us one of the most confusing transport hubs in Japan and there you can take the subway for your destination.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean hotel but the bathroom area is too small. Not advisable to stay in this hotel when travelling with senior citizens because of their bathroom. Nothing special about the breakfast selection. They should add more choices. The location is okay, few steps away from Lawson and Family Mart. Walking distance to the popular Don Quijote. Housekeeping staff are very good.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a big hotel that one gets the impression that it is either in the four or five star hotel category, but it is not.CONS:1. The cost is in the "pricey" territory (about US$ 130 a night) that, methinks, for less than that, one can still get the same service and facilities. The point is, there is nothing remarkable about this hotel except, maybe, No. 2 below.2. Taking off from the typical Japaneses hotel, the rooms have two larger-than-usual bed: One queen size and one oversized single bed (48" x 75"). Yes, this is true even in their "single rooms." I know since I booked both twin and single rooms and lo, I discovered that they are exactly the same, making me thin in hindsight that I should have booked all single rooms instead (cost is only about US$ 86).3. Because of No. 2 above, there is hardly any space between the two beds that one has to tip toe passing these two beds to be able to traverse from the main entry area to the other end of the room which is the window and TV area.4. As with other Japansese hotels. the cable TV are all Japanese channels that tourist may find it not necessary to turn on this appliance.5. The Toilet/Bath area is so miniscule that If you are big in height, say about 5'10 and above, you will have a hard time squeezing yourself inside it, much more its bath tub.6. The price stated in No. 1 above doesn't come with breakfast so no review of food here.7. Since this is a big hotel, there are times that using the lift will be a challenge and guests gathering at the lift waiting area tend to get noisy.8. On rush hours, the lobby area becomes noisy as guests gather in that area.9. There are no big shopping places nor tourist spots near the area.PROS.1. As mentioned in the title and No. 2 above, the beds provided can actually accommodate three persons.2. the rooms are neat and clean, ditto with beds and linens and towels.3. The hotel uses the Shiseido brand in its toiletries.4. The hotel location is fine with lots of convenenience store, a duty-free thrift shop (Don Quixote), eateries and flea market.5. Osaka is just one train station away.6. The hotel is very near the Juso Hankyu train station. Kyoto, through the end station called Kawaramachi station is just a train ride from Juse through the Hankyu line 7. After emerging from the Kawaramachi station, you can simply walk and go through the different tourist sites in Kyoto passing by several historic temples, shrines and parks.8. The wi fi in the hotel room is good.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 2 nights here in Feb 2015. I paid more here than I usually pay for hotels (average about $115 USD per night), but I made my reservations last minute and didn't have many other options. I felt I wasn't getting much for the price and rather disappointed compared to what I got for a similar price in Kyoto. But it's in Osaka and location was ok, so I suppose that's what you are paying for. My room was clean but kind of old. The hotel is within walking distance to Juso Station. I wouldn't stay here again at the price I paid.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a three person room, which was an OK size. We were only able to get a smoking room, which was unfortunate, but the smell wasn't too bad. There are coin operated machines for washing and drying laundry in the basement which worked well.The nearest station is Juso, which is part of the Hankyu Railway line. You can change to the subway system at Umeda. Just follow the signs for the Midsouji Line. Or, conversely, follow the signs for Hankyu Railway when you're transferring from the subway to the Hankyu system.When using the ticket machines at Juso you need to put money in first before you can indicate which ticket you want.The Hankyu line can take you directly to Kyoto (e.g. for a day trip). But be aware the Google maps information for the Kyoto parts of the Hankyu line is generally wrong (e.g. you'll end up on local trains instead of express ones).There's a lot of love hotels around Plaza Osaka, by there's no dodgy characters on the street.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything is fairly good except the bathroom which is too small for my preference. However, they do compensate the size by providing an amazing set of toiletries. During my stay, the breakfast was equally fine yet too crowded, even on early morning. There was a long queue for the buffet and then another queue to get on a vacant table!!
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First let me start with the plaudits for the exceptional honesty displayed by the Hotel house cleaning maid whose name i was not able to ascertain inspite of efforts! I was staying with a friend of mine & while going for B`fast i left the key with him & told him to take it along with him.Being an elderly person he probably forgot.In the evening after we returned from the local sight seeing the key could not be found with him!keeping our fingers crossed when we reached our room we found it in exactly the same condition as we left with of course the cleaning having been done!My room partner had forgotten his expensive camera,purse full of money & suitcase open & all these things remain untouched!What a wonderful unique honesty!It would have been better of course if the maid had informed the reception lobby & deposited the room key there who did not know about the incident! This was one of the ever present Japanese character which i noticed as they strongly believe in `Karma`!Otherwise the room was old & scruffy & the bed linen in not a very good condition along with the toilet. A/C was not cooling & it took a very long time to get repaired & with the lack of english knowledge of the staff much more difficult! The B`fast was nothing much to write home about along with the service.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was quite large with small bathroom. Everything is good, clean with air purifier. Standard Breakfast, but the taste not bad. The outside view from our room is a lil bit dissapointed. Just can see other building around the hotel.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best thing about this hotel is it's location - quite in the heart of the city with alot of hustle and bustle around . There's also a 'Donkey store' around the corner where you get just about anything you're looking for . It tax free , so cheaper than other places . The hotel rooms are average . Breakfast too . But I guess good by Japanese standards .
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the 4th and last hotel our family stayed in during our road trip through western Honshu and Kansai. We had two adjacent rooms on the 5th floor. The rooms were a decent size, especially by Japanese standards, but the views were disappointing: other surrounding hotels, with a glimpse of the river between buildings. Inside, the hotel showed signs of being past its prime: dated furniture in the rooms and tacky white marble counters in the lobby. Also, the hotel was advertised as having a pool, but it turns out that it belongs to the Gold's Gym on the 2nd floor and you have to pay extra to use the pool and children under 16 cannot go in, even with an adult accompanying--our kids were disappointed. When I paid for parking, the concierge pulled out a battered metal cash box. Parking was a hassle: not included with the price and then difficult to negotiate with the attendant in the basement garage, as he wanted not only the hotel's parking receipt but some ticket thing. Even then, they grudgingly allowed us to use one of the larger spaces for our crossover SUV. Overall, the hotel gave the impression of a formerly nice hotel that is ageing and declining to be average.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: HiI was in this hotel 2 weeks ago. The hotel is situated close to Jumbo station. Unfortunately it is private metro station ( it costs 150 YEN from Umeda). So if you have public subway ticket, choose other hotel. Apart from that I liked the hotel. Rooms are quite big. In toilet you have conditioner, shampoo, face wash and body soap. So it's plenty to choose. There's a wifi in rooms and you can use a computer and free printer next to reception. Highly recommmebded
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights and we really liked the room with views on the 23rd floor.As we arrived the receptionist gave us a room on a lower floor which and it was very small and old. We asked for a better room and they offer us an upgrade for an extra 700Y (≈10$) per night. We accepted and the new room was much better. Bigger, newer and with views over the river and Osaka. The area around is quite interesting, there are many Love Hotels around Plaza Osaka and there are also many great options for food, izakayas and restaurants, specially around Juso train station.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice front desk staff, and some speak English! Room is small, but clean which was my main requirement! Location to Osaka activities is a bit far, which I knew in advance; just didn't realize downtown parking would be so expensive. (and already paying 1500yen/day at hotel).
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A poor experience. From a room with materials unchanged since the 50s to a name and address that taxi drivers couldn't recognize, in itself a very bad sign. And not much at all as redeeming factor, poor location, high noise level. Definitely best avoided.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Even though it is near a local rail station, it is not easy to locate the place in the night. Even the JR rail staff was barely able to find it on the local map. Taxi from Shin-Osaka Station costed nearly 3,000 Yen.Although we requested for non-smoking room on non-smoking floor, we were given a smoking room. The staff were very unhelpful, it was either take it or leave it and forfeiting our payment. They didn't even bother to attempt to help in any way.After we checked out, they refused to provide any assistance to contact our local guide; we couldn't even leave a message at the front counter.My family was so upset with the experience that we didn't even bother to tour Osaka and just proceeded on to the next stage of our journey (Hiroshima).
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is good value for money and has three very good restaurants. It is way way out of town though, close to a metro train station that will take you to Kyoto, Kobe and into Osaka. It is also surrounded by "love hotels". The covered market than runs from the train station parallel to the hotel and beyond is a great way to see everyday modern Japanese life. the hotel also has a taxi rank right outside and late check out. the website is in English and most of the staff also speak some English.
hotelName:
23    Hotel Plaza Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for four nights and it was absolutely lovely. The rooms are wonderfully and thoughtfully appointed, the pyjamas were heavenly, and the views were stunning. One of our favorite hotel experiences for sure. Thank you!
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our second visit to this hotel. We were impressed the first time so decided to come back. The location of the hotel is extremely convenient if you're taking the train to go to the airport or another city in Japan. It is not really central for touristic sights. Both times we stayed in Osaka as a transit stop so it has worked out perfectly for us. The service is very attentive and detail oriented. I read some reviews where people think the service is not good. I have to say that my understanding is that people often take their jobs very seriously in Japan, so what might be perceived as "not friendly" is actually them being respectful and courteous. The rooms are well-appointed and spacious for Japan. The view is always great. I enjoy the cute pjs and the shower with good water pressure. The club lounge is what sets this hotel apart for us. The space is big with high ceilings. Beautifully decorated with Japanese accents. The service again, is 100% on point. The food for happy hour was easily enough for dinner. The beverages offered are a step above the average. Breakfast featured eggs made to order, which is usually missing from a lounge breakfast. Our second stay was just as wonderful as our first. I highly recommend this hotel and will be staying here again next time I am jn Osaka.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Daughter and I travelled around Japan staying in the Marriott Miyako in Osaka. Rooms were lovely in a great location with incredible views. The hotel is above the department store and train station. We did get a little lost on a few occasions when getting of the train and finding our way through the large department store to where the lifts where for accessing the hotel. There is also a zoo near enough next to the hotel and lots of temples to visit. Very good, clean, modern hotel with everything you need nearby. Like everywhere in Japan, it’s a problem with the language barrier, the staff in this hotel are very helpful.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location, easy access to the airport and other major areas by underground. Nearby with a few big malls which is good for family with baby / kids who doesnt want to go too far and can always go back to rest. Free ticket to harkas 300.Recommended for ppl want a short getaway shopping trip.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The highlight of this hotel is the incredible views from the rooms. Since this is one of the tallest buildings in Osaka (and Japan), the views are breathtaking.Check-in: Because this hotel is so massive, the lobby & check-in felt like you were lining up for airport security. The overall lobby was very bright with dramatic high-ceilings but not many spaces to sit & relax.Service: As English speakers, it was a little harder to communicate with the staff, but regardless everyone was friendly & warm. Even though we are platinum elite at Marriott, none of the perks were offered to us (early check-in, room upgrade, etc).Rooms: The rooms are the redeeming quality of this hotel as the view is spectacular & truly breathtaking. The rooms were very clean & very well maintained.Overall this hotel is a great value. Due to the size of this hotel, be prepared for large amounts of crowds entering & exiting (the elevator wait can sometimes take 10+ minutes) but if love a good view, this is the perfect hotel.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve booked 3 rooms for our 5 night trip to Osaka & very delighted for choosing the Marriott. Not only because of its location with numerous shopping /food option & easy access to public transportation, but also for its specious rooms & breathtaking view of Osaka. The hotel has good gym facilities but jogging in the nearby park or around the Osaka castle is not to be missed. Certainly the highlight of a family trip to Osaka is universal studies , the concierge can help with park tickets & fast pass.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Japan, one of our DREAM DESTINATION. Finally, we decided for the 1st week of JUNE 2019. to make our 15thWEDDING ANNIVERSARRY - we stayed in MARRIOT MIYAKO HOTEL @ ABENO HARUKAS.The STAFF: VERY RESPECTFUL, HELPFUL. the moment your check in and with our daily stayed and interaction- the people/ staff were AWESOME.THE ROOM : we were assigned to room #4908 - SUPER NICE VIEW - overlooking OSAKA high rise buildings, sunrise and part sunset. THE ROOM WAS SUPER CLEAN. the room attendant make sure we have clean towels and bed is super well fixed and ready when we arrive EVERYDAY from tour.THE LOCATION : centrally located - its by KINTENSU DEPARTMENT STORE; LOTS OF FOOD STALLS, gift shops and late restaurant available. Also, since its connected to Tennoji station, you have a SUPER EASY ACCESS TO ANY TRAIN STATION SERVICES. TAXI and BUS as well.OVERALL - we will give a 5 STAR EXPERIENCE.... SUPER PLEASED with the service and location and NOT TO MENTION the FREE access to 6OTH FLOOR ROOFTOP for great night view of OSAKA skyline.MARRIOT MIYAKO, you made our 15th Wedding Anniversary SUPER EXTRA SPECIAL!!!Arigato Gozaimas!!!!NOEL & TESS CABANFLORIDA, USA
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have traveled all over the world and the Marriott Osaka Miyako has been the most outstanding service we have been privilege to enjoy. Every employee took care of our every need from the front desk, the concierge team, the housekeeper and the staff in the club lounge..Being from Hawaii it was a honor to experience the Aloha Spirit alive & well at the Marriott Osaka MiyakoI look forward to returning again in the near future....Mahalo
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is easily the best Marriott we have ever stayed in. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. The air worked fine and the shower was great. But the real star of this hotel is the view, simply spectacular. The only drawback is it is not real close to the shopping district. There is a very nice mall with shops and restaurants right downstairs. Breakfast was very nice as well.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceptional service and a beautiful Marriott property located in the heart of Osaka. The hotel starts on the 19th floor where the Lobby is and guest rooms are beyond that. We stayed on the 41st floor and had a great view of the city. The room was spotless and comfortable. The hotel is also attached to the Abeno Harukas "Mall" which is an 8 floor department store which also has 3 floors of various restaurants to choose from. You can also access nearly any train line on the lower level which can take you from Tennoji Station to anywhere in the Osaka/Kyoto/Kobe area.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was excellent. Room service at its best with a very kind staff member who explained everything to us. The room is full of comfort and quite large, with a dedicated area for a hot bath and available bathrobes for every guest. They also added a bed for our toddler to sleep in.When we departed a very kind woman brought our bags to the train track in the morning! The train station is easily reachable with the elevators and booking a room grants you free access to the 63rd floor to enjoy a beautiful view of Osaka.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Marriott Osaka Miyako offers great service starting from greeting, registration at the counter and so on till you check out. The room has a superb view of the downtown from one of the tallest building, Haruka 300, in Osaka. (I don't know it can be compared with one in Umeda or not.) Gym facilities is excellent, again you will find yourself running way top of the city. What a great feeling.The room is clean. Location is excellent. Marriott Osaka Miyako is definitely the top choice. My stay in Osaka has been memorable with it. Thanks to Marriott.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spend 5 nights here and was so impressed by the modern setting of the hotel. Great location next to Tennoji JR station and underneath the hotel is a huge supermarket and linked to other railway options. We love walking around the shopping centers nearby and also go to the Supermarket below 30mins before closing time to buy different savoury and sweets to bring back to the hotel room for dinner. This was especially handy for travelling with family. There is also a small bank outlet to exchange money if you need in the lower ground between the entrance to the supermarket and the train station. The shopping centre across the street is very handy for varienty, also the nearby convenient store (like 7-11) were great for buying buys and snacks. THe hotel room and separate bathroom/toilet were great - super modern and always clean. the only feedback is the carpet were stain. Otherwise a great hotel and hotel staffs were extremely friendly. Much better than those in Tokyo. They also managed to help send our luggages (extra fees) to Tokyo as you can't bring big luggages on Shinkansen. Will come back again !
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location of the hotel is close to the Tennoji JR Station, which makes travelling around Osaka and surrounding area easy. Rooms are large and comfortable, the shower is especially refreshing and comfortable especially after a long day of sight seeing. The staff is very efficient and friendly, especially in the Executive Lounge, they are ready to go the extra mile to help. The Executive Lounge is large with high ceiling, and the tables are well spaced to ensure privacy which makes it very comfortable. Food selection was good and the staff was always ready to help clear the tables.As the hotel sits on top of a large department store, shopping is very convenient with a good selection of eating places. Also connected to other shopping malls by the skywalk and close to Tennoji Park and the Museum, Transportation from and to the airport is easily accessible by the airport limousine and is inexpensive.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great stop for lunch or afternoon tea. In the area you can visit the Shitennoji Temple and grounds, The Art Museum where you can take spectacular photographs of the Tsutenkaku Tower and Zoo, Tennoji Park where there is this gorgeous red bridge. Harukas 300 is based at The Marriott for spectacular views of the city. 16Floor has a lovely garden area and viewing deck if you don’t want to go all the way to the top. And once you have done all of that stop on the 19th Floor for tea and cake.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I and my husband went there to celebrate our anniversary and this hotel just gave us a best memory. We stayed there for 5 nights in a junior suite. The room is spacious, bed is comfortable and I can’t find anything to complain. We had a marvelous teppanyaki dinner on the 57th floor ZK, the food and the chef won’t disappoint you. Location is good and you can take the JR or Metro to anywhere around Osaka. Value for money.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights here in a deluxe double room. Ended up on the 49th floor with the most spectacular views one could wish for. The whole stay was superb - the location was excellent (the train station - JR line and subway - are right underneath the building PLUS a whole world of shopping levels that will take your breath away, let alone restaurants galore)...except for our adventurous spirit we could have stayed in this complex the whole time and not ventured out! The room was extremely comfortable; bed and pillows gorgeous; shower products in the room of a very high standard. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful. In addition, we got free access to the Sky Tower that was in the building. We give this hotel full marks for everything.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Other marriott chains need to learn from them.. first class hospitality, great location, every staff was attentive and respectful.. our kid misplaced one of his medication in the room, we called room service, they tried to help us locate the missing item even to the garbage truck. When they couldn’t help us find, their housekeeping manager himself actually came down to meet us and apologized for not being able to help us.. amazing people.. will come back again soon.. they just make you feel right at home..
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location, with the train station and huge department store Kinetsu downstairs. Just opposite Tennoji park. Abenos Q and Mio have great eating options next door. Rooms are spacious, with amazing views. The toilet seat is always warm, and the technology is top notch. The bath is deep and luxurious. A special shout out to room service who clean so thoroughly without disturbing your personal belongings. I loved the toiletries and the special kettle for green tea. Very well insulated and quiet. Thank you for the gift and we will definitely return. You get a ticket to the observatory, free, which is great fun and Harukas Art Museum is downstairs.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for the third time... prior thereto, I had last stayed there in September 2017. Great hotel, great executive lounge. Spectacular views. Highly recommend. I actually had to stay one night at the Courtyard because this hotel was completely sold out and I much prefer this one.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: View is amazing and why we stayed, and also get access to the observatory. Breakfast very good by Japanese standards. Room is also big for Japan, especially compared to Tokyo! Location is OK, not as close to the action as I'd normally like, but as its essentially on top of a train station, it was workable.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for two nights in this vast hotel in the south of Osaka. The lobby on the 19th floor of the Abeno Harukas building (the tallest building in the country) and guest rooms are on floors 38-57 so good views are guaranteed, if you like that sort of thing!Our room was on the 42nd floor and was very comfortable. Not the most up to date decor but the bed was super comfortable and amenities top notch, including both bath robes and pyjamas. The loo was one of the best we’ve encountered in Japan with a motion sensor which opened the lid when you entered the room and closed it again once you were finished. I’m a total convert to Japanese loos!Breakfast was great, a fantastic choice from the large buffet and egg counter for omelettes.All staff very professional and lovely- there were a lot of them.Hotel is three stops on the metro to the brash, busy and bonkers heart of Hamba and Dotombori- an experience which is totally Japanese. Wonderful and exhausting!Loved the Miyaki. We don’t usually go for chain hotels but this one ticked all the boxes.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights at the hotel. The hotel is exceptional by any standard. The rooms are luxurious (even the standard room which is what we had). Very polite staff and very helpful in guiding us throughout our stay. The hotel occupies floors 38-55 and is in the tallest building in Japan. The top has an observatory (tickets are included in your stay) and the metro/JR station is right below the hotel.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have had a woest experience ever at the hotel. I think this Osaka Marriott does not reserve a name Marriott, considering the hospitality of the staff, communication. Communicating both in Japanese and English did not go through and we truly had an uncomfortable moment. for example, we wanted our luggage to be delivered soon after the checkout, but the hotel front staff, Ms, Lee did not understand our request properly, or delivered our message differently as we have not yet gone out of the Rooms. Hotel location is bad as well and the guidance in Japanese is wrong ina way that people misunderstand the way to the hotel. I think the hotel website should be throughly changed to a correct one. Worst experience ever and we are very sorry for us that we chose this hotel to stay. 最低最悪の経験でした。このホテルは、マリオットと名乗るべきではないと思います。スタッフの教育がなっていません。これまで、マリオットでここまで酷い経験をしたことはありませんでしたが、今回、日本でまさかこのような経験をするとは。
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: sakura season every year but just two weeks flower can still on tree.whatever i'm coming here just need to see Sakura flower true my eyes,before just looking at internet or watching TV..Sakura flower for me..so nice flower in Japan
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located strategically in central Osaka this hotel is truly top notch. The level of service from the staff is excellent. Room size is good view spectacular and facilities are well maintained.Food options are plentiful with B1 and B2 full of fresh choices and Floors 12-14 with restaurants.The only negative I can find is not actually that is specific to this hotel but a lot of the hotels in Japan. This is they have a very limited selection of English movie channels and children’s channels. So if you are traveling with children please keep in mind you may be stretched when it comes to choice.That being said a special thank you to Azumi with the concierge team for helping me with a very large box and to organize transport to the airport.I will return to Marriott with my own family in the future.Thank you to the Marriott team.Arigatōgozaimashita
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a very good time in this hotel. At check-in they were already waiting for me and was immediately redirected to a staff member that spoke Portuguese in order for the experience to be more fluent and that really impressed me.The room was very large by Japanese standards and very well-appointed. The fitness center was also very pleasant and offered amazing views of the city. The hotel is in the Abeno Harukas building and they offer a complimentary ticket to the observation deck on the 63th floor. Tenojji station is right below the building and is very convenient to use wherever you're going.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have nothing bad to say about this hotel experience. The hotel itself is absolutely gorgeous, clean, Very hospitable staff. Panoramic views from anywhere on the property. Love the aesthetics of the hotel, especially the elevator leading to the Harukas at the very top floor. One big bonus was I lost my phone in the city in a cab, and they did all they could to find it, specifically Diego and his co worker! 5 stars all the way
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at level 49th during our honey moon, stunning view from the room and can view the osaka city. Complimentary access to the sky level and strategic location, accessible to 2 mrt lines and direct from airport rail link.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing stay at this hotel and there are only a few small things that I feel could have been improved on. We have an in depth review and photos of our room on our blog at randrwander if you want more information. We also included an awkward interaction with the staff if you are curious!
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want the wow factor, stay in a premium corner room in the Marriott Miyako Osaka. We stayed here for 3 nights and wished it was longer! The view from our room on the 44th floor was breathtaking day and night, particularly with the double aspect floor to ceiling windows. The room was really spacious, unlike other hotels we have stayed in in Japan, and it had a little sitting area and also another little area with a small round table where I guess you could work. The bedding was great and we enjoyed 3 brilliant nights sleep. The shower and bath were incredible and also had views of the city. The hairdryer was rubbish but that is my one and only criticism of this fantastic hotel. The lobby is very impressive with high ceilings and floor to ceiling windows and it really is an oasis from the madness that is Tennoji below. Upon checkin we were presented with complimentary tickets for the 60th floor observatory which is a must do. We did not have breakfast but did order dinner with room service and it was very nice (there was a good vegetarian menu). The location suited us well with very easy access to trains. Finally, the staff were exceptional and couldn’t do enough for us. I would highly recommend staying in this hotel and particularly in a premium corner room.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 6 nights with the family, the hotel is new and best location in Osaka located above the JR / Trains and 3 shopping centres either under or next to the hotel. Lots of places to eat down stairs, great for families and kids. The hotel itself is very busy with a number of bars and restaurants on the foyer level. Overall very good stay with nice clean room and great views of Osaka. This building is actually the highest in Japan, there is a observation level that hotel guest get free entry on top. The only issue we found was the quality of the food for buffet breakfast was very poor compared to rest of the hotel.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best hotels in which I've stayed. The location is ideal - whether you arrive into Osaka via train, bus or plane. The hotel is located immediately above a JR rail station, so if arriving by train, it's only a matter of catching an elevator upstairs from the station. Similarly, you can catch a train from/to the airport, or (better) airport limousine bus which deposits you right outside the hotel.Previously unbeknownst to us, the hotel is the tallest building in Japan, so accommodation there also includes a free pass to the top floor observation deck, which costs money for all other tourists.Our room was perfect and considerably larger than those in other Japanese hotels in which we stayed. Full sized bath, etc. Amenities were top quality. Breakfast was the best hotel breakfast we had in Japan. Finally, service was top-notch. All in all a fantastic stay and I highly recommend the hotel. The only thing missing was a swimming pool :-(.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superb service, from the initial reception to the car service arrangement when we left. Professional and respectful staff. Our corner room on the 50th floor of Japan’s tallest building gave us spectacular views of Osaka. Concierge lounge was very nice; breakfast on the reception floor was very fun. No spa but the gym has a great view of Osaka and you can watch the sunrise over the city from the window-facing treadmills. It’s worth a visit to the top floor although the option to put on a harness and hang off the top of the building is closed during the winter months. Convenient location: the rail lines can be reached in the basement and Kintetsu department store is part of the same building complex.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in the corner room this time, the view was stunned and the interior decoration was elegant. The service was great too, I really had warm greeting in the period of the stay. The location of hotel is so convenient, just next to the JR Tennoji. This is the best Marriott hotel I ever stayed, definitely will go back again soon.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful views from our room. I've never seen skyscrapers look so small. Staff was decently fluent in English and provided top notch service. I was upgraded to a room on the 54th floor and got executive lounge access. The lounge had a great selection of food and drinks (the desserts after cocktail hour were delicious) and was a great atmosphere to sit and relax in.
