hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First you arrive in the lobby. The service is extremly kind and welcoming me. Than they showed me the room on level 52. Take a room which looks to the north. mmmmmVery stylish. I took a room on higher levels. Great view, great bathroom. great bed. Very stylish and quit big. I loved all. Restaurant on leve 57 is so good too.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was such a pleasant trip staying at Marriott Miyako in Abeno Haruka once again after my last trip this May. I am addicted in staying this place. The location is perfect for transportation (between airport and all other sightseeing attractions), shopping and eating places around the hotel with variety choices. The staff are very helpful, attentive to details and positive attitude that you can feel from heart.When I came around Osaka Marathon period on 25th Nov, the hotel had a special event for house guests being a part of the race, there was a 'Sky Jog' at 60th floor from 7:20 to 8:20am. A very creative idea, not many guests came up to jog but I did and love the quiet time in enjoying a a very good view at 300m high.My friend was one of the runner and requested to have a late check out as we wanted to have a shower after the run, the staff was very helpful & extended the check-out time for us. An extra nice touch for my next return this December.A bit pricey to stay here but it all worth it after all. Be honest, I wanted to keep this good place for myself but guess more people should enjoy the best services there. Hope it will never changed.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely hotel in the Tennoji area of Osaka. Very convenient with direct access to Tennoji station, a mall and lots of convenience stores and a Don Quijote close by. I was only in Osaka for 3 days and it was the perfect resting place in between exploring the city, especially after going to very busy hectic areas such as Dotonbori street it was great to come back to the hotel and relax in the spacious rooms and take advantage of the total quiet and great amenities. Great view and service, and all attractions are easily accessible through train rides from Tennoji station.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly and helpful staff.. hubby wanted to tip the concierge, he rejected his offer thrice stating its hotel policy. Facilities are new and modern, automated refill bathtub. Spacious room. Free ticket to observatory. Convenient location to mall and train even airport bus is nearby. For that price I feel it’s worth it. Certainly will be back if I come to osaka
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As we said in our previous review, we visited Japan during this month of November. At this stage, we stayed 5 nights at the Osaka Miyako Marriott Hotel, which is located in the Japanese tallest building. This was the starting point for visiting the Kansai region (Osaka, Kyoto and Nara) and Hiroshima. It is a recent building, very modern, which has commercial areas and very convenient access through the galleries to the subway and train. In addition, this building has an observatory (Harukas 300) at its top, at 300m altitude, to which the hotel guests have free access, and from where you can enjoy amazing views of the city.On arrival at the front desk on the 19th floor, we had a quick check in and we were assigned a top floor room (#5509). We were escorted by a bellman that provided us adequate explanations regarding the room.The room had large windows, with a superb view over the city. Its décor was very modern, had a very comfortable king size bed, AC that worked perfectly and very quiet, which allowed us a great sleep quality. Although the room was not very large, there was enough space for two people to relax comfortably. Complimentary Nespresso coffee, tea and water were replenished daily. The bathroom had very good conditions: electronic toilet allowing Japanese style hygiene in separate space, one basin and separate shower and bath. All necessary amenities were made available in the bathroom and replenished daily with generosity. Housekeeping did a good job.As a Platinum Premier member, we had access to the Club Lounge, which was a grandiose space with a modern and cosy décor, where we had buffet breakfast, which we considered regular, and enjoyed the evening cocktail, where good quality items were made available, although somewhat repetitive.As for us, the service provided by the hotel staff is somewhat patchy, although some elements did a great job. There are, however, some details to improve, causing them to compromise the property rating. For example, on the day of our departure when we had an early flight forcing us to arrive at 6:30 am at the Club Lounge (opening hour) the breakfast was not ready, there was only some bread, some pastries and some cold cuts... It was not a good farewell!We did not comment on other hotel facilities because we did not experience them.Nevertheless, weighing all the experiences we've had, the rating we give to this property is a “short” 5 stars. For those who want to combine modernity, comfort and strategic location, this is the place to stay.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very awesome hotel with perfect view, despite the elevator is a little inconvenient (we have to take elevator to the hotel lobby on 19F then change to another guest lift to reach our guestroom).Bell attendants r very friendly and helpful and the room is perfect in all aspects.Front desk staffs were polite too, however, we asked for assistance with restaurant reservation upon check out and got rejected just because we were checking out. I believe that is not appropriate for a 5-star hotel to reject a guest’s request that way, it makes us feel like once we checked out then we are no longer your guest..we are not blaming the staff at the front desk though, maybe that’s the hotel’s policy or whatever.We will still choose this hotel as our first choice when we return to osaka. Overall experience was still excellent.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The views of Osaka from this hotel really are stunning. The rooms are spacious and the location is convenient if you are travelling as the hotel has direct access to the station. Having travelled a lot over the previous few days we decided to stay in for the evening and ate the special hotel guest set menu at ZK restaurant on the 57th floor the service was excellent, the food was beautifully presented and delicious.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spend a lot of time in hotels.This one was pretty special. The service from start to finish was amazing.The room was amazing. We were on the 51st floor. The view over the bay is amazingThe location is amazing, you're on top of a train stationThe lounge. Is amazingThe breakfast is the only thing I won't say is amazing. It was good though, even the coffee machine makes passable cappuccino.I'll be making sure I stay here again if I'm back in Osaka.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quite simply one of the BEST hotels I have ever had the pleasure to stay in. Located inside one of Japan’s tallest buildings it doesn’t matter which floor you are on you will have a clear unobstructed view of Osaka anywhere. Easy access if you are an international traveller using a JR pass as the hotel is directly above Tennoji on the Osaka Loop line and direct connections from the Shinkansen at Shin-Osaka. The wow factor starts from the moment you walk into the lobby on the 19th floor, which has to be at least 3 stories open plan with cafe, restaurant and lounge all located here. As platinum elite guests we were then taken up to the lounge to check in and the expectations kept being smashed. The lounge again is very impressive, large open space on the 38th with a large selection of snacks throughout the day. Evening meal was also ample and the drinks selection in the evening had something that would cater to almost everyone. Breakfast was a little less satisfying but I still shouldn’t really complain. Our room was on the 51st floor and had stunning views across Osaka, really took my breath away. The rooms are modern and stylish and have everything you would expect in the including an espresso machine for the coffee addicts. The wet room/ shower is also a welcome addition including the option to open the room out to continue overlooking the Osaka skyline (don’t worry you’re very high up so no one can see you!) As hotel guests you are also allowed to jog around the 60th floor in the morning. It may only be allowed from 7-8:15 but it really is worth the early start. The 360 views are spectacular. You are also given a free entry ticket to return after 9pm and see the city at night. Again very worthwhile.There are plenty of things to do around the hotel, Tennoji zoo, shopping in the Abeno Harukas Kintetsu Department Store, the Tsutenkaku district for food and entertainment but with the JR line and subway lines you can get to pretty much anywhere you need to. All the staff were friendly and attentive, I cannot say a bad word against any of them. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. If you have the opportunity then stay in this hotel!
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For our fourth stay in Japan we stayed for 16 nights in this hotel, this time in a Superior room (budget wise more friendly) whilst we previously stayed in Premium Corner Rooms. It was a big smaller but size-wise still very generous and i was pleasantly surprised. I do notice a little bit of wear and tear of the rooms that I did not see previous times. For instance, dirty spots on the side of the bed-side-tables and orange spots on the walls of the bathroom next to the mirror. It made me want to start cleaning. Also the carpet was fraying a bit and had some marks on it and there is a bit of mold starting in the bathrooms. Its not really obvious perhaps, but as i have a bit of OCD when it comes to hygiene and cleanliness i just notice these things maybe a little bit sooner than other people. Still, i am very happy with the hotel and i will stay here next time. The view from the hotel is exceptional. We received water bottles and coffee cups every day. The staff is very friendly. Check-in took ages however, but that was more the "fault" of the guests who were arranging all kinds of trips during the check-in process. Staff should have told them to come back later, or go to the concierge counter... there was a long line and people were very annoyed. Its not good to annoy so many guests just to make one guest happy with immediate service. Especially when you come from a 12 hour flight and you are just knackered.I hope these small issues can be solved, just for the sake of keeping this hotel the top hotel it truly is. Its located exceptionally and i cannot wait to come back!
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first experience in a Asian hotel. I had heard the rumors... now I know: not a detail is missed.The views is the first thing to talk about. Floor to ceiling windows with a view of the city that is nothing short of spectacular. Our room faced north and you could see all the way back to Kyoto. Day and night, it was a fantastic thing. We didn't even use our complimentary vouchers for the observatory because the room view was so good.Location is great. We got everywhere we needed to go in Osaka quickly and all from Tennoji Station. Quick walk to Tsutenkaku. 15 mins to Dotombori. 20 mins to Osaka-jo.Service is at least two levels up if you're used to American rack Marriotts. From dropping off out luggage prior to check-in, to taking us through the room to check-out, everything was constantly on point without being oppressive. We had been staying in AirBnBs for the front end of our trip and wanted a more traditional hotel for the final night and they made us feel right at home.Enjoyed the lobby bar (not cheap, but when you're looking out the window at the Akashi Kaikyo Bridge on the horizon with the lights of Osaka around, it works out.Highly recommend. I honestly wish I had business needs in Osaka just for the chance for a return trip sooner.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved our stay here at the Miyako Marriott. We had a corner room and a great view. The service and restaurant were very good. The staff was very attentive and helpful with all our needs. I would definitely stay here the next time I come to Osaka. .
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the best Marriott hotel I have ever stayed, it is located on the tallest building in the city with about 300 meters in height.Upon checking we were given a free voucher for the building’s observatory, which is gorgeous and had an even more impressive view than our room on the 43th floor.The lobby is located on the 19th floor, the first 14 floors house an excellent and huge shopping Center with the best designer stores, stationary , sports and department stores.On the 16th level there is a beautiful modern art museum and on the 17th level a A convenient store, a couple of coffee places.On the 57th level the hot Thad a first class Japanese cuisine restaurant and there are many more restaurants on the 14th floor.On the b1 level there is an important subway station that conveniently conecta the hotel with the rest of the city.As expected the hotel offers outstanding rooms and service, there is probably no better place to enjoy Osaka than this magnificent hotel.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In our last stay of a 15 day holiday we stayed in a corner room on Level 47 - the perfect finale! It offered most spectacular views. Everything else about the hotel is great: very comfortable bed, luxury lobby lounge, sumptious buffet breakfast, well equipped gym. But as we had come to expect in Japan, the hotel staff provided impeccable friendly service. Nothing was too much trouble. Their arranging and escorting to taxi's was top class. We highly recommend you stay there.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After 2 weeks travelling Japan this hotel was exactly what we needed. The hotel lobby is on the 19th floor and our room was on the 49th floor and the views were incredible. You can get direct access to the JR & metro stop Tennoji from this hotel which was really handy for getting around Osaka. We got to Osaka earlier than check but the staff were friendly and kept our bags for us whilst went and explored the city. The room itself was beautiful. The bed was massive and large room length windows allowed us to have a great view. The shower was really powerful - just what you needed after a long day walking around. The amenities were fantastic!You also got free tickets to the viewing platform on the 60th floor. If you are coming to Osaka this hotel is definitely worth the money - we enjoyed every second.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recommend the Marriott Osaka Miyako.I am glad I chose this location over a more expensive hotel I'd frequented in the past. One of the best hotel experiences I have ever had at this price point. Can't wait to go back.Wowed by the view. Wowed by the bath/shower room. I had a room on one of the highest floors with a lovely view of Osaka Castle. Worth it just for the views - afternoon, night time, and dawn were all amazing. Facilities all new and although some wear and tear on the furniture is already evident, my room was a truly superb space (corner room, club floor).Check-in went smoothly and quickly but I had to point out my Marriott rewards status and ask for an upgrade or I wouldn't have gotten it.The staff were all attentive, professional, prompt, and polite. Well done. They speak multiple languages. Must apologize for forgetting their names - they deserve recognition. Rena Katsumoto was quite helpful in making my checkout quick as possible. The spacious bath/shower room even had a wonderful view and was well designed with large stone tiles and a large floor to ceiling window - a couples paradise. The shower had an awesome massage function - the strongest/best I have ever used. Water was as hot as could be and came out strong. Very good. The bath had a timer so you could fill it and the faucet would turn off automatically - Marriott provides nice bath salts. The amenities were great. All towells were fresh and fluffy. The bedroom was large for Japan at this price point, and the coffee (nespresso) was a nice service. The bed was not firm enough for my liking and sagged a bit towards the middle but I did have a very restful sleep. They brought me firmer pillows within 5 minutes of my request - very good service for such a large hotel.The lighting is quite well done and easy to understand. TV.... not sure, was too busy or too asleep to really watch but it was large enough for the room, new, and in a perfect location to watch from bed if you so desire.Elevators: for such a high location, I was surprised at the efficiency of the elevators. There are 2 sets (one set from ground floor to lobby, and one set from lobby to rooms) but I didn't wait more than a minute or two at a time - and never felt like I had been kept waiting - quite amazing considering how high up it is. I wasn't particularly impressed with the lobby space or the way it was laid out, and it seemed quite crowded - almost like a train station - designed for a flow of foot traffic rather than for pause and relaxation. The JR Haruka Train to Kansai Airport (KIX) leaves directly from Tennoji JR station, a short 5-10 minute (indoor) walk from the hotel. Takes about 40 minutes to get to KIX, give or take.Finding this hotel from the airport train could be a bit tricky as the station area is quite a busy place and there is another hotel with "Miyako" in the name - be sure to go towards "Marriott." Best to depart the train platform by the "Chuo Deguchi" (Central Exit). Turn left after coming out of the turnstiles and walk about 100 metres to a down escalator (towards "Abeno Harukas") - there, you can see a sign for the Marriott Osaka Miyako above the stairway/escalator. Proceed down the escalator as if going towards the Kintetsu department store and the elevator to the Marriott will be to the right before entering the department store and well marked. There are 2 Marriott-guest-only elevators.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Second time stay at this hotel with easy access from Kansai Airport by JR express. Travel to other place in Osaka area with easy access by underground or JR.Front desk English is above standard for communication. Our twin room is on 47/F with swipe view of Osaka. Clean & good space at reasonable price as we book well ahead of our trip.Guest benefit - get breakfast voucher discount at front desk, purchase of Teamlab ticket at group ticket reduced price.Well located above department store plus a lot of shopping & dinning choice nearby.Highly recommended for family & couples.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lobby located up high on level 36. Too bad the queue at check in time is quite long, and it’s not possible to do early check in. I think it’s japanese custom, since all the other hotel i stayed in japan also like this.Deluxe Corner room had 2 double beds, great views with 2 sides of floor to ceiling windows. Breakfast is excellent, plenty of choice for japanese, western and chinese food. Although there’s little variation if you stay a few days, it can be quite boring. Unfortunately it can be lengthy wait around peak hour.Located in the tallest building in Osaka, on top of metro station. Difficult to find your way from the station to the hotel, since not many sign for Marriott hotel, but you can try finding sign for Abeno Harukas building.There is a big high end shopping mall under the hotel, plenty of shops and food outlet.
hotelName:
24    Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Imperial deserves a 5-star rating. It checks all the boxes of a fine hotel -- comfortable, clean, updated rooms (mini fridge & A/C that goes down to 62 degrees), terrific service, delicious restaurants, beautiful location (along the river), fast elevators, and the best water pressure of any hotel I have stayed. I travel 75% of my time for work and I would stay here again. Well done Imperial Hotel!
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The stress of a visit from a head of state amid a major global conference is enough to bring any hotel to a breaking point. Both the staff and property held up well during such an event. My room was very well equipped and had all amenities I needed and expected. The bed was very comfortable and the room had a nice city view. For those on a generous expense account or tourists willing to splurge, the Imperial will not be disappointing.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Imperial hotel at the end of our Osaka trip and when we arrived, we got upgraded to the imperial level, which was very nice and unexpected. We had an amazing view of the river from our room. The room was very spacious and so was the bathroom. I believe our room had around 40 sq m. I instantly felt welcome and comfortable in our room and the variety of bathrobes and PJ’s was a nice touch. The staff was very friendly and super helpful and the room service and food was high standard. There is also a shuttle service going to one of the main train stations. It might not be located in the heart of Osaka, but it is very close to sights such as Osaka castle and Hokoku Shrine. The breakfast buffet was also good. It was quite small for a 5 Star hotel buffet, but it had something for everyone, which was great. All in all a very nice and enjoyable experience and great service provided by the staff of the Imperial Hotel Osaka.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent four nights here with my son and his new wife and it was amazing. We were checked in quickly the rooms were great no issues at all. The place is spotless throughout and the staff were superb during our stay. The free transport to Osaka station was a huge bonus. I cannot comment on the breakfast, because we didn't eat there. We bought breakfast locally and ate it by the river, which was so nice. I would stay again for sure.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Look, I'm not saying this isn't a nice enough hotel. The lobby is large and fancy in a severely outdated style, and the rooms are well appointed, but in desperate need of an update. However, it's shortfalls were far too great to justify the ridiculous price.So let's start there. I got serious sticker shock after discovering what I had accidentally paid for this room. After travelling in Japan for a collective month in the past, I knew that rooms in some hotels are charged per person. This visit, staying at only the most luxurious places (for my honeymoon, no less), and extremely conscious of that fact, I noticed that high class hotels tend to forgo that uniquely Japanese pricing structure, and so in a momentary lapse I didn't notice that Imperial was the exception. Therefore, upon arriving at the hotel, I was stunned to realize that one of the most expensive hotels in Osaka was actually twice as expensive as I had anticipated. This was devastating as I had left Okinawa that morning because of an inability to justify the price at the luxury resort there for more than a few days. Of course, this was my fault, but it set my eyes to carefully assess what I was paying for.Now, though I know it isn't strictly illegal, every luxury hotel I have stayed at in Japan has been voluntarily non-smoking. Indeed, no smoking signs are erected all over the Imperial. This did not stop the room I was allocated from smelling so severely of cigarettes that I could not even make it over the threshold. The second room I was allocated, kindly upgraded but no longer on the Imperial Floor (executive level or something like that), smelled distinctly musty but mercifully not like an ashtray, so it was just about acceptable. If I had walked in to this one first I would have rejected it. The room was otherwise fine, but felt as if it had not been touched since the mid-90s. If you like that sort of thing, then fine, but I expect a little bit of modernity in ultra-modern Japan, unless I'm in a traditional Ryokan. I was disappointed to find that the cleanliness was sub-par, as certain very obvious bits of dirt were not rectified between cleanings. Otherwise, nothing in the room deviated from what you would expect in a mid-range international business hotel chain.Location was a real problem. Osaka is a ridiculously well connected public transport city, and the Imperial seems to be situated in the only dead spot. The views are nice enough up and down the river, but it is very difficult to get anywhere else in the city. It is at least a 10 minutes walk to any subway, which when it is raining as it often does here can be a real barrier to enjoying your visit. The only benefit to its location is if you happen to be there for the one week a year when the Sakura are in bloom. A 5-star hotel, as the Imperial purports to be, has certain amenities as standard. It has been mentioned before on this site that the gym and pool are not included, but it was still a shock to be told that, on top of the exorbitant room rate, we would have to pay an additional 50USD or so to access what is even the most basic feature of any hotel. It was, frankly, offensive.One of my favourite things about travelling in Asia is the breakfasts, and Japan is no exception. I have had so many exquisite breakfasts at hotels here that the Imperial offering was a real let down. It was very limited and for the first time ever I left feeling hungry and let down. Despite having paid for it in advance, I skipped subsequent breakfasts in exchange for a bun from the 7-11 down the road. If that isn't a damning indictment, I don't know what is. At breakfast was also the only time I have ever felt discriminated against for being foreign in Japan. Upon entering, we were not offered tea or coffee, not even the a la carte menu options, but just left to our own devices. Others were accorded far greater courtesy and availed themselves of more appetising meals. When I flagged down a waiter to request tea, he came towards us and then caught the eye of a Japanese lady at the next table. He immediately turned to her and pretended never to have seen us. I was shocked, and deeply offended.All in all, a true let down. The cost was sky high and the hotel was a serious let down in many areas. My recommendation is to stay elsewhere.My wife would like me to mention the horrific uniforms. It makes her uncomfortable to witness employees being tortured in such a way.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent one night in this hotel, but it was the second time for me.I use to travel for work and what I am looking forward when I take some rest is cleaniness, good quality services, skilled staff and (why not) nice place and view!THIS HOTEL HAS THEM ALL!I really recommend it, you should try even for short period. (bear in mind that the period that goes to end of March and beginning of April it the perfect time to see the cherry blossom)super!
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is excellent right next to the river where you can jog or walk to the Osaka Castle undisturbed by the busy streets of Osaka. The staff were amazing: courteous and helpful. The hotel offers a complimentary shuttle bus service to Osaka Station daily (every 15 min during week days and 10 min during weekends). Room was spacious with a beautiful view on the city. Amenities restocked every day. Toiletries cover almost everything. Room is refreshed every day. The breakfast was delicious with multiple choices attending to all tastes and preferences. Facilities are excellent. The only things I could think of that could improve are TV entertainment (very limited and mostly in Japanese with no subtitles). BBC World is not particularly what one would want to watch on a holiday. The other thing is language. Some staff seemed to struggle with English and most of the written material (flyers, brochures, booklets etc) were only in Japanese.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow what a fantastic Hotel ranging from service to fantastic river city views just 100 m or to stroll along the river the room were big and very comfortable even with music playing in the bathroom was a Regal touch couldn't fault this classy hotel apart from one the walls being thin and hearing movement and muffled sound from other rooms, but this was the case with all the rooms in Japan I guess since we stayed in four different hotels on our trip I definitely would have no hesitation in staying here again was great value as well compared to other hotels
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel gets great reviews on Trip Advisor and it didn’t disappoint. Friendly English-speaking staff; nice clean room that was fairly large for Japan. Mostly Western-style bathroom and amenities. I was there in winter so the river wasn't inviting but I imagine it would be in every other season. Splurge for the Japanese breakfast one morning on the top floor Japanese hotel. Great views and exquisite Japanese food!
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is really a five star. The food in its restaurants are oustanding. The Frank Lloyd Wright inspired interior decor is fantastic. The rooms are well appointed and very clean. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Osaka.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second stay at this fabulous, elegant hotel. Very kind, helpful staff.Thanks especially to Ms. Odabe at the front desk, Mr. Saeki the bellman and Mr. Tsukashita and Mr. Tanaka in the bar! Their personal touch made it a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel located out of city central but is in quiet area and beautiful scenery of the river.Room are large, bed and pillow are very nice and very comfortable. Yukata and Pijama are provided and changed daily. Staff are very polite helpful and friendly. unfortunately our trip it was too short, only 2 days in Osaka but will definitely return to stay at Imperial Osaka for next trip.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay in the Imperial Hotel was absolutely perfect. The location is good, the staff speaks English enough and is very helpful, beautiful lobby, great spacious rooms that are perfect in every detail. Flawless experience, totally recommend it.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As part of our tour of Japan my wife and stayed two nights in Osaka in the Imperial Hotel ( again based on Trip Advisor recommendations). Situated on the riverside conveniently near two subway stations this is a large reasonably upscale 4 star double tower block property with a good range of amenities . Very good fitness and spa centre with a full size ( 25 metre ) swimming Pool that I used whilst staying ( after of course paying the irksome extra charge that all Japanese hotels seem to levy for using these sort of facilities) Our room was a decent size and very comfortable . And one has to say the staff were extremely courteous, friendly and helpful and all aspects of their customer care was excellent. Like most better quality Japanese hotels there was a lot of expensive restaurant facilities that we didn’t use. The exception was the Imperial Cocktail bar ( despite also being pricey) where we did have a couple of drinks . Very nice interior ( a sort of classic Art Deco feel ) and again excellent service made this a pleasant place for a nightcap . In the environs of the hotel in easy walking distance there are also a number of more modestly priced bars and decent restaurants which we took advantage of . Overall we really enjoyed staying at the Imperial would recommend it unhesitatingly and return there again if we ever get chance to revisit Osaka .
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the third hotel we visited on our Japan trip, and it was certainly the grandest. In Tokyo and Kyoto we had tiny hotel rooms, so the spacious room at the Imperial felt especially light and open, and we loved it.Arrival: the regular and frequent free shuttle-bus from Osaka station is easy to find, spotlessly clean, and a great way to get out to the hotel. It's operated by the hotel so it doesn't waste your time by stopping anywhere else, and the drivers are immaculately presented and polite, helping with the luggage and showing you to a seat.Check-in: fairly fast, very polite, and good English spoken. Then, we were shown to our room and given a tour of the facilities.The room: big, as mentioned, and a little bit tired. The carpet has seen better days, the paintwork on the wardrobe is scuffed, and the furniture is dated. It's perfectly clean, however, and the mattress and sheets were spotless and very comfortable. There was plenty of space, a good-size wardrobe, a desk with a fairly comfy chair, a couple of armchairs, a window with a view over the river, and - shortly after our arrival - there was a selection of welcome-gift snacks that we enjoyed very much. The bathtub was big, and there were masses of amenities in the bathroom.Internet: fast wireless, worked perfectly.Food: did not try; Osaka is a city for eating out, so this was not a reflection on the hotel's offerings, just our choice of priority.Fitness room/pool: Ah. Yes, this is by far the biggest problem with the Imperial: it's listings on hotels.com, Expedia, etc etc all show a fitness room and swimming pool as hotel amenities. This is an OUTRAGEOUS LIE. The hotel has no fitness room. It has no swimming pool. It is adjacent to a facility where these are provided, but not exclusively to hotel guests, and at TREMENDOUS COST. Seriously: a single visit to these facilities would have cost US$100 for me and my companion. ONE visit. It's grossly dishonest of the hotel to claim these as hotel facilities. When I stay in a hotel and want to work out a bit before breakfast, I do not expect to pay US$100 for the privilege. I can stay in ANY hotel and visit the nearest pay-in gym.Service: Excellent; we ran the staff around getting irons and ironing boards, power adaptors, and we never had the slightest problem with using English, and the staff who responded so promptly to our requests were polite and helpful. Can't fault the staff in this hotel. Not at all.Check-out: Quick and easy too, and the staff member at the desk provided information about how to find and use the limousine bus to Kansai Airport. It was lucky I double-checked this, though, because they were using an out-of-date timetable from 2017, and if I'd turned up for the 15:08 bus as they'd suggested I'd have been very disappointed because it departs at 15:03 now.Overall, The Imperial is extraordinary value for money. I have no idea how they provide this level of service and surroundings for the price they charge. I'd definitely stay here again next time I'm in Osaka, and I'd definitely recommend it to others, but I'd strongly advise them to update all their listings on web sites to make it perfectly clear: the hotel does not have a pool and fitness centre; it is just next door to one.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived in Osaka via the Shinkansen into Shin-Osaka station and transferred to a local train to get to Osaka station. Here you can pick up the hotel shuttle bus (which runs approx every 15m) to get you to the hotel which is about a 10-15 minute ride depending on traffic. A taxi from Osaka station cost us around 1200 yen.Check in at the hotel is 2pm. Staff here is very typical of what we have witnessed on our journey throughout Japan - polite, courteous, respectful and very friendly and more than willing to help.Be sure when you book to request a smoking or non smoking room. We thought we had booked a non smoking so surprised to be allocated a smoking room (17th floor is a smoking floor), which if you're not a smoker, you will find unsuitable. despite this, the rooms are pretty big compared to the rooms we have stayed in when we visited Tokyo, Nara and Hiroshima. The hotel instantly offered a change but as there were no more non smoking double rooms, we were upgraded to a Junior Suite on the 19th floor.....and what a fantastic room this was with ample seating, twin beds, a sauna, safety deposit box, tea/coffee, minibar, separate shower/toilet, TV/wifi and an office desk. Defintely worth booking if you can afford 100,000yen per night!There are also a number of small noodle bars around a 10 minute walk from the hotel that offer up cheap and tasty local dishes if you don't want to eat in the hotel. Of course, the hotel provides four menus; Jasmine Garden (Chinese)/Les Saisons (French)/The Park (Buffet)/Kamon (Open Grill) should you wish to try these. We opted for the local food! Overall, a very pleasant stay and a hotel that we would thoroughly recommend.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spend 4 nights at the hotel. The service provide by the entire personnel and specifically the people on the concierge desk was incredible. I had to ask several difficult trips for the rest of my trip in Japan and they help me at every stage even if it was involving their hotel.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We, a family of 4, just checked in on Imperial Hotel. After a HOT day in the city we wanted to go to the pool and relax. But no.It seems the hotel pool isn't available for kids or even persons under the age of 20?At the same time they charge 20 USD if you are old enough to even visit the pool/club.Ehhh.. Nothing was advertised when booking about this.We booked this hotel only because of the pool. When confronting the reception about this, they were sorry, and blaimed Expedia (hotels.com) for not giving correct information.We have now read the earlier bad reviews of the hotel, and can see this has been a problem for a long time. The pool seems to be a fake selling point for this hotel. Something they keep doing eventhough they already know of the problem.It would have been easy for them to write a part about the rules and regulation of the pool and gym in the important information on the booking sites. But then they dont sell as good.I would stronly suggest, not to book this hotel, if you come with kids. The hotel is not for families.Honestly, then you should be ashamed of your self. This is not a way of running a hotel. We spend 50+ days a year on hotels around the world, and have never experinced such advertising before.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Searching for a really perfect hotel in Osaka?search No more and try the imperial hotel for a Good stay in osaka!close to the river and Many shops and restaurants and bars!40 minute shuttle to the AirPort,and next to the Subway!rooms are Nice cosy and very clean,Good bathroom with a lot of ammenities!great bed!the staff is very helpfull and friendly!breakfast is superb!the restaurant in the hotel is also Good so a lot of Reasons to stay at the imperial,Been here before and allways very satisfied!i love this hotel,Had a short but fantastic stay here,i Will be back soon!
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights , the room is spacious, the bed is much bigger. We saw more businessmen than tourists. The location is great, 10 minutes walk from subway.The service is excellent. But there is few shops nearby. Namba is great for tourists,there are more shops, restaurants. In sakurai blosoom season, it is a great place to see.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After spending 3 nights in this hotel, we feel that this hotel is more suited for business purposes and weddings. While the rooms are large clean and spacious the hotel is not situated In a central location for tourists. While the hotel offers a shuttle service to Osaka central station, it still took us over 40 minutes to get into Dotonbori. The shuttle service also ends at 9pm leaving you to find your own way back to the hotel. Some of the staff were friendly and helpful, however, the concierge was useless and didn’t even try and help which was very disappointing considering we were paying for a 5 star hotel. Lastly, while there are several restaurants within walking distance to the hotel none of them are open for breakfast. This could present as a problem as the hotel charges roughly ¥3800 per person for the buffet breakfast, which was far to expensive for us! If you are a tourist wanting to experience the excitement of Osaka id suggest staying elsewhere!
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really loved this place. Nice view of the river, walking tracks all around. We had a big room, and our toddler had a big cot. Lots of little restaurants within walking distance. Nice feel to the hotel.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel for general purposes in Osaka. Maybe 20 minutes by taxi to Universal Studios Japan, and 10 minutes to Shin Osaka. The hotel sits on beautiful river and a very nice walking or exercise path along the river. Food was good with nice but expensive Chinese and French options on 23 floor. Actually the casual restaurant on 2nd floor was quite nice. The rooms were comfortable and clean, and the hotel is newer than many Japanese options. I would have given a higher rating, but they wouldn’t provide sheets and a blanket for the pull out sofa (which is in the room) unless an ¥8000 fee was paid. We were there with our 10 and 11 year old kids, the room had 2 full size beds, and it would have made the visit more comfortable. And we were registered for 4 guests. This was a super annoying interaction with them, and makes absolutely no sense that guests aren’t allowed to use furniture that is already in the room without an additional fee. So silly and small minded. It’s a stupid policy.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good service in this high end business hotel. Rooms are very convenient with a lot of space. Relaxing atmosphere and very friendly staff. The amenities are well selected, but also the minibar has a good selection.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank Ms Yasugi (front desk, hope I didn't spell your name wrongly)We are extremely grateful that you help us to check and plan the trip from Osaka to Kanazawa(Shirakawa-go)Because you, I feel this is the best hotel in Osaka and better than most hotel in the world.I will back again with my family. Cheers!
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spacious and clean rooms. Located next to a river and within walking distance of the Mint’s cherry blossom viewing. The hotel offers free shuttles to and from the JR station. Breakfast options at the hotel were excellent and service throughout the hotel was great.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Simply the best service that I have. Even though some do not speak English well, they seem to all understand a bit and try hard to help.This place examplfies Japanese service which may not be the best for family with kids.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Four of us stayed in superior twin rooms for 3 nights. The beds were king singles and very comfortable. The beds in Japan tended to be on the hard side but were very good. The room was spacious and bathroom fine with a great view of the river in front. The shower was excellent - an overhead and a hand-held with bath separate but in same glassed-in section. Staff were courteous and helpful and the free shuttle bus an excellent service. There's great coffee and pastries at the Foodscape bakery just outside in the connecting area. We also tried a couple of the restaurants under the mall and they were also good. There's a handy 7 Eleven at the back of the adjacent downstairs area, selling great snacks, sandwiches and cheap wine and beer, and spirits. A small patisserie opens at 10.30am in the foyer area where you walk across to next door - cakes to die for! We enjoyed our stay here, and the rooms were reasonably priced. Hotel rooms in Japan can be small by our standards so check the floor space when booking. It's worth a few dollars more to get a room above standard size.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Large comfortable room with a nice view of the river which I enjoyed when having breakfast. Services are good and efficient, especially if you want to send luggage to another hotel. Simply call the bell captain. She came within 10 minutes, made measurements of the suitcases and completed the forms (we have 3 pieces). You can use the hotel shuttle to go to Osaka / Umeda (15 min). Or take a leisurely walk to Sakuranomiya station along the riverside (7 min) and take the very frequent JR loop line to Osaka (7 min).This is the second time I stayed at Imperial. I stayed in hotel around Osaka station before, but the room was much smaller at similar price. The room has every thing. There are 2 noticeable improvements since my last stay in 2015 - staff speak much better English and the room has very tasty English tea bags. Imperial is a very good location for cherry blossom season. We missed the best bloom time this year because the flowers opened 10 days earlier than usual. But we still enjoyed the late bloom at Japan Mint which is only 10 minutes from Imperial Hotel.There are restaurants in the OAP building next to the hotel and the two building are connected.I will choose Imperial again when I go back to Osaka.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fast, efficient check-in. Large, comfortable room. Lots of amenities, including a jogging map! Great hot water and climate control. Everything worked, including the power driven draperies. I loved the location next to the river with access to walking paths. The view of the cherry blossoms in early April was lovely.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights. The rooms are spacious and bathrooms are of decent size. We had room overlooking the road and garden side. I understand from friends, their rooms overlooking the river were having great sight. The garden in the hotel is v good and well maintained although of small size. The night lighting is beautiful and creates a v good ambiance.The staff is cooperative and helpful in nature. The shortcomings of breakfast buffet is tried to be made up, to some extent, by the helpful staff.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at Imperial Osaka was average. Whilst it is located next to the river, it is actually away from the main attractions. The shuttle to the Osaka Station takes 15 minutes and we are required to catch a short subway to Shin-Osaka which is slightly inconvenient. The most disappointing thing is the fact that we are required to pay ¥5000+ (A$60) for access to the fitness center. We have stayed in many hotels of similar standards and have never had to pay for gym access. We would have expected free access to the gym for a hotel that claims to be a “luxury” hotel.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had stayed at imperial many years ago and it was wonderful to be back. Great park to walk behind the hotel especially during the sakura cherry blossom season, alongside the river. Tastefully appointed rooms. Great gym - although you do need to pay for its use. Japanese etiquette is quite elaborate but it’s fun after you get used to it. Gym has a sauna and public bath.Maybe Imperial is not known for its restaurants but there are restaurants in the shopping complex attached.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my two teenage sons for two nights. This was our last stop in Japan and we wanted to spoil ourselves for our last hotel. It was certainly luxurious. The service at check in was great. The bell hop came up to our room and explained the heating and showed us around. We were on the imperial floor (19) and had great views of the river. The beds were so comfortable and the shower was amazing. The bath was great too and we really appreciated a soak after all our travels. The push button lights, drapes and background music was cool as it could all be done from bed! The restaurants were expensive although we had a nice lunch at the 'casual dining' cafe which was actually pretty posh. There is a shopping mall attached to the hotel with not many shops but a convenience store, a cafe and mcdonalds which is handy if you don't want to pay for the restaurants. The location is quiet and very pretty beside the river. It is a short walk to the Osaka loop train station so easy to get around on JR pass (highly recommend getting a JR pass, ours paid for themselves many times over and were just so convenient). My only disappointment was the pool cost extra and there is an age limit of 20 years old. To be able to have a swim would have absolutely topped off our stay. For a five star hotel, the pool should be included and there should not be an age limit.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Classic old style 5 star with regular shuttle to & from JR Osaka station at Sakurabashi Gate exit (note: NOT Shin-Osaka where the bullet train arrives and departs)Large rooms with all mod cons (although cups are a bit small for those who prefer a larger serve)Brilliant concierge service from Hiromi Akai in booking restaurants at short notice. But the absolute highlight was the adjacent Foodscape bakery on the ground floor of the OAP Building.Simply the best coffee in Japan and the best bakery outside of Paris.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place to stay quite Royal and the best is they have a free shuttle between the hotel and Osaka station which is very convenient , they provide free mineral water bottles and the service is at its best
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are confortable and have a great view. To compensate for the not too centric location, it offers a shuttle to Osaka main train station and shopping area every 15 minutes. The day-tour to Kyoto that they booked for us, organized by Sunrise Tours, is not recommendable at all. The guide rushes through the monuments, gives poor and irrelevant information (Ex: "There was no electricity in the 16th century" - really?), Also her English was difficult to understand. The trip lunch was awful!The hotel offers a complimentary coupon for two drinks at their bar. It is not complimentary 100 %. You have to pay 4000 yens. It turns out to be a discount coupon. Be sure to clarify information on every coupon they give in order to avoid misunderstandings. We recommend you rather spend that money dinning in some great restaurant downtown.A good experience would be to try the hotel's Japanese breakfast.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great experience at the Imperial Hotel Osaka. It was actually the best hotel on my visit to Japan. The service was excellent, the room was very clean, and the bathroom was gigantic and beautiful. The river view from the Imperial is amazing. The beds very comfortable. The location is very good, in a quiet neighborhood, not far from the metro station. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Check-in required an endless form of questions... arrived tired and yet they asked us to fill out more questions..I found it unusual that women were carrying the luggage, the one who carried ours struggled a lot so we ended up just carrying the rest ourselves. Men were at the front desk while the women all struggled to carry luggage... very strange. Breakfast had an expensive fee, so we didn’t eat it. Gym and pool can only be used by people above the age of 20? I don’t understand this rule and it’s pretty unprofessional. Adding on to that, you also have to pay about $50 USD to use both facilities... terrible and definitely not a 5 star class hotel. All hotels I’ve stayed at provided free gym and pool facilities with no ridiculous age limits. Showers made a very weird noise and the body soap smelled terrible. Seems very old and I would not stay here again.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the most beautiful hotel I’ve stayed in in Osaka. The rooms are HUGE, which is an oddity in Japan. It’s decorated in glamorous high Art Deco style, which I love. It is perfectly and serenely located, if not too easily accessible by train (the station is about a 10minute walk from the lobby).  There’s a mall right beside it, which makes things very easy.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the pleasure of staying here just one night but really wished we had longer. Having stayed at the Imperial Hotel in Tokyo, we had high expectations, but actually I think Imperial Osaka was an even more enjoyable stay. It's a older, more traditional hotel where the staff really treat their guests well. From the moment we arrived, we felt welcomed as though we were special guests. The rooms are beautiful, large king size and very comfortable bed.Our room overlooked the river and the view was very pleasant indeed. The marble bathroom is beautiful with luxurious towels and lovely well thought of amenities. Breakfast had enough variety for us to enjoy many different kinds of food both western and Japanese. This is a luxurious hotel, well deserved of its reputation and we would definitely stay here again next time we visit Osaka. It's well located and links to the OAP (Osaka Amenity Park) Tower next door offering dining and shopping facilities.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Imperial Osaka for 5 nights/ 6 days in December 2017 from Christmas Day . We had a great experience .The room was spacious, tidy , nice and good amenities . The housekeeping was excellent . The concierge staff including Emi Shimada, Emi Yasugi, Naoko Arikado were great. The staff were professional and courteous . The turnaround time for any request was extremely quick . The hotel environment was fabulous and the shuttle bus to Osaka station was efficient. The hospitality was great and overall it was a fantastic experience for us which made our Osaka trip a truly enjoyable and memorable one .
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Major Con:-GYM IS NOT FREE, COSTS 5400 YEN.-GYM EQUIPMENTS LACKING.-Pool costs 2100 YEN.-Location is inconvenient if you prefer public transport.Pro:-Staff was nice.Conclusion:For a $200-$500 USD hotel your gym should be free if you advertise it as an amenity. We will not return.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks again to the entire staff for the xmas eve organized the 24th of December.Amazing food and drinks provided by an efficient staff.Great location near the castle.Rooms are clean and quiet.I recommend this hotel
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family stayed here for 4 nights. The rooms are huge by Japan standards. Great bathroom. Although the hotel is not located in the shopping area, there is a small adjoining mall where you can get meals. There is a free shuttle to Osaka station every 15 minutes. Very convenient.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positives:a) Nice, clean and good size room (standard twin room).b) Effective and helpful staffs. c) Free shuttle service to JR Osaka station.d) Quiet location and not too far from subway.e) Good WIFI connectionNegatives:a) Takes about 15mins by bus to get to Osaka station. b) No bus service to airport from hotel location.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is just a block away from the subway and close walking distance to local food and shopping areas. The hotel was immaculate and the rooms were perfectly maintained. The bath tubs were large and the abundance of really hot water was great. Everything about this hotel was made to be special.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel in november 2017. It has a nice hospitality, clean room, and the hotel area is the best. I am impressed by the river behind the hotel, where i went for jogging. Very recommended!
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed with my son, my friend, and her son for 2 nights and we all had a truly enchanted experience at this hotel. We had no elite or frequent user status with this particular hotel group, nonetheless all the staff greeted and treated us as if we were VIPs. I booked this hotel last minutes online but when we walked into the room, the sofa bed was already converted into bed and made up with all the linens, the tea pot was already filled with hot water ready for us to make hot tea and coffee anytime we wanted. When my friend’s son wet the bed, they cleaned with no charge. When the kids messed up with the safe in the room, they came over to fix it within a few minutes after we called the front desk. The list goes on and on. Japanese style hospitality at its best! We would definitely stay at this hotel again.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has an old world charm, which reminds you of establishments of the 1980s though definitely not in any negative way. Rooms were very decent, comfortable and slightly larger than the Japanese average. The breakfast menu was adequate though the after hours room service menu was very limited for a child.the rear of the hotel opens up to a wonderful park and river, with the views from the room being astounding especially at dusk. it's about a 700m walk to the JR rail station which takes you into Osaka CBD.There's a convenience store just across the road which came in handy for anything, including late night supper given the room service options were limited.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breakfast spread was good. Room was decent sized. Could fit 3 pax for their standard room. Overall ambience feels a lil dated but hotel does give a grandeur feel. Staff are friendly and polite. Bottled water, bedroom slippers and toiletries are provided.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first time to encounter japanese toilets! almost robotic fully automated. amazing experience.. the view was facing the river with cherry trees on the sides. sadly, it was not time for cherry blossoms.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was by far the nicest we stayed in during our trip to Japan. The rooms were beautiful and very spacious. Nice touches such as bathrobes (that were changed daily) blinds/curtains that operated by using buttons at the side of the bed, the radio that played through speakers in the room on command and the free daily newspapers that were delivered were very nice. The bathroom was great and the beds were huge and comfortable and cleanliness around the entire hotel was impeccable. The hotel also provide a free, regular shuttle bus to the train station which was ideal for us when we were moving on to Tokyo. There is a smaller train station nearby the hotel, however it is easy enough to travel around Osaka and further afield from - we used this hotel as a base to travel throughout Osaka and Kyoto. The hotel also connects into a small shopping mall which meant shops and restaurants were nearby - we actually ate in two restaurants in the mall next to the restaurant and they were excellent on both occasions serving great and authentic cuisine. The hotel also has spectacular views across Osaka which we enjoyed both in our room and in public areas in the hotel. The overall hotel aesthetic is stunning, right down to the fresh flowers placed in each of the elevators, they have fine tuned even the smallest details.Staff in the hotel were always incredibly friendly and aiming to please - in fact, there was always a few waiting in the lobby area simply to greet guests with a big smile no matter what time of the day or night which was always welcoming and the level of English spoken by staff was the best we encountered in any establishment in Japan which was helpful for us (our Japanese was limited to basic conversation!) The hotel also felt very secure with ample staff working, even throughout the night.There are a few cons; access to the pool and spa facilities was not included and came at an extra charge which wasn't exactly cheap. There are several restaurants and bars in the hotel, mostly located in the upper levels and therefore providing the very best views across Osaka, however they were absolutely extortionate to dine in so we were not able to, even the room service menu was incredibly expensive. It is perhaps to be expected with this standard of hotel, however offering at least one affordable option would have been nice and we would have certainly dined in had this been available. To be honest, I think we got a pretty good deal booking through Expedia and others may have paid considerably more than us to be there - maybe we were out of place a little bit.The location isn't the best in Osaka in terms of being central to attractions and the main transport hubs, however it is certainly easily accessed and a nice area nonetheless and was useful for us a hub to travel from. There isn't a lot to do around the hotel, except the small shopping mall, and is mostly a residential area nearby, but again getting around Osaka from the hotel is easy enough. I would certainly say it is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in and would absolutely recommend it to anyone travelling to the area.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A comfortable hotel with good amenities, clean and well appointed spacious rooms. Located on the river this was a great place to see all the locals out celebrating the cherry blossom along the river banks. This hotel is conveniently located to explore the city and surrounding area. Concierge keen to be helpful but seemed to be lacking in local knowledge.
hotelName:
25    Imperial Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here in June. If you travel with JR stop at Osakajokoen Station. When you exit the station go to the right down the stairs, strait ahead cross the bridge and the first road on the left you’ll find New Otani Hotel on the right. The check in was very fast and efficient (Japanese style). All of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. At check-in, we were accompanied up to our room and helped with our bags. The room was elegant and quiet, and the beds comfortable; everything was clean and in order. There was a Japanese paper in English outside of my room every morning.I had breakfast every morning in the restaurant which has an Continental/Japanese buffet. I tried every day some Japanese cuisines and it is very good.Thank you New Otani staff for your hospitality. We had a memorable stay and hope to see you soon as possible!美しくありがとう
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We cannot thank the management and staff of the Hotel New Otani Osaka enough for making our first visit to Japan an unforgettable experience. From the moment we arrived from the U.K everyone was so helpful courteous and willing to help at every opportunity.The hotel is spotlessly clean well maintained and offers excellent value to any traveller.The location is ideal for taking short train journeys to Kyoto , Nara and the sights of Osaka city . Our room on the 16th floor was well appointed with a large kingsize bed and view of Osaka Castle Park . After our first night in the room we requested a change of mattress which was dealt with immediately and without any fuss which we felt displayed an exemplary commitment to customer service from the hotel staff. If you are considering visiting this wonderful country you not be disappointed if you choose to stay at this wonderful hotel.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family always chooses New Otani hotel. It is a family choice since my grandpa generation. So bring back a lot of memory, everytime visiting here. Big room, good view, near train station and surrounded by convenient stores.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at the new Otani. It is not the newest one, but with very friendly staff and super clean property. Breakfast with Western stlyle and Japanese very convenient. We fully recommend this hotel
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The surrounds of the hotel have many offerings for eating and transportation. The hotel itself has restaurants and exercise provisions - all very nice. The staff were polite and efficient. The hotel was very clean and nice. The room was very clean. However, I did not think much of the bed..I may be more accustomed to better mattresses..still a thumbs up for the rest!
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great hotel, wonderful staff. and superb lobby/foyer.Great location- so close to all stations and ameneties. From the time of our arrival at the reception till our checkout, all hotel staff was amazingly polite, welcoming and helpful. To name a few- Furuya, Oshita, Onishi, Matsui, were always available to help, go the extra mile to find out and help with the day's itinerary which made a difference to our trip particularly considering our difficulty with theJapanese language!  We had a fantastic view of the castle and the bed was comfortable.The only downside that we experienced was that the air-conditioning system seemed unpredictable but the duty managers helped us with heating and cooling fans.  Mr.Keizo Doi, manager, rooms division was very helpful and caring in this respect.. I would certainly stay here again in the future.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived in the elegant foyer of the Hotel New Otani Osaka, we knew we had made the right choice of hotel. We were greeted by friendly, helpful and courteous staff members who looked after us in an efficient, professional manner. Our room was spacious and beautifully decorated and had everything we needed for a comfortable stay. We particularly lovely experience was sitting in our room watching the sunset and the nightlights looking out towards Osaka Castle. What a wonderful, luxurious,experience! We hope we get the chance to stay there again.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I should have sent this review last year after my trip. It was a very good place to stay whilst in Osaka. I realize it’s off the beaten track, but the property is clean. The room I had was fantastic. I had a view of the majestic Osaka Castle every night! And the amenities were more than ample. The concierge was very accommodating.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was kind enough to upgrade our room, we had lots of space and the room was beautifully appointed, very stylish. Also, since on the 16th floor, it boasted panoramic views. The personal is very friendly and helpful.If you want to visit the Castle nearby, this is the perfect spot. Within easy Walking distance from the train system (350 meters), the Location could not be better for a visit since you just need to cross the river and there you are! Great for runners, by the way, there is a nice course of about 3 míles around the Castle and the moat.The breakfast room is busy in the morning, but has lots of options and is efficiently run.The only small dampener is the fact that some of the communal areas (swiming pool, gym) are not for free, and look tired. This was a little surprising, since all the other areas are so well maintained, but there you have it.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the New Otani for a couple of nights. Nice hotel. Good location. Great breakfast. The room was comfortable and clean. The service could have been a little quicker in the bar. All round though a nice place to stay and very handy to the Osaka Castle.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 days. Great location by the river, with a room view to the water as well. Excellent service, great buffet breakfast with both Japanese and Western fare, and spacious rooms (something that can be hard to get in Japan) and bathroom. Definitely a good choice.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for my last 2 nights in Japan. I booked a single room but was upgraded to a double with a view of Osaka Castle which was amazing. Checkin was excellent and I was showed to my room. All the staff I spoke with spoke excellent English and were very helpful. The room was very spacious even having a small sofa and desk area. The bathroom and amenities were great. There is a convenience store right opposite the hotel as well as a number of restaurants within walking distance. It's also only a short walk from the station. I can't wait to come back and stay!
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An excellent place to stay at in Osaka. Proximity to railway stations is a big plus, enabling easy and quick travel to places in Osaka and out. The rooms are spacious, neat and very well maintained. The hotel is located in a lovely locality, close to Osaka castle. The breakfast spread is substantial and caters to a variety of tastes. The staff in all sections are very courteous and helpful, speak excellent English, making the stay so comfortable. A definite choice for stay in Osaka.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed here and I enjoyed the property. Rooms are decent size, but a bit outdated. They are clean and the shower has good water pressure. Best part of the hotel is the location though. It's a 3 minute walk from a train station and a 5 minute walk from Osaka Castle.Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel New Otani Osaka is located close to Osaka Castle and Osaka Business Park area, which is not in Osaka's central area (Shinsaibashi / Namba), where shopping areas and the famous Glico are located. Having said that, connectivity to both central areas and Osaka Central station is relatively easy with Subway and JR Train. Subway and JR Train stations are relatively within easy reach with 5 minute walk for each station. Convenience store is within 2 minute walk, providing easy option to buy food if your hotel deal doesn't include breakfast.Osaka's close distance to Kyoto, Nara and Arashiyama make it a good base for those who want travel to those areas.If you like shopping, the hotel is located more or less halfway between central area and Mitsui Shopping Outlet, which is only 6 subway stations away.Check in was swift and staffs were friendly and polite. The room looks like an old hotel room, but having said that, it is very spacious by Japanese standards. We had a triple room and there were plenty of space left outside our beds and bathroom. The room also had a sofa, which we hadn't had in our previous accommodations in Tokyo and Kyoto.Overall, the hotel's only drawback is it's location, however easy access to Subway and JR Train as well as the big rooms is more than enough to make up for its downside. I would personally recommend this hotel to those who are planning a trip to Osaka
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have a night stay at this hotel. Behind the hotel is the Osaka castle and on the weekend I was here, there was a large crowd on the castle grounds in the afternoon. The staffs are very friendly, polite and always on hand to help. On check in, I was invited to join their hotel membership which entitled me discount in the hotel restaurants and the use of their Club lounge for free. Membership was free. The room was spacious and clean with all your usual amenities. The breakfast menu was excellent and offer both western and Japanese foods. The hotel is just around 5 minutes walk to the Osaka Business Park subway which will bring you directly to Shinsaibashi station for all your shopping needs. If you go to the hotel 18th floor day or night you can get a good view of the Osaka castle.Will definitely return if I am in Osaka again.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a week in hotel new otani osaka and originally booked a superior twin room with castle view. When we arrived to the hotel, they told us that they were grateful we chose their hotel to stay for a week and hence have upgraded our room to triple room. The room had a sofa with two chairs and a table to sit and enjoy some tea with the beautiful view and the bathroom had two basins, so it was really spacious in comparison to our original reservation. We didn't use much of the facilities including the pool, as we were busy exploring osaka and kyoto, but we did request room service which offered a variety of vegetarian food, western and japanese style food (menu was in English). It is true that the room service was a bit pricey, but it was worth trying and very delicious.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were fortunate enough to be upgraded from a Deluxe to an Executive double room, and it was simply 5*!!!! Beautiful, very big, and with a direct view across the castle. Even Typhoon Trami wasn't able to affect our enjoyment of the hotel - the double-glazing completely drowned out the sound of the wind and the rain.The staff were extremely helpful and courteous - the only slight issue was that a guest of ours could not use the indoor pool on a rainy day, as her child was less than 18 years old, but the manager compensated by giving our guest all-day free parking during her visit. There is a wide choice of restaurants, albeit dinner is relatively expensive. Breakfast is expensive, particularly given the relatively restricted choice available.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is superb. Subway is nearby and there is also a food court and a Family Mart across the street. The rooms while not spectacular and need updating are clean and spacious. I also like that it is situated in more of a business/financial district yet you could walk a few minutes and be in front of Osaka Castle.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely gem closed to shops, restaurants and the Osaka Castle and gardens.Was pleasantly surprised all the way up.A very good location, a very good hotel, a very helpful and kind staff.Highly recommended.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel with my family for two nights (two rooms). Actually, I choose this hotel outside the city center for one main reason....its pool.What a disappointment ! You would expect to have a pool to relax, swim and drink few cocktails? But when I tried to access it at 5 PM, it was closed !! and I was told it would open from 6.30 to 10 PM...Why??? End of July the weather conditions are perfect and a pool should be open all day long, not for few hours! So, I came back at 6.30 PM and guess what...I was asked to pay for each of us 2,000 yens! even if not sure I would actually swim. As a guest of an hotel you would expect the pool to be freely accessible, but not at New Otani Hotel. Actually, here everything is charged, even the bad quality coffee sachet available in your room. We then tried to get to the "garden roof" hoping for a terrace with a bar... actually your reach a no man's land area...Breakfast is charged at 3,800 per head! For this amount you can get a very good breakfast for 4! in any coffee shop, what we did (Starbucks in across the bridge 200m from the hotel). Don't be fooled by by pictures of the hotel, all is at an extra cost. I traveled around Japan (and the world) and I can tell you can get much better hotels deals for the same amount. We complained to the manager on duty but he would not care less. On the second day I witnessed at the reception another family complaining for the same reason. The only reason why I did not change to another hotel was because we were staying for two nights only.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:-* Hotel is near train stations.* Nice river and park view from windows. Osaka castle is just a little walk away.* Quieter location.* Spacious rooms.Cons:-* Expensive room rent.* Restrictive timings for fitness centre.* Big sized room mechanical key.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
