review_body: Just briefly this hotel is the best in every thing , is enough if you are seeking for 5 stars hotel in best value best service best customer service, high attitude and very polite stuff . You will find high and most and best performance from all the stuff , I recommend any hotels management in the world to visit Japan especially new otani hotel to learn how to deal with the guests .
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The concierge was very helpful in helping us get to the train station. Also, the concierge was very helpful in helping us get a taxi to the bus that would take us to the airport.This hotel is within walking distance of the train station. There are a number of taxis waiting at the hotel.The room was very clean and nice. However, I was disappointed that we did not receive one bed, since we emailed the hotel and requested one bed. Also, there was good view from the room.Breakfast was great. There is a wide selection of foods to choose from.Wifi worked and allowed us to keep in touch.This hotel does not offer airport transfers and is not near the airport.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. I ordered my pocket wifi to arrive at the hotel and when I arrived at check in they already had it ready. The reception area was absolutely gorgeous. The location was central as it was near the station and Osaka Castle. I didn't have breakfast there as it was very expensive so I had Starbucks which was a 2 min walk across the bridge. The television channels are all in Japanese. After my 4 night stay here I would gladly come back. It was very comfortable and classy. Also the personal touches from the maid cleaning the room and leaving a note on the desk was very professional of the hotel. They also have very friendly employees that make you feel very welcome. Thank you very much for the pleasant stay.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights in one of the suites (I think that it was a Junior Suite Superior) and the room was perfect, every detail was taken care of, we even had amazing views of the Osaka Castle. The check in and check out was easy and well done and the stuff was nice and helpful, but they mostly don't speak really good english though. As I said everything was good except for the gym that it's really small and doesn't have the requirements needed to follow a normal gym routine (the biggest dumbbell weights 10kg) but again the staff was really good and the fact that we weren't allowed in the pool and sauna because we have tattoos but had to pay full price (you pay for gym, sauna and pool together)I understand that the country has traditions and I will respect it but if I'm not allowed to enjoy some facilities, do not charge me full price!If they solve the english problem and the gym experience, it will be a 5/5. If I ever go back to Osaka, probably will go back
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed a couple of nights while in Osaka recently. The room has good view of Osaka castle during day and night. Room is largish compared to most Japanese accommodations. There are a 2 twin beds and they were comfortable. In-room safe is big to store laptop, there’s even an outlet in it. Complimentary bottled water is provided daily along with newspaper. Bathroom is quite small but dated with pink wall tiles. We didn’t go to the hotel restaurants since we spent the day away from the hotel. We got our breakfast fixes from 2 nearby McDonald’s restaurants. There is a Family Mart, Ministop, Lawson and Starbucks nearby. The hotel is about 5 mins walk from Osakajokoen station on the Osaka loop line and Osaka Business Park station on the Nagahori Tsurumi-ryokuchi line. The proximity to these stations provide quick access to Umeda area around Osaka station on the loop line; Namba area near Shinsaibashi and Dotonbori on the Nagahori line.Overall, the stay is very pleasant. Staff and service is excellent. Checkin and checkout were quick and efficient.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a very grand interior and large rooms, however for the price paid I do not believe it to be worth the money. We stayed for two nights and were hoping to use the facilities however it transpires that although the outdoor pool is for summer months only summer does not start for the hotel until July. You cannot even sit outside by the pool in the nicer weather. The indoor pool and gym areas cost approximately 2000 yen for members of the new otani club as well. The breakfast buffet seemed OK although due to my partner having a nut allergy we were only able to have a very small cooked breakfast which cost almost as much as the buffet! It was not even a particularity tasty breakfast. The staff at the hotel try to be as helpful as possible but the facilities after paying such a lot really do not make for a good stay. The location is fairly easy to access by train and is close to the castle which is a plus. There are also alternative (good) breakfast cafes close by. I would not recommend staying at this hotel if you want to be able to use the extra facilities offered such as a pool if you are not willing to pay.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was wonderful!! The staff went above and beyond to help with anything! First class service feel. Hotel itself is very beautiful and spacious. Our room looked out onto the river and Osaka castle. The room was large and comfortable. Only wish was I wish there was a fan for some noise to sleep with but other than that, best hotel in Japan yet!
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you get the room with the view of Osaka Castle, it's beautiful. The other rooms are not so nice. Best time to go of course is the Cherry Blossom time (early spring). The hotel is refurbished, because it's an old hotel. Front Desk people welcomed us very nicely. The nicest man was Nomura, a gentleman who spoke English well. Coffee in the room is not free. You have to pay for it. Only the teas are free. And only one complimentary bottle of water per person. Otherwise you have to pay extra. Nice drinking water filter in the Bathroom.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked our stay far in advance and couldn’t predict the cherry blossoms opening early this year. I could imagine it would have been beautiful with the sakura along the riverbank in full bloom. Nevertheless we still think the premium paid for a room with the castle view was well worth it. Overall the hotel is pretty old and needs a makeover; especially in the rooms. There are some good restaurants in the plaza across the road at Osaka Castle Park (even have a branch of Gram, the popular pancake place). I guess if they have completed renovations, they would probably charge much more! Staff were not too friendly but the check in/out process was efficient enough. There isn’t much shopping around the area so would only suggest a stay here if you’re a fan of Osaka Castle or have business meetings nearby.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing view on the Osaka castle, the room is modern and convenient. I didn't feel the staff very good but maybe little bit shy with foreigners.We prefered to eat outside because the price was a quiet expensive,
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nothing to really critique, all there, all clean, all busy. A bit dated though so could do with a make over. Well situated near the castle park area, good connections to the rest of Osaka. If on business a good place to be, if on holiday there are better charming options.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed at the Hotel New Otani Osaka and was very impressed by the recent hotel renovation. Many hotels miss the mark with their renovations-- but the work at the New Otani was exactly right. The carpets chores for each new floor, for example, were remarkably beautiful. The rooms was superb, along with the attention to details-- and the wonderful attentive staff. A great hotel.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was here for 3 days at the start of my business trip in Kansai. The hotel is great as you would expect for this rating. The room was upgraded as per my Expedia VIP status. The staff were very helpful. As I am training for a marathon I asked for a local running map and they provided a measured map of the local Osaka Jo (Osaka Castle). This was very useful and I used this on two occasions during my 3 days. Food - I did not try the restaurant or coffee lounge as I had early and late meetings. The room facilities were good - room was not large but then again no hotel rooms are large in Japan. Location to the train net work was fine (albeit that the OSaka train network is hard to understand itself). Overall a very nice hotel that comes highly rated.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location - very close to Osaka Castle, JR station and municipal train station. The staff in the counter is friendly and speaks English well. The beds are comfortable. We had a great time. :)
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we first arrived, a few thoughts immediately came to mind:1. It's vicinity to Osaka Castle Park is a major plus2. It's mostly quieter than downtown hotel - on a flip side, away from the excitements of city centers3. It's hotel mostly used by business clients and tour groups.The look is old school but still retains its elegance and grandeur.The lobby is vast and ceiling is skyhigh.Lobby boasts its centrally located and cafe-like lounge.Rooms are roomy, suited for a family of three just like us.A 3-bed package offers 33 sqm space with comfy and bright ambiance.Get a room with the castle view is a plus.Daily water bottle is complementary.Mini markets are within walking distance. There's mall-like complex nearby with McDonald's, Family mart and restaurants.No landromat option other than hotel laundry service.Not many train access options nearby other than Osakajokoen that serves Osaka Loop Line. Taxis are frequent.To access the airport you would need to plan ahead with trains or hop a cab to Osaka Station or Kyobashi Station for more direct route.Otherwise take a cab to Shinhankyu Hotel for Airport Limousine Bus.For the running enthusiasts, a morning run alongside the river is fantastic.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I spent couple of nights here late November 2017. Hotel is only 5 min walk from Osakajokoen Station and also distance walk to Osaka Castle (4-5 min walk). Great location, nice view and there's convenience store just in front of the hotel. Room was spacious and comfortable. If you like art and paintings, hotel has painting gallery inside.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stopped over in Osaka for a night to end our Japan trip. We travelled 8 hours on a train and couldn’t wait to relax in the hotel pool. We were very disappointed when we were only told on check in that the fitness centre (gym, indoor and outdoor pool, sauna, spa) was undergoing maintenance. We understand that this happens however, it would of been nice to be informed in the confirmation email when we booked or closer to the date. Not to mention, if the fitness centre was open we would of had to pay a fee (4000 YEN/42 AUD) on top of our room price (24000YEN/300AUS a night) to access the fitness centre. Again, there was no indication on the booking confirmation that there was an additional charge to use these facilities nor their website. However, the room was clean and well presented. The service we received was good and the check out time was great (12pm).
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel give an extra bonus in upgrading my booking to Castle view room. The park view is excellent.The red, yellow, orange and green color of the trees in the park makes a beautiful picture . The castle will have lighting until 23:00. After a whole day city tour, a beautiful castle view at night time, a colorful park view when you wake up in the early morning, You can have a relaxing and warm trip with these amazing views in front of you everyday. I surely will book this hotel when I visit Osaka again.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They have an excellent staffs that helps you the best that they can. Clean and spacey room, bathroom and hallway. It’s near to Osakajokoen train station too. Outside of the hotel has a lot of food options, near to Osaka castle so if you like to stroll around, you’ll enjoy the view. What I really like about this hotel is they they take note of their shortcomings. If you look at some bad reviews they reply back and they do make changes from the feedback they got from different customers. For me, it means that the management of this hotel does care to each and every customers they have.Keep it up New Otani Hotel Osaka! We will be coming back again!More power!
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in early November and the view from my room of Osaka Castle was amazing, especially at night! Right across the street from the castle grounds.The breakfast buffet was the best I had in Japan. There were western and Japanese choices separated on two stations, which were on opposite ends of the room from each other so it never felt busy even though the dining room was full. They had a monitor for the stations as well so I never saw anything run out. The food was also very delicious and there were so many choices to choose from. A+
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Huge, quite anonymous hotel which serves it purpose: quite central and rooms are ok but they gave us a non-smoker room which seemed to have become non-smoker very recently because it smell very strong like cigarette. But that was not the worse. We had to leave quite quickly and forgot some clothes and a new Mont Blanc pen in the room. We called them as soon as we noticed the missing items and they confirmed they had picked them from the room and would keep them until our return which was supposed to be one month later. Unfortunately, our second trip was canceled. When we eventually called the hotel to ask if they could send us the items (on our costs) instead of waiting for us to pick them up, they said they had discarded the Mont Blanc fountain pen and the clothes. They had our phone-number, our mail and all our details but they never let us know that they where about to throw our personal stuff away. It is difficult to believe that they would throw a Mont Blanc pen away.Anyway, the minimum would be to give their customer a short notice a few days before discarding forgotten items to let them a chance to get their belongings back, especially when the customer called to signalize the loss and organize the pick-up of the items.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The New Otani Osaka is an upscale, 5 star-ish hotel in a good location. As others have pointed out, it's about a 5-7 minute walk to the subway, as well as a short 10 minute walk to Osaka Castle, which you can see from the hotel. The decor was very nice, and contemporary, but not as modern as other hotels, The New Otani is an upscale hotel with classic furnishings both in the rooms and on the grounds. It's a well kept and beautiful place in a good area. It is situated in a higher end business area, but the backside is where you can find the Osaka Castle, and shops/restaurants leading to the subway. It's a good hub for Osaka.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 전반적으로 우아한 호텔이다, 그러나 옆방에서 아이들 소리 때문에 아늑한 휴식이 어려웠다, 5성급이라는데 방음이 이래서야... 매니저의 해결책은 방해가 된다면 짐을 두고 다른 방에 가서 자라고하니 이런 경우가..주말 부페는 한껏 기대를 하고 갔으나 음료비를 별도로 charge 하고 있었으며 디저트로도 과일 한쪽이 없었다. What kind of buffet is this? It was the worst hotel buffet during my trip ! 팁을 드리자면 먹방을 위한 여행이라면 여기에 머물지 마시고 -주변에 쓸만한 음식점이 별로 없음-오사카성을 즐기고 싶다면 강추입니다. 특히 야경을 한껏 즐길수 있습니다
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff in this hotel make you feel a million dollars. Rooms were a good size for Japan.A great selection of restaurants. The only thing I would say is take your own coffee, and be prepared to pay to use the pool. The locals we spoke to said this hotel is a more traditional hotel. I would recommend to anyone looking for a quiet rather beautiful hotel in a great position in Osaka.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was excellent with a wonderful view of Osaka Castle. Service was wonderful from the reflexology treatment to the shops below in the mini mall. Breakfast was either Japanese or American, I had a bit of both, excellent assortment on the buffet tables. The hotel has several restaurants, I chose a Sushi bar, again good food and service. Most of the hotel staff speak little English so be patient. Purchased a lovely purse in one of the shops. A very good experience for the short time I had there, would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed as a couple in October 2017. It is situated close to Osaka castle but there are no shops / restaurants nearby. The hotel presents as a huge business type complex. The vast reception area is surrounded by posh shops and a bar and a couple of eating establishments. The main restaurants are situated on the ‘3rd’ floor or the top 18th floor. We had booked into the 3rd floor Japanese restaurant the first night but left without ordering given it was empty and had a poor choice. We went to the Chinese restaurant but were disappointed in the food and, as is often the case in Japanese hotel restaurants, found the wine list limited and expensive. The last night we ate at the top floor posh French restaurant. This was very expensive but had superb views, excellent service and lovely food. The wine list was expensive but with a reasonable choice. The style of food is nouvelle cuisine but was superb. As for the room, we were in 1239 (12th floor, Superior Junior Suite) which was rather dated in style and appeared tired. There were 2 toilets, one which looked as though it was out of the 1970’s. The other was typical hotel style and cramped for a ‘suite’ room. Perhaps we were spoilt coming from the excellent Hyatt in Kyoto and the Imperial Palace in Tokyo, but I would advise choosing somewhere else.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here twice whilst in Osaka wither side of visiting Kyoto. The Hotel is very smart and all the staff were very helpful and we really enjoyed our stays.Top tip before you arrive would be to apply for New Otani membership as this provides you with free access to the swimming pool (which is really nice however would otherwise cost you around £20 per time ) . The membership also got us a free upgrade to deluxe ensuite the first time we visited. The Hotel is also brilliantly located in terms of visiting the castle and Osakajokoen station which allows you to visit different areas of the city via the transport network which is so efficient.Finally if you are hungry for an easy meal out after your flight visit Osaka Jo Terrace as the Good Spoon restaurant (5 minute walk from hotel) served wonderful food at a reasonable price.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Group of 3, stayed during 21/9/17 - 24/9/17, Superior Triple. Location: Osaka-jo koen Station (Approx 5 mins walk to Hotel)Hotel room was very spacious, Service by the staff are great. Even took extra measure to guide the way to room, introducing places in hotel and where to get ice for cold drinks. Room has a mini walk-in wardrobe that has some hangers, luggage holder and a safe inside. Toilet are well equipped with 3 sets of amenities and hair dryer. Main area has sofa set, working desk, TV, mini refrigerator, some alcohols and drinks, beds. Area is very spacious, 3 (24" luggage) all opened up at once and there are still plenty of space to move around. Some items in the room can start up slowly like the kettle and the air con. Takes awhile for the kettle to boil water, air con may start up slower and temperature adjust can be slow too. Nearby the hotel, it has Lawson and Starbucks towards Osaka Castle direction, and towards the business district, more stores can be found. Food can be found around the same area. Overall, a very pleasant and comfortable stay here,Pro: Close to Osaka-jo koen station(Osaka Loop Line), those who are using JR pass, this allows you to make full use of your pass, Spacious, polite and friendly staff,Con: Slow start up of kettle and air con.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel one year ago(sept. 2016) when we visited Japan. This was our first hotel in Japan. We were very satisfied with the spacious room with amazing wiews over the Osaka castle and the nearby river.It was prety hot outside but the aircondition was perfect. We even used the hotel outside pool whith the free acces for the New Otani Club members. The breakfast is very good, there is a good choice of delicious japanese, chinese and european dishes.We used taxi or underground to visit most of the Osaka turist atractions. The acces to the subway is very close to the hotel. The service is exellent and I would stay in this hotel again if I visit Osaka in the future.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here while we where in Osaka, in a superior double which was quite spacious for a Japanese hotel, nice big bathroom lots of space. Nicely located near a JR stop, and a nice food area with a water park our room had a great view of the Castle (definitely take a look). Our one issue was a noise complaint that the night manager really didn't know how to deal with. He offered us another room but it was a downgrade. In the end we just polite asked the gentleman if they could be quieter and they where very happy to compile. Would still stay here again though.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The New Otani Osaka is a good hotel if you want to stay one night for a visit to Osaka Castle or the Concert Hall. Otherwise, it's location is not particularly convenient to most other areas of the city. The Hotel does boast a great view of the Castle, but the construction of a new Television Station across the street may block what were the best Castle views. The tour boat station and restaurant that faces many of the rooms makes a fair amount of noise with constant broadcast music and boat announcements. The rooms at the hotel are generally large and good. The Junior Suites are very nice. There is a gym and swimming pool, but they are both expensive to use, often crowded by Club members, and inconveniently located. After several stays, I just avoid these facilities. That is unfortunate for guests. The neighborhood doesn't offer much in the way of restaurants for foreigners. Hotel restaurants seemed costly and presented limited dining options. There is a good bakery outlet on the ground floor. We stayed 9 days. and know this hotel well. We prefer to stay in the Shin Osaka area.
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very nice and modern crewhotel, the view of osaka joo alone is tremendous! i was lucky to get a room with a view. the roomservice is outstanding delicious, not cheap but of high quality. the surroundings are good, with a lot of shops and restaurants in walking distance, the castle is of course the highlight! ( history-nerd that i am!) i'd love to return asap! domo arigato gozaimashita
hotelName:
26    Hotel New Otani Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Basic hotel, pretty standard sized rooms for Japan, with all the normal amenities. The best part about this hotel was the LOCATION. You are situated right at the beginning of both major lanes that have all the main attractions of Osaka. We didn’t have to taxi anywhere really, as everything is right there. Also it’s steps away from the train station if you do decide to wander off. At the foot of the hotel is a family mart convenience store that is open24/7 and the hotel also offers a money exchange in the lobby.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 처음에 체크인하고 객실에 들어갔을 때 냉장고 먹다 남은 듯한 빈 생수병이 있었던 것 빼고는 다 만족합니다. 위치가 굉장히 좋아서 웬만한 곳을 다 걸어 다닐 수 있었습니다. 직원들도 친절하고 방도 깨끗했습니다. 2박 했었고 재방문하고 싶네요. It was nice stay except one thing. There is empty bottle of water in the fridge when I checked in my room. It was not good impression. But the location is great. I could walk everywhere including subway station. Staffs were helpful and the room was clean. I stayed for 2 nights. I definitely want to visit again.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Kudos to Natsumi Sasaki and her team at RedRoof Plus + who welcomed my gang with warm hospitality. Tolerating our silly antics. Patiently explaining the venue of scenery . My customer service Ms.Natsumi Sasaki was also very professional. Love the experience overall
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice little budget hotel. Right in the middle of Dotonbori, shopping, eating, Dontobori Canal Boat ride. Easy trin ride to nara Park to feed and see the Deer. Staff are friendly, helpful and housekeeping is esxcellent. Great location, recommend red Roof Plus to anyone looking for a cheaper hotel with all the mod cons included.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for one night, but definitely would of stayed even more. We arrived expecting a twin room but there was a problem and they offered a double, w/breakfast and difference in cost. It was no problem and glad I did. The breakfast was excellent. The western food was delicious and the variety. They also had japanese breakfast food too. It wasn't crowded when we went either. Room was clean and modern. The location is right next to Round 1 and close to major streets and subway. For the price, this is a great place!!
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good stay in this hotel. Prime location with a family mart right below the hotel. Room makeup is clean n tidy daily. Room comes with a fabric freshener which keeps our coat and jacket smells fresh from all those deep frying and bbq food. Laundry room is a plus point as we don't need to bring back dirty clothes. Staff are friendly and able to communicate in English and Chinese. Definitely we will be back if we were to visit Osaka again.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small but otherwise convenient for a short stayLocation is great. Metro lines and Namba railway station are near by and hotel is easy to find. It’s on a busy street right next to Namba night life and shopping area. Still it’s a quiet hotel. No noises from other room or corridor. You can hear traffic from outside but it’s not disturbing. So it’s quiet place for good sleep.We stayed on premium floor. It’s located on the top floor so we had nice open city view to east. Bed was very narrow for a couple, only 140 cm wide. But we knew that when we booked this hotel. We stayed there only one night so it wasn't a problem.Room is small but very well planned and organized. There is luggage rack and several racks on the wall for hanging the clothes, bags etc., huge table and comfortable chair. Room was also very clean.Bathroom was half open. Sink was in open area next to room but toilet and shower ”booth” were separated from that area.Room amenities were excellent for this kind of small room. Just everything you need on your stay. Body and facial soap, shampoo and conditioner, toothbrushes, toothpaste, robes, slippers, hair brush, hair dryer, coffee, tea, candies (included), mini fridge, foot relaxing masks, refreshing spray for clothes...Breakfast was basic but excellent start for the day.I would definitely stay there again!
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When you arrive in Osaka you get how bignnit really is and the Red Roof Plus is in the heart of it. Perfect for all forms of transport; bus, train and walking. It's clean, relaxed and have lots of free stuff. I got a brekky thrown in.This place is great value.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 5 nights in this hotel. Short walking distance to Kuromon Market, Shinsaibashi, Namba and right inside the Dontonbori area. Although full restaurants and shops around this hotel but still can feel quiet inside hotel. Hotel provide free coffee and boiled water at the lobby everyday. Overall are very conformable and convenient. Highly recommended to everyone!
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is very convenience to stay in Namba. There is a lot of shopping places nearby the hotel. And it is next to the train station. The 黑門市場 is very close to the hotel, just need to walk 5-8 minutes. The staff are nice too.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent four nights in Osaka in this great little hotel. It is well located near the Osaka Namba subway with connections to anywhere you need to go in Osaka.The rooms are well sized (we choose a twin room because they are slightly bigger). The room amenities are great - pajamas, toiletries, tea, coffee and snacks!The staff are super friendly and couldn’t do enough for us. They greeted us with a smile every time we entered the lobby.The breakfast buffet was great. Plenty of variety in Western and Japanese selections and again the staff were fantastic.Walking distance to the Dotonbori district with plenty of restaurants and shopping choices.We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location. There's a 24hrs convenient store right below the hotel. Many restaurants, cafes and shops for shopping around the hotel. Near train station. Room is clean but small. Ok for single or couple travellers. A bit cramp for family.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights over NYE for our first trip to Osaka. Location was good, right in the heart of the action. Room was quite claustrophobic, we expected small but it was also very dark and low ceilings. No door on the bathroom and the "door" on the toilet gave no privacy at all. Bed and pillows quite uncomfortable by western standards but seems that is standard in Japan. Staff were friendly enough.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location:- Near to train station and subway. - Family mart is just next door. - Walkable distance to places of interests like Dotonbori, Shinsaibashi etc.Room:- Comfortable- Aircon control doesn't seems to work
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 5 bights lately. Small room, not so comfortable bed. Hotel is a lot nearer to NIpponbashi station than Namba station. Dotonburi is right behind hotel. Namba walk is right across the street. Very very centrally located. Ground floor is actually Family Mart. Hotel takes part of ground floor as their lobby.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is located in a very convenient area, with lots of shops and restaurants. The room is comfortable, the staff efficient in the check-in. Useful and complete amenities in the room. There was also a laundry room, with washing and drying machine, with reasonable price. There was also a scale in the lobby to weight the luggage and also a currency exchange machine. Around 8min walk to Namba STN. BIC Camera shopping mall right in front of the hotel. Convenient store right next door!!! Will definitely recommend and stay here next time!
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was told they overlooked the booking so only left the only room which was not the premium twin room that I booked for. But I reached there was 12plus in the morning and I had 2 young kids with me so I had no choice to accept it. No compensation or refund was given.I booked the room for 4 pax but I had to ask for extra 2 towels everyday. And they expect you to go to the lobby to collect. Bad service. Not worth the $.Good location.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the room with standing shower booth. Room space was alright for 2 adults. We were able to open our luggage fully. The bed was comfortable and we had very good sleep throughout the night. There was a family mart next door where we can get our breakfast daily. It was very near Dotonburi and the train station.There were power points on each side of the bed where we can charge our handphones. There were also enough power points on the table. Very satisfied with our choice of hotel during this trip.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel room was very clean and tidy. No spots to be criticised at all! The toilet cleanliness was above expectations too. Spotless!The location of the hotel is very ideal: Just round the corner of Namba and just above Namba Walk. A great place to stay in and convenient to travel to various places! Loads of food places to seek for near the hotel. However, there can be more hooks installed in the bathroom as we had no spots for us to hang our clothes or towels. Also, the floor space is a bit tight for luggages to be opened up.Other than that, nothing much to complain. Just a perfect stay in Osaka! =)
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 6 nights in early October.Pros:1) Great location. This hotel is situated right in the midst of the busiest food and nightlife area in town, consisting of Dotonbori, Namba, Shinsaibashi, and countless other food and shopping streets. The entire area is just huge. The hotel itself is a 5 minute walk to the Nippombashi subway station, and less than 10 minute walk to the Namba station. These two stations will connect you to most places of interest. Most of the time, i found using the Nippombashi station more convenient than Namba station, as the former has less platforms and lines to navigate and was therefore easier to use. Google maps was dead accurate as a navigation tool, providing correct routes and timings of trains. Along the street where the hotel is situated, there is a long underground street running from east to west which connects the Nippombashi station and Namba station. This underground street is essentially lined with restaurants and other shops. At street level, there a large number of stairways down to this underground street. There is a convenience store right next to the hotel. I didn't try the ATM in the convenience store, but since it wasn't a Seven-Bank or Japan Post Bank ATM, I don't think it accepts international ATM cards.2) The front desk personnel were fluent in English and quite helpful. I had no problems communicating with them whatsoever.3) There are 3 coin-slot washers and 3 coin-slot dryers on the 11th floor of the hotel. These are all fully automated so you do not need to bring your own detergent. 300 yen will get you a 30-minute wash cycle. Another 100 yen will get you a 30 minute drying cycle. Add more coins for longer cycles.Cons:1) The bed felt a bit stiff. The pillows seemed like the gel-type which may not suit everyone. I had to stack 2 pillows together to achieve a comfortable height for my head to sleep on (I'm a side sleeper). Maybe that's why they provided 4 pillows for my double bed. It got quite hot under the thick quilt cover and i found that I had to turn the air conditioner down to 22 degress celsius to sleep comfortably.2) Not much sound insulation within the hotel itself. Not an issue if you're an early riser though. At 9am everyday, I was woken up by the sound of people opening and closing their doors and it usually carried on until 10am (I guess that's when most guests would have left their rooms to explore the city). At 10am, the contingent of cleaners would go about making up the rooms. Street noise however seemed well insulated from my room.Other Notes:The 'Do Not Disturb' tag is a double-sided piece of magnetic sign which you will find slapped on the back of the door of your room (simply flip over the sign to switch to 'Please Make Up Room').2 free bottles of mineral water are provided every day in your room.A convenient way of traveling to and from the Kansai airport is to use the Nankai Rapid Express train at Namba station. The journey takes less than an hour and costs1270 yen per adult. Each carriage has a small area to comfortably place your luggages.I would recommend these few places to eat at in the vicinity:i) Kushinobo Osaka Hozenji. This restaurant was recommended by a local and was a surprise find. They serve kushikatsu, which refers to fried skewers of just about anything, from meat to seafood to potatoes. It's a nice quiet restaurant where you can get good food without competing with the crowd. Located a few minutes walk to the east of the hotel.ii) 551 Horai's. Their pork buns are really good. They have a sino-Japanese style dine-in restaurant around the sennichimae area above Namba station, a couple of minutes south of this hotel.iii) Kinryu ramen along Dotonbori. Excellent quality and costs only 600 yen per bowl of noodles. There are a few branches along Dotonbori I think. The most centralized branch is very busy. Walk further east along Dotonbori and you will find a less busy one.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel together with flight tickets via Cathay Pacific Holidays. Recently renovated and situated at the heart of shopping area and night lives, Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba is a great choice for a family trip. Staff are nice, friendly, helpful, and spoke good English. Complimentary coffee is available at the lobby.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in the Namba district and very close to dining and shopping. No need to take any type of transportation to get around since everything is within walking distance. The rooms are average size and kept very neat and clean. I had difficulty with communication since I don’t speak Japanese. All tv channels are in Japanese.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated in the middle between Namba and Dotonbori this hotel, newly renovated gives you the ideal hotel to experience the busy side of Osaka. You are really surrounded by restaurants and more restaurants catering for all taste of Japanese food. As if not enough, there is a convenience store right next to the hotel entrance, and an exit of Namba station is just 20 steps from the hotel entrance. in front of the hotel is a taxi stand because the hotel on a main road . The staff is fluent in English , checkin and out is a breeze. Hotel room is lean and comfortable. Bathroom, toilet and washing basic are all separate. Water pressure and temperature of the shower is commendable because the room is new. Go for the twin bed room because they are much larger than double bedrooms.Double glazing windows shield the traffic noise off pretty well. Plenty of power sockets for your charging and Wifi is free and adequate depending on where your room is. Will definitely come back when visiting Osaka again.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Inreally enjoyed this hotel, which have a great location in Namba. You have plenty of restaurants and bara around and can do Namba attractions by foot. If you like some food and dtinks at night, I really recommend this hotel. Room have a good space and confortable bed. Enough for a couple. Toilet is apart from shower, which I like it, and have very good shower ammenities.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location for exploring the Dotonbori area in Osaka.Conveniently close to metro and train stations, comfortable beds.Acceptable room size (for a Japanese hotel) plus the usual amenities set (I wish European hotels would imitate Far East hotels amenities policies).
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I original booked this hotel for celebrate my 30th wedding anniversary in Osaka from October 17-20,2018 from Agoda. My booking was premium twin room. My son told me that he can join my trip during that period then I went to Agoda and Expedia try to switch the room type to standard triple room but no room was available. I contact Red Roof Plus and ask the staff and she said they have triple room available and that triple room was their last room if I want to rebook I have to pay 4000 Yen per night and total will be 12,000 Yen at the front desk upon arrival. I said ok confirm with them and asked the the total cost of the triple room and the answer was they did not know my deal with Agoda and I just need to pay 12,000 Yen. She didn’t say if I switch to other room type, they will going to charge me more. I want them to send me confirmation for triple room, they didn’t send anything and still the premium twin room on my booking. I called Agoda and talk to the staff because I pay for premium room and Red Roof offer standard triple room and I have to pay extra therefore I switch my room to standard double and I notified Red Roof Plus by phone and online of my new reservation number. I received back 2 welcome messages from them but the 3rd message I received from the same staff called Jeon said I have to pay 80,000 Yen per night and the total will be 24,000 Yen, I was very upset regarding to this because she didn’t mention anything before and I ask her few times for the total cost, her answer was the same and she said I don’t know the deal between Agoda and me. I called the hotel directly and the manager kept saying I have to paid 24,000 Yen. I cancel my booking and I never will go back to Red Roof Plus Osaka again!
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay in this hotel for 6 days back in April. The hotel is new but not to big. The Location is very good. In the middle of the market. Food and shopping is only a few steps away.We stay in the raining season, only a few steps we can go to underground shopping that will lead u to the train station. If you like the busyness of Osaka this is the hotel for you.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not the easiest place to get to from the airport (but we did the train, bus would be easier) but it is a perfect spot to base yourself in Osaka. 3 different rail/subway lines at your door, underground shopping tunnels leading to all quickly & easily, the food markets, Dotonbori all at your doorstep, Starbucks for coffee just downstairs. The laundry facilities were very handy, staff all lovely and the hotel is relatively new so everything immaculate. The beds were a great size and soft which is rare in Japan and the room size was also probably a bit bigger than usual in the Premium rooms. We had a great week based at this hotel.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For what we paid this hotel is way over priced. Only positive is the location but front desk staff are unpleasant and not friendly. Hotel hallways are dingy and very worn. Our 10th floor smelt badly. Rooms have a dark dingy feel. They give you couple 'free' snacks but do check expiration dates as we stayed late June and items had expired in March. The hotel is supposedly non smoking with large fine however we someone was smoking and our room and hallway full of smoke. I told reception who came up and smelt it but appologized and said nothing he can do. What a joke! The walls are paper thin and we had some obnoxious loud tourist speaking in mandarin which made things more unpleasant. Overall, very disappointing stay. Definitely wont be back to this hotel.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had booked a standard twin room, but were pleasantly upgraded to a premium twin room. Although the room was smaller than most other hotels, all basic items and amenities were sufficiently provided. The location of red roof was unbeatable! It was near shopping places and there were plenty food choices all around! However, housekeeping standards could definitely be improved (e.g. clearing of used towels, cleaning of used utensils etc).
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Convenient location, just few minutes walk from underground Namba station, plus few minutes walk from Airport Express. Also just around ten minutes walk to Dotonbori and Shisaibashisuji shopping street.No exaggerated decoration but room has enough space feeling comfortable and two beds can be moved together to make room for my 2-year-old boy sleeping in the middle.Price is reasonable.Just occasional noise from the highway.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an unassuming little hotel in a very good location close to the major rail junction of Namba and to the liveliness of Dotonbori. The rooms are small, the beds are comfortable, there's a fridge, a few free snacks, and a window view of the rooftops if you're on an upper floor. Everything works well in a confined space, including a very efficient shower.We paid a little extra for the buffet breakfast, offering plenty of western as well as Japanese food. There's a handy foreign currency exchange machine in the lobby, as well as a scales to weigh your luggage.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are after location, then this hotel is perfect for you. It is right about 2 mins away from Dotonbori. Shopping & restaurants all around. It is also very near the Namba Subway Station. Room is just the typical small size for Japan but very clean. The shower is tiny but the water pressure & hot water were very strong so I loved taking a shower. Coin laundry & vending machine also available inside hotel. Didn't avail the breakfast so can't comment there.Service was just average. They provide free coffee in the room, but only had them once since they never refilled them after the first night. The staff don't really do much. If you ask for something they would ask you to go down the lobby to get it yourself. And if you ask for an extra bottled water, they would refuse saying only 1 bottle is allotted per day (what?). There were extremely noisy Europeans or south americans banging on each others door and screaming and laughing like there's no tomorrow outside the hallways on our floor as early as 6am & as late as 1am everyday. When I called the lobby to complain, he couldn't understand me so no help there. Plus our room (#422) was just across the housekeeping staff room and so another source of noise there waking us up very early. Sound proofing is quite bad so just hope you are placed on a quiet floor. Some residents also smoked on the floor, after convincing the staff came up, got shocked that it did smell like cigarettes (it's supposed to be a non-smoking hotel) and did provide an air purifier.Overall, don't expect any special services from the staff but we can still say it was a good stay & hotel. Wouldn't mind staying here again.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is really good - just behind Dotonburi, cheap street food everywhere, about 20 mins walk from Namba station using the underground shopping street Namba Walk Exit No. 26, 5 mins walk to Nipponbashi subway and 10 mins walk to Kuromon market. Room is clean with basic amenities. Only complaint is the bed is too small. It says for two, but hardly a double size bed.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed three nights in a premium twin room while our friends had an ordinary double. We didn’t see their room but they assured us ours was much better. We had a bit of a view whereas they had a dark room with no natural light. While our twin room was still quite small it was easy to get around and we had a place to put our bags and hang a few things up. We had good bathroom amenities and everything else you need including a safe. Breakfast was the typical mix of western and Japanese choices including eggs made for you a choice of three ways ( OK if you like eggs slightly underdone). We could always find plenty to eat. The location is right in the midst of everything you want to see at Namba and surrounded by shopping and restaurants. It’s extremely busy on the weekends. We had difficulty finding our way in the maze of shopping that leads from the various stations. I had read a lot of reviews about how to find the hotel but none really helped much.The first thing you must do on exiting your train is to find Namba Walk. Look up to the signs at ceiling height. Namba Walk is written in red or ask for directions. Japanese people are generally very helpful. Namba Walk consists of two parallel walkways running east west between Namba and the next subway station. Once you are on Namba Walk look for the exit signs. If you have luggage you need to exit at B 20 ( or was it B22 ) for an escalator to take you up to street level. (Otherwise B 24 or 26 has stairs to bring you up within a few metres of the outside of the hotel). B 20 brings you out almost directly across the road from the hotel. There is a pedestrian crossing right there to get you safely over the road. Hope this helps.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located next to dotonbori this fabulous hotel will not disappoint. The staff are very friendly and helpful. We had a room on level 11 on the premier floors which gave a little extra room which was nice. The room rate we purchased also included a good quality West and east breakfast. Location is amazing next to metro and 1000 restaurant choices plus shopping. Only a few minutes to Osaka main metro and jr Shinkansen trains. Also has coin laundry, ice machine.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was clean tidy service was great and room was just what we needed The location was great less than 3min walk to station and around the corner from Dōtonbori food and entertainment district.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wifi did't work in room (our room was at corner side). we sought assistance from the front desk staff and she had no idea, even just wanted her to reflect the problem, she showed no motivation to help. (just asked us to use our own data.)Fairly, the room is ok and the hotel is convenient. We are not the first time to stay here. However, if you want to use wifi and good service, do not choose this hotel!房間 wifi 極差 (房間位於走廊角落位置).我們到服務台找服務員幫忙, 但她說只著我們用自己數據, 我們請她代為反應問題, 她沒理會, 只說沒辦法. 雖然明白她未必能即時處理問題, 但這態度也未免有點過份.平心而論, 這兒房間尚可, 地點方便, 我也不是第一次選擇住這兒; 但論 wifi 設備及服務, 還是要好好考慮, 這兒並非好選擇
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 7 nights. We were a group of 6 people so we booked for 2 triple rooms accomodation. The location was defintely a factor when we decided on this hotel. Everything was just a few meters away. It was near tourists’ favorite spots and defintely situated near all the good resto! The train station can be reached via the underground walk-Namba walk. The front desk people were very nice and accomodating. We had no problem with check-in and checkout although rooms were a little bit small it was very clean and nicely designed to be functional. We were lucky to be assigned a room on the 11th floor where the laundry area was situated.All in all I can say that this hotel can be recommended.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The biggest plus is that the property is conveniently located to Dononburi and major shopping areas. We found the room small by western standards, but is on par with most Japanese Hotels. The rooms were in good condition and felt new. The buffett breakfast offered a combination of Japanese and western offerings. It was raining during our visit and the hotel put our umbrellas for guests to use during their stay. The only thing we had trouble with was navigating the temperature controls. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A modern hotel in an excellent location. Dotonburi is just behind the hotel, Kuromon Market is less than 10 minutes walk from it and you can browse along Namba Walk (underground shopping) on your way to the happening Namba area. Also, it is situated between Namba and Nippombashi stations so you are spoiled for choice when it comes to transportation.The room itself was modern, clean, comfortable, as expected of a Japanese hotel.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room and facility were decent and love the location near the lots of restaurants and shopping areas. Nothing much to complain about.. would recommend if you travel for vacation and want easy access to restaurants and shops..
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located very close to Dotonbori which was awesome for us as we can just walk there. The staff is friendly.The bathroom in our room is huge! Definitely will stay here again the next time round i visit Osaka :)
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel as we read good reviews about the location. As what most people have shared, the location is excellent and it was so close to all the shops and restaurants as well as to 2 train stations. However, the room was too small even for Asian standards. Booked a premium double room as we thought it would be better but got a shock when i saw the room as it was so small it was more suited for a single traveller rather than 2 people. there was not much space for walking or for the luggages and there was no wardrobe to hang your clothes. the bed was abit tight for 2 as well. the "premium" came in the form of better bath robes, toiletries and snacks but we didnt really need those. the room was ok for a short stay but not longer than 3 days. would recommend the twin rooms for a more comfortable stay.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location- situated with easy walking distance to Namba station, and shopping/ eating areas. The hotel was exceptionally clean and the staff were very friendly. Would highly recommend for your stay in Osaka.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was absolutely perfect, everything was within walking distance. Around you you have shopping malls(0101, Takashimaya, Daimaru, Namba City, Namba Park), BIC Camera, endless shopping/eating strips/joints (Namba Walk, Dotonburi, Shinsai Bashi), Kuromon Market (The equivelant of Tsukiji Market in Tokyo), and Nihonbashi for ACG fans. I couldn't think of a better location to stay.The rooms were tiny, but then again I wouldn't expect anything bigger because it is Japan... reasonably tidy, but the room could use a good vacume. There were dusts on the floor and threads/furs things stuck on sheets. We stayed there for 8 or maybe 9 nights and it didn't look like house cleaning had vaccumed at all, not even once. However this hotel can seriously up their game on the service front. So I've mentioned about house keeping before... there was also the fact that house keeping can't tell if we're still in the room. I woke up late one morning and was still inside at around 10am, my husband was still in bed asleep and the house keeper, after knocking, opened the door and came in... I was shocked... this is unacceptable. At around 10:30, I decided to head out on my own and leave my hubby in bed so I stepped outside of my room and told the house keeper that my hubby is still asleep inside. She nodded and carried on with her work. My hubby slept till around 11 and came out to meet up with me, we returned to the hotel at night and found the room unserviced... So instead of waiting to check if anyone was still in the room, they simply skipped our room because I told them someone was still inside in the morning. I wasn't happy.Also, the other night we wanted the reception to help us make a call for a resturant booking. It was nearly midnight, the resturant was closed, and they won't open till late afternoon the next day. I 100% expected the gentlement would take down the details like the name of the resturant, phone number and the date/timeframes I was wanting and make the call the following afternoon for me during its opening hours. However he told me it's midnight now, the resturant is closed and I need to come back tomorrow to the reception during its opening time... how unhelpful can you get? Being a tourist on a short visit, your own hotel room is the last place you will be on a typicall afternoon.If I visit Osaka again, I would stay in the same area but I'll definitely look for another place, this hotel will be my last resort.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were clean and rather spacious in terms of Japanese Hotels where space is premium. The shower was separate to the toilet which was very welcome for our stay. We did book a non smoking room, however other other guests did not adhere to hotel rules and ruined our stay as the air conditioning circulated their cigarette smell. Cannot fault the staff, for the price we paid and ease of access to the metro, dotonbori st and namba walk shopping - wouldn't mind staying here again
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was easy to find. Walk outta Namba subway turnstiles, find exit 16 (leading to Namba Walk underground shopping street), walk til exit B26, step out til street level, walk alongside street with overpass on your left, pass a 24h convenience store and the hotel entrance would be right next door.Check in was at 1430h. So the hotel held our bags for us while we went out sightseeing. Rooms were a little small but everything was cleverly designed to fit into the space. We especially liked the bathroom. Very quaint but surprisingly enough space for a full sized adult.Everything was in good condition, albeit the door lourves were dusty. Looking aside that, the room was well furnished with a safe, an empty bar fridge with 2 free bottles of water and a large kettle.Sleep was good. Beds were firm but not too hard.Not much noise from the road or expressway either.Good place to base yourself out of.Do note that only odd numbered floors have humidifiers and air purifiers. And rooms 20, 21, 22 are larger.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel provides you easy access to shops in Dotonbori. Two Don Quijote outlets are like 10 minutes away from each other plus you wont run out of food places to go to like Ichiran Ramen, Takoyaki on the streets, Family Mart if you're lazy, etc. The rooms are not that big but reasonable for the price and are well kept. If you plan to shop in Namba then I would definitely recommend this place.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the second time i have stayed at the Red Roof Inn and i made that decision mainly based on the Location. As others have said, it is in a great location very near Dotonbori with the train station nearby. Unfortunately it's also the second time I have stayed here and had a non smoking room that smelt really smoky. That's the only reason i am rating them 3 circles this time.To be fair to the hotel, this time, we didn't ask to be moved to another room but i am mentioning it here for others to be aware of. I'm sure had we complained, the hotel would have moved us as they did last time. I think they must have poor ventilation?The room is a typical size for Japanese hotels (small). but if you're only going to be there in the evening, it not a big deal.The rooms are modern and well appointed, they were tidied everyday, and they were clean.Staff were helpful and friendly but english language capabilty was not strong.A pleasant stay.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed three nights in one of their superior rooms. People are complaining about the size of the rooms but we didn’t find it too bad. As others have mentioned the rooms & especially the bathrooms are very well appointed. We stayed through Super Typhoon Lan & even before the typhoon clipped Osaka the wind noise coming from the Window was terrible! You would be forgiven for thinking the window hadn’t sealed correctly or was slightly ajar but there wasn’t any draft. Avoid the breakfast, it’s not very good & very expensive for what it is. It’s much cheaper to go over the road to McDonalds, in fact it’s significantly cheaper!Hotel staff were friendly but the standard of English spoken even during the day was rather low, the night staff hardly spoke more than the basic greetings.The good point is that everything is on your doorstep. The subway is access directly outside. Even with the location be prepared to do lots of walking, & I do mean lots!
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stay 3 nights in Red Roof. Standard Japan style small room. Due to the great location, noisy at night. My room at 4th floor. Clean room. Nice services. Will try to stay again if can book higher floor.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This location is very convenient! Right outside there is a Sunkus to buy drinks or snacks, especially since a lot of the food places do not open till 10-11 am. Access to Train is really good because there is stairs to the B22 exit to go through Namba walk( there is a small Daiso store too) and to Namba station or if you want to cross the street. Also, Nipponbashi station is a minute walk away too!! The room is not that big but, hey you are in japan and what do you expect. The room was clean and we had more than enough room for our 4 suitcases. I actually would stay there again because its away from the crowds of Dotombori and everything is about a 2-3 minute walk away in either direction!!
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: By American standards, this was a tiny room, but the location was fantastic, and the room was nice. Very helpful staff too, and a money-changing machine in the lobby was very convenient. Close to multiple subway lines, tons of restaurants and nightlife, and a 7-11 next door with an ATM cash machine. The bathroom was especially nice, with a separate shower and water closet.
hotelName:
27    Red Roof Plus Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a Platinum Ambassador member and always try to stay at Intercontinental Hotels when I travel. We enjoyed our stay and the service was friendly and what is expected of the Intercontinental brand. Both our dinners in the restaurant were very good. We didn't do the b/breakfast as we don't eat much for breakfast so for us its a waste of money! All the staff were lovely and welcoming. We are a family of 4 (16 and 12yrs old children ) Unfortunately there were two issues which didn't impress us at all.1. I understand when stay here you expect to pay more for drinks and food, that I accept BUT 1200 yen (Around $15-16 Aus) for a latte' is not a little more it's a rip off!!! What a joke.. We didn't go back for another coffee 2. As a platinum member I'm entitled to an up grade. However we couldn't have one because the upgraded room only had one bed.(This always happens at every Intercontinental) So I was use to it but the bit that left us so disappointed was at check out they had not only charged us for the extra bed (5500 yen per night) but also a extra person charge of 1500yen per night for my teenager daughter! Double dipping at it's best! I kindly asked to have one of the charges taking off the bill because I had not received an upgrade but was told no. Instead they gave me a lousy 10000 points which is of no value at all. We will be traveling to Osaka again next year but we all the extra charges I don't think we will stay here again. Disappointingly Intercontinental is losing it shine.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got upgraded to a larger room and it was an amazing experience. The size and decor, cleanliness of the room was highly commendable. Staff were extremely helpful and professional. The location is conveniently connected to a few main shopping malls and the train station is about 10 mins away. Definitely highly recommended!
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Intercontinental Osaka well and truly meets all standards of and Intercontinental hotel. The location is extremely central and not far from Osaka Station and loads of shopping around.Stayed in a Premium King room which was great and extremely spacious. The Club lounge is so worth the extra money, such a good value add and the staff in the club lounge are so friendly and attentive .Overall this hotel is amazing and gets a 10/10 rating from me. I highly recommend staying here if you are visiting Osaka.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this hotel from the moment we arrived. Fantastic location, beautiful lobby, restaurants and bars. Amazing room, truly luxurious with incredible views. Very spacious. Would go as far as to say one of the best hotel experiences we’ve had. We stayed five nights and had two rooms as we were travelling with adult children. Staff and housekeeping were exceptional. A special mention of Trung who helped us make a booking at Intercontinental The Strings, Shinagawa. We changed our Tokyo accommodation as we were so impressed with Intercontinental Osaka that we decided to stay with them in Tokyo as well. Would definitely recommend using pool and spa area, it is beautiful, relaxing and immaculately clean and helps revive after busy day in Osaka. Really can’t recommend this hotel highly enough. Would definitely stay here again and have already recommended to friends going to Japan. Thank you for an incredibly beautiful and relaxing stay. Thanks again Trung for your incredible hospitality.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stepping first foot into this lovely luxurious hotel, this has to be one of the absolute top 5 of all hotels I ve stayed in around the world. Staff so friendly, rooms the epitomy of luxury, gorgeous views. Hotel starts on the 20th floor. Breakfast outstanding, the total quality of everything was there. Not one negative. When the General Manager took time from his busy day to see us off (Jerome) what an impression that made. We felt like celebrities. Thanks to all the staff and hotel so very much for making our last 2 nights in Japan so fantastic.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 days for a business trip. I’d recommend the location as it’s connected to Osaka Water Front (a shopping, office and restaurant complex) with two shopping malls and loads of restaurants you’ll be able to get whatever you need for food and shopping and still be within walking distance of other offices in the business district. Customer service is amazing, room facilities are top rated, Bose sound system, great bathroom facilities, and bedroom facilities.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located conveniently in the Grand Front complex linked to Osaka Station and Umeda Station, this is an exceptional hotel. With the lobby on the 20th floor - it’s special right from the start. Great views of Osaka and superior room amenities make this a very special stay. Staff are also very helpful and obliging.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had 3 nights as were sight seeing in the Kansai area. We had used points so we really weren't upgraded. Even though my partner and I are Ambassadors.The room is very nice and well designed. Quite a bit larger than most hotel rooms in Japan. The room had every imaginable amenity. Cleanliness was very good. We only ate breakfast once and the food was good, but we thought it was very overpriced. The hotel has an indoor pool, which we didn't use.Location is in the Grand Front Osaka, which is excellent. This is about a 5 minute walk to Osaka Station. The Grand Front is a vertical mall containing many shops and restaurants.We really enjoyed our stay and would stay here again.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Every things are excellent, location, room, ammunity , view, and personal service.Receptionist was so kind and showed professionalism. He showed all possible places where we can do the things including dinning near the hotel, of course he told us hotel restaurant and bar are also excellent.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our third time staying at the Intercontinental Osaka and it never fails us. The hotel property itself is well maintained and conveniently located in Umeda, with all the shopping just minutes away yet quiet enough to enjoy the tranquility. I want to give a special thanks to Hibiki-san, the Chief Doorman with Guest services. He has been very helpful and go out of his way to assist with our needs. Will definitely come back again!
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This review is way overdue. I've been in this hotel 3 times and after my stay yesterday I decided to write this review. Basically I'm repeating most of the other reviews by saying how amazing this place is from the staff at the entrance, at the pool, Michael at the bar they really provide a 5 stars services. This is my favorite Intercontinental in Japan and among top 10 in Asia.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As you’d expect with Intercontinental hotels, this is a another great hotel.. rooms are clean and well kept. Hotel staff were very helpful / friendly and politeLocation was great for being close to the central Osaka station (for both overground and subway/metro lines (including the JR lines and Shinkansen))... this is just 3 minute walk through the 2 office/shopping tower blocks adjoining the station complexThe hotel is actually located within one of the office/shopping towers, so there’s cafes/amenities around too (including a muji with cafe!)Hotel has a good size fitness centre/gym and pool tooTop tip: walk through the office towers and try not to get the music stuck in your brain!
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything one expects from an outstanding hotel. Jerome Palacoeur ensures the guest experience, for which he is the director, is well taken care of by his team. There is a friendly, warm, ambience rather than a cool professionalism which leaves you unsatisfied. Rooms and bathroom are large and comfortable. Swimming pool is large with a nearby hot tub and gym facilities. Concierge and front desk personnel go out of their way to assist and take a personal interest. Dining at dinner and breakfast provided a range of western and Japanese cuisine which is very well prepared and served. Location vis-à-vis trains, subway and shopping opportunities is excellent. We were there for five days and it was hard to leave.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just spent two nights here. Great location very close to transport if you don't feel like cabbing it. The room was excellent and the facilities really topclass. Most impressive of all was the service which was a cut above most luxury hotels I've been to anywhere, especially Srijana Rai who really impressed us with her lovely solicitous manner and great tips for where to go and how to get there. The only quibble I have is that the food/drink could be a little less expensive - £10 for a cup of coffee seemed a bit steep but perhaps that's what the going rate is for coffee in hotels in Osaka. Well done overall though.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay in hotel 23-27 MarchFirst , We would like to thanks Mr. Sasa and Miss. Takaoka as they are very professional and super attentive. They will try their best to satisfy your request. Also we would like to thanks the housekeeper who makeup our room every day . Room is very clean and comfortable Second, the hotel location was very good. So many shopping mall or restaurants near by , the metro just next to us 2mins on foot .Third, the view from the room was worth for the price...and told hundreds more for the sunset in this room !We must will come back next time .Hope to see you guys soon ! Thank you so mush !Mandy Lee & Eric Cheung
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best city hotels in Japan. Great location about 5-7 minutes away from Umeda station, and 7 minutes away from the JR station that's connected through the mall. Located above a large mall with plenty of dining options. Large, nicely appointed rooms with an extremely comfortable bed. Lobby is on the top floor and then you take the elevator down to the rooms. Beautiful pool area as well as a separated men and women onsen spa. Service is very good and the front desk went above the extra mile for us when we made a booking mistake.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I usually don’t write reviews, but my exceptional stay at Intercontinental Osaka prompted me to write my first one. I travel all around the world with my family (3 children) and I have to say that this hotel absolutely flawless. We had an unfortunate incident where my youngest child was diagnosed with Chicken Pox, but the hotel concierge went out of their way to arrange a local children’s doctor appointments for us and kept checking up on us every few hours ! The hotel and room is spotless - I swear we didn’t see the house keeping staff once , but our rooms were clean and kept the moment we stepped out for even an hour! The breakfast was exceptional ! Wonderful staff , wonderful variety. Just would have liked some oatmeal porridge to be part of the breakfast buffet since younger children usually eat that for breakfast every morning. Otherwise truly wonderful ! A special thanks to Maichi at the Concierge and to Jerome (director of rooms and service ) for making our stay simply spectacular!! Thank you guys .
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the second time I’ve stayed here and it doesn’t disappoint. The breakfast, the views the staff are all great. I had such a wonderful stay at this hotel would definitely stay again. The rooms are huge which makes a nice change in Japan
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m back home now & not only do I miss the good food, shops and attractions in Osaka but I also miss the exceptional service I received during my recent stay at IC Osaka. Prior to my stay, I was surprised to receive an email from Munf at hotel reservations advising they found 3 of my separate bookings and really helped very nice rooms for each of my stays. Thank you Munf! The concierge team led by Asako san was superb. I needed help to make a number of restaurant reservations for Osaka and Kyoto, and they were all arranged timely and responsively by the team. Special thanks to Miho-San, Emi-San and Raymond.Upon arriving KIX airport, we took airport limo to New Hankyu Hotel bus stop, the hotel sent a hotel car to meet us at the stop and take us to hotel free of charge. Check in was smooth with no wait. When I checked in again after returning from Kyoto, the luggages I left behind in Osaka were already waiting for me at the room. Received free drink vouchers as Spire Ambassador benefit. The views of Umeda Sky Building and river were beautiful, AM housekeeping and PM turn down service - it was nice touch to place candies by pillow during turndown. Overall, I am very pleased with my stay and IC Osaka has been my BEST Intercontinetal experience so far! Thank you for making our stay a very enjoyable one. Kind regards,Alicia
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the best Intercontinental that I have stayed around the world. High level service and very details with all aspects. This is beyond my expectations.I have stayed from 29Jan to 01Feb 2019 for vacation. Hotel is about less than 30 minutes away from Itami Airport. If you take Limousine bus, you need to stop at New Hankyu Hotel and walk about 6 minutes. You can see this hotel from New Hankyu Hotel.The lobby is on 20th Floor and because I was booked on Club Room, I have done check in at 35 floor.Thank you so much to Edwin Santos for your high level of service and all the club lounge staff that made my stay memorable.Location is a top notch. Which is? Walking distance to Osaka Station, Umeda Station and many shopping malls.Room was big at 2616. Very clean room, comfortable bed.Gym was good. Breakfast at the restaurant was excellent.
