I took breakfast at the lounge.Upon check out, Bill was accurately prepared.I will of course be happy to return to this property.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2 night stay at IC Osaka after a week snowboarding in Hokkaido. Pre-stay communication was excellent and the complimentary pickup and dropoff at New Hankyu hotel (airport bus stop closest to IC Osaka) much appreciated. It’s only a 1 min drive, but 400 metres can be quite far while dragging luggage or little people on busy sidewalks.Hotel is connected to Grand Front Osaka (a fancy mall) and a short walk to the JR Osaka or subway (various lines). There are plenty of shopping malls and the usual chains around IC Osaka so there is no real need to go to Namba (4 stops JPY230) unless you really want a selfie with the glico man. Being a major transportation hub, lots of famous restaurants have a branch at Umeda.Reserved a deluxe and got a one level Ambassador upgrade to a premium king which is like a junior suite (FYI they do not have twin bed set up for the premium rooms). Spacious and modern, even had a walk in wardrobe. Local honey sweets in turn down service was a nice touch. Bathhouse was lovely, with indoor Japanese bath and 2 saunas. Totally empty when I visited at around 3-4pm on a Saturday. English instructions on the lockers for those not familiar with bathhouse etiquette. HOWEVER, it is not possible to wear the yukata between your room and the bathhouse (or at least I would feel uncomfortable doing so) since you need to change lifts at the lobby area to get to the bathhouse. While I typically dislike large hotels, it never got too noisy or busy in the lobby and public areas (unlike say IC Bangkok). The high ceiling definitely helped. Not sure what scent they use in the public areas but it made the hotel smell and feel classy. Definitely a five star experience.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'd like to give this 4.5 but didn't have the option! We'd just come from Hotel Gajoen in Tokyo so its a difficult benchmark. The room was very practical but just lacked the open layout and quality finishes we had at the Gajoen. Some of the furniture looked a little tired. But really this is just nitpicking. The room was very comfortable for a family of four and the washer and dryer were very handy. The location was very good and we had some first class service from the chief concierge Asako. My son broke his wrist ice-skating while we were there and Asako was very helpful tracking down a clinic for us to go to. Asako and the team were very supportive and the help was much appreciated. The hotel is well located very close to the station with lots of nice places to eat nearby. Would stay here again if we came back to Osaka.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Took the train to Osaka Central Staition after arriving from Frankfurt, once in the station the Intercontinental is a short walk through the covered mall.. check in is on the 20th floor and i have to say the staff are truly fantastic, despite our room not being ready for 45 minutes check in was quick & polite.. our room 2611 was just fantastic too well set out spotless with everything you need for a comfortable stay... the bathroom is just great and for Japan the room was huge, our stay was just perfect had a great sleep both nights.. i guess food/bars etc. While plentiful are expensive however to be expected at a 5☆ hotel in any major city around the world.. the location of the hotel offers restaurants shops night life and transportation on the doorstep so actually if the food & drink options in the hotel are too expensive venture out around the central station for some amazing food options... i would stay here anytime ... its not cheap but on occasion there are some deals
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was very swanky and easy to access from the Osaka station (walk through 2 buildings, all escalator-accessed so you can drag your luggage easily). Hotel is newly built/furnished, and there is a nice little island in the room for serving tea. Great hidden surprise was the new, swanky Japanese bath (need to get butt-naked per tradition) which was fairly empty when I went. Service was impeccable - all the staff extremely accommodating and made sure we had what we needed at all times, and always wore a friendly smile. Only small complaint is the bathroom is not very segregated (all glass walls) but not a big issue for couples/close family in a room. Overall, extremely comfortable and modern stay.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Residence room with separate living area was spacious and functioning, fully equipped and good value. Location is conveniently close to Osaka station, yet would need 300-400 meters walk through office building/mall to get to the platform and shopping or grocery anyway. Grand Front Osaka mall in which it sits on feel a little too quiet and uninteresting for tourist, and not so much variety of food and eateries. Early check-in offered without request was a great uplift after arriving from overnight flight. However, there was some mix up on check-out rate which was later solved. All in all, great comfortable stay, but may explore other places more central next time, may be near Shinsaibashi.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the second time we have stayed at this conveniently located Hotel and as always, we have been treated with excellent service.Having left my jacket on the luggage trolley at Kaisai airport before boarding the Airport Limosine to Osaka Station, the hotel gladly arranged with the bus company to transport the jacket back to Osaka Station for me to pick up within the day. The service was very efficient and was communicated clearly as to when the jacket could be picked up.The club floor services also were very convenient and the food available at pretty much most hours of the day were excellent.We thank you again to the friendly and helpful staff and look forward to visit the hotel again in the near future.Thank you so much!
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect base for visiting Osaka. Connected to Osaka train station and next to Grand Front Osaka, Lucua, Lucua 1100 and Yodobashi. So many shops and restaurants in the area.We stayed in a deluxe king with a wonderful city view. Room is super spacious. Really loved the bathroom as well.Staff are knowledgeable and very professional.Great selection for breakfast at Noka. Room service is very prompt.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had a vacation in greater Kansai Area two weeks ago we had great pleasure of staying at InterContinental Osaka for 3 nights . This was the second time we stayed at IC Osaka; the first time was 10 months ago in January we stayed there for 5 nights. Our first stay experience was so delightful we managed to stay again at IC Osaka to celebrate our Pearl Anniversary. Again this time was an exceptional experience making our trip to Kansai and our special occasion the most memorable. We took the non-stop Airport Bus from Kansai Airport to Hotel New Hankyu (it runs every 15 minutes and the travel time is one hour) from there it took 5 minutes to walk to IC Osaka. As the JR Osaka Station is within 5 minutes walk from the Hotel we also used it as the transportation hub to explore Kyoto, Nara and Kobe. Taking a ride on the Sagano Romantic Train should be on the top list for everyone exploring Kyoto at Autumn Foliage Season. It is convenient to take the Special Rapid Train from JR Osaka Station to JR Kyoto Station (the travel time is only 30 minutes) and then take a connecting train to JR Saga Arashiyama Station. The Sagano Romantic Train terminal Saga Torokko Station is within walking distance from the JR Saga Arashiyama Station. We also took a shuttle bus from the JR Osaka Bus Terminal, which is located at the ground floor of the JR Osaka Station, to Kobe-Sanda Premium Outlets which was acclaimed to be the largest outlets site in Kansai region. We spent almost the whole day for shopping in this Outlet. We stayed at a Corner Suite. The room was spacious and well appointed with a separate sitting room furnished with a large writing desk, a 3 seater sofa, a bar corner equipped with Expresso coffee machine, water boiler, full bar kit and a tea table placed on top of a massive stone for making tea. The Corner Suite was embedded in floor to ceiling window walls so the room had great view. Looking out from the room the view of the Osaka city, the riverbank and skyline was amazing particularly at sunset time. The elegantly designed bathroom had a spacious walk-in rain shower cabin which also had an island full sized bathtub and a separate toilet room. The bathroom was well stocked with high quality toiletry and amenity kit.  The Club Lounge is located at 38/F. It has a nice and comfortable ambience. With much regret we were out of Hotel most of time so we only had time to enjoy the evening cocktail which had buffet of good assortment of cheeses, nuts, cakes, snacks. Hot canapés were served to our table. The extensive drinks list included champagne and a good selection of wines. All the staffs working at IC Osaka were great; they are professional, courteous and attentive to the small details. We received exceptional good services at the Club Lounge, the restaurant, the bar and the Luggage Room. We also received great services from Ms. Huang and Anna at the Front Desk.  I would like to express my sincere gratitude to the dedicated concierge team Machi Kimura and Yukari Imai who helped me plan for our trip to Kyoto and arrange tickets for the Sagano Romantic Train few months before we arrived in Osaka. They also took the extra efforts to exchange the train tickets to a more suitable time slot. Without their in-depth knowledge, professional services and attentive attitude it was impossible for us to accomplish such an enjoyable trip in Kyoto and Osaka. Such professionalism coupled with services oriented and customer-mania companywide management philosophy are indeed make InterContinental Osaka so special and outstanding. No wonder it is rated the best hotel in Osaka in the past years. When we return to Osaka in the future I could not imagine staying anywhere else.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was our second stay this year at this property and it is our absolute go-to hotel whenever in Osaka.The room upgrade is duly given and appreciated, with lovely views of the Yodo River. We must say that their rooms are comfortable, spacious (quite the luxury in Japan) and comes fitted with amazing bathrooms (love the dual, strong showers!).The buffet breakfast has a wonderful spread and if you're fortunate enough to get window seats, breakfast with a view.Jerome (Director of Rooms & Guest Experience) certainly embodies his job title to a tee! My husband and I always come away from a chat with him feeling like valued guests. This time, we engaged with the Concierge team for recommendations for Sake Breweries and Teppanyaki recommendations and the above and beyond Chief Concierge, Asako, wow-ed us with her customised recommendations.Thanks to all here for another fantastic stay and we look forward to our next visit to Osaka!
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We walked in and one of our delegates said it smells posh. It was posh. Wish we could have spent more time there just to enjoy the beautiful rooms and view. Apparently the gym is amazing as well but I didn't have time to see it.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have chosen InterContinental Osaka for celebration of our 20y anniversary. The hotel is absolutely stunning and the service is amazing. Every single staff was friendly and helpful. Club room design is very inspiring, fresh and modern.We fell in love with room view and the honey - lemon bonbons that we were getting for turn down service!
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has been renewed shortly which made us feel like being in a very new hotel! The atmosphere was very nice, room sizes are good & entrance to the metro station!The location is very nice where you huge metro station with many shops nearby.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is absolutely one the of the best places to stay in Osaka. The rooms are exceedingly large. About 45 sq. m. Service is top notch. The location is great too. Hotel is connected to Grand Front Osaka and a 5 minute work leads you to Osaka station. The rooms are just beautiful. Ask for the river view. The concierge is outstanding and always ready to meet any requests. Located in a nice quiet area. We had an opportunity to stay in two different rooms. One facing the office buildings and another facing the river which was nicer.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a deluxe twin room and added an extra bed for my son. The room was still roomy and spacious, unlike most hotel rooms in Japan. Service was excellent! The concierge recommended different restaurants based on my preference even prior to my arrival, and made the bookings for me. The hotel also arranged for "car" pick up from New Hankyu Hotel (Kansai airport bus' first stop) to the hotel so we didn't have to haul luggages across streets, and up and down escalators. They also arranged the same service when we left. There is a Jap bath house at the hotel which you can use to get a flavor of Jap bath. The hotel made our Osaka stay very comfortable and easy. Location is convenient, within close walking distance (8m) to Osaka station, Umeda station. Lots of shopping, restaurants around the area. One would be happily entertained just staying in this area. Would definitely stay at the hotel again if I visit Osaka.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: location 5/5staff 5/5facilities 5/5cleanliness 5/5room amenities 5/5top facilties and service comes at a price commensurate with luxury hotel, 5 to 10 minutes walk to Osaka station / Omeda station / Airport limo stop
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: InterContinental is more often than not my go-to hotel chain; their properties strike just the right balance between luxury and practicality. For our visit to Kyoto I had chosen to stay at the nearest InterContinental in Osaka, which although still reassuringly priced, was not quite as eye-wateringly expensive as the five-star properties in Kyoto itself. Staying at the IC also offered an excellent opportunity to use my yearly Ambassador complimentary weekend night certificate. Located in the Grand Front Osaka complex, the InterContinental was opened in 2013 and occupies the top floors of the third tower in a series of four. We arrived by taxi from Shin-Osaka Station, not to be confused with Osaka Station which is conveniently within the same complex as the IC and serves as the departure point for regular trains to Kyoto. We were warmly welcomed at the ground floor lobby where bags were taken quicker than I could say ‘don’t worry’ and we were escorted to the 20th floor main lobby and reception. A few taps on the keyboard had us being escorted up another eight floors to the Club InterContinental lounge, where we were invited to take a seat and enjoy afternoon tea whilst check-in formalities were completed. This was a pretty seamless welcome, although could’ve been improved by avoiding the stop at the main reception. The Club lounge is a relatively small simple rectangle, with a dining area directly behind reception, bar and buffet to the right and lounge seating beyond. A meeting room is available adjacent to the dining area. Towards the rear of the lounge and adjacent to the TV area, a small library provides a focal point to the otherwise somewhat bland design. Large picture windows provide a view across the Yodo river towards Itami Airport in the distance. Whilst it’s a comfortable space, the ambience was more upscale airport lounge than some other Club InterContinental lounges offer, an impression augmented by the regimented arrangement of seating and rather odd choice of at times loud background music. One of the washrooms within the lounge housed a shower, a useful feature for those arriving early in the morning with no room yet available. Afternoon tea was an entirely waiter-led affair and consisted of a good range of daily changing sandwiches, sweet and savoury pastries, all presented neatly and with the thoughtful addition of cold towels. Declining the offer of an escort, we headed around the corridor to our spacious Club InterContinental room. Whilst not a suite, the 50 square metres of space was more than adequate for a four-night stay, and offered sweeping views of Osaka, a skyline that is generally more pleasing the higher you look. The Umeda Sky Building is particularly ugly. Decorated in much the same style as the rest of the property, the only oddity was the lump of rock in the middle of the room, atop of which sat a Japanese tea set (with accompanying sweets replaced daily) and within which were the drawers for the adjacent desk. Certainly a unique feature, if not a little out of place. This sort of custom design was evident throughout the room, and certainly added to the practical yet stylish nature of the layout. For such a modern hotel (complete with the usual James Bond-style control panels for lighting and window coverings), the lack of any USB ports in the room is unforgiveable, although power sockets were thankfully plentiful. To the left of the entryway, a modest walk-in closet housed most of the usual hotel paraphernalia, with the exception of a portable suitcase stand but with the addition of kimonos.Built into the side of the closet facing the room, a glass-fronted cabinet housed the minibar and Nespresso coffee machine. The was no Ambassador mineral water beyond the usual complimentary IC-branded bottles; I often find that properties skimp on this benefit, although I assume a branded bottle would be available if requested. The Ambassador fruit plate was waiting on the ledge adjacent to the TV, whilst an assortment of sweets and snacks were placed on the desk; I have no idea what these were as I couldn’t get past the eccentric packaging. As far as furnishings went, the single armchair (or should that be lounge chair, given it lacked any arms?), although in keeping with the interior design, did not offer much in the way of comfort; call me old fashioned but I’d have liked two proper armchairs with a table between them. The juxtaposition of the sprung wooden floor alongside the inlaid carpet was a swish design element. The marble-clad bathroom was the room’s strongest feature; a huge walk-in rain shower (in the same wet room as the free-standing bath) offered the same amount of force as I was hoping not to feel from an earthquake. The usual Agraria amenities were available in abundance, and a separate room to the side housed the obligatory Toto.Breakfast each morning was taken in the Club lounge and featured an extensive à la carte selection of both Japanese and Western options, along with a moderately sized but well-provisioned buffet. I found the size of the dining tables to be a bit skimpy, although it was generally better to eat in the dining area than at one of the tables in the lounge area; the bucket seats there (with round cushions) were impractically low and downright uncomfortable. Practicalities aside, the breakfast was of a very good quality, and the accompanying service was professional without being overly deferential. The lounge looked its best in the evening, when another buffet of fruit, cheeses, cold canapés, breads, savoury and sweet snacks was complemented by a rotating selection of hot canapés delivered table-side. The extensive drinks list included the pleasant Louis Roederer Brut Premier champagne.When it came time to check-out, all formalities were taken care of in the Club lounge. To ensure complete symmetry of the check-in and check-out experiences, we were reluctantly forced to indulge in afternoon tea just one final time before heading downstairs to a taxi to Itami Airport. InterContinental Osaka represented a solid choice as a base for exploring Kyoto, given its location just 30 minutes from the city via the JR Kyoto Line’s Special Rapid Train from Osaka Station. Whilst the property’s design is not necessarily to my personal taste, and the obligatory two lift journeys to reach the room a multi-use tower block necessitates gets wearisome, the overall experience was as comfortable as you could wish for.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Shen at the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful w a late night checkin when we were fairly grumpy. Hotel is directly linked to a mall with restaurants open until 4am most days, which was great. Covered / underground access to Osaka’s main train station pretty much made this perfect in terms of convenience.We booked a residence which is on the top floors of the hotel w fully equipped kitchen and an extremely large by Japanese standards apartment w dining & living room. Very pleased w our stay and will be our top choice coming back to Osaka.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my third time staying in this best Hotel. The front office, concierge and also the bell service all giving the best ever service to us. Pay high attention to our needs and help us lots. Highly recommended hotel. Thanks to the hotel team.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Because of the rate, I expected it's an amazing hotel.Compare to Conrad Osaka(nearly same charge), I should say it's not worth that. Room is not big, looks not new. Corridor is narrow. No benefit for platinum member.Location is good, connect to station directly.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka

review_body: We stayed 4 nights with our kids everything was great the rooms, the food, the service all over, the concierge service had great tips we enjoyed it and defentlt reccomended, the rooms were excellent we will come back for sure
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights after a very long flight to Japan.To put simply - this hotel ruined me for other hotels !The service is amazing, the breakfast is delicious.The rooms are spacious and super clean.I can't fault this place...it's amazing.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved our stay here. Treated us with absolute respect and generosity. Beautiful accommodations. The gym and the onsen were large and spacious. Found some real peace there. Central location and easy to get to everything we wanted. Staff was most helpful and kind. No complaints whatsoever.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in Osaka Japan and first time in this hotel chain Impressive lovely hotel very friendly staff first class. I normally go for smaller hotel but this is very good and highly recommended Japan and this hotel
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a business conference in September. Could not ask for a better experience. Staff were exeplerary and the room was good but the interior lighting was poor.The swimming pool was OK and well maintained.Our conference facility was well set up and the catering support was excellent.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent a terrific 6 nights at the hotel with my wife - was intended to only be a 4 night stay, however, Typhoon Jebi has other ideas! Fortunately, the Intercon took it in its stride and we were able to ride out the storm in this wonderful hotel.Our room was a beautiful Club corner suite which had great views, was beautifully peaceful and totally immaculate every day thanks to Housekeeping.The staff in he club looked after us really well every day, and particular mention to Edwin who went the extra mile on a couple of occasions printing off information on sightseeing in Osaka and Kyoto as well as details on how to get to Nagoya when our return flight got changed from Kansai airport.During our stay the food was ideal, and I would definitely encourage people to make use of the club facilities if you can.We will be back to see more of Osaka and Kyoto and definitely will stay here - hopefully no typhoon next time.Our thoughts go out to everyone who was affected by it and the earthquake in Hokkaido.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel!Because this is only one hotel have the residence!!And the location is wonderful!Every staff is friendly!!The gym and pool is fantastic,I never find a professional gym and pool in Japan hotel.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the train station, you walk through a shopping mall and at the end is the elevator that takes you up the Intercontinental Hotel. Once, the elevator door opens, we were greeted by the receptionist. As we got to our room, we were amazed at how big the room was, with a separate tub, bath and toilet. I had a desk for office work if I needed to, with tea and coffee on hand on a rock pedestal. Just be careful not to trip on it. The windows shades are run by motors. Each day we had candy in our pillows. A very pleasant stay. Chcck out the pictures
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first time staying at an Intercontinental property and I was absolutely amazed by the level of service and facilities of the hotel.I luckily got a room facing the river from which you can enjoy beautiful sunsets over the city. The room itself was very spacious for Japanese standards and had a number of lovely minor highlights, like a Japanese tea set, selected premium TWG teas and a nighttime surprise. If you have a room on the Club floor you can access the Club Lounge, which offers breakfast (delicious Eggs Benedict!!), afternoon tea (including freshly cut Spanish ham) and evening cocktails and canapé in a nice and quiet ambience. The club lounge team was also kind enough to let me use the board room for free for a conference call.If you want to use the recreation facilities such as the Japanese bath, swimming pool or fully equipped gym, there is a qualified trainer available to assist you. Although I didn't make use of this I found his politeness a very nice gesture.Overall I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be back upon my next visit in Osaka.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I always stay here when I visit Osaka. 5 min from Osaka station, close to everything. The room design is pretty modern, you feel comfortable surrounded by furniture made of stone, wood and glass. The bar is nice but sometimes very crowded, the main restaurant has a room for improvement, just expensive. The spa and pool is not crowded and nice but the accessibility from rooms is not ideal
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Intercontinental was the best part of our visit to Osaka. Located within walking distance from Osaka Station, inside a new mall, the IC has great views of the city, and understated luxury throughout. I really enjoyed the art throughout the building, and the wonderful rainforest shower. As was the case throughout Japan, this hotel went above and beyond recognizing our mid-level IHG status, and upgraded us to a corner room. The layout was grand and spacious, especially for a non-suite.Osaka itself fell short of expectations, but if I am ever in the city again, I would definitely stay here.
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm so haply I chose to stay in this excellent hotel ,we were 3 poeple in a regular room, 25 floor.We stayed for 5 nights . The level of the regular rooms is top! Great view, BIG SURFACE ,great bed, great bathroom with all amenities ,room service excellent,the hotel itself is beautifully designed and well located just near Osaka station and the big mall called Grand front. Around are several department stores ,many restsurants etc.. the hotel staff is amazing ,the concierge team and customer relations as well advised us what to do in Osaka ,even by email few weeks before arrival. In the hotel i noticed especially Miyuki who helped us so nicely to book some activity in Osaka. !! All the hotel team are amazing and this hotel is recommended as the best in Osaka!
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 5 stars, literally. Beautifully spacious, located next to the big Grand Front Osaka mall, not far from the Osaka Station. The bed is very comfortable, bathroom is fully equipped, and the rest of the room spells luxury. I wish i have spent more time in the hotelBonus: Complimentary mochi and tea provided was super nice There're also bicycle that you can reserve to use to travel around the city, provided by the hotel. Overall, a world class hotel with world class hospitality.Restaurant at ground floor is also very nice. Was told it's a Michelin star restaurant. Beware, it is pricey. I think it costs us more than $350 for two
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a great location (very close to Osaka station) and is exactly what you want from a 5* hotel. The stunning views from the reception and bar areas really compliment the friendly and warm service received here. The rooms are a very good size and thoughtfully designed with space carefully used to ensure discreet storage and functionality, without compromising on style. I always have a busy work schedule so coming back to a relaxing and quiet room was exactly what was needed. Room service is fast, of a good quality and always beautifully presented. Highly recommend this hotel for visitors to Osaka!
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was so happy to stay in InterContinental Osaka again. When I arrived at the Limousine bus station & I was greeted by their hotel staff. They were so efficient & arrived on time at the limousine bus station. The baggage staff was so friendly & greeted me. After a 5 mins taxi rides, I arrived the hotel & their front desk lady Miss Chen was so sweet & very helpful. As I arrived very late & she told me where to eat. Very detail & informative. I was staying there for 6 nights. Their room is big, nice room amenities & room was clean & tidy. During my stay in Osaka, there was a heavy rain storm & all shops were suddenly close. I was so worried about my flight delay. Their front desk staff were so patient to answer my question. Especially the Guest Relations Manager Ganiell, he was very kind & he left me a message about the weather situation in the morning & I was appreciated. Lastly the check out was fast & smooth. My luggages & departure car were managed well by their baggage team. InterContinental Osaka is the best hotel in Japan. I will highly recommend this hotel to everyone
hotelName:
28    Intercontinental Hotel Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I book the Westin I expect Starbucks in the room. Not only is there no Starbucks in the room there no Starbucks in the Hotel. Closest Starbucks is 25 minutes away. Which leads me to point out that everything is min 25 minutes away by shuttle or by walking. The coffee in the room is so bad I wouldn't give to my worst enemy. I keep reading how great the location is... sorry it's not... and next to means a couple blocks away not 25 minutes. Overall disappointed in location and the one of the things I really look forward to staying at a Westin. The other issue was a trainee was checking us in at the front desk. It took beyond forever to just give us two room keys. It was painful to watch... almost as bad as walking 25 minutes to starbucks.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We took a red eye flight and was dying to take a nap before exploring the city. The front desk was able to upgrade us to a high floor and let us have the room at 11am. The gesture was very much appreciated! The concierge was also very patient with my multiple requests (and changes) on restaurant reservations. The rooms are very large (for japan standards) and we had a great view of the city. Housekeeping was spotless. Limited english channels on TV but that was not a problem with me as I could easily connect to netflix with the hotel internet. Although the hotel was slightly further away from the train station, there are frequent shuttle buses available. As the weather in May was excellent, we didn't mind taking a walk as well. We will definitely stay here again the next time in Osaka. Thanks so much for your hospitality!
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located a 15 min walk from Osaka & Umeda stations & also provides a free shuttle that leaves at regular intervals (timetable us clearly posted in the lobby & as with Japanese precision leaves on the dot as advertised). Check in was fast, efficient & we warmly greeted & allocated our rooms on Club floors in quick time (as Platinum members which comes with a range of privileges including use of club lounge, pool & health club facilities). The rooms are huge by Japanese standards & the bathrooms are luxurious & well appointed (with the requisite amazing auto toilet seat that does everything for you!) Overall decor is a little dated but still modern & streamlined in accordance to Japanese sensibilities. The Westin heavenly bed is super comfortable & the luxury high thread cotton sheets are luxurious. The “sleep help” consisting of a small roll on bottle of lavender oil placed next to the bed is a nice touch. The executive lounge is small but adequate & the food offerings are also sufficient & regularly topped up. Breakfast is ok (the main cafe in lobby level serves a much wider variety but the lounge is quieter & exclusive). Afternoon tea is a delight - served individually consisting of a range of mini cakes & petit fours. Evening cocktails are also ok - a small variety of tidbits to have with pre-dinner drinks. They serve Jacquard champagne as well as a nice range of Japanese sake & plum wines. The pool & health club was excellent. Japanese style bathing facilities with a hot soak pool (segregated in the male/female change rooms) & very good sauna. The gym though small had sufficient equipment for a thorough workout. The outstanding part of this hotel is their service. Every staff member we came across were warm, friendly & genuinely keen to help. This was consistent throughout the hotel so kudos to the management for this. We stayed 3 nights & thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I would highly recommend this hotel - I realized past reviews commented about smoking room issues etc but I honestly did not notice any excessive smoke smells or even anyone smoking! Look forward to returning to this hotel when we visit Osaka again.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked a room online and requested for a baby crib. When we arrived, they told us that we have a smoking room! My sister who also has a baby, called to book her room and also requested for a crib - still she was given a smoking room. Hotel was fully booked so we couldn't switch rooms. Ended up having to go to a different hotel and wasted our entire first day. What's worse is that the Westin staff actually tried to convince me to take the smoking rooms with two babies. Their only explanation was that their website didnt give people to select smoking or non smoking...clearly they did not read my special request and used common sense.Oh ya and they also charge to use their gym and pools...even though we're paying $500 per night.Not impressed.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Westin Osaka is an elegant, hotel offering traditional Japanese hospitality. The staff are wonderful, polite, organised, efficient and very helpful. Some rooms on the lower floors do not have an in-room safe; The bedrooms and bathrooms are spotless. The hotel shuttle bus service to JR Osaka station is efficient. The buffet breakfast iis plentiful,a wide selection available.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a family trip to Japan with the first leg beginning in Osaka to tour the sights of Osaka, Kyoto, and Nara. We booked out stay through our credit card's points for 4 nights. The hotel itself is near the Osaka Station but it still is about a 10-15 minute walk to get there (through a tunnel and then a large shopping center with good food options). If you have a good amount of luggage as international travelers often do, then it could be hard to lug the bags over since there aren't that many ramps around.The hotel itself is a little bit of a throwback design wise and the rooms are a bit tired and in need of a facelift. The rooms are non-smoking, but there's always a hint of smoke in the air in this hotel.Perhaps the most unexpected part of the stay is that KIDS UNDER 18YO ARE NOT ALLOWED IN THE POOL. This is a tough one because it is neither on the US Westin website profile nor was it on the Chase Rewards Portal. It just says that there is an indoor pool and fitness center. Furthermore, if you are not Bonvoy Gold, then there is a steep charge. It should be mandatory that these details are spelled out since they are well out of the norm of other Westin (Marriott) properties. We talked with the manager Mr. Bito, who was apologetic but inflexible.The sights in and around Kyoto require a bit of walking and hiking which is great, but it would be nice to be able to take a dip. As a hotel and chain that is billed as "family friendly," we found that not to be the case. We would NOT have stayed here had we known that this was going to be their policy.So in the end, we would have found one with a pool free and accessible to children, and one that is closer to the station. Perhaps next time we will give the Intercontinental a try.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I spent 3 nights at the Westin. We very generously received an upgrade to a 2 room suite with beautiful views. The bathrooms and bed were top notch. The hotel is a quick easy walk from station. We enjoyed the lounge very much. Everyone is no nice and professional. Definitely recommend!
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Compared to the other Westin hotels, The Westin Osaka facilities and ambience is one of the best; but more importantly, the quality of service and hospitality of the staffs is not comparable to other hotels. Eventhough to some extent it is due to Japanese culture, compared to other hotels where we stayed in Tokyo and Kyoto, The Westin Hotel Osaka's quality of service is still the best.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Westin is located a bit off from the Osaka Station. Luckily, the 10+ minutes walk to the Station was not too bad and guests could also take advantage of the hotel’s complimentary shuttle transfers. Interior decor of the hotel was conventional. Our room was really big with a large bathroom. Everything looked clean though room furnishings and fixtures needed updating. Hotel staff were extremely polite and helpful, in the good old Japanese way, which is very nice. We are seeing less and less of this kind of traditional Japanese service attitudes in the newer urban hotels.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are the family with two adults and a 9 year old boy. We were upgraded to a super spacious room with a super king bed and separated living area, including free breakfast. Surprise! Although it is a smoking room, the staff refreshed it eventually. We may not feel any special flavor. The night view is perfect. And beautiful green surrounds here. You may enjoy the peace and happiness in the center of Osaka.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just finished a week trip to Osaka and I chose to stay at Westin Hotel Osaka. The hotel was conveniently located at Kita near JR Osaka Station and there was a shuttle bus service between JR Osaka Station and the hotel. It could be reached on foot by just a five-minute walk from Grand Front Osaka, which was adjacent to JR Osaka Station and Daimaru, if you missed the shuttle bus or after 10pm when the shuttle bus service was over. Though the hotel was 25 years old already, the upkeep was satisfactorily maintained. The room I stayed was Deluxe King and it was quite spacious compared to other local Japanese-branded hotels. The service was good and sufficient to our needs. The staff at front desk, concierge and service express were all very nice and courteous. Especially the concierge staff was extremely helpful in handling my request for the reservation at a restaurant nearby. The service express staff also handled well to our two parcels being sent to the hotel. My kid expressed that Westin Hotel Osaka was a good hotel to stay and we should stay there again next time we visit Osaka. This is also our intention. It’s worth to know that there is an airport limousine bus stop in front of the hotel entrance, which is good and convenient to those who have a number of luggages like us. There was a drawback that came to my astonishment was the use of swimming pool, which was not complimentary to the hotel guests.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Asked for a connecting room. Was told they will try but they managed to secure us one. Room spacious and clean. Separate shower and bath tub. The hotel is old but it is well maintained. I don't think it looked tired at all. Beds are heavenly. Kids loved it. It is 10 minutes from the station but there is a regular shuttle that helps you get there if you have luggage. Service was great. Breakfast was nice and a mix of eastern and Western food. Highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great business hotel, superb location, friendly staff, fabulous lounge:BUT: Seriously end the nonsense of no mobile phone talk in the club lounge; The background noise of setting the wooden table, opening the champagne corks and the normal chit chat of guests is equal loud if not louder. I personally really enjoy a relaxed and quiet environment but not being able to take a phone call on a headset in a business hotel in business lounge really beyond any comment.Currently in-house Marriott Platinum Ambassador Guest..
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a Starwood (now Marriott Bonvoy) gold member, I was able to book a six night stay on points and was upgraded to a room on a high floor with a nice view. The hotel is a bit dated, but service was top notch from start to end.Room: 4/5 (decent size room for family of four)Location: 3/5 (not near a subway line, but hotel has a punctual shuttle to/from Osaka station which is approximately 8 minutes away or 15-20 minute walk to Osaka station, 7-11 across the street)Beds: 4/5 (our room had two double beds and the hotel provided a rollaway bed at no charge for my older son, beds were comfortable)Bathroom: 4/5 (large separate room with double sinks and seat, bathtub, shower with good water pressure)In-room amenities: 4/5 (mini-bar supplied with complimentary bottles of water daily, kettle, in-room safe, bath robes, hotel pyjamas)Hotel amenities: 4/5 (excellent gym and pool area that is complimentary for gold members or higher, no laundry facilities)Service: 5/5 (lots of staff, there is always a greeter, and staff seem to go out of their way to be helpful and friendly)TIP: If you are visiting other cities in Japan, consider using a luggage delivery service which will deliver your luggage to your next destination the following day and costs approximately US$20 per luggage bag (the concierge can help with this).
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travelled to Osaka in early February 2019 and booked The Westin Osaka for two nights, separated by a stay in a hot spring hotel an hour away from the city. On arrival at The Westin Osaka for our first stay, we were upgraded to a high-floor (22/F) room with an unbelievable view of the Sky Building. We were so excited and grateful for the upgrade—a lovely room that was both spacious and well maintained. While the hotel is not far from the Osaka Station (about an easy 10-minute walk), we liked that it offered free shuttle bus service at 15-min intervals, which was really convenient. Upon checking out, we stored our luggage there, for our return a day later. Overall, we were impressed by the friendly service.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Westin Hotel is only few minutes walks from the Main Train Station of Osaka and from the Shopping Area as well. The Hotel is really well organize clean and all Staff are extremely very professional.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A fantastic place to stay i would gladly stay here again.The only criticism i have is the hot selection at breakfast was only warm at best and the tea and coffee were only very warm and not hot.Check in was a simple and quick.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay for just one night and we weren’t disappointed. Great staff, great beds and a great place to stay if you want to be near of a JR station on Osaka city. I’ll recomend to stay there if you have the opportunity!
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located v close to Osaka station (1 km), good rooms, good service. Decent gym and pool with sauna. Stayed here for business 3 nights and definitely recommend. The pool is indoor and heated for the winters so is very comfortable. The hot tub is relaxing too. Overall great stay.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here twice on our 13 day visit to Osaka, Kinosakionsen, Kobe, Hiroshima and back to Osaka before returning home. Although the hotel is away from the city commercial center, it is convenient by shuttle bus to Osaka Station and by taxi everywhere else.We were quite impressed by the attentive staff and genuine hospitality demonstrated by everyone. Congratulations to management on an excellent training program.In particular, one of the Concierge staff, went out of her way to help us with dinner reservations at several restaurants -- printing out specific directions and pictures of how to get to the restaurants for the cab drivers. We appreciated her kindness and help.The Club Lounge is excellent, the gym and pool are modern and clean, the breakfast buffet provided a good variety of selections and the Blue Bar was a great place to end the evening with scotch and cigars. Our party of four adults definitely would want to come back and enjoy this property as our base again and again. Westin gets it right with this property!
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As others have said, the hotel is very exact. Everything by the rules, and no adjustments. As long as there are no deviations from the standard, it was nice for a two night stay. The hotel is a little out of the way, depending on what you want to do, and I would have preferred a location on the other side, closer to Osaka station. The best part for us was eating dinner in the hotel at Hanano. We had sukiyaki, and our server was wonderful and attentive the entire time. It was a great final night.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern hotel with all the Westin amenities you would expect. A little out of the way but they do offer a shuttle from the JR station. Breakfast buffet amazing in the lounge restaurant with views of a very nice garden.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a corner room in the Westin Osaka in Dec 2018 for 3 nights. The room was big with basic amenities. The hotel was in a convenient location and close to shopping malls and restaurants. The staff were OK but not particularly warm and helpful to customers. Would recommend the hotel to friends who do not have very high expectations of hotel quality and service.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel in Osaka. My family of 4 stayed at Osaka for 4 days and we decided to try the hotel’s futon style room. The room is very spacious with separate living/dining area and bedroom. The kids (aged 13 and 10) were thrilled with the tatami floors, “chairs with no legs” and mattresses laid out on the floor. Bath includes Japanese style bathtub and the beds are very comfortable and blankets nice and warm. Whilst room is very good, it is starting to be a little dated.Service staff was excellent and very polite. There is a frequent shuttle service to the JR Osaka Umeda train station which is very convenient. There is a good selection of shopping malls at the vicinity of the train station. Just opposite the hotel is a 7-11 - making it easy to get any snacks or drinks. Breakfast could be better - the breakfast spread is quite limited. There is for example only 1 type of sausage, limited selection of cold cuts or cheese and no peanut butter spread or low fat yoghurt.Breakfast aside, we enjoyed our stay at the hotel very much.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Definitely a five plus hotel, outstanding bilingual staff. On a scale of 1-10 the hotel staff is one hundred... YES, they are that good! Hotel has many anemities, including several excellent restaurants, pubs, and bars. Location is great, a few blocks from the largest and best shopping mall in the city. I strongly suggest the morning buffet at the hotel with every food available for one price...hundreds of choices... including my favorite a select your ingredients omelet. By the way, a “very” safe area, very clean and there’s NO TIPPING!
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Free shuttle bus to JR station, located in peaceful area, there is a convenient store just across the street. Staff are friendly & helpful. It is easy to take Shuttle bus to airport, hotel itself has station.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m sure you are aware that space comes at a premium in Japan and when we first got here? Totally blown away by the size of the room. Yes, given that the furniture looks a tad jaded but to us was the cleanliness and comfort of the bed. The view was also spectacular, especially at night. Wished we had a little more time here. We didn’t bother to pay for the breakfast in the hotel, after all; food was easily available everywhere. We will definitely use this hotel again when we are in Osaka. Enjoy!
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good things: room ready with SPG Gold upgrade when I arrived at 11am; shuttle to Osaka Station three times an hour; next to Umeda Sky Building with Kiji serving great okonomiyaki.Bad things: the whole hotel needs a contemporary upgrade. Trapped in an era gone by, decor and facilities were all ancient. They charge for use of a small non-commercial gym without stating upfront on booking. They will waive if you protest as SPG Gold, as it is only free for SPG Platinum.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first time to stay at Westin Osaka, but it has already become my favorite Westin in Japan. The property isn't the most convenient, it takes a bit of walk to go to the station, but the shuttle service is easy and very comfortable. The neighborhood of the hotel is nice and quiet, a couple of convenient stores nearby. The rooms we had was on the higher floor with a great view of the area and a bit of river view. Beds were the best we had on the whole trip, typical Westin beds. The bathroom was big, separate shower and a big bathtub. The best asset of the hotel must be the staff, bell service, front desk, everyone is polite and professional. Huge thank you to Mr. Nishikawa at the concierge desk. He did whatever he could to help us to solve our problems, like booking a local beauty salon (no one spoke in English) for my wife and fruit farm for my kids to pick fruits. There was a strong typhoon coming to Japan, and we were going to drive to other prefectures after checking out. Mr. Nishikawa provided so much information on the weather condition so we could plan our drive, and he helped us to call the upcoming accommodations to confirm our stays during the typhoon. The duty Manager Mr. Nagasuna was very kind and warm to us, he made our stay a great one.It was a great stay, and Westin hotel is one of the reasons for us to return to Osaka
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Westin is one of the nicer ones I have been to. Rooms are generous. Fairly close to the Osaka central train station. Good shopping near the hotel. Only negative is you need to pay attention to where the shuttle bus picks up. Osaka station is massive and phone navigation tricky when there are multiple layers of floors and sidewalks.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect in every way. Concierge, front desk, service, and of course the "Heavenly Bed".A great deal at only ¥20,000.Frequent shuttle to the center. Just wonderful staff and structure. Would definitely stay there again. NPS = 10!
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we got to our room, the extra bed was already been setup. The young man who carried our luggage to the room introduced how everything works in our room. Hotel employees, including the shuttle bus driver, were polite and helpful. Executive lounge is small but cozy and offers nice view of the city.. Breakfast at the lobby has good choices of Japanese and western food. We are very satisfied overall.We walked to Osaka station (not Shin-Osaka station) from the hotel a couple of times. It took us about 10-15 minutes.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Getting to the Westin Osaka is a little tricky if you’re coming by Shinkansen. When you arrive into Osaka you will arrive into the Osaka station however you will need to take a local train to the Shin Osaka Station. Once you get to Shin Osaka you will need to find the bus pickup for the hotel, otherwise you can take a taxi for about 1,000 yen ($10 USD). The station is huge and a little tricky to find the bus. The hotel itself is nice, nothing amazing but very well kept, the rooms are a little outdated but in very good condition. The beds are very comfortable, AC works good, great water pressure and of course hot water. There is not much activity near the hotel so if you are looking for action, stay closer to Namba. The trade-off is the Westin has larger size rooms since it’s off the beaten path a little. The hotel staff is very nice and helpful.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and i spent 6 nights in The Westin Osaka during the summer from 25 July to 31 July 2018. It was our wedding anniversary and my husband had arranged with the hotel to surprise me by decking out our room with 100 balloons and a bouquet of flowers. The room we booked was not the refurbished one, but it was still clean and big with a very comfortable bed and great amenities. The only downside to the hotel is the walk to the train station and the fact that there is only one airport shuttle a day that goes straight to the hotel. In the hot and humid summer Japan, the walk is simply unpleasant. However, you can always catch the airport shuttle which comes every 15mins. The hotel bar is smaller and less entertaining compared to The Hilton which is my de facto hotel in Osaka, but for the bigger room, i will stay in The westin again.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room size is average for Westin hotel, but it should be considered large by Japanese standard. And the room was clean. The hotel staff was friendly. But the room rate was on the high side for what you get.The location is close or next to Umeda Sky building, so it was convenient for me. But it was away from city center, away from central station for subway or train. So the location may be good or bad, depending on your taste. It is quiet and a bit isolated.There is a 7-11 store across the street from the hotel.Restaurant: The hotel has restaurants, but the prices are too high ($ 40 at least, and up in most cases). Although the prices are high, it did not taste all that great. Fortunately, there a food court at Umeda Sky building (B1 floor), and the food prices are cheap and the quality is acceptable. The problem was that there was no place to eat for breakfast, since the food court in Umeda building is not open for breakfast. You can eat at the hotel - breakfast buffet (the only choice). But it was about $38 for the breakfast. It was too expensive for me for breakfast, as I usually eat light breakfast. The hotel should provide breakfast to hotel guests at reasonable price. The hotel seems only to care about making money from people. If you don't want to pay $38 per person, where do the family have breakfast?
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed in The Westin Osaka with my families for almost a week. We stayed at the Japanese suite which is best stay we have in Japan. Not only it's roomy but also the experience made kids so exciting. Good fit for a family of 5 and still provide spaces for socializing.Great service and great location (free shuttle to/from Osaka station in every 15 mins). Mr. Nagasuna (hotel manager) is very friendly and provided us all supports required. He even arranged a birthday cake for my wife and kid during their birthday :)We love the hotel and would definitely stay again if back in Osaka.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was the best of all the hotels I stayed in while in Japan. The staff are amazing and go out of their way to help you! (I even got an extra bed for my daughter as we were not keen to share!) We ordered room service and it was the BEST meal I had eaten my whole time in Japan! Superb! The hotel is modern and has everything you need. It is a short 15 minute walk to the shopping area. I wish I could have stayed longer!
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Westin Osaka is a nice hotel well collated in Osaka.The staff is nice and hospitable.The only remarks is relative to the food - nothing special was noted - there is an attempt to serve Italian cuisine at a relatively expensive price but the taste is just not there perhaps because of the products.Last the tv stations available in foreign languages is even lesser than Tokyo - in this day and age it is not normal.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First up - finally,a hotel that does have demarcated bathroom space and no see-through private areas! It may be a personal peeve, but I just don't get this 'modern' concept and it was a relief to find a 'normal' room. The hotel is big, part of the Umeda Sky building complex, walking distance from the JR Umeda station and shopping. Very good service overall, though paying for gym facilities when you are a hotel gues just beats me. The one thing that hugely disappointed was the Chinese restaurant that was cited as a 1 Michelin Star... another review of that!I'd pick this hotel again.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights and we love how big the room was. As the location was 15 minutes walking distances from Osaka Station they provide free shuttle bus to and from the hotel. The private garden was really nice.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location: Within the vicinity of Osaka/Umeda Station area, but comfortable walking takes about 10 minutes at least. Shuttle buses are available at scheduled times and very efficient. Taxi is easily available, and two convenience stores (7-Eleven and Lawson) are nearby. Room: Comfortable for two people, but added an extra bed for another adult and it becomes rather tight. Given top-most floor due to my SPG Platinum status. No room upgrade to a bigger room or suite this time. Amenities were topped up generously. Quality of bed and pillow is as per standard.Service: Excellent! front desk was efficient, concierge was accommodating, and service staffs were faultless. This is one area where everyone seems to excel at.Meal: This is where Westin Osaka definitely fail to live up to its name. For 4 straight days, no change in menu. Selection was poor, but taste is decent. I had better breakfast selection at Sheraton Miyako Osaka, and Westin is supposedly a superior brand than Sheraton. Very disappointing
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at The Westin Osaka for a couple of nights during April and overall, it was a nice short stay.Location is good, about 10min walk to Osaka station or 7-8min via Shuttle bus (takes the long route).One thing I really like about this hotel is its structural design, the lobby, rooms, even room keys all have a classical and contrasting tone to it, which really suited me.Check in was easy and we were upgraded to a Luxury Room. This was a decent sized room (45sqm) with fantastic night views of Osaka. Compared to Hilton Osaka across the road which we stayed the week before, the room was only half the size... (90sqm+ at Hilton)The lobby staff was very friendly, took our luggage up to our room and showed us where everything was.As a gold member, I was only entitled to a one category room upgrade, without any other entitlements so there isn't much else worthy to comment on. Hopefully, as a Platinum member now, I can enjoy more benefits staying at The Westin in the future.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our first time in Japan & our first 2 nights in Osaka. This hotel has set a high standard! The room was large. The beds (twin) extremely comfortable. I mistakenly booked a smoking room but the staff advised they had done what they could to remove the smell & they did a great job. My mistake wasn’t so bad! The bathroom was large with a nice selection of complimentary items. Breakfast was great. The staff here were wonderful & attentive. The breakfast selection had a good choice of Japanese & western cuisine. We arrived at Umeda station & missed the last shuttle bus (22.00) to the hotel so had to walk. Following the instructions sent to us from the hotel it was an easy walk in the dark with large suitcases (approx 10 mins). We had to catch the shuttle bus back to the station on our last day due to rain & it was a longer journey. Great stay & highly recommended!
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Westin Osaka is a Western style hotel located in Japan. Being a loyalty member of SPG, I was able to get an upgrade to the corner suite. The lounge provides high quality foods and beverages. Besides, it was served instead of buffet style.Overall it was a wonderful stay. Special thanks to Miss Eri for the communication before my stay. I am sorry for the late review. I would give the hotel 100 marks and look forward to my next visit.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a ton of trouble finding an affordable place to stay in Osaka with an SPG/Marriott hotel (I really wanted the Marriott Miyako Osaka but it was completely sold out). However, the Westin Osaka seemed to be a decent option near Osaka station and not too expensive.The hotel has a free shuttle from Osaka station that leaves every 20 - 30 min, and it takes approximately 15 to 20 minutes to get to the hotel (so not quick if you're in a hurry). To walk to the hotel is approximately 10-15 min as well which is difficult to do with luggage. However, the shuttle is never crowded and the personnel are friendly.The hotel is not much to look at from the outside (similar to the Westin Tokyo), but the inside is appointed very well (imagine imperialist regal?). The service was hit or miss - the bellhops were nice and efficient, but the front desk staff was slow and weren't very forthcoming with providing "service" to a 200+ night a year platinum guest. I had three rooms at the property, and it took 15 minutes to get the room keys (this is even after I completed online check-in and actually got to the hotel 4 hours earlier to drop off my bags and let them know I'll be back later). Also, I got to the hotel at 10AM and our rooms weren't ready (we requested early check-in) - not a problem we could hit the town and explore. However, my disable grandparents needed a place to rest and I didn't want them in the crowded and noisy lobby so I asked if they could sit in the executive lounge. It took two calls to different supervisors to let them go up and rest in the lounge (This has never been an issue in the US).The room itself was nicely appointed and comfortably sized. The view isn't half bad, and the bathroom had plenty of room (comparable to a newer Westin in most major US cities). The elevators take you to your room pretty quickly (they even have a small chair to sit on). The club lounge is nice (though dated and small) and the people are very friendly there.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Westin was wonderful. This hotel was very nice. It was in a very convenient location. The restaurant had very good food, and the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms were spacious and the beds were very comfortable.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Older building but good amenities. It has a shuttle service to Osaka station which makes everything more convenient. It’s directly next to the Umeda Sky building which has a great food hall. Only downside is the bed is super hard and uncomfortable. It’s like sleeping on concrete.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Shuttle takes a good 20-30 min to drop to the train station/city area. The reception at train station is difficult to find and also they don’t allow you to leave your bags there or send the bags to hotel which we found a bit annoying. Hotel is nice, no platinum upgrade and limited club. Seems to be the same trend across japan.Average breakfast
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in Westin Osaka for 3 nights and found the hotel very comfortable and efficient. The staff are responsive, attentive, polite and helpful. The Chinese restaurant has very high quality menu and the service staff knows their menu, I was recommended a portion I can realistically consume. The room is impeccably clean and amenities replenish on time. There is a 7-11 Store right beside the hotel entrance driveway. I particularly like the free shuttle to the Osaka train station every 15/30 minutes intervals. I will surely recommend this hotel and will come back,
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A friend and I stayed here for a night in Osaka, and we had lovely time. The room was large and spacious, the bed very comfortable, the hotel stylish and very elegant. The bathroom was excellent, with a lovely large bathtub and shower. The breakfast buffet was varied and nice, although the atmosphere was a little stuffy, and the staff warm and friendly with good English skills. The area around the hotel is a bit of a building site, so the view leaves a lot to be desired, and it's a 10 minute walk to the nearest train station, but these are minor issues. The Executive Lounge was wonderful, fabulous service and range of drinks and snacks. The only real problem I encountered was the WiFi, it took a long time to connect, and when it did it was very slow. Most hostels have better WiFi than this. Other than that, a wonderful stay. Many thanks!
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 5 nightsWe arrived on a bullet train at Shin Osaka and took a taxi for a fairly short ride to the hotel...... with luggage it is best to do this.The hotel runs a frequent (on time) shuttle to the JR Osaka station and without luggage this worked very well for us .... there is a very frequent (every 4 minutes!) train to connect the JR and Shin Osaka stations. This meant that the hotel location was excellent ... we easily went to Nara, Kyoto and HibejiWe had a room on the 14th floor ... not a spectacular view .... BUT one of the quietist rooms I had ever come across. Combine that with the bed and the buckwheat pillow and it meant a really good nights sleep!We included the breakfast buffet with our room - it was very good. We also ate a couple of evenings at the hotel and that was very good too.The front desk, concierge and restaurant staff were wonderful. Thankyou.As well as quiet, the room was large and very clean .... good bathroom too.This was an excellent place to stay.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Currently staying at Westin osaka and its a nice big room for Japanese standards, good views of the city, in close proximity to Osaka station, helpful staff, free shuttle to Osaka station although it's walkable if you do not have much luggage.Bad things and I do not see this changing any time soon by looking at other reviews and their timeline this hotel still has not responded to their shortfalls which are the main one is a massive charge to use the pool approx $21 Usd per use and this is 50% discount only if you have SPG gold status. This is slightly buried on their website and I think Japan should move with times and join the rest of the world although the hotel benefits from having a pool this defeats the purpose of booking when you have to pay additional excessive prices when nowhere else in the world you encounter this. This can only be avoided if booking a club room or being an spg platinum member. Why charge for something that should be included in the room price anyway. Another disbenefit of the hotel is that television is only approximately 32" and there are absolutely no channels in English language or any other language than Japanese. So if you want to relax at night and watch some TV if you are not fluent in Japanese I'd suggest staying somewhere else just like I will next time.And lastly only two free bottles of water per room provided as if it was champagne as well as no usb charging ports or universal power outlets in the room. I hope this changes but I do not think it will be any time soon. Beware
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were nice and the breakfast buffet spread was good too. They have their in house massage Service which was excellent. Highly recommend after a very tiring day, it helps to relax and get a nice sleep. They have their shuttle bus service also to the station, which is really helpful to reach faster.All the staff were also very supportive and helped in providing appropriate information too.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would have no hesitation in recommending or returning to this hotel. Very good hotel with a great location very near JR Osaka station and shopping complex (no shortage of food outlets there). Our room a superior double (40m2) very large by Japanese standard was located on 22nd floor offering amazing views of river and city (could not close curtins at night). All hotel staff encoutered were very helpful, friendly and pleasant to deal with. Amadeus restaurant over looking pond and garden area is a great place for breakfast and offer plenty of choices. Very good way to start a day of shopping or sightseeing. Blue Bar was also very good for after dinner cocktails/drinks and cigar since in Japan you can still do that. The hotel also offers regular free shutle services about every 20mins or so to and from JR Osaka station very handy if arriving in Osaka via this station. Hint on our last day we discovered that you can also walk to station in about 7 to 10mins via covered pedestrian walk ways and under passes.
hotelName:
29    The Westin Osaka
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location...room is adequate....well designed for function and ckean. Nice staff...breakfast is a little weak.. hot food should be hot..not cold...but probably in line for the price...a value driven hotel.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location close to JR Namba with 10 minutes walking distance - be awared on which exit especially if you have more luggages so you don't have to drag too far.Connecting rooms made it more comfort if you stay with family and kids - we stayed at 6 beds connecting rooms - especially with 2 toilets so you don't have to wait for turns.Free breakfast - even it is simple breakfast but helps a lot if you will leave early morning for next destination. It is a eco-friendly hotel with all the recycle bins information and so helpful to follow. Fully recommended to stay again.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great time! Hotel was within walking distance to dotonbori and shops. Staff was so helpful. Breakfast had very good variety of food. Plus the almost whole day free hot and cold drinks!! Highly recommended. Will certainly go back.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we got a 2 connecting rooms so spacious good wifi and the breakfast is good. best hotel for big groups and family. all the usual amenities are available. the staffs are very nice and approachable. our stay is perfect
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel was superb with all the amenities that a traveler would need. Very excellent customer service from the the front desk officers to the restaurant staff and and to those who make up our rooms everyday. Breakfast was good and the all day refreshments (coffee, tea, juice and soda) were a plus. A very big thumbs up sign for the superb location, being a few steps away from the famous Shinsaibashi Shopping Street. A very good vacation indeed, thank you very much to all nice and beautiful people of Karaksa Hotel Osaka Namba...
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you Karaksa for such an amazing experience in Osaka. The staff were so helpful and very friendly. Rooms were clean. Staff helped us a lot with directions and where to visit. They were just great people! We loved everything about this place. Definitely coming back!
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a few nights here while in OsakaPositives + good location, easy to walk to most things + decent sized room for the price+ high power usb sockets for charging Neutral - no wardrobe hanging space although you can borrow something from reception Negative - seriously cheap low quality paper thin towels- faulty laundry machines that claim to automatically dispense detergent. When we brought this to reception attention that our freshly washed clothes did not smell clean, he continued to insist that the dispenser was working only to be proved wrong when he checked the machine. He did not offer a refund for money already spent
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My son and I arrived from the United States today with backpacks and no reservations. We took the bullet train from Tokyo to Osaka. We started walking around the area and were in need of a place to stay. We walked in and were greeted by a lovely staff and they had a room for 2 nights available for us! The price is very reasonable, the room is nice, super clean and cozy. They also provide free breakfast in the morning
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: New clean modern hotel about 3 min walk to Dotonburi. Its located in a side street opposite a bustling takoyaki place. The hotel is one of those new concept minimalist style that caters to millenials: cutting out the frills but focusing on the important stuff. So no closets, bathroom amenities are self-service (pick up in lobby), but very nice big bathroom & shower area, and comfortable beds & pillows. A clothes rack is available on request. Breakfast is simple but surprisingly good. Best part is it has a shuttle bus service to Kansai Airport (not free though).
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is clean and eco friendly and spacious for Japan. The breakfast is not the greatest but it gets you started in the morning. The location is fantastic close to dontonbori and shopping district. There is JR trains within walking distance and the subway. The hotel provides welcome drinks after 2pm which is nice as well. I would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Extremely clean rooms and comfortable beds, excellent breakfast and location. Fantastic location from train stations and very friendly and helpful staff..Will definitely book this hotel when we go back again to Osaka.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A good comfortable stay at Karaksa namba Osaka hotel and especially Thanks and appreciated for the hotel staff Ms.Marques for her proffesional assist to help me handle my defect luggagu before we heading to airport . Highly recommended for this Hotel and good staff and good breakfast .
hotelName:
