30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of 7 stayed in a pair of connections rooms and a triple room. Rooms weresmall with little storage space. But stay was comfortable overall. Friendly staff. Good location. Simple breakfast to a good start every morning.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had wonderful stay at this hotel -close to restaurants, shops and subway station.Breakfast is good and the staffs are very professional, special thanks to Monson.She made us feel at home. Hotel highly recommended.SFO-CA
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very convenient location,Very nice staffVery comfortable roomEverything is excellent!There are so many popular famous food I have a good time here ,I recommend this hotel and I will be back again!
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They do have hanging rack for rental but didn’t expect no wardrobe. The shower Bath is great for elderly- no climbing into bath tub. Location is great and tons of restaurants nearby. Room are typically small as usual in Japan so with room this size and this price - love it. Staff are helpful and nice - extend late check out available at 500yen per room per hour, so I avoided the peak check out time till 1pm. Some guest were wearing hotel pajamas while having a mask on ..... but only bump into them 1 time out of the 6 days during my stay.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:- Conveniently located- Modern hotel- Close to popular Midosuji subway line- Walking distance to shopping at Shinsaibashi and eating at Dotonbori- Walking distance to Namba and Denden Town (Nippombashi) - Spacious room- Comfortable beds- Free afternoon tea/snack service for guests - Large seating area for breakfast- Easy shuttle service to Kansai Airport for just ¥1000 p/person - Very friendly and helpful staff- Many adjoining rooms so good for families or groups travelling togetherCons:- None! We love this hotel and will definitely stay again!
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Karaksa Namba is located between Namba and Shinsaibashi Station - less than 10 mins walk to either. This makes it very easy to use trains to see things within Osaka or to use it as a base to do day trips to places like Nara or Uji. The shops and bright lights of Dotonbori eg Glico Man are just 5 mins walk away - and in a different direction you are just as close to the Americamura area. The hotel is surrounded by many places to eat, convenience stores, etc. The hotel is very new and the rooms are cleverly designed. The 5 of us had connecting rooms with 3 beds in one and 2 beds in the other. It was big enough for the 5 of us with a large suitcase each. Great to have 2 bathrooms with 2 separate toilets. Whilst the rooms do not have wardrobes there are some hooks for hanging clothes and we found these sufficient. A sign in the lift advised that you could ask for clothes racks. The rooms are extremely clean as were common areas of the hotel. The staff were friendly but may need a little more training to give English speaking guests clearer detail on directions, buying tickets for Universal Studios etc. Breakfast was free and was ok. The cold items (broccoli, tomatoes, corn, lettuce, yoghurt, tinned mango, frozen berries, etc) were all good. Each day there were 3 hot dishes and they varied in terms of whether we liked them. However the hotel is catering to a mix of nationalities so we understood that others may have liked what we didn't! There was also croissants, bread rolls, cereal, and a mix of drinks via dispensing machines. In the afternoon/evening the breakfast area was set up with drinks and a couple of packaged snacks (biscuit, chocolate, etc) available also for no charge. The breakfast area is busy at breakfast and it is cafeteria type style but we always got a seat and were always able to leave full enough to sightsee. Would stay here again as room design was great and location makes it very easy to get from airport (use train to namba station and then use exit 24/25 and walk up Midsojuji towards hotel ).
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good size connecting room. Might be a little cramp for 3 pax in a room. Provides free breakfast and tea breaks daily. Walking distance to Dotonburi and to Osaka-namba/ Namba station. Airport shuttle at a minimal costs with advance booking is available too.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great hotel.Good space, super clean, healthy breakfast, generous afternoon snacks and drinks. Great for families. Friendly staff. Close to everything. Lots to eat in surrounding area. Thank you for a lovely stay for four nights.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for six nights, the place is centrally located, only a few minutes walks to Dontonbori, Glico man and The Shinsaibashisuji shopping district. It’s good that the place give all kind of free drinks from 2pm-.9pm. My family loves staying here
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a connecting rooms for 4 people. Room size was average but it was clean and comfortable. You can easily walk to Dotonbori or Shinsaibashi from the hotel. Overall a very good hotel for family with children.On a side note, there was a BBQ restaurant opposite the hotel which was good.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is good near to Dotonbori, Shinsabashi Shopping Arcade, Namba(subway) and JR-Namba Station. Family Mart, 7-Eleven and eateries next to hotel readily for night bites. Bath and toilet are separate which is great for maximising time. The connecting rooms are spacious and good for big group. Staff are helpful especially on our luggage transfer from Osaka to Kyoto.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. Beds were comfortable, room is clean even though it's slightly small with 3 beds and without wardrobe. The complimentary breakfast saved us lots of time and hassle in the morning. Special thanks goes to front desk staff Tabatha, who went the extra mile to help us reserve our bus tickets to Kanazawa, Takayama and Shirakawago. It took her more than 20 mins having to coordinate between us and the ticket office as some of our preferred timings were fully booked. She was still very patient and willing to help. We have enjoyed our stay there. Thumbs up for great service and good location.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is conveniently located with eateries and subway within walking distance. Stayed in the connecting room for 5, and although the room is small it is comfortable. The hotel provides free breakfast. Although breakfast variety is limited, it is still ok and saves you some money. The staff are also friendly and polite. Great for family stay.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked an inter connecting room for week stay. Enjoyed the room space, cleanliness and excellent separate toilet and bath convenience. Very comfortable stay. Daily breakfast provided, drinks throughout the day. Walking distance to shopping and eatery at Dotombori. Will stay at the hotel again.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our week long stay at the Karaksa Hotel turned out to be quite enjoyable, after an initial room change due to a odorous a/c unit in the first room. For the most part, the hotel is very well maintained and the staff work hard to keep it very clean. The hotel is a newer building with a nicely decorated modern theme. It’s located very conveniently near the Dotonbori and Shinsaibashi shopping and restaurant areas and about a 20 minute walk (800m) to the central Namba train station. The area immediately around the hotel is quiet being away from the main bustle. Front desk and housekeeping staff were courteous and helpful.Our room was generally very quiet with a capable a/c unit. It’s small like most Asian hotel rooms, but its modern design is very thoughtfully done. There’s a separate toilet room for use when someone else is in the shower. It also has a small built toilet paper shelf for (ahem) your cellphone. There are lots of USB ports and electrical outlets built into the headboard by the beds. Smart, useful.The shower only unit is quite big with modern and practical to use fixtures and lots of hot water. Our housekeeping and room cleanliness was excellent as is the standard set with most Japanese hotels of any class.The beds were firm but comfortable with nice clean bedding and linens.There is also an excellent door to door airport shuttle at a nominal charge that we took from the hotel to Kansai airport.Our stay included a hot and cold buffet breakfast which was only fair to my palate. It caters more to Asian tastes. Unfortunately, most items are reheated prepared foods. There’s also some bread, buns and cereal. The strong coffee was very good. A nice feature is the breakfast eating area is available to make late evening snacks like instant noodles.Overall, we enjoyed our stay at the Karaksa Hotel.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 乘坐南海電鐵往難波站， 再步行往酒店，如慢行只需十多分鐘。酒店距離心齋橋飲食購物熱點梗三個街口， 十分方便。 但在住方便較住心齋橋那裏寧靜和舒適。 職員亦懂各種語言： 日文，英文，普通話也可。 今次入住雙人房，浴室和洗手間是分離的， 房間雖不是太大，但適中，亦有一長枱可以放置雜物。 還有一些位置可開一個大喼，算是這樣了。房間內有獨立冷氣和空氣淨化機，整體乾淨，舒適，寧靜。 早餐簡約健康。亦有免費小食和飲品長時間供應。在酒店旁有吃蟹名店“網元”， 這是“蟹道樂”同一集團高級版。前行還有動漫玩具店，Kobe Beef，Gram鬆餅，Craftholic專賣店，Step 多不勝數。It is a very convenient and quiet hothel rather than the hotel in Shinsaibasin. Near the Namba station around 10mins walk. Breakfast is simple and enough. Room is clean and tidy, not too big not too small. Bathroom and toilet is separate. Overall it is a very convenient hotel.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family of 2 adults and 2 children (6 and 9 years) stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. We had adjoining rooms, which was great as it gave us more space than a quad room. The hotel has a minimalist and contemporary design, which we liked. The rooms were light coloured and comfortable. The shower is a walk in one with a separate washbasin area. The toilet was separate to the shower/wash basin. The rooms comes with a very small fridge (fine for drinks), hot water and green tea. You can choose to have an "Eco" room service, which means they replace the towels and empty the bins but they don't make the beds. However, they then provide you with 2 free bottles of water instead.Check in was fine. The reception desk has lots of staff and most seem to be bilingual. Therefore, we never had any problems finding someone at the reception desk who could speak English.The breakfast is simple and adequate. Most of the food seems to come from a packet or a can but there are some cereals, toast, 3 hot foods and salad, amongst other things.The hotel also offers a free welcome drink in the afternoon and evening, which means you're welcome to help yourself to the hot or cold drinks from the drink machine (eg coffee, tea, soft drinks). Still it was a nice touch. There was also a box of board games that people could use.The hotel is a in a "laneway" off the main road. The area seemed quiet though. There were complimentary toiletries in the reception foyer.Other useful info:- there is a small Family Mart a few metres away;- the hotel offers a shuttle to KIX but you need to book in advance and I think it costs 1000 yen per person;- Namba Station is a 5 to 10 minute walk away and it can be done with suitcases in tow (you'll need to take exit 24 if you need an elevator);- Dotomburi is within walking distance.Overall, we enjoyed staying at the hotel and would recommend it.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here 3 nights and we had connecting rooms. Compared to other hotels in Japan the rooms were spacious. The rooms were spotless & everything worked as it should. The front desk staff spoke English fairly well and had many maps and brochures to point us to the subway easily. The location is very walkable to restaurants, shops and subway. We never made it to breakfast so I can't comment on that. We would stay here again, especially with kids. It made it nice to be able to slide the door closed and have some privacy and space. My only complaint was that we had more than one taxi driver really struggle to find it (despite showing them the name in Japanese). Be sure to ask the front desk for a card to show any drivers to make sure you can find it again.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, awesome staff, clean as an operating room, ok value for money. The Namba location of this new formula hotel is right in the middle of everything. The staff were incredible to the point of overdoing it. But you need to know that this style of hotel may not check all the boxes if you are a westerner used to rooms and amenities found in places like a Westin or other established chains. I think Karaksa is definitely appealing to a young Asian based traveler that has a certain taste for super clean ultra minimal room designs and amenities. I paid $170/night at this location. I am going to say that Red Planet (another newish formula hotel found in Japan, Thailand and Indonesia) gave me a better experience for @$100 dollars less per night. Yes that was in Nagoya,so you will pay a premium for the Osaka location, however I think that RP is still a class leading value property that is hard to beat.. At Karaksa there is no desk in the room, just two tiny stools and tiny table. That’s it. Very hard to work in the room. I feel like they want you to go to the public spaces of the hotel. No coffee cups in the room , just two small tea cups. So no In room coffee. You like to get up, check your mail with a hot cup of coffee ? You have to go down to the lobby to get it. Another glaring issue at the Karaksa would be breakfast . I was shocked that they used so many single use items. Paper cups, paper bowls, paper plates. Not only did the whole experience feel like I was eating breakfast in a third grade classroom, it is also unbelievably irresponsible in this day in age and a clear sign that they don’t want to hire a dishwasher and instead generate massive amounts of garbage. Just lazy in my book. And please don’t talk about recycling solving that tactic. Most likely I will not return to this chain. However I think they will be a success with millennials for sure and with budget travelers that appreciate a very Japanese approach. Airport shuttle a great deal and super convenient if you have luggage’s.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my stay here even if the hotel room is tiny. The vibe is modern throughout the hotel as it is pretty new. The bathrooms were clean. They had daily breakfast included in the rate. They also had snacks and drinks in the afternoon. The room rate was very reasonable too. We got a connecting room for 5 people. Again, basic room but in a great location. I would stay again and use the money saved for the more expensive hotels for shopping!
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: karaksa hotel in namba is very good for position and the size of the rooms but i can`t give more than 3 for some reasons that i`m going to explain.1) the laundry. There are only 3 washing machines serving a big hotel and they are always busy!! to wash your clothes it`s really a nightmare!2) breakfast is limited. Good for the japanese standard but nothing or very fair number of western breakfast3) if you opt for the eco, cleaners don`t even bother to fix your bed.4) overpriced.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is nice, small and clean, which lives up to the Japanese culture of minimalisma and simplicity. It has everything guests need and it also has vending machines and massaging chair for leisure.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: He hotel is easy to find. Third exit left of the bridge after exiting Namba station exit 25. We loved our two night stay here. Comfortable, spacious rooms, great shower, decent enough breakfast but the real shining point is the location. Located close to lively Dotombori with its thousands of bars, restaurants and shops, it’s situated between two major stations and has many small bars and restaurants close by without seeming too over the top. Would stay here again in a heartbeat the next time I come to this extraordinary city.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in between Shinsaibashi and Namba station, this hotel is a good starting point to access dotonbori and shinsaibashi shopping streets. Go to the hotel website to access the detailed picture by picture foot access from OCAT and Namba station. if you are looking for a triple room, the offer 3 single beds. The pillows are not the most comfortable so bring your own if you have neck issues. The breakfast is decent with changes to the warm items daily. Enjoy free flow of beverages (coffee, tea, soft drinks etc) from 2pm daily, you save spending on bottled water. Help yourself to the free amenities from the lobby (washed cloth, toothbrushes, combs etc). A highly recommended mid range small hotel .
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:Location is very close to dotonbori and shishabashi Very clean hotelHelpful and friendly staffs who can speak English Room is bigger than most jap hotels Free flow of drinks from 2pm-9pm Provides shishedo shower amenities Cons: Bad internet connection Does not have drinking glass cups in room (they do have Japanese teapot cups which are too small for drinking regular drinks) Toliet sink design is too small which does not have enough space to put our own face wash or make up products Bed is hard and uncomfortable No drawers or safe to keep your clothes or belongings Aircon setting only provides high-medium-low; which gives us less flexibility to adjust the temperature.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A newly built mid budget hotel. Very clean place, room and friendly staff to boost. Near to all restaurants, street food places, sports bar, market and many more. A very convenient location to go walking around the area.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hotel for 4d3n. They have 2 types of house keeping; standard or eco. We chose the latter which does not make up the beds and change the bedsheets but provided complimentary water bottles daily.Dislike:- As the room is compact, there is no cabinet instead only a few hangers on railing for hanging our clothes.- only Japanese TV channels Like:1. Location: About 5 mins walk from Namba station, Shinsaibashi shopping area, Dotonbori and America mura just behind it. 15 mins easy walking to OCAT bus terminal.2. Room: Clean as its a new hotel and toilet is separated from the shower room.3. Breakfast: Simple spread but delicious with many hot and cold drinks selections.4. Welcome drink: Available daily from 3 to 9 pm.5. Free shuttle to airport with 4 timings a day
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s a new hotel with modern, clean facilities and efficient service. The location is very central and easy to get around the key attractions in Osaka. I would recommend this to anyone looking for no frills accommodation at a fair value.My only complaint was that they had run out of water the day we checked in. It’s a given and not something to be overlooked by a hotel.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited with my husband and 2 boys (14 and 10) for 3 nights. The hotel is in a good location and we found it easy to get from the train station using the subway and then walk with our cabin cases. There are loads of bars and restaurants nearby and it’s also very close to the American area and main shopping streets. The hotel itself is very new and styled in a modern way. We booked connecting rooms. The rooms aren’t huge but more than adequate. The toilet and shower are separate and the toilet is pretty small. I would say that anyone who was larger than average would struggle to get into the toilet. We also had the ‘western’ breakfast; average but not what I would call western. To be honest the majority of people staying at the hotel were not western so I guess the breakfast was fine. The restaurant area does not offer food at any other time than breakfast but is open between 14.00 and 20.00 for hot drinks and soft drinks. If you’re after a basic, comfortable place to stay this is perfect.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would definitely come back in this hotel if I visit Osaka again. The reception was really nice and helpful, and they spoke great English with is which is a big plus point in Japan.Our room was big as it was meant for 3 people but we were only 2. I was a bit unhappy about the arrangement though as there wasn't a single place to put our clothes. We had to keep everything in our backpacks. There was only 4 hangers and not even a shelf or wardrobe.The room was really clean and the beds really comfortable. When we checked in they asked if we wanted regular cleaning or eco (and 2 free bottles of water everyday)(it's written with a green leaf drawn next to it and is a bit misleading). The eco isn't actually ecological but economical. They change the towels everyday which is highly unnecessary but only do clean a bit.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel specially the open bar in the afternoon till night. You can hang around their cafe/bar after a tiring day. The staff were gracious and helpful; very patient too with guests of different cultures.The hotel was clean and tidy always as it just opened last Nov 2017. They serve big breakfast everyday although items can be improved. I will recommend this hotel to friends.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stay for 5 nights for my Kansai trip (Osaka, Nara, Kyoto, Kobe). The location is perfect, 5-10 minutes walk to shopping street. Free drinking during 14.00-21.00 pm are available for all guest, I love it Room is clean and modern.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We took a bus from the Kansai airport to the Namba Bus Terminal OCAT (about 40 minutes journey). Then took an escalator to the ground floor and walked about 15 minutes to the hotel. It was perhaps the most convenient way to reach the hotel from the Kansai airport other than a private car or taxi.While the room was small and without a cupboard, it was functional for 2. The bed was hard and comfortable. Also, while the sound-proof was not 100% it didnt disturb our sleep at all.The receptionists were friendly and helpful and spoke well in both English and Chinese.It was a convenient location only 5 minutes from the main high-end shopping street and also to the Shinsaibashi Shopping Street and Dontobori. Namba Station was also a short walk away.There were restaurants and small eating stores surrounding the hotel.We shall come back to stay at the hotel.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The location was great. There are heaps of restaurants nearby and it is very close to the Shinsaibashi shopping street. Also a short walk to Dotonbori. The hotel is brand new, so it was very clean and up to date. USB sockets for charging, a great shower with a handheld shower head and a 'rain' style shower on the room. The toilet and shower are separate, with a sink in each. There was no soap in the toilet sink, which was a little odd. I didn't have breakfast here, but a friend said it was quite average. I really enjoyed my stay here.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed 3 nights from 05-08Nov, where the hotel should be newly opened on 01Nov. Room is clean with twin beds which is comfortable, but the pillow (2 types) are both too soft and no other choices as already asked the reception. Therefore, cannot have a good sleep for 3 nights. Shower room only which is quite big, with separate toilet, and this is convenient, but water pressure is fine just not strong enough. Breakfast is free but only very limited choices with sausages, bread, few vegetables for salad, noodles/spaghetti, and no Japanese food at all. Drinks are free till 9pm, good. One more thing is that although the room size is okay in Japanese standard, but the table inside the room is small with a TV, and also a very small size bar table and bar chairs. Therefore, everything bought had to put on the floor, and suggest the hotel should consider to replace the bar table and chairs with a sofa.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comes with free drinks (till 9pm) and breakfast everyday. Friendly staff too. The room is a little small but it's normal in Japan. Less than 10 min walk to the subway station on 5 min to the Dotonbori area.
hotelName:
30    karaksa hotel Osaka Namba
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: STAY HERE!Best location, funky interior, lovely bilingual (trilingual?) staff, washing machines, breakfast, LOCATION, PRICE etc etc. Only thing we didn't like- the bed was too hard for us. That's personal preference however. Great value for money, highly recommend.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I were in awe of the stunning design of the building from the moment we walked in. It is beautiful. The staff have been so friendly and helpful and Yoshida helped us with the best sights to see and where to eat as we are only here for a short time. The rooms are immaculate. It is easy to find and walking distance to everything we need. We wish we were staying longer!
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely wonderful hotel!! Clean, bright, cheery and affordable! The location is perfect!!! Great restaurants, night life and buzz made it an exciting place to stay! This will be my go to hotel when visiting Osaka!
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Out of my 3 different accommodations while staying in Japan, this one was by the far the best bang for the buck. The hotel itself is clean and modern. The staff has both Japanese and English speakers on site which was convenient since they made reservations for us at a restaurant. The room sizes were average, but bigger than our stay in Tokyo. We really enjoyed the free coffee and tea in the lobby that we used before departing for the day and upon return. The location was good as well. I was really pleased with the overall experience.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our one night stay at this hotel was near flawless. First, the proximity to the subway station was very convenient, and the hotel is in a good neighborhood with plenty of shops and restaurants. Everything about the hotel felt clean and new. Our room was a little small, but the bathroom was amazing, in particular the large, modern shower. The breakfast was great as well as the service. My biggest complaint is that the dryers they have are extremely ineffective, forcing us to air dry the clothes we had washed.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We would usually stay in Namba area when in Osaka but this time we opted to stay in this Hotel due to many good reviews. Excellent location and the breakfast is good compared to the other Hotels we had stayed in Osaka (we found lychee on the buffet ). Only hoping they will change breakfast menu a little bit more frequent, we ate almost the same food for 5 days Many good restaurants around the area and shopping is just seconds away.Will be back next year!
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a nice stay at this hotel. The hotel is located in the best area. There are so many restaurants and shops all over. There a huge promenade of stores in a covered walkway about 2 blocks from the hotel that leads to the Dotombori area. It is about half a mile covered with every store you can imagine. The decor of the hotel is cool chic, the breakfast buffet was excellent. The only drawback is that the rooms are very small, which is somewhat typical of Japanese hotel rooms. We would stay here again for sure.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family (wife, 3 boys ages 15, 12 and 9) and I just checked out after a 2 night stay. We really liked everything about the hotel - staff, facilities, service, amenities. The property has a great central location, easy access to restaurants, nightlife and public transportation. The rooms were very modern and comfortable. Breakfasts were incredible. We have been traveling for 2 weeks in Japan so we made use of the laundry facilities. A much better value than some of the brand name chain hotels in Osaka. Would recommend strongly!
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights while travelling around Japan for a couple of weeks.Can't beat the location of this hotel, right at Shinsaibashi, close to all shops and good restaurants. 5 minutes walk to Dotonbori.The hotel has good facilities, coin laundry, free coffee the whole day, and more importantly a smart phone which you can use while sightseeing in Osaka. You can also use this to make free international calls to certain countries. Great service!The room itself is comfortable. The shower room is particularly big for Japanese standard.Would definitely recommend this hotel to people visiting Osaka.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A gem in Shinsaibashi, this boutique hotel was great. Practically brand new facilities, spotless cleaning, top food choices on your doorstep and friendly staff made this my best stay on my Japan location. You are not far from Dotonbori, Osaka Metro and extensive shopping options. The lovely and friendly greeting with the suggestion of a dinner spot at my late night arrival was very much appreciated.I would have no hesitation in staying here again.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent a few days at The Flag. Very enjoyable stay. Hotel has a calm, quiet yet friendly atmosphere assisted by decor, furnishings and, importantly, welcoming staff. Room on 6th floor ...not a particularly nice outlook but room, though fairly compact, spotless and efficient. Enjoyed good sleeps each night. Air con and safe worked well. Had breakfast once...nice room, fairly popular, good choice western and local foods. The hotel opens on to a very busy neighbourhood, vast shopping arcades and close to underground mall and ground level prestige stores as well myriad small and "unusual" shops. Numerous eateries closeby and nearest metro line about 8 mins walk. We flew out back to UK from Kansai airport. Hotel kindly arranged a taxi, pre arranged flat rate. Very convenient, efficient service. This part of Osaka is very busy but good fun and felt safe. Shin Osaka - for bullet trains... a reasonably short journey on the underground. This allowed us to enjoy a number of day trips from Osaka such as Hiroshima, Himeji castle and Okayama kraken garden. We thought the hotel worked well on all levels. Thank you to the professional staff for a great stay.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived about 30-40 min early but was able to check in. It is literally a few minutes walk from the subway. But I will say that google maps has a hard time navigating in this region, so look at the map to know where to go.Check in was smooth. The room is nice but small. But managed nicely with ledges for items above the bed (no nightstands). The bathroom has a decent size step up, which is odd. The shower is large, no tub. Water pressure is good; shower is fairly large. Toilet is great; toilet paper is on the cheap side. The bed is quite firm and comfortable for my taste. There is no closet or any system for hanging items...so know that hanging wet clothes is a challenge. The AC works great and is in both English and Japanese. The blackout shades are not absolute. This wouldn’t necessarily be a big deal except that the sun rises in the 4 o’clock hour...so the room lightens up early.WiFi was surprisingly not awesome. I ended up using my pocket WiFi (Japan wireless - highly recommend), which was much better. They do provide a Handy, which is great in the event you do not have any other option for WiFi outside of the hotel.There is noise around that you can hear - both inside and out. I wouldn’t let it deter you but I always sleep with a white noise app. There is only one outlet close to the bed (more within the room but nothing close to the bed). I have a multi plug adapter, which worked great but if you have a bunch of things and do not have this, your items will not be in arms reach. No direct USB ports, which I found strange for this type of hotel.There is laundry on the 2nd floor, which was hugely convenient (¥300 wash; ¥100/30 min dry). But I will tell you that I had very few items to dry (most of which were wicking types of fabric) and it still took 3 drying sessions. I did not opt for breakfast but I did opt for the tea ceremony, which was lovely. I don’t like matcha tea and didn’t particularly care for the sweet that was given, but learning the way of tea here in Japan was kind of cool. The women who taught us were very nice as well. Would recommend.Overall a nice hotel with a central location to shopping and nightlife. Would recommend.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This recently built hotel looks lovely and is excellent value. The rooms are smallish but functional and the shower was excellent. The only negative is a lack of storage. Bigger wardrobe space and some hooks around the room would help. There are some nice touches like free coffee all day which you can drink in the spacious but cosy reception area and the staff are friendly and helpful. Shinsaibashi is lively and buzzing and it is an easy walk from the hotel to Dotonbori canal and the amazing food stalls.The lovely lanes around the hotel are filled with restaurants and bars. There is also a nearby metro for exploring the city.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Flag totally exceeded our already highly anticipaded expectations. Simply a great hotel on all levels. Wonderful staff - friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and very comfortable - great layout. The bathroom was excellent! The free coffee machine, library and relaxation area was such a welcome addition to our stay. The Flag really went out of its way to make us feel welcomed and comfortable, Thank-You!! -Bren & Kelly, 2019.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was small, but actually not too bad by Japan standards. Location-wise, it is a short walk to the Shinsabashi shopping street, but at the very end of the street, so it is a long walk to the Dotonbori area. What stands out about this hotel is the sophisticated and hearty breakfast buffet; not run-off-the-mill standard items, but unique dishes (if you come in early, before 8am, you will catch the steak slices; delicious and very tender! Unfortunately, they do not replenish). The complimentary 24-hour coffee machine in the lobby included cappuccino and latte; a nice feature and perk! Very friendly and efficient staff; helpful and accommodating. They gave us sound advice as we worried about getting back to the airport: simply take a short cab ride to Namba OCAT bus station, and take the Airport Limousine Bus! Hassle-free, and no worrying about catching the train or subway with heavy luggages.I would look at other hotels closer to Dotonburi, but if you prefer the Shinsaibashi shopping street, this is a good base.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The first hotel in Japan. This one has raised the standard. Nothing like other hotels. I personally love their minimal concept, keep it a clean look overall. It's very convenient, close to subway line, a step away from bars and restaurants yet very quiet and safe. Staff are very friendly and professional. We love the hair dryer that we bought one! Recommend for sure!!
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel and would absolutely come back for our next visit. Great location walking distance from major sights, friendly staff and clean/modern rooms. Small, but that's to be expected. We loved breakfast (though some more fruit would be really nice), and the "eco" option to save on their energy and will bill by reusing your sheets got you extra water bottles which was a huge help in the heat. Would definitely come back again and hope we do!
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a great location, close to train station, close to Dotonburi, and with a lot of good restaurants around. The hotel itself was very clean, and quiet. The rooms are quite small, but this is common in Japan, and it still had everything you needed. Would stay again.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location here is top if you iike to wander around and eat/drink. It is walkable to all the sights/neighborhoods you want to see in a 1-2 night stay. The service is good, it is a nice boutique/design hotel. Rooms are modern but small (typical for Japanese standards). Great shower. My only suggestion is they improve the quality of the coffee. Easily accessibly by metro. Wifi in rooms was slow but good in the lobby.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this groovy hotel! Very warm and welcoming staff who go out of their way to help. Rooms are great and you get use of a free smart phone while you are here. Coffee machine in reception area was a great touch. Fantastic location, what more could you want?
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent little boutique hotel. The front desk people are extremely helpful and nice. On several occasions, they were very helpful from checking in to directing to the nearest clinic to directions to a place. They have English speaking employees. The petite Japanese lady spoke very fluently. The hotel is a short walk from the Shinsaibashi station. Less than 5 minutes and central to the shopping district. A short 15 slow walk to Dontonbori area and Namba station. The area is lively with tons of tourist, especially Chinese. The area is a Very different experience than Shinjuku or Shibuya area. The standard rooms are small and to be expected of Japan. The designs are nice. The negative I have about the room is the TV location. It's to the side of the bed, making it difficult to watch. Each day comes with two bottles of water. Free wifi. The room has a safety box and other basic amenities. Love the shower area! The robes are comfy and get replaced daily. The balcony window does not open. The common area is interesting. I'm not very sure about the seats by the library area though. The one by the central fireplace is comfortable. There is an on the site laundry room. No public bath or gym on site. The luggage storage is an odd placement. It's in the middle of the library area. Overall, it's a very clean hotel with helpful service.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: modern, clean and good location hotel, nice amenities, grate breakfast and wonderful friendly staff, recommended.Special thank to Mrs Tae Ishikawa for her extra care and service... (:Irit and yaron magen - Israel
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely hotel with some good points:Great king bedGreat shower Kettle and fridge in roomTea & coffee available free all day (& ice) from reception areaBottles of free mineral water daily tooGreat location for lots of bars and restaurants nearbyThe shower is really big but I would have preferred a little more space around the basin to put a make-up bag on and toothbrushes etc.As with all the hotels we’ve stayed in Japan a great bidet looMinimalist room - could not see out of our window atall or open it more than 2 inches- apparently this is for security but it would also be noisy with it openAll in All a great place to stay
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our time at Hotel the Flag. The staff are extremely friendly, helpful and have great English skills. The hotel is clean and modern. There is a well kept library and a coin laundry room which was very handy!The location was perfect, you are close distance to the train and Dotonbori. There are loads of food options right outside the door.We were able to purchase late check out (up till 1 or 2pm) for only 1000 yen per hour. In addition, we were able to send our luggage ahead to this hotel with same day arrival without any issues.  The only downside was that our room was very small and the windows are frosted, so you can’t look outside and can only open the window a few inches. This made it feel a little claustrophobic.Overall a nice hotel for a short stay.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Flag Hotel in Osaka during golden week so maybe the prices were inflated, but what we got for ¥ 50,000 for 2 nights was quite poor (in Tokyo during GW we paid half the price and stayed in a great new modern property) Pros: - You are in the centre of Osaka (which later becomes a con depending on your room) - The lobby is nice Cons:- Extremely poor sleep due to people screaming in the streets until 5am, the street the hotel is on is really crowded.- The room decoration is not great looks like 0 effort was put into it- The windows are tainted this means you can’t look outside or open the window (felt super weird) it’s as if you’re sleeping underground or in a box. This is probably done because the street view would be terrible. Great, there is free coffee and tea but almost any hotel in the world has that by now. Honestly disappointed by the hype on TA.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I stayed at Hotel the Flag from March 20-25 and had an amazing stay there. Probably the best location of any hotel I have ever stayed at plus really, really nice staff and great breakfast buffet. As we were checking out, we thanked the manager and promised that we'd come back. We definitely will! In the meantime, I am recommending Hotel the Flag to all my friends and family.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is centrally located just a few blocks from the subway and walking distance from the river. The architecture is modern and simple with very interesting touches. The hotel has everything you need. A restaurant with very good breakfast, laundry room, free coffee and great staff. The room is spacious, clean and very well decorated with comfortable beds and a nice bathroom. I will totally recommend this hotel and go back when I’m in Osaka.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very pleased with our stay last night. The hotel is new, tastefully decoratively and considerately planned. Modern Japanese with minimalistic design but with just enough comfort. Unlike other hotels in Japan, the hallways and common spaces are spacious and uncluttered. The rooms are clean and thoughtfully planned with modern fixtures. Delightful breakfast buffet with lots of veggies and a good assortment of food. My only comment is please increase the amount of fruits, nuts and gluten free grains. Very conveniently located to the station, shopping and restaurants. Only stayed one night to see Ed Sheeran play at the Kyocera Dome but thoroughly enjoyed.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Second trip to Osaka in 18 months and previous stayed at hotel Ibis in same area but this time decided to stay at the FlagGreat decision Location excellent for shopping mall subway eating places and convenience storesImpressive hotel facilities such as free all day coffee good breakfast and larger than average japanese roomOnly criticisms was the position of the tv no English speaking tv channels and no sofa or chairs to sit onStaff were very friendly and always helpfulWould definitely stay again
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful hotel! The staff is multi-lingual, and really nice. The room was spotless and the sheets were luxurious. We had a slightly larger room, two double beds for a couple and a kid. They provided complimentary bottled water daily. The hotel has a free coffee station - really good strong coffee which we needed to over come our jet lag. The hotel is just a few blocks from the subway station, and another few blocks from the Dotonburi. It is a busy area with shops and restaurants, but the windows were noise proof and we slept comfortably! The mattress was firm and super comfortable! Overall this was a gem of a hotel, highly recommend it!
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is good value for money for the newly refurbished interiors of the room ans it is located very close to the subway station. Even the room we stayed at is a bit too small it's like that in Japan
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's very well located for Osaka's hotspots. Bars are restaurants all over the place!The room was comfortable, but the windows are frosted and only open an inch or so, so it can fell claustrophobic. There isn't much of a view, which is probably why they frosted the glass. They offer free tea and coffee in the lounge and there's a coin-operated laundromat in the hotel. The lounge itself is very nice and a decent place to chill before stepping out into the bustle.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here as a base for 6nights in Osaka. Really pleased with our choice as a family of 3 wanting comfort and a good location.We decided upon a deluxe twin and were delighted with the size of our room, comfort of beds and luxury of the bathroom and associated amenities.Breakfast always provided a good start to the day for us preferring the western choices and our 10 year old feasting on chicken nuggets and cake!For 3 nights we ate excellent Japanese food at Nakago just opposite (and to the right as you leave) the hotel. For us it was great not to have to walk far for dinner after long days exploring the region. We think it should be on the hotels recommendations list!Would highly recommend The Flag to anyone.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely modern hotel, staff were very friendly whose English were all very good. Location wise we quickly realised how handy it was, if you're looking to go to the main area for dinner or drinks, this hotel is very close and easily walkable. Close to 2 different major metro lines also.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just mediocre. I wished that we would have stayed at a different hotel but I already had this pre booked. The bathroom had a step down that was dangerous. The room temperature was hot but if you turned on the AC, it was a dinky machine that blew air onto one person in the bed. The trash can was the size of a pencil box.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located on a small street this hotel is near to all the attractions in Osaka. Metro is close by and a great selection of restaurants and shops in walking distance. Check in was a breeze. Very comfortable room with a great bed. The shower is wonderful. Great selection of Western and Japanese food for breakfast. Very good coffee free all day long in lounge. The staff are multi lingual and always ready to help with a smile. Will definitely go back to The Flag next time we are in Osaka.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel caught me by suprise, it's located in a small street (I walked passed it) and when I found it I wasnt sure what I was getting. However I must say I was pleasently suprised. The hotel is clean and tidy and in a great location. 10 min Walking distance of the Dōtonbori and other attractions and 15 min walk to Osaka Gymnasium if you are heading to the Sumo's. The rooms were good the only issue I had was the leg space between the toilet and wall was minimal (im 6 foot) and my knees were jamed into the wall. The rooms have a reverse cycle heating and cooling device on the wall which I'm not a fan of. For the price and location I can see why this is rated so highly-would stay again when next in Osaka
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just stayed here in a standard room. We found it to be spacious enough for us with 3 pieces of luggage to sustain a 9 night stay. The bathroom is roomy and has an awesome rain shower. Rooms were especially clean. The hotel staff were all very helpful. Everyone we interacted with spoke English well enough. The hotel is near Shinsaibashi station which is helpful. It is also within walking distance of a lot of shopping, restaurants and Dotonobori. We would definitely stay there again. We took the Airport Limousine Bus from Kansai Intl. Airport to Hotel Nikko Osaka which is just about a 5-7 minute walk away to Hotel The Flag. It beats taking a train and hauling your luggage on the trains. Check the bus times though. They are limited to this stop at Hotel Nikko Osaka.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first hotel on arrival into Japan and were very impressed. Relatively small hotel, the staff were very friendly and helpful. Arriving mid morning, as expected our room was not ready, but cases were safely stowed and free tea/coffee and water was available from the excellent machine in the communal area. Umbrellas were also readily available on loan in the reception area, as it was raining.We stayed in a Deluxe double room and it was good. Not huge, but light and well laid out it had everything we needed. The furniture as shown in the photograph was simple but effective, with electronic safe in a drawer. Also provided were kettle, tea bags and bottled water each day. The bathroom had an excellent shower and deep(though not long) tub, with lovely toiletries provided and replenished daily, together with Dyson hairdryer! The hotel also provide a. ‘Handy’ phone which allows free calls within Japan, messaging and internet access whilst out and about - we found this very useful.Breakfast was very good, with a good selection of foods, both Japanese and western style; sugar cereals, small fresh rolls and fruit was available, rice porridge, rice & soups, bacon, scrambled eggs, chicken nuggets, salads, yoghurt, cake and jams. Various juices, detox water and coffee/hot water/hot milk machinesThe communal area, with books and large screen tv was minimalist style with a variety of chairs and off this area was the smoking room and laundry. Washers and Driers, were available for a nominal charge (cash coins) and free sachets of detergent were provided. There is also a 24hr tea/coffee machine (different language options), offering a variety of good quality drinks.The hotel was well located just a few minutes walk from Dotonbori and local restaurants offered great traditional foods.We would recommend and also would stay here again.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommend. Very near dotonbori which is a must see while in the area. You get to borrow a ‘handy’ phone for your stay which allows you to use 4g when you are out and about. Very friendly staff with excellent English.Immaculately clean. Shiseido amenities. Great shower. Surprisingly quiet given its location. View from the room is just onto a relatively quiet street. Breakfast was great with a massive selection to suit all tastes (rather randomly you can have chicken nuggets)! Railway station is just 5 mins away. Loads of nearby eateries and an amazing shopping mall 2 mins away. I would return here.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, a free breakfast, good coffee machine in the communal library/lounge, lovely bathroom.Can’t really fault the place apart from my pillow was too soft. It’s handily located and even though I wasn’t mad on Osaka however enjoyed coming back to this hotel after a day exploring was enjoyable.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed four nights at Hotel The Flag. We rooms were amazing with a fantastic bathroom and plenty of space. The staff were very helpful in booking us a taxi to Shin-Osaka station. They spoke to the taxi driver to ensure he understood where we were going. Couldn't be happier and would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very modern hotel with new facilities and bathrooms etc. Room for 3 was very small and the hotel knows this and said they are planning some changes. Terrific area of Osaka within walking distance of the Shinsaibashi shopping area. Close to nearby subways stations. Breakfast was great but could have done with a toaster and a bit more fruit. Perhaps I’m being too picky! Overall a terrific hotel, great staff, very helpful with good English. Would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Outstanding city centre hotel. We stayed for 3 nights and were so impressed that we booked another night for our return to Osaka a week later. The location is incredible, 5 mins to the station, it’s ideal even with luggage as the roads are so flat. You are less than 5 mins to the centre and all the food and shops. Within in a few steps are bars and restaurants and a couple of family marts/ 7 elevens. The rooms are a great size for city centre Japan. The bathrooms are modern and the showers are very good. Free coffee 24/7 is an added bonus. Finally the staff are so helpful. They have maps, flow charts printed to help you get to the airport on public transport and they speak multiple languages. This is a great hotel, you won’t be disappointed.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hip hotel located within walking distance from shinsaibaishi shopping street and train station. Free coffee provided. What makes the difference is the service provided by the staff. Thumbs-up to Lisa for the warm welcome and enthusiasm. Even my hubby said it's good.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could just say Location, Location, Location, but I loved everything about this boutique hotel. Besides being hip, and cool, and brand new, the service staff was exceptional. The room was comfortable, bed and bedding was excellent, and all was impeccably clean. Free coffee station was so generous and helpful. The Handy phone was a lifesaver! The first morning breakfast was gratis, and it was delicious, (though we opted to go elsewhere on the other mornings - this is Osaka - land of never ending eating experiences). I highly recommend this hotel in terms of value, service and location.

hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I spent 6 nights in this hotel in late October. This was my third visit to Osaka, and I decided to be rather picky about the location of my lodging. I wanted to be in Shinsaibashi, the intersection of the Midosuji Line and the Nagahori Tsurumi-ryokuchi Line of the subway. Reasons: we would arrive in Osaka, and would also take day trips, using the Shin-Osaka station on the Midosuji Line, and, I would go to the Tamatsukuri station on the Nagahori Tsurumi-ryokuchi Line for three work days. Looking at hotels around Shinsaibashi, I picked Hotel the Flag based on all the positive reviews on this site. My own experience was very good indeed. We reserved a room for two at a very attractive rate ahead of time. Arriving from Tokyo on a Friday afternoon, we realized the size of this room would be very restricting for two of us with luggage for two weeks. After a very quick chat with the hotel front desk, we were able to switch to possibly their largest guest room. Two full beds, sizeable bathroom with modern amenities, a nice desk / work area, and plenty of shelf and clothes-hanging space. We ended up paying more for this larger room. Yet, the comfort level, and how efficiently the switch got handled, made it all very reasonable. The hotel had modern designs and was small enough to be cozy. The multi-lingual staff left me a very nice impression. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast every day. The many practical touches in the hotel included the coin-op laundry facility and a multi-purpose library area. The guest rooms had windows that were very good with respect to sound-proofing. Returning to my hotel room at night really meant getting a relief from the huge noisy crowd, the party scene and overwhelming sounds of Shinsaibashi. Upon departure, we took advantage of the KIX airport limousine pick-up just two blocks away (at the Hotel Nikko), adding to the good feeling of our stay.

review_body: This hotel is really near Shinsaibaishi station, for someone who hates walking much... the hotel distance is perfect as it is quite centrally located. The room we stayed in was small but it does not take away from how amazing the hotel is. The room is immaculately clean and new ish.The staff are very friendly and speak perfect english. Theres a free coffee machine on the 2F and some interesting books.The bathroom amenities were Shiseido, that was really a nice touch.It is a no frill hotels but for what its worth, its one of the nice one.
hotelName:
31    HOTEL THE FLAG Shinsaibashi
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you’re looking for a hotel that offers a room that is clean and comfortable without compromising on convenience, look no further. Location - it’s very conveniently located near the subway exit, and along the road to the hotel you will find family mart, drugstores along the shinsaibashi suji as well as the famed ichiran all within 2-3 walk. Room size was ok considering that it is Japan but as a solo traveller, there is nothing to fault on the room size (twin room). The cleanliness and the amenities provided were of good quality. The bed and pillows were comfortable and housekeeping was always very well done. Overall there is nothing to fault about the hotel and if i were to visit Osaka again, this will be my first choice as it is one of the best hotels i have stayed in recently.

Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little hotel in an excellent location! The hotel itself was nothing fancy but the rooms were decently comfortable and slightly larger than the average Japanese hotel. The ammenities provided were excellent, and it was great that the hotel provides free coffee/tea. My only complaint was the pillows provided were horribly uncomfortable but that’s just a personal opinion.Staff were lovely however did not really go out of their way to help out with several queries we had. Overall loved the hotel and would definitely stay back here again!

review_body: Not overly special or amazing, but you can't fault The Flag for anything. Everything is clean, tidy, well presented. The room was small (standard for Japanese style), however westernised. The staff are friendly and helpful. Great breakfast at the hotel restaurant, and within walking distance of an incredible shopping mall and restaurant block.Would definitely stay here again!
